Unmatched Durability: Metal has many benefits over wood, plastic, and polymer - not the least of which is its durability. With these pieces, you can play in the wind, rain, snow, sun, or at a pub, without fear of damage! 

How Handy: Best of all, our exclusive design includes a functional "hand" that allows you to customize your games in ways never before possible! Whether you want a flag-bearer, wizard's staff, or just more factions, this hand makes it easy to expand your force to fit your needs!



SIZING:


Height: .625"
Width: .625"
Thickness: .375"
Weight: 10.5g
 Hand Size: .040"



FINISHES:


Solar: Shiny Golden


Lunar: Shiny Slivered


Eclipse: Shiny Black


Dawn: Aged Brassy Yellow


Dusk: Aged Coppery Red



 









 
What could be better than sharing the things you love with the people in your life? Earning free goodies at the same time!
It's really easy to get free stuff: after you contribute for a perk, stay logged in and share this project using the buttons at the top! 
Every person who contributes through your shares will earn you a **FREE** Vanguard Meeple! There's no limit to the number of times you can share, or the number of  Vanguards you can earn! Even better, once you have earned 25 Vanguards, you'll also get a special travel case only available through this contest!
Need more info on Referral Contests? Check out this nifty IndieGoGo article!







How to Contribute



It's easy to get the Vanguards you crave! Just click the perk that's perfect for you and proceed through the checkout process. Your contribution will be processed immediately via PayPal, and we'll get to work creating your items!

Your contribution can not be changed after you pledge, but have no fear, you don't have to miss out on getting more goodies! You can receive as many perks as you desire! Simply contribute again to add more perks to your shipment! Our software will compile all of your contributions together so that we can mail all of your perks and freebies together in one epic package!

We anticipate shipping perks at the beginning of December. Have no fear, that won't seem like such a wait thanks to Updateday! As with all Bibelot Games projects, we'll be posting weekly updates throughout the production phase. Updateday (every Monday) is a spirited and exciting behind-the-scenes overview of the creation and production process where we share the details of our progress.



Perk Details
All perks include FREE Shipping to US and Canadian addresses!




This perk includes 1 metal Vanguard meeple of each finish (Dawn, Dusk, Lunar, Solar, Eclipse) packaged inside a black velveteen bag.






Pick this perk to snag an 8 piece set of Vanguard Meeples in your favorite finish! (after the campaign, we'll email you to find out which one you want) Each set comes packaged in a black velveteen bag!



The perfect perk for head-to-head matches! The Dynamic Duo set includes 8 Dawn and 8 Dusk Vanguard Meeples in a black velveteen bag!



Eclipse and Solar and Lunar, Oh My! This set contains 24 total Vanguards (8 each of 3 finishes) packaged in a velveteen bag! It's all the shining goodness you need to make your 3-player games come to life!



The Complete Set is just the right size for most gamers! It contains 8 metal Vanguard meeples in each of the 5 finishes (40 meeples total) and is packaged in a lovely velveteen bag! 
This perk is perfectly sized to replace Carcassonne's plain wooden followers with luxurious metal Vanguards!



Get your game night off to the right start with this travel-friendly boxed set of 40 metal Vanguard meeples!

This set contains 8 meeples of each finish snugly packaged in a LASER cut and etched foam insert perfectly fitted to the small 8" x 5", Gamer Vaultz® case.
The Gamer Vaultz® case is perfect for all of your gaming needs, featuring a keyed lock, mesh pouches inside the lid for extra storage, a pen loop, and a clipboard on the front for score cards and notes!



Containing a massive 120 Vanguard Meeples, the Ultimate Gamer Boxed Set is perfect for gamers who play big! The large 8.5" x 11" Gamer Vaultz® case is the perfect storage solution for your Vanguard Meeples and accessories, plus all of your standard gaming equipment (dice, score cards, pens, etc...).
The Ultimate Gamer Boxed Set includes: 24 Solar, 24 Lunar, 24 Eclipse, 24 Dawn, and 24 Dusk Vanguard Meeples, sorted into groups of eight, and neatly nested into precision cut and etched foam.
The inside of the lid features multiple mesh pockets for easy accessory storage, plus a handy pen loop. The front of the Gamer Vaultz® case functions as a clipboard to make it super easy to take notes, keep score, or hold your character sheets!



Whether you're looking for the latest and greatest bit of awesome for your FLGS, want to replace all your game pieces, or have the goal of winning Christmas, Metal Meeple Madness is the perfect perk for you!
Weighing in at more than 10 pounds, the 4" x 6" Meeple Vaultz® chest contains a truly amazing 500 meeples (100 of each finish), making it a perfect counter-top display or game closet accessory! 


All of our perks include FREE shipping to the USA and CANADA. If you require shipping to any other country then you will need to make an additional contribution for the International Shipping perk.










Wahooooo! We did it! Vanguard Meeples WILL be made!



Yippppppeeeeee! Another one down! Now, every single contributor getting a perk will ALSO get a FREE Vanguard Keychain*!





*Small print: Contributors must pledge for a physical perk to receive the free keychain. Only available in Lunar.






Wowsa! 500% funded is a massive milestone that will make it possible for us to produce Flagpoles for your Vanguard meeples!



The poles are specially designed to fit inside the Vanguard hand and are shaped to stay in place. They are plated in the same 5 finishes as the Vanguards, so you can match them to your armies, or mix things up to create even more distinct factions!
New Perk: $10 Raise the Flag - This kit includes 120 flagpoles, 24 of each finish, and a full sheet of 154 blank flag stickers!




1,000% funded is no small feat! In tribute to all of you amazing supporters, we'll be making it even easier for you to showcase your love of Vanguard Meeples! At this marker, we'll also give everyone receiving a perk a FREE Vanguard Necklace*!


*Small print: Contributors must pledge for a physical perk to receive the free necklace. Only available in Lunar.




WAHOOOOOO! We have to do something epic for this colossal goal! But what's monumental enough for one-thousand, five hundred percent funded???!!!
Gem Staffs!
At this milestone, we'll be able to produce brilliantly shiny, cut-glass studded staffs made in the following colors: diamond, jet, emerald, ruby, and sapphire! These staffs fit perfectly into your Vanguard's hands, allowing you to colorize your forces, while keeping all that glorious sparkle and shine!
New Perk: Gem Staffs - This kit includes 40 Gem Staffs, 8 each of 5 colors!



 
But wait! There's more! Once we decimate these goals, we'll add even more awesome achievements! 
Even better, you can help us decide what's next by sharing your thoughts in the comments!
 
 









 
Bibelot Games is an Independent Game company based just outside of Phoenix, AZ. We take pride in developing amazingly unique and luxurious games and game accessories!
 
Bibelot Games is running this project with the help and support of...
 
 

 
 
The Ring Lord is a world-renowned metal fabrication company specializing the manufacture of craft rings for chainmail (maille) jewelry and armor. "We make it - You create it!"

story:
JOIN THE FLEET!

Battle Fleet 2 needs your help to take the game to the next level by building on the awesome core gameplay of naval strategy battles and expanding the game with new campaigns, ships, weapons, locations, missions and features. The core game has already been released on PC, Mac, iPad & Android and has a growing fan base, and with your help it can be so much more!

Learn more about the game and get download links at: http://www.battlefleetgame.com


What The Press Is Saying

"Battle Fleet 2 is a great game. Landlubbers, cast off the moorings and sail your fleet to victory in the Pacific! For this price, you can’t go wrong!" 94% - Armchair General

"incredibly satisfying and fun" 8/10 - The Digital Fix

"Battle Fleet 2 stacks up very nicely." 8/10 - Pocket Gamer

"I could get on board with this" - Rock, Paper, Shotgun

"Naval Combat Simulator with Depth" - IGM

"battle strategists amongst you will have a lot of fun with the game" 8.5/10 - AppZapp

"Battle Fleet 2 is every bit as good as those strategic simulations of yesteryear, and in many ways much better." 4.5/5 - Game Industry News

"Overall, this is a great app" 4.5/5 - AppAdvice

"impressed with the surprisingly diverse gameplay" - Mouse n Joypad

"best naval combat game on the market" 9.2/10 - Game Players Review


About Battle Fleet 2

Developed by the indie game studio Capital j Media based out of Portland, Oregon, Battle Fleet 2 is the radically improved sequel to the original and has kept the “Worms” / “Scorched Earth” style angle+power mechanic, but now features full 3D modeling of terrain, ships, and ship hit locations. Hit the the engines and cripple the enemy's maneuverability, or aim for the command center and disable the ship for an entire turn. Ships are more realistic in which weapon compliments they can carry, and ship control is more intuitive. Battle Fleet 2 also features Fog of War, allowing for stealth tactics and surprise attacks to be a viable strategy as well as adding the importance of using ships and aircraft for recon as well as attacks. With a full featured campaign and cross-platform multiplayer, Battle Fleet 2 will keep even the saltiest of sea-dogs satisfied. 

CURRENT FEATURE LIST

  • Build your fleet from 6 different ship classes each with different hardpoint locations for mounting different weapons, different mobility, and different hit locations. 
  • Use small caliber guns to pinpoint your shot and switch to devastating salvo mode, forcing all available guns to fire at the same location. 
  • Equip your ships with a wide variety of weapons including AA guns, torpedoes, and different caliber naval artillery. 
  • Utilize or neutralize bombers and recon planes launched from island bases, aircraft carriers, or cruisers. 
  • Assign captains to each ship to determine the ship's turn order 
  • Play the strategic campaign mode, random skirmish mode, full cross platform multiplayer, or even hotseat multiplayer. 
  • Use recon to clear Fog of War and defeat enemy ground based airfields and coastal artillery.
  • Deploy Strategic Command Cards to surprise your enemies with special actions like deploying mines, sabotage, enhanced aiming, airstrikes and more! 
  • Battle Fleet 2 features full 3D models of US and Japanese WW2 era ships. 
Battle Fleet 2 is made by a small team that is passionate about strategy games that bridge the gap between the often simplistic strategy games on mobile and hardcore games on PC.


What We Need & What You Get

The Battle Fleet 2 Expansions campaign is a tiered funding campaign that starts with the Atlantic Campaign expansion for the initial funding goal of $5000. Once the funding exceeds that original goal, new feature tiers will be unlocked and slated for development in future updates of the game. 

This initial budget will be used to add the single player Atlantic Campaign to complement the existing Pacific Campaign. In order to do this we need to create a specialized Atlantic map, 12 new territory battle maps, create new models of ships and aircraft to match the ones used in the Atlantic during WW2 and add merchant ships to tie in the concept of convoys into the game. 

Bismarck - courtesy of German Federal Archive

If the funding goes over the $5000 required for the Atlantic Campaign we will then put that extra amount into more features to continue making the game even better. Not only that, we will actually let YOU vote on which feature we develop next. That's right, as a Battle Fleet 2 supporter you will get to have a say in how the game develops! 

Additional features will be split into $5000 funding blocks and once a block is reached we will put it to a vote and the supporters will select which feature set we work on next. For example, once $10,000 is raised every supporter will use their votes to vote up their favorite feature, the one with the highest votes will be developed and added to the game. *The only case where voting will be skipped is if someone makes a Fleet Admiral level contribution at which point they will be able to decide which feature that contribution will be spent on.

It will take 2-3 months to complete each expansion.


Feature Sets for Future Funding Blocks:

New Ship Types & Captain Abilities:

New Light Cruiser, Destroyer Escort, Light Carrier and Japanese I400 Submarine Aircraft Carrier. Some Captains will now get special abilities that will give their ship an advantage during battle, such as "Flank Speed" (ship will move further), "Hard to Port" (ship will turn at a sharper angle), "Marines" (ship is immune to sabotage), and other abilities that could turn the tide of battle. 

Advanced Damage, Damage Control, Rockets:

New Rocket Turret that can fire a devastating barrage against land and sea. Damage that can impact more systems such as causing flooding, shipboard fires, reduce reload times of weapons, reduce accuracy of weapons and reduce visibility. Damage control will allow the ship's owner to direct damage control crews to a specific sub-system and potentially fix it during a battle. 

Special Missions

During campaigns you will be presented with special "Missions of Opportunity" that will give you a campaign advantage such as additional prestige points, free ships, extra recon missions instead of taking over a territory. These missions will range between convoy escorts, destroying special land installations (radar site), locating a hidden enemy ship, rescuing survivors and more. 

Historical Scenarios

These are a set of standalone single battles that will be based on actual historical battles in the Pacific and Atlantic. You will get play out the Battle of Midway, Sinking of the Bismarck, Battle of the Coral Sea and more. 

Aircraft Expansion

New aircraft such as torpedo bombers, kamikazes, land based heavy bombers and a new Dual-Purpose 5" gun that can be used for AA & fired at ships will be added. 

Expanded Multiplayer

The existing multiplayer will be expanded to provide a 2v2 and 3v3 battle experience. Allowing you to team up with up to 2 additional players on your side and work together to sink the enemy fleet. 

Tanks & Land Units

Battles will no longer be limited to the sea as you will be given command of tanks, artillery and landing craft creating a combined force that is required to capture territories. 

Weather Effects & Nighttime Battles

Take to the night and fight the enemy on an uncertain and dangerous battlefield. Weather effects such as storms and fog will limit your visibility, ground aircraft and make high speed maneuvers difficult. 

Distinct Ship Classes Per Country

Each playable country will have their own set of ships instead of sharing the same generic ship classes, giving much more variety to gameplay and strategy. Each ship and each country will have their strengths and weaknesses, making battle more unpredictable and ship selection strategy that much more crucial. 


Perks

Expanding and improving the game is not the only perk of your contribution, some funding levels include additional copies of the game that you can share with your friends, copies of the original Battle Fleet, plastic miniatures of the various ships in the game, free copy of our next game, one on one Skype lessons on how to develop your own game using the Unity3D game engine and more!


Our Track Record

Capital j Media has been responsible for the development and launch of 6 games to date, including the original Battle Fleet, Battle Fleet 2 and Starbase Gunship. The original Battle Fleet even became the #1 game on the Mac App Store within a week of it's launch on the store. 


Risks & Challenges

Although all projects and games have an inherent risk, the risk involved in this expansion of Battle Fleet 2 is minimal, mainly because the game has already been released. We were able to prove that we can not only successfully complete the game but also get incredible reviews from the press.

The biggest challenges the expansions face are the time required to produce them and how complex or intricate they can be given the budgets. The worst case scenario for the expansions is that they are delayed by a month or two, or that we are not able to make them as detailed and polished as we would like. Our track record of making fixes and updates to previous games and even Battle Fleet 2 shows that even if things are not perfect on the initial release we always continue working on the game and release free updates to improve each and every facet of the game. 


Other Ways You Can Help

As Battle Fleet 2 is currently available for sale, you can always help the project by sharing this campaign and links to the game with your friends. We're also open to help with creating 3D models, translating the game into new languages, and even just offering your feedback. Battle Fleet 2 succeeds because of the community of players and fans that have helped us make this awesome naval strategy game a reality!

We'll also be giving away prizes to supporters who refer the most friends, so even if you can't donate directly, share the campaign with the share buttons at the top of the page and you can still get prizes and perks. Details coming soon...

Vote to get Battle Fleet 2 on Steam Greenlight:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=262465622

story:
Hi there,

  We would like to share with you our idea. We call it the Endemiron Project. (a.k.a. Project “E”)

  We are a team of passionate gamers with extensive experience in the gaming lifestyle. Killing monsters with our friends is usually of higher priority than the trivial necessity of grocery shopping or getting healthy amount of good night sleep. We know what makes a game great. So far, we are continuously missing some vital details in the available browser-based titles. So, our journey in the jungle of the game industry begins.

  As a start we want to create a browser-based RPG game with lots of social elements, exciting content and tons of fun for the player. We are currently building a prototype for the game mechanics. First glimpses of the world are also emerging from our Art vaults. We have lots of cool ideas about battles, classes and skill sets to forge an exciting gameing experience. Finally, the game will offer numerous original story-lines through both singleplayer and multiplayer on a large scale.

Basic Gameplay

  Project E is a Role-Play Game with turn-based battles. The game will offer different classes of characters which players will shape as they see fit. We have developed a complex system of attributes that can be manually chosen from or decided by the computer instead. At the very beginning of the game players will embark into an exciting adventure with a new hero with no particular skills. Each player will have the opportunity to customize and perfect their prefered abilities.

  The character skills in Project E are one of its strongest features. We have 100 + different skills available to the players divided into two major groups: offensive and defensive. The core of the game mechanics constitutes of stacking negative effects on the opponent to limit his resources and at the same time managing player’s own condition. We want to turn the battles, especially the multiplayer group raids against monsters, into epic clashes with deep strategy elements. One can also “relax” developing their hero with side quests and 1 on 1 battles against other players, or AI.

Multiplayer

  We are paying special attention to the multiplayer experience and the team-play. Players will participate fully in the combat, choosing which skills and abilities to use at any time. The result of the fight will depend more on their skills rather than on a Random Number Generator (RNG). Differences in character level can be overcome with smart decisions and clever choices.

  We will offer Player vs Player (PvP) and Player vs Environment (PvE) engagement. For our competitive players we will provide a constant struggle for dominance over their foes. It ranges from quick 1 on 1 Matches, where different skill configurations can be tested, to huge battles of up to 10 vs 10 players. For those who prefer exploration and are anxious to uncover the story of the world, a multiplayer option is also important as players will need friends to complete the more difficult quests in the game. Once we get up to speed we intend to introduce a Guild system. Being a part of a guild will give players the opportunity to participate in Raids (PvE) and Guild Battles (PvP). The raids will range from epic monster hunts to complex Boss fights with difficult mechanics. The guild battles on the other hand will allow numerous players to trade blows defending the honour of their guild. No-matter what the engagement, our multiplayer system will always bring lots of rewards to all of you.

Social

  The social element in the game is another focal point of the project. The game will use “FB connect” for connecting players and easy communication. We want to offer our players full and engaging social experience. The project will be available online through the dedicated website we are building. Players can either create a new account with the Endemiron project or use their Facebook account via FB connect.

  The main idea is to make communication and interaction between players easy and natural. Friends can chat and plan their common quests. They can use their friends’ heroes and skills for team adventures and PvP battles. A really cool feature is the option to “borrow” your fellow’s hero and with multiple heroes to go on a quest. During such quests the player will have control over all heroes in his party with all their available abilities.
The social element brings unique aspect to the Reward system of the game. Players will receive additional rewards for doing battles when controlling multiple heroes. At the same time their friends will be rewarded for “lending” their own.
  The Guilds in Project E are with high social function. They will be the family of the players in this world full of cruel monsters and other hungry for fame competitors. The Guilds will be entitled to unlock special “Guild bonuses” that will benefit their members. Meanwhile the success of the Guilds will strongly depend on the selfless effort of each player and the common struggle for epicness.
  Most importantly we want to make this world open to everyone. We want players to feel a part of it in every possible way. We would like to provoke our friends and fans to be actively involved in the development of the game and will appreciate their feedback. On that note, we have some very interesting ideas about various mechanics through which players will be stimulated to contribute to this growing project. The first one of these ideas is introduced in the Perks.

Art

 

  The art direction of our world is fantasy oriented but with strong Steampunk elements. The story unfolds through various eras - all with distinct looks and art-style. This allows us to blend genres and create internal references. We have many wild ideas about environment, characters, items etc. We want to create an unique atmosphere that will immerse the player in the depth of the experience. For now, things are a bit chaotic in our workshop but that is normal for every creative process. To confront the growing need of artwork we are installing a new “Steampress”. The chief engineer assured us that it will be able to produce an abundance of epic visuals

  The game in Project E starts in a late era where the world gets rebuilt after some major events. This period introduces a technology-meets-magic kind of feeling and is known by the scholars for its early steampunk dominance because magic is no longer working on a massive scale. We try to differ from the rich and luxurious Victorian age that is commonly used in the steampunk culture. Instead, we want to focus on an earlier stage of the steampunk development where things are raw, a lot dirtier, darker and where getting-the-job-done is more important than aesthetics and style.

 

Project E world and stories  

   Epic visuals go hand in hand with cool stories. We have set the scope of our world on a massive scale. We are creating a rich history full of exciting and groundbreaking (sometimes literally) events. Epic battles, cataclysms, enduring heroes and cunning villains inhabit this fairy landscape. The history spans over three different eras and describes the rise and fall of various dynasties. Empires grow and crumble, rulers change, new religions divide the land and brave heroes unite the people. Magic and Spiritualism that once thrived and made obsolete Technology and Pragmatism had waned. Mechanical devices are filling the gap as innovation and practical inventions become the new standard of the world. But with time everything turns to dust or into Legend.

   Knowledge lost, buried deep in forbidden places and forgotten chambers awaits to reemerge and shape the world once more. Remnants of the old and the technology of the present are bound to meet again.

    Our website will feature a Lore Panel that will contain numerous elements revealing portions of the world. There you can find everything from letters, messages and scholar researches to historical records, folk tales and famous legends. They provide one of the ways for you to contribute to the Project (See Perks). Even cryptic clues to the whereabouts of powerful artifacts or weapons may sometimes emerge. The Lore Panel will be updated regularly with new samples from the world.

    The story in Project E begins in the city of Volaxor. Exactly at noon of the first Friday of the month, the usual announcement by the Voice of the City Council was a little different this time. The herald was noticeably anxious which attracted the attention of everyone.

“ Heed me Volaxorians !

I,  the Voice of the City council, announce that a great Expedition, coordinated by the City council and his supremacy The Grand Magus of the Order, will be sent by the end of the year far beyond the west plains. The Goal of this Expedition is to find other cities surviving the Junction, reestablish relations and bring fortune and glory to our city and it’s inhabitants. Many able men and women from the Volaxorian army, the city watch, cadets and masters from the Order will be going on this important mission.  Now is your chance to join this industrious enterprise – riches await, adventures will be aplenty, and your name will be sung for ages after your glorious return.

We need only the best, so if you think you can become a Champion for this Campaign, sign now for the Days of Trials. Join the festivities, taste of the entertainment, and overcome your opponents.

The Arena awaits you citizens, so do not linger. Several months of hard training and battles will select the very best among you to lead our Campaign into Glory! Anyone can enter the Tournament. Our Trainers will provide support and guide you to overcome the challenges of the Arena. Those willing to test the physical strength of the Body will train with Arsul Gladious captain of the city guard. For those of you placing their faith in the Spirit who have not yet joined the Order, you will be guided by nonе other than The Grand Magus’s apprentice -  Adoven Snappe. And finally Master Hunter Elixor ”Deadeye” Jackson will train those who excel in Mind, cunning and dexterity. Although our Arena has been enchanted by Wards to prevent lethal outcome, bear in mind that you may experience  deep injuries, poisonings, fatigue, stun, bleeding, burning  and other unpleasant effects. Overcoming those conditions and prevailing in the tests-to-come is a part of the trials and will secure your place as a Victor. Winners in the different challenges and battles will be awarded Gold to spend on various Upgrades provided by our finest Crafters. So get your gear on, charge your Runescopes, strengthen your Spirit and join the tournament.

Those not willing to join the Tournament will enjoy days of festivities and glorious spectacles.

The Voice of the City council has spoken."

 

Plans for development (why do we need the money)

  In terms of development we are working on a Demo before the Full game is launched.

  We find the Demo stage of extreme importance. It is the stage when every ingredient of the game - game mechanics, art and programming - come together to create a working product. This is the time for introduction of all the necessary features and their testing. A significant amount of story and art content is scheduled to be finalized during this stage as well.

  A website for the game and for our community is to be launched along with the Demo. The site will feature forums, a blog, developer’s diaries and other communication channels. A portion of the site will be a library of knowledge (the Lore Panel see Perks!) where all the knowledge about the growing world will be preserved. The game itself will be featured on this site with its own interface and style.

  We need the $7500 to officially launch the Full Game. We are already working on and self-financing the Demo.

Below we would like to present a general plan for achieving our goal:

  Objective: Completion of the Demo and launch of the Full Game.
Note: It is possible that the Demo launch will occur during the time of our Indiegogo campaign.
Estimated duration: 3-4 months
General overview: The completion of the Demo is divided into three steps. Each of them is planned to be with average length of 45 days. During each step, new software features will be implemented. The steps are planned, as follows:
1 step - First version of the game (Project E v0.9) launch: fundamental game features installed, players may have basic PvP battles, first version of the web-site launched, concept art for the battle interface created.
2 step - Implementation of Player vs Environment encounters and reward system; introduction of Invite-a-friend system for massive battles; introduction of first set of quests, introduction of first Boss quest, first glimpse in the world of Endemiron - presentation of the first stories.
3 step - Introduction of Item generation system; emphasis on content and art generation; introduction of several new quest sets; fine tuning and last moment tests for software glitches and problems. Official launch of the Full Game.

  The estimated expenses for achieving our goals are divided into two main categories:
- Human resources - the intensive art and software generation, as well as the on-going system maintenance, require a modest, yet fair remuneration for our small team of specialists. Our team is currently consisting of two awesome artists and two mystical software gurus who don’t require much to continue practicing their craft but still have a tendency to become angry when not fed for some time.
- Administrative expenses, such as server maintenance, hardware issues, etc.

 

The Team 

    Our team is small but feisty. The basic lineup came together with the beginning of the project more than an year ago.  At the same time we are all close friends and we achieve our best through constant creative argument and vicious word battles. As a team of passionate gamers we like playing and most certainly would love to make a game of our own.

    In the center of the team is Borislav Grigorov, along with some great experts and creative minds, such as Zlati Pehlivanov - lead programer; Alexander Grantcharov - Marketing, Creative Direction and  Velizar “Nordic” Ivanov -  lead artist.

    The main driver and creator of the world of Endemiron, and subsequently the game, is Borislav Grigorov. On a personal note, Borislav has just turned 30 and, thankfully, the first signs of wisdom started to appear in his RPG-obsessed eyes.

    More than one year ago he shared his ideas with us and we just fell in with his passion about this project. Since then, Bobi has been working relentlessly. He developed the story of the world of Endemiron on a massive scale encompassing 3 large eras of history and in the process tons of lore was developed. The original battle system of the game was also designed.

    Zlati Pehlivanov is our leading software specialist. He is with the team from the very beginning. He is the guy to go to if you need anything connected to programming and software codes. Zlati will be responsible for the 24/7 maintenance once the Demo is launched.

    His expertise covers about 75-80% of all skills required for the game to start. For the other 20-25 % we usually turn for some part-time help to close friends of ours. And this part of the programming is the first line of expenses that we need to finance with your generous contributions.

     We have some very talented concept artists on the team to visualise the extraordinary world we are creating. Velislav Ivanov (Nordic) is our lead artist. In the workshop he is the main engineer of the Steampress. He is responsible for giving shape and bringing to life all of our wild ideas. Other great artists that help in time of need are Kalin Georgiev and Miroslav Petrov (Soulsart). Kalin is a designer and conceptualist. He constantly pushes the boundaries of our imagination and pursues an ever bigger scale to make things epic. Miroslav is a veteran in the game industry and his experience as an art director at Masthead Studios is extremely valuable. Some of the awesome art created by our team can be seen on this page.

    Our evergrowing workshop needs constant engineering work. All the miles of copper pipes need to be checked and the pressure maintained throughout the entire installation. For the steam to flow smoothly and the gears to turn in the Steampress we have Boris Angelov to thank to. He does all that heavy IT work and is responsible for network and server support .

    We take really seriously the PR and marketing side of our project. We strongly believe that the success of Project E will depend to great extent on the community of passionate supporters and friends. We would like to involve the players not only in playing the game but in the creation as well. Based on the that the job of the community manager is the hottest seat in the house. And this seat is well reserved for Alexander Grantcharov - our epic PR guru.

   We are constantly looking for good talent to join our cause. So if you want to give us a hand in development or with art, please contact us at  arena@endemiron.com.

Thank you for your time and your support!
story_txt:
Hi there,
  We would like to share with you our idea. We call it the Endemiron Project. (a.k.a. Project “E”)
  We are a team of passionate gamers with extensive experience in the gaming lifestyle. Killing monsters with our friends is usually of higher priority than the trivial necessity of grocery shopping or getting healthy amount of good night sleep. We know what makes a game great. So far, we are continuously missing some vital details in the available browser-based titles. So, our journey in the jungle of the game industry begins.

  As a start we want to create a browser-based RPG game with lots of social elements, exciting content and tons of fun for the player. We are currently building a prototype for the game mechanics. First glimpses of the world are also emerging from our Art vaults. We have lots of cool ideas about battles, classes and skill sets to forge an exciting gameing experience. Finally, the game will offer numerous original story-lines through both singleplayer and multiplayer on a large scale.
Basic Gameplay
  Project E is a Role-Play Game with turn-based battles. The game will offer different classes of characters which players will shape as they see fit. We have developed a complex system of attributes that can be manually chosen from or decided by the computer instead. At the very beginning of the game players will embark into an exciting adventure with a new hero with no particular skills. Each player will have the opportunity to customize and perfect their prefered abilities.
  The character skills in Project E are one of its strongest features. We have 100 + different skills available to the players divided into two major groups: offensive and defensive. The core of the game mechanics constitutes of stacking negative effects on the opponent to limit his resources and at the same time managing player’s own condition. We want to turn the battles, especially the multiplayer group raids against monsters, into epic clashes with deep strategy elements. One can also “relax” developing their hero with side quests and 1 on 1 battles against other players, or AI.
Multiplayer
  We are paying special attention to the multiplayer experience and the team-play. Players will participate fully in the combat, choosing which skills and abilities to use at any time. The result of the fight will depend more on their skills rather than on a Random Number Generator (RNG). Differences in character level can be overcome with smart decisions and clever choices.
  We will offer Player vs Player (PvP) and Player vs Environment (PvE) engagement. For our competitive players we will provide a constant struggle for dominance over their foes. It ranges from quick 1 on 1 Matches, where different skill configurations can be tested, to huge battles of up to 10 vs 10 players. For those who prefer exploration and are anxious to uncover the story of the world, a multiplayer option is also important as players will need friends to complete the more difficult quests in the game. Once we get up to speed we intend to introduce a Guild system. Being a part of a guild will give players the opportunity to participate in Raids (PvE) and Guild Battles (PvP). The raids will range from epic monster hunts to complex Boss fights with difficult mechanics. The guild battles on the other hand will allow numerous players to trade blows defending the honour of their guild. No-matter what the engagement, our multiplayer system will always bring lots of rewards to all of you.
Social
  The social element in the game is another focal point of the project. The game will use “FB connect” for connecting players and easy communication. We want to offer our players full and engaging social experience. The project will be available online through the dedicated website we are building. Players can either create a new account with the Endemiron project or use their Facebook account via FB connect.
  The main idea is to make communication and interaction between players easy and natural. Friends can chat and plan their common quests. They can use their friends’ heroes and skills for team adventures and PvP battles. A really cool feature is the option to “borrow” your fellow’s hero and with multiple heroes to go on a quest. During such quests the player will have control over all heroes in his party with all their available abilities. The social element brings unique aspect to the Reward system of the game. Players will receive additional rewards for doing battles when controlling multiple heroes. At the same time their friends will be rewarded for “lending” their own.   The Guilds in Project E are with high social function. They will be the family of the players in this world full of cruel monsters and other hungry for fame competitors. The Guilds will be entitled to unlock special “Guild bonuses” that will benefit their members. Meanwhile the success of the Guilds will strongly depend on the selfless effort of each player and the common struggle for epicness.   Most importantly we want to make this world open to everyone. We want players to feel a part of it in every possible way. We would like to provoke our friends and fans to be actively involved in the development of the game and will appreciate their feedback. On that note, we have some very interesting ideas about various mechanics through which players will be stimulated to contribute to this growing project. The first one of these ideas is introduced in the Perks.
Art
 
  The art direction of our world is fantasy oriented but with strong Steampunk elements. The story unfolds through various eras - all with distinct looks and art-style. This allows us to blend genres and create internal references. We have many wild ideas about environment, characters, items etc. We want to create an unique atmosphere that will immerse the player in the depth of the experience. For now, things are a bit chaotic in our workshop but that is normal for every creative process. To confront the growing need of artwork we are installing a new “Steampress”. The chief engineer assured us that it will be able to produce an abundance of epic visuals
  The game in Project E starts in a late era where the world gets rebuilt after some major events. This period introduces a technology-meets-magic kind of feeling and is known by the scholars for its early steampunk dominance because magic is no longer working on a massive scale. We try to differ from the rich and luxurious Victorian age that is commonly used in the steampunk culture. Instead, we want to focus on an earlier stage of the steampunk development where things are raw, a lot dirtier, darker and where getting-the-job-done is more important than aesthetics and style.

story:
Who We Are and Our Mission

Hello! My name is Noah Smith, I am a high school student, an avid gamer, and a member of the Chobo Team League. We are Starcraft 2 Low tier Player league and we are looking to raise money for the Child's Play Charity. "Child’s Play works in two ways. With the help of hospital staff, we set up gift wish lists full of video games, toys, books, and other fun stuff for kids. By clicking on a hospital location on our map, you can view that hospital’s wish list and send a gift. Child’s Play also receives cash donations throughout the year. With those cash donations, we purchase new consoles, peripherals, games, and more for hospitals and therapy facilities. These donations allow for children to enjoy age-appropriate entertainment, interact with their peers, friends, and family, and can provide vital distraction from an otherwise generally unpleasant experience." - from http://www.childsplaycharity.org/about We would greatly appreciate it if you helped us!


Our Goal and Our Event

For this Charity event we are doing a Video Game marathon and a Starcraft 2 Tournament to help raise funds. Our goal for these events is $1,000 for the Child's Play Charity.
Our Video game Marathon will take place Friday April 18th and will end Saturday April 19th. Our Starcraft 2 Tournament will be taken place on April 18th with the finals being live on the marathon stream.

The Impact Of Your Donation

The charity we are raising funds to support, distributes gifts to children in hospitals and puts new consoles, games, and other entertainment into hospital and therapy facilities to help the children have a distraction from an unpleasant experience.

story:
Mission Summary

The year is 2174.  Earth is a polluted, over populated planet rapidly running out of resources.  The planet Krixzon, discovered 80 years ago is a beacon of hope for humanity.  

Krixzon: Colonization is a M3ORPG (Mobile Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game)  where you will join the effort to colonize and tame a savage new world.  

The game system has 2 major elements:  (1) the server back-end that runs the game world  and (2) The apps for iPhone/iPad, Android, Windows Phone and eventually desktop apps for Windows and Mac OSX.

We have been working on the first element (the server back-end) for 25 months using our own resources and talent.  We ask for your support to hire graphic artists and one more iOS programmer to complete the app for iPhone/iPad followed by Android devices.  

What We Need

Our goal was to prove that we could develop the back end server software before we proceeded with a crowd funding campaign.  That has been achieved.  It has taken over 25 months and an enormous amount of development time but we are at the point where the apps can be aggressively worked on.  This includes all the artwork and graphics.  Until now, very little graphics work has been completed.  All additional resources will be contract help until such time as we can generate the revenue to hire our own talent.  

The budget breakdown is for 3 areas:

  • Graphics artist talent - 45%
  • iOS programming talent - 45%
  • Server resources/software - 10%.  We plan to use AWS or GCE and not spend substantial capital to purchase our own production servers or rental of Data Center space.  Our existing servers will continue to be used for development and testing.

We have 7 games planned on the storyboards. The first game (Krixzon: Colonization has its storyline and lore 99% complete...minor elements are still being tweaked).  The second game is outlined and we have started lore and the storyline but the priority is on the first game: Krixzon: Colonization.   The second game will be called Krixzon: Invasion.

Our vision is to have you, the players and supporters help develop the future story lines.  There are lots of ideas for the future on the table but right now they are just ideas and nothing substantial has been done with them.  Your help will jump start us and get the games published.

    Risks & Challenges

    As with any software project there are challenges.  That is the reason why getting the server software operational was so important.  Without that working it didn't make any sense to raise funding through a campaign like this.  In a few weeks the server software feature set will be frozen so app development can proceed as our primary focus.  If you have ever developed client-server software you know how difficult the client side can be if the server side isn't stable and in a "frozen" state.

    We have two big challenges.  First, finding talented graphics artists that can come up to speed and add the artwork and graphics to the app foundation so we can get the iOS app published.  Second, finding the right iOS programming talent that understands such an environment as a MMORPG and how to effectively use the resources that have been developed.  Right now, the client apps are basic frameworks with a library of routines and calls that interface with the server.  Although we have had just over 100 test clients running, the big test will be with real beta testers who will do things we never thought of in the test scripts.

    Another area we are taking ideas is with quests.    It seemed simple at first to write dozens of quest lines with the lore and story in mind.  It wasn't.  We have had a lot of fun and amazing quests ready to play and have introduced some randomness into the quests so they will play differently every time through the game.

    Originally we had 2 factions but a few months ago expanded the game to allow for more player factions.  Today we have 3 factions defined and built.  There is room for more but every time you add a player faction, the resulting complexity in how your character progresses through the game and interacts with the game increases by a large factor.  

    We see more than 3 in a future game release but for now, we have capped it at 3.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share our campaign, share our vision and any feedback or questions will always be helpful.   A volunteer said a few days ago "I can't wait to play the game...its gonna be a blast!".    We agree and thank you for any support you offer.


    Follow us on Twitter:  @Krixzon
story_txt:
Mission Summary The year is 2174.  Earth is a polluted, over populated planet rapidly running out of resources.  The planet Krixzon, discovered 80 years ago is a beacon of hope for humanity.  
Krixzon: Colonization is a M3ORPG (Mobile Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game)  where you will join the effort to colonize and tame a savage new world.  
The game system has 2 major elements:  (1) the server back-end that runs the game world  and (2) The apps for iPhone/iPad, Android, Windows Phone and eventually desktop apps for Windows and Mac OSX.
We have been working on the first element (the server back-end) for 25 months using our own resources and talent.  We ask for your support to hire graphic artists and one more iOS programmer to complete the app for iPhone/iPad followed by Android devices.     What We Need
Our goal was to prove that we could develop the back end server software before we proceeded with a crowd funding campaign.  That has been achieved.  It has taken over 25 months and an enormous amount of development time but we are at the point where the apps can be aggressively worked on.  This includes all the artwork and graphics.  Until now, very little graphics work has been completed.  All additional resources will be contract help until such time as we can generate the revenue to hire our own talent.  
The budget breakdown is for 3 areas:


Graphics artist talent - 45%
iOS programming talent - 45%
Server resources/software - 10%.  We plan to use AWS or GCE and not spend substantial capital to purchase our own production servers or rental of Data Center space.  Our existing servers will continue to be used for development and testing.

 We have 7 games planned on the storyboards. The first game (Krixzon: Colonization has its storyline and lore 99% complete...minor elements are still being tweaked).  The second game is outlined and we have started lore and the storyline but the priority is on the first game: Krixzon: Colonization.   The second game will be called Krixzon: Invasion.
Our vision is to have you, the players and supporters help develop the future story lines.  There are lots of ideas for the future on the table but right now they are just ideas and nothing substantial has been done with them.  Your help will jump start us and get the games published.

  Risks & Challenges  As with any software project there are challenges.  That is the reason why getting the server software operational was so important.  Without that working it didn't make any sense to raise funding through a campaign like this.  In a few weeks the server software feature set will be frozen so app development can proceed as our primary focus.  If you have ever developed client-server software you know how difficult the client side can be if the server side isn't stable and in a "frozen" state.
We have two big challenges.  First, finding talented graphics artists that can come up to speed and add the artwork and graphics to the app foundation so we can get the iOS app published.  Second, finding the right iOS programming talent that understands such an environment as a MMORPG and how to effectively use the resources that have been developed.  Right now, the client apps are basic frameworks with a library of routines and calls that interface with the server.  Although we have had just over 100 test clients running, the big test will be with real beta testers who will do things we never thought of in the test scripts.
Another area we are taking ideas is with quests.    It seemed simple at first to write dozens of quest lines with the lore and story in mind.  It wasn't.  We have had a lot of fun and amazing quests ready to play and have introduced some randomness into the quests so they will play differently every time through the game.
Originally we had 2 factions but a few months ago expanded the game to allow for more player factions.  Today we have 3 factions defined and built.  There is room for more but every time you add a player faction, the resulting complexity in how your character progresses through the game and interacts with the game increases by a large factor.  
We see more than 3 in a future game release but for now, we have capped it at 3.

  Other Ways You Can Help Share our campaign, share our vision and any feedback or questions will always be helpful.   A volunteer said a few days ago "I can't wait to play the game...its gonna be a blast!".    We agree and thank you for any support you offer.

Follow us on Twitter:  @Krixzon

story:
Detective Michael Stone enters the small town of Pineview to assist the local police force with a seemingly simple case - A couple is found dead in their kitchen.

The locals believe it to be a case of murder-suicide, their speculation fueled by rumors of the turbulent nature of the couple's relationship. Is it just idle gossip, or is there some truth to the rumors?

Help Detective Stone, assisted by the driven and empathetic Officer Blunt, discover the truth behind Chris and Diane's story. But be warned: the further he pursues the case, the more his own past shall come back to haunt him.

And the closer his own sanity will be pushed to the edge.

 

 

 

 

Featuring:

  • A story-first approach for a dramatic and sublime experience made to linger in your mind years after you've played the game.
  • Simple yet surreal 2D art combined with a cinematic approach to storytelling.
  • A town full of characters with deep backstories, distinct personalities and a whole lot of opinions.
  • An Immersive game world that will pull you in and drench you with its atmosphere and never ending rain.​

 

 

As Detective Stone, explore the beautiful town of Pineview, talk to the many locals, interview suspects, dig through the victims' pasts and try to piece together the story of how and why Chris and Diane's lives ended in such a brutal manner.

You will observe and investigate suspicious looking objects, solve a few puzzles, get to know your co-workers and settle into the daily rhythm of a small town murder investigation even as your past does its best to throw everything off the rails - and it will if you let it. 

 

 

But the past is not just a story to be witnessed.

You will also play as Chris and experience his story with Diane - joining them in key moments of their lives together as they meet for the first time, get to know each other and fall in love.

 

Beautiful, surreal art style

 

 

Your stay in Pineview will be divided into multiple days of investigating various leads, solving a few puzzles and dealing with nightmares, alongside the only co-operative local police officer Blunt.

 

Plan your next move

 

Take notes. Feel like the old man's got motive? Think the local mechanic seems jumpy? Immerse yourself in the investigation and jot down your thoughts in the in-game journal so you can keep a track of all clues!

Pay attention, and maybe you could put the pieces together before the story ends. 

 

 

Experience both sides of the case. Not only do you play as the Detective, but you also get to experience the victims' side of the story first hand as you play through flashback sections.

This way, you get to live through the last few months of their life, take part in their story and develop an emotional connection to the characters whose deaths you are trying to make sense of.

 

 

Discover different locations.

Start your day with a coffee in Mark's cafe before setting off on Market street that connects all of Pineview's major locations you'll be visiting during the investigation.

Home to the renowned Pineview festival and often described as 'charming' and 'vibrant', Market street teems with the lives of young and old vendors, shoppers and a chilly breeze.

 

 

Atmosphere. Not all of Pineview is equally vibrant though, as the rain continues to take its toll on buildings abandoned to the neglect of insufficient public funding. 

Water seepage has made the interrogation room inaccessible, Algae covers the hospital walls, all of which adds to the atmosphere and immersion of living in the game world of Pineview.

 

A damp store room temporarily being used for interrogations

 

 

CHRISTOPHER GREEN, DIANE MILLER

 

The game is as much about Chris and Diane's lives as it is about their mysterious deaths. Newly moved into town, planning to start a life together in the peaceful neighborhood of Pineview, what could have gone wrong?

The police might appear nonchalant and the townsfolk might have much to assume with regards to their reputation, but what really lies beneath is for you to discover.

 

DETECTIVE MICHAEL STONE

 

As a student, Michael was brilliant at everything that he did. An endless thirst for knowledge, a persistent interest in crime fiction and an obsession with the mysteries of the human psyche led him down the Detective route.

Despite being a bit brooding, self absorbed and often out of touch with his emotions, Michael is professional, thorough, and the best at what he does. Except, he's not been himself lately.

Something's been bothering, even haunting him. In fact, if he gives in, it may stop him from solving the case altogether.

 

OFFICER BLUNT

 

Warm, empathetic and ambitious, local officer Blunt is eager to prove herself as a professional of Pineview's finest. She's also known for fearlessly speaking her mind and her loyalty to the ones she loves.

With Detective Stone's sporadic hallucinations and a murder-suicide to deal with however, she might just have more on her hands than bargained for.

 

THE TOWNSFOLK

"It was just a matter of time."

"They never really got out much, you know?"

"They cut themselves off from the community."

"They would argue ALL the time, the things that I've heard..."

The people of Pineview are a source of information, stories and gossip. Not all of it is relevant to the case, and much of it is inaccurate. Their version of events might just be the one they'd rather believe - but does that make them wrong?

 

 

 

Rainswept's visual style prioritizes a cinematic experience through the use of closeups and smooth camera movements, which work together with the simple art style to create a unique look during cutscenes.

 

                      

 

Another aspect that helps the style of the game is the lighting. A simple shift in colors through layers of gradients helps to create different conditions - from misty hills to valleys bathed in the glow of the setting sun.

 

 

Adding parallax to this gives an almost dynamic look to the lighting, and adds depth to the game world.

 

         


                      

 

Fundamental to the experience, Rainswept's soundtrack has been designed to aid the game in achieving its goal - to move and impact the player emotionally.

Just like the game, the music covers an expanse of emotions, and is dripping with atmosphere. It's also pretty good to put on and listen to by itself!

The soundtrack is being composed by micAmic, the composer behind Harvester Games’ 2012 sentimental epic The Cat Lady  Here's a preview.

 

 

 

                                                                                     

From impractically dreaming of becoming a game developer to giving up on that dream a decade ago in favor of architecture, film making and eventually returning to video games, I've been looking for the right medium to express and share beauty with the world.

To convey the indescribable in a form that, if not understood, can at least be felt. Thanks to the way the indie game development scene has developed over the past decade, the original dream is finally within reach!

It has become my life's purpose to create art that moves people; hopefully Rainswept is the first step in achieving that dream.

 

Besides being involved in the founding of brother Rem Michalski's Polish independent games studio Harvester Games himself, Michal alias micAmic has also served as the chief music composer to all of its major titles.

This being of course the trilogy of The Cat Lady, Downfall - A Horror Adventure Game and the highly anticipated Lorelai.

 

 

Rainswept is scheduled for a January 2019 PC, Mac and Linux release on Steam, Itch and Gamejolt. The game is complete in terms of its gameplay and story, and is playable from start to end.

Now however it’s time for me to plug in the holes by:

  • Completing missing scenes, levels, dialogues and other accessories to make the game world feel even more alive,
  • Polishing various aspects of writing, animations, graphics, user interface,
  • Testing for quality assurance.

While other localization oriented tasks will follow.

This guarantees that the project will be completed and released as per the following schedule, while also allowing for me to ensure maximum quality.

The demo released in January 2018 was positively received and hopefully, something similar awaits a full year later.

FOLLOW ALONG

 

 

Originally planned for August 2018, the release date was pushed back so that I could really make sure the entire experience was great and not just playable.

Funding from Indiegogo, with your help, gives me the time to continue working on the game for this period by helping with rent, food and general costs of living, and will also enable the purchase of necessary sound and visual assets.

 

 

 

DESCRIPTION

 

MAKING OF RAINSWEPT DIGITAL ART BOOK (TIER $25 AND ABOVE)

The Art Book provides insight into the development of Rainswept's cinematic scenes, characters and locations by describing my thought processes, motivations and inspirations behind each. 

 

A mock-up of the art book - the final thing will look cooler!

 

CHARACTER WITH YOUR NAME, APPEARANCE AND PERSONALITY (TIER $400)

 

Your chance to be a Pineview resident!

I'll design an NPC, or a non-playable character with your name, physical appearance and personality that can also be interacted with while exploring the town! Not just that, but your character will also have dialogues scripted for each in-game day.

Whether you'll aid the detective or confuse players will completely depend on you, as your character will be based on personality tests, discussions with you and a survey with questions regarding how you'd react to different situations in the game!

 

 

So what led me from Architecture to developing a video game?

I've been trying to understand beauty ever since I caught glimpse of a few mist covered mountains during a railway journey.

Those mountains left an impression. I was 15, and I realized I wanted to give my life to seeking, creating and understanding beauty. Over time I came to realize that making art was essential to this search of mine, but turning it into a career path was something I still had to figure out.

I ended up in Architecture school despite not wanting to be an architect and completed my education regardless, all the while mulling over what I really wanted to do.

Any childhood dreams of entering the game industry had been long abandoned; financial issues and the lack of local industry presence made the idea impractical.

 

 

During architecture school, I discovered and fell in love with films. But as I entered the film industry upon graduation and started working on a few projects, I learnt that while I loved film making as a medium of storytelling -- I hated the process.

I realized that I was happiest working indoors, on a desk, in front of a screen, preferably with a small team or even alone. Somewhere I could sit and think in silence. I still wanted to tell stories and move people emotionally, but the medium wasn't right - I had to look again.

I took a year off from this search and landed myself a nine-to-five job in Architecture as I attempted to re-calibrate. The job was temporary, intended to give me time to stabilize myself as I tried to plan out my next move. 

This was when a friend of mine suggested game development; where I'd have normally dismissed the idea as I had done in the past, things were different now.

Game development had grown accessible to the world as barriers to entry had dropped. Besides turning out to be the perfect medium of self expression for me, I now had a background in film and architecture to exploit.

Just through the process of working on Rainswept, I feel I have already achieved a part of my dream. Now it's time to share it with the world.

 

REFERENCES

 

Early concept art for Rainswept

 

While Twin Peaks and other TV shows of the Police Procedural and Nordic Noir genres act as obvious inspirations, Rainswept primarily derives from South Korean crime thrillers in its overall mood and emotion. 

This isn't just a murder mystery - but a story about life, love, beauty, suffering and meaning.  It's about how other people impact our lives, and whether we have any control over who we become once they're gone.

My aim with Rainswept is to create something that affects players, moves them emotionally  and hopefully, stays with them years later. Something cathartic.

That is what the best games, movies, books and music have done for me, and that's what I've always wanted to do for others.

 

 

The main challenge is that I'm working on Rainswept relatively alone and a delay in release is always likely.

That said, living frugally in a place with a low cost of living has helped avert a lot of the financial risks, while a successful demo release has made me aware of the game development and publishing process.

Also as mentioned previously, most of the game has already been developed apart from addressing minor issues, additional content and polish. An unsuccessful campaign may hamper progress, but Rainswept will be released regardless.

It's been more than a year that I've been working full-time on Rainswept -- This is now my career and my life.

story:
ref'ju:geeks welcome!

  • Deine Bank hat die Langsamkeit entdeckt!  
  • Der ju'nien Mailserver hat Dich verraten!
  • Deine Gruppe war zu langsam!

Wenn einer oder mehrere der obigen Punkte auf Dich zutrifft, dann ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit groß dass Du es dieses Jahr nicht auf die Junien geschafft hast.

Wenn Du ...

  • trotzdem nicht auf Hagen verzichten möchtest.
  • Deine Kumpels wiedertreffen möchtest.
  • eine Partie auf dem Damenklo zocken willst.

... dann komm zur [ref'ju:geeks welcome]!

 




Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir organisieren eine private Invite-only-LAN-Party, ausgerichtet insbesondere für SEG und STS.

Kosten

Wir benötigen dafür mindestens 800 EUR. Diese verteilen sich wie folgt:

  • Hallenmiete: 700
  • Switch-Hardware: 200
  • Internetanschluss: (LTE-Router: 100, Internet-Kosten: 50)
  • Puffer: 100

Ihr seht, mit 800 EUR sind wir deutlich unter dem was wir eigentlich brauchen. Jedoch kriegen wir bei 800 EUR die Location sicher angemietet - ab dann können wir verlässlich planen.

Benefits

  Der Hauptbenefit den Du mit Deiner Beteiligung bekommen kannst, ist die Teilnahme an der LAN-Party, samt Location, Strom, Netzwerk und Schlafplatz.

Mit etwas mehr Geld werden wir auch einen Internetzugang ermöglichen.

Sollte erheblich mehr Geld zusammenkommen, ziehen wir folgende Schnapsideen in Betracht:

  • Cateringangebot
  • Netzwerktunnel zur Junien
  • Shuttleservice zur Junien

Dies sind aber bisher reine Gedankenspiele, einiges davon ist natürlich auch abhängig von Anderen (zum Beispiel ist ein Netzwerktunnel ohne Unterstützung vom Team Junien unmöglich). Angeboten wird erst mal nur Location, Sitzplatz, Strom und Schlafplatz.

 

Dein Beitrag

 Mit Deinem Beitrag machst Du diese LAN erst möglich. Erst wenn wir mindestens die Kosten für die Hallenmiete zusammenkriegen, können wir die Verträge unterschreiben und die Party steigen lassen.  
 

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Die Hauptrisiken sind finanzieller Natur - und da kannst Du uns helfen! Spende jetzt und sichere Dir Deinen Platz!

Das zweigrößte Risiko besteht darin dass uns die Location weggeschnappt wird - viele Möglichkeiten gibt es im wunderschönen Hagen einfach nicht. Auch hier gilt: Buche so schnell Du kannst, und wir können uns die Location sichern! Zögere nicht, junger Flüchtling!

Auch der Internetzugang hat noch Fragezeichen. Aktuell gehen wir zwei Alternativen nach und sind optimistisch dass mindestens eine davon aufgehen wird, 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Wenn Du in die Planung mit eingebunden werden möchtest, sprich uns einfach an.
Knowledge und Hardware wie LTE-Router, -verträge, Switches, Gameserver können uns auch weiterhelfen.
  

Disclaimer

Dies ist eine private Veranstaltung. Wir behalten uns vor zu entscheiden wer zu dieser LAN kommen darf (SEG und STS in erster Linie). Diesem Umstand tragen wir dadurch Rechnung dass das entsprechende Perk nur als geheimer Perk im entsprechenden Kreis verteilt wird.
Wenn Du unsicher bist ob Du zum erlauchten Kreis gehörst kannst Du uns gerne vorher kontaktieren.
story_txt:
ref'ju:geeks welcome!


Deine Bank hat die Langsamkeit entdeckt!  
Der ju'nien Mailserver hat Dich verraten!
Deine Gruppe war zu langsam!

Wenn einer oder mehrere der obigen Punkte auf Dich zutrifft, dann ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit groß dass Du es dieses Jahr nicht auf die Junien geschafft hast.
Wenn Du ...

trotzdem nicht auf Hagen verzichten möchtest.
Deine Kumpels wiedertreffen möchtest.
eine Partie auf dem Damenklo zocken willst.


... dann komm zur [ref'ju:geeks welcome]!

 
Was du uns gibst & was du bekommstWir organisieren eine private Invite-only-LAN-Party, ausgerichtet insbesondere für SEG und STS.Kosten

Wir benötigen dafür mindestens 800 EUR. Diese verteilen sich wie folgt:

Hallenmiete: 700
Switch-Hardware: 200
Internetanschluss: (LTE-Router: 100, Internet-Kosten: 50)
Puffer: 100

Ihr seht, mit 800 EUR sind wir deutlich unter dem was wir eigentlich brauchen. Jedoch kriegen wir bei 800 EUR die Location sicher angemietet - ab dann können wir verlässlich planen.
Benefits  Der Hauptbenefit den Du mit Deiner Beteiligung bekommen kannst, ist die Teilnahme an der LAN-Party, samt Location, Strom, Netzwerk und Schlafplatz.Mit etwas mehr Geld werden wir auch einen Internetzugang ermöglichen.Sollte erheblich mehr Geld zusammenkommen, ziehen wir folgende Schnapsideen in Betracht:

Cateringangebot
Netzwerktunnel zur Junien
Shuttleservice zur Junien

Dies sind aber bisher reine Gedankenspiele, einiges davon ist natürlich auch abhängig von Anderen (zum Beispiel ist ein Netzwerktunnel ohne Unterstützung vom Team Junien unmöglich). Angeboten wird erst mal nur Location, Sitzplatz, Strom und Schlafplatz.

 Mit Deinem Beitrag machst Du diese LAN erst möglich. Erst wenn wir mindestens die Kosten für die Hallenmiete zusammenkriegen, können wir die Verträge unterschreiben und die Party steigen lassen.

darf (SEG und STS in erster Linie). Diesem Umstand tragen wir dadurch Rechnung dass das entsprechende Perk nur als geheimer Perk im entsprechenden Kreis verteilt wird.Wenn Du unsicher bist

story:
Hell has been unleashed! Face the demons head-on with a team of Hell Warders, an ancient order of heroes with unique powers and abilities. Push back waves of demons with an arsenal of weapons, powerful hero skills and deployable towers. Hell Warders is a co-operative multiplayer action hero defense game unlike any other. Backers will get immediate access to the Hell Warders Beta (PC - Steam Platform Only) and the Full Game once it's released (See Rewards Section for more details). 

 

  • A new Defense subgenre - With elements of Hero Defense and Tower Defense, and Hell Warder’s unique character.
  • 4 Player Co-op - Combine forces and battle the forces of evil! Hell Warders supports both co-operative games with friends or with other warders via auto-matchmaking.
  • Multiple Playable Classes - Choose from a roster of diverse heroes, each with unique skills and abilities. 
  • Build your Defenses - Plan your defenses and build powerful towers to foil the enemy
  • Game changing skills and abilities - Use your skills and abilities strategically to destroy the enemy invasion.
  • Epic Enemies - From giant earth-shattering wurms to magic wielding lyches, the enemy will not wait for you.
  • Dynamic Maps - Dodge flowing lava or fly on a giant spinning fan! Every map in Hell Warders is dynamic and offers tons of different strategies.
  • Action is the Core - Hell Warders is designed to put action and Heroes at the focus of the game. Players can immediately pick up the game and get into the action without worrying about reading strategy guides or memorizing build strategies. Every map has dynamic elements that force players to react and formulate plans as the game progresses.

The Key objective of Hell Warders is to defend the Nexus from a demon assault. Warders must work as a team of 4 to scout for power-ups and set up a defensive perimeter. There is limited time to do this - the Demon army waits for no-one and will carry on a full on assault. Demons will attack from multiple entry points and all angles, and it is the duty of the Warders to ensure that they do not reach the nexus crystal. 

Defensive units

To aid the Warders, the nexus crystal will gather nearby energy to create spirit orbs that will appear on the map. Unfortunately, these powerups may be far away and in dangerous locations, forcing the Warders to decide whether or not to pick them up. 

​​

Ash, The Ember Knight

Trained from birth, the knight combines brutish strength with intelligence. He is the sword and shield of the Hell Warders. He can employ different swordplay techniques, such as the Strike of Wrath or the Abyssal-strike, which pulls enemies towards him.

Dead Eye, The Tainted

An expert cannon maker who has decided to join the Hell Warders. Armed with a variety of hand cannons he can dispatch both hordes and single demons.

Samson III, The Dethroned

Samson was the king of a thriving desert empire before it fell to the Demons. He swore on the ashes of his empire that he will avenge his fallen people. 

More Heroes are coming soon!


We need your support to make Hell Warders a game without compromises. We have designs for crazy maps, intense bosses fights, and powerful heroes - all of which need substantial amounts of money to build and test. Unfortunately, as a small self-funded company it is difficult to bring these ideas to life. Your financial support means we can act on our creative ideas and build game-changing yet balanced features. This means we can focus on building features instead of cutting them. By supporting Hell Warders, you become a patron of our game and a vital part of our community. 

We want to make the game even better for your support. With additional funds, we would able to support the development without the pressure of rushing the product. 

  • $10000 - Enriched Hero Experience - Heroes would have more depth, require practice and skill to master.
  • $20000 - Extra Maps Mechanics - Mind your Surroundings! at $20,000 we'll further enrich our map experience to include more environment effects and triggers.

​​

4x Hell Warders Beta: Backers will receive this as a set of 4 Steam Keys (usually within 12 hours of backing the project), which can be used to immediately activate the game on Steam and gain access to the game. Extra copies could be sent to friends so they can join in on the fun! Beta Access will end on the 24th of May. 

1x Hell Warders Full Game: The Full Hell Warders game (Includes both Steam Early Access and Full Game once it's released).

4x Hell Warders Full Game: Be a true Leader and buy 4 copies and share with your friends!

Exclusive Backer Skin:

Note: Special Backer rewards are cosmetic and will not affect game balance. 


We are conducting a closed Beta to test our game balance and our multiplayer support. The Closed Beta will run from the 10th of May until the 24th of May. Players will get access to unreleased material and test out the game for the first time! The Beta will support online multiplayer up to 4 players. It will also have the following features:

  • 3 playable characters - Play as the Ember Knight, Deadeye, and the Samson III.
  • 2 playable maps -  Fight in a desert storm or on top of a floating island.

The Beta is meant to be a preview and is missing features such as character progression. During the testing period expect downtimes and drastic character re-balances. The gameplay and game balance will not be final. 

We're currently at the Beta Testing stage. Over the next few months, we intend to enter a 3 month balancing period on Steam Early Access. During this period, we will release new characters and maps for players to test out and provide feedback. 

  • May 2017 - Hell Warders Beta (2 Weeks)
  • June - August 2017 - Steam Early Access  (3 months)
  • September 2017 - Full Game Released

How will I receive the Beta Keys?

You will receive the Beta Keys in your Indiegogo registered email usually within 12 hours of purchase. 

How will I receive the Full Game?
 We will email Full Game Keys the day Hell Warders Early Access launches (currently planned for June 2017).  Early Access is a preview of the Full Game and intended to help test out features prior to the full launch. Early Access will automatically upgrade to the Full Game once Early Access phase ends.


What's the difference between the Beta and Early Access:
The Hell Warders Beta will be conducted on the Steam platform. The Beta is a very early preview and will potentially have major bugs and unfinished features. Beta access will end on the 24th of May 2017. Players need to purchase the Full Game to play after the Beta ends.

Players who choose the PC edition of the game will get access to the Steam Early Access Program.

Early Access will automatically upgrade to the Full Game once it is released. Early Access is a preview of the Full Game and intended to help test out features prior to the full launch.

 

Contact us:

Twitter: @Hellwarders
