story:
Twodi is a story in which you the player take up the role of a heroic miner knight on a quest to save princesses in distress. On your quest you will pass through three amazing Twodi worlds which containing a variety of lands to explore, coming up against various foes along your journey. Every world you conquer, you will gain a new ability to use on your quest to further your Twodi experience. Each ability will help you on your journey to crushing enemies, boulders and rubble and digging through obstacles, eventually becoming a legendary miner knight.  


The gameplay you will see featured in this trailer is not the finished version and a few textures (Player and Enemy) are missing, or are not yet complete. This is simply a base of a huge structure, keep that in mind. A beta version of the game will be releasing soon on the app store and other available outlets after the Indiegogo countdown; with your donations and help we will release a true full complete version. The epic Twodi adventure will come out, firstly on Android, and then secondly on IOS and then other platforms in the future (Mac, PC, etc.) with more content depending on the funds raised from Kickstarter.


Our Kickstarter goal is 1,400€. We need your help to bolster our efforts to create this epic quest. We can be trusted to deliver and if our goal is met you will help us achieve our dream and share in the journey with us.

Twodi is coding and created with Unity 3d the free version. To get the game as great as possible we need your support to buy Unity 3d Pro.


Hi I’m Karl Klagges the developer and creator of Twodi. My goal with the game is to improve my own skills and to create a game which is fun for anyone to just pick up and play. I've worked over a year now on Twodi and I hope that I can get your help to get a good start on the play store. Twodi is my first big project.

My group consists out of a young team of developers from different parts of the world. Such as Germany and New Zealand, where I have met likeminded individuals who have the same passion for this industry as me. I met my key partner, Anton Rothe, in this venture during travels as an exchange student in route to New Zealand, and Wayne Maxwell, one of those New Zealanders with incredible entrepreneurial spirit.

Anton Rothe is the level designer on project Twodi and focuses on building the different worlds and lands that have never heard or thought of before. He has come up with some ideas that might have never crossed my mind. Anton was integral member of the team that tested the pro-version of Unity 3d and has undoubtedly improved the functionality of Unity 3d pro.

Wayne Maxwell, has become the music producer on project Twodi. He has helped capture the genre and feel of the game in the beta release.

Now that you have decided to join this epic quest we are pleased to have you along for the journey. No doubt, we will face many trials and tribulations and hope to draw on your knowledge and experience along the way.


Any contribution, large or small is hugely appreciated.

5€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team


10€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows


20€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper


40€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper

+The beta version for android devices with continued updates


80€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper

+The beta version for android devices with continued updates

+Free Mac and Linux copy of Twodi


120€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper

+The beta version for android devices with continued updates

+Free Mac and Linux copy of Twodi

+Your name included in the game credits


160€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper

+The beta version for android devices with continued updates

+Free Mac and Linux copy of Twodi

+Your name included in the game credits

+Video game soundtrack


200€ = Receive a signed letter from our development team

+A free full copy of the game for windows

+A free exclusive wallpaper

+The early beta version for android devices with continued updates

+Free full Mac and Linux copy of Twodi

+Your name included in the game credits

story:
Summary:

I will keep this short and sweet.

We are looking primarily for a location and the equipment to cast full time, both live and recorded as well as host a 24 hour gaming center. This is a gaming center, not a game store. There will be small things like dice and other gaming accessories available for purchase, but we are looking to have a full time location for people to come and host games of various types.

We are looking to:

  • Host various game events and tournaments as well as just spontaneous leisure gaming
  • Offer a town with nothing more than a host of bars, someplace else to congregate in a positive fashion for people of all ages
  • Help fellow gamers with a place to congregate, participate, and find new players and friends

    We are a group of serious gamers looking to share this joy with everyone else.

    Any and all support is of the utmost appreciation even if it is just well wishes and encouragement.

We are a group of serious gamers looking to share this joy with everyone else.
Any and all support is of the utmost appreciation even if it is just well wishes and encouragement.

story:
I have a dream. It is a dream of giants, of metal and men and the incomprehensible monstrous alien, clashing with such force that sky itself screams.

Buildings shudder, and the earth itself thunders with their footsteps. Man-made sunfire lashes out from above. There is a strange, flowery smell in the middle of such chaos. A wet tide of purple ichor slaps against armored walls.

I dream - as if I were a mere soldier, standing in the shadow of monsters from beyond the stars, sweating in terror, but at the same time full of hope as man-made gods rampage. I look up, and up, and bare my teeth as titanium slams upon chitin. 

I dream of a legend being written before my eyes. I close my eyes and reach for that feeling, as I stand here in this dense and smoky city. Of a titanic clash of 'natural philosophies' rendered to its purest and most violent form*.

 

*giant robots and giant monsters punching the heck out of each other. 


An epic adventure about savage new steel pantheons:

Out of the cold dark Void came strange spawns from strange suns, here to wage war upon the little beings for simply daring to exist. Man, long basking by his uncontested dominance open his lonely planet, was shaken from his complacence.

And shouts of rage and despair rose with the radioactive winds.  

But though the Voidborn were powerful, they were not completely invincible. When all hope seemed lost, The Betrayer gave humanity the understanding about how to battle its own kind. The woven threads of spacetime were shattered by the collective psychic screams of billions, but the invaders were only temporarily stymied.

Dream with me now, of a desperate time, of two and a half decades spent by a broken but yet unbeaten mankind, in nothing but preparation.

In feral expectation.

For the stars will yet be right again, and the broken threads be as one again, and alien skies will overlap the azure blue.

And gargantuan alien horrors, they return.

But now mankind possesses weapons that can fight them. Titanic war machines, designed to battle the Enemy on their own terms, to turn the enemy's terrible power upon themselves.

New stars are in the sky.

 


The siege has begun.

This is 



What is it, really?


Concept: Epic scale figures on a destructible cityscape.

It is supposed to be a tactical combat game involving differently-sized game pieces, from epically large 4" giant figurines to 25mm conventional forces. It is a game that mixes intense tactical action and deep strategic choices.

Imagine individualized Titan pieces fighting on the field. Imagine stackable buildings that not only provide physical barriers but also may hide weapons turrets, resupply points, or civilians that need rescue. Imagine sheer customizability that makes each game unique, and adaptive rules for different custom scenarios - from brutal skirmishes to complex story-laden campaigns.

The gameplay is simple and straightforward, with very minimal dice-rolling and sheet-checking. Imagine encapsulating a desperate struggle for survival within an hour of fun and exciting play.


What’s inside the game?


The planned components of a Basic TechTitan SiegeBattles Boxed Set are:

  • a) 3x 3″ tall TechTitan game pieces
  • b) 3x 3″ tall VoidTitan game pieces
  • c) 10x 42mm Infantry (Tech and Void) game pieces
  • d) 6x 42mm Tank (Tech and Void) game pieces
  • e) 6x Civilian and Pilot game pieces
  • f) 36x stackable Building Structure pieces
  • g) 6x Hidden Structures (4x Weapon Turret, 2x Supply)
  • h) 24x Action, Person, and Data cards
  • i) 1x printed Quick Rules
  • i) 1x CD with Game Manual and Literature
  • j) 6x City Combat game board (8 x 8 1.5″ grid)
  • k) data sheets and supplemental materials

- and hours upon hours of fun.


Features!

  • ►Epic combat of titanic proportions.

  • ►Many detailed game figures in different sizes, with different capabilities, all significant to the game. Soldiers and civilians move in the shadow of giants.
  • ► Stackable building sets providing a realistic and destructible environment. 
  • ► Game mats allow for custom play areas and huge cityscapes.
  • ► Tactical layer provided by turn-based movement but simultaneous actions, embellished by action cards.
  • ► Strategic layer provided by factors of research, rebuilding, and morale between battles. Scenarios and campaigns provide hours of play.
  • ► Easy, out-of-the-box rules of play. No tedious dice rolling actually needed.
  • ► Artistic and durable miniature pieces that are also great as diorama pieces, for storytelling, or as action figures.

________

Prototype pieces:


Note 1.5" wide game area tiles and figurine bases.


(admittedly, we are not very good at painting)

________


Stampede across an expansive cityscape formed by eight 8×8 grid game mats.


Super New Year bonus:


What's a giant monster-fighting robot setting without a kaiju rising from the depths?

The Basic Set's 8 8x8 game mats will be increased to 10, with two dockyard maps.
The Complete Box Set will have four dockyard mats, increasing 8x8 mats to 14.


Gameplay

TechTitan SiegeBattles is designed to be played straight out of the box. You don’t even need to look at the manual.

You have squishy humans and slightly less squishy tanks and turrets. You have a cityscape with buildings that can fall down. You have teams of Giant Robots and Giant Alien Monsters. 

Heck, you don’t need rules. Let your inner child free and go ‘Braap!’, ‘Pow!’, and ‘Wham!’ and send pieces crashing into each other.

But for an actual game pitting alien attackers against human defenders, you only need to remember three things.

  • 1. All units have Movement Points that can be used to move through the battle grid or be consumed as an Action. 
  • 2. Action Cards represent attacks, tactics, powers and events; how they’re meant to be used is already printed on them. Person and Data Cards tell you everything else you need to know.
  • 3. If you end the turn with Movement Points left, you can counter your opponent’s Actions during their turn with your own Action Cards.

||
All Action Cards consume only one Move Point

That’s it. No need to look up tables and weapon lists, no need to keep checking the rulebook, no confusion about what decisions to make. 

TechTitans SiegeBattles tries to minimize note-taking and reference-checking as much as possible, unless you’re playing the Tactical and Strategic Layers. Then, you will be able to undertake Logistics, Research, and Resource Management for a simulationist style of play. 

Scenarios can be played individually, or chained into a tense campaign through pivotal moments in the history of humanity's Wars Against the Voidborn.


Production Method

The game figures are designed as  3D computer models then 3D-printed into prototype game pieces.  


Why did you choose crowdfunding for this project?

For years now, I've been wanting to play a game that simulates giant robot and giant monster combat, with certain strategic elements that allows for either 'commander' or 'pilot' playstyles. I've enjoyed certain video games and movies, but always there seemed to be something missing.

This isn't that unusual a desire. I know others feel that missing niche too, since I've seen and been inspired by a free RPG system that have been developed to allow players to take the role of giant robot pilots or a base commander. And in a funny bit of recursion, I've also been credited a bit by those cool guys for previously having inspired them to create the game system through a story I've written.

The tacticle fun of a board or tabletop game, competing against another person, it's definitely a different experience to a video game. However, it is also well-known that war gaming tends to become an expensive hobby very quickly. 

No one offered exactly what I was looking for anyway.

I wanted something simple enough that I could play with my little brother straight out of the box. At the same time, in respect to the titanic scale, something that could still play out as tense scenarios or epic campaigns. Expensive and painstakingly painted pieces like most gaming miniatures may deter carefee play. 

If it doesn't exist, why can't I just make it myself? Why wait in vain?

Creating such a game, for quite some time now, seemed as a laughable impossibility - it takes a big company and high-performing team to bring out a board game. It didn't matter how much I itched under my skin for that specific kind of game.

Research however has shown me that in the end what it takes is dedication, bravery, and a lot of hard work. Just waiting for something to happen is not enough anymore. I had thought it was necessary to save up years ahead for massive capital, but it turns out that trying to do it alone is the wrong way to go.

So I saved up and  assembled a team that can do this. Already our 3D modeling and printing method is proving to be faster and cheaper than miniature sculpting and casting. We are sufficiently funded for the first few prototypes, but help is needed.

It is the strength of humanity to help each other, and in that spirit please help me create this game of titanic combat and human survival.



What will you do with the money pledged to this project?

Creating a custom game from scratch takes a lot of time, money and effort. What you give will be used only for:

1.  Actual production of the game, involving miniature sculpting. computer modeling, 3d printing, duplication, etc.’
2.     Contracts with artists, writers, and web developers to help in the creation and distribution of the game;
3.  Registration and Distribution;

These will likely take up most of the donated funds. Game assets will be drawn, designed and crafted even during the crowdfunding period. In effect, we are asking for funds to cover the debt incurred through pre-production.

4.     Then setting up a website and online store to showcase the game and the rich setting behind it, customer support, and a forum for community interaction;
5.  Doing business with a local toy manufacturer to turn the models into high-detail hard plastic game pieces, printing out of the game materials, and packaging for the box set;
6.  - and international shipping costs. It may even be necessary to have someone serve as a distributor in the US because of severely punishing postage. Fortunately I’ve got a friend who can handle that.


How much do you need?

$3500 should be enough to create prototypes and deliver a first production run for play-testing and further refinement. Then, after receiving feedback, time to go full production using a small business loan.


What will I get for my pledge?

$ 5 – Civilian

A personal thank-you note through email, listing in the acknowledgment section of the manual, and early access to the tie-in interactive novel.

$ 25 – Observer

A thank-you note through the email, a pdf copy of the rulebook, a pdf copy of the short story collection, and a random TechTitan or VoidTitan Data Card.

$ 50 – Battler

All previously noted perks, and the City Encounter Diorama Pack containing

1 random Tech Titan figure
1 random VoidTitan figure
2 Tech or Void -Infantry pieces
2 Tech or Void -Tank pieces
12 stackable Dummy Building units
2 random Armament Buildings
1 6 by 6″ Broken City terrain mat.

$ 80 – Tactician

The TechTitan SiegeBattles Starter Box containing

3 Tech Titan figures
3 VoidTitan figures
8 Tech and Void Infantry pieces
4 Tech and Void Tank pieces
4 Civilian pieces
36 stackable Dummy Building units
8 Armament Buildings (2x Gun, Beam, Missile and 1x  Recharge and Resupply)
4 8 x 8 grid Game Mats
3 Person Cards
6 Data Cards
12 Action Cards
1 CD containing the PDF copy of the full rulebook, the lorebook, concept art, and supplemental materials

$ 120 – Strategist

The TechTitan SiegeBattles Expanded Box containing

4 Tech Titan figures
6 VoidTitan figures
10 Tech and Void Infantry pieces
6 Tech and Void Tank pieces
2 Pilot pieces
60 stackable Dummy Building units
6 stackable Large Structure units
2 Bunker Building units
15 Armament Buildings (3x Gun, Beam, Missile and 3x  Recharge and Resupply)
3 8 x 16 grid Game Mats
6 Person Cards
12 Data Cards
24 Action Cards
1 Expanded Rules booklet
1 CD containing the PDF copy of the full rulebook, the lorebook, concept art, and supplemental materials



Your forces stand ready, Commander.


There are two main possible complications to the production of the game:

1) Running out of funding to produce the many game pieces or ship the box sets internationally, 

2) Delays in shipping due to failing to meet art production deadlines.


Don’t worry! Even as you read this, we’re continually working to produce the game itself out of my own pocket. The figurines and play materials are already being prototyped.

Regardless of the funding level, rest assured that if you pledged to receive a full game then you’ll get it. Even if we have to send hand-crafted figurines and game boards with the parcels, you will have what was promised. 

While we are sufficiently funded to produce the game pieces; be it the figurines, terrain blocks, and the game mats; sizable outlay of time and money are still required for various artwork and literature. In this instance we are actually at the mercy of our contracted artists when it comes to finishing the game cards and the manual. 

However, those who provide their email and shipping address are due free updated editions of the game manual and lorebook in PDF format. We will not be shipping the manuals as printed editions due to how much a book weighs and the volume it eats up in a box set. 


That’s good to hear, but what if you manage to receive over what this project needs?

Reaching and going over $4000 will see upgraded perks to everyone who pledged.

  •  Those who gave $10 will get a pdf copy of the game rules and a random TechTitan or VoidTitan data card.
  •  Those who gave $25 will get the rulebook in paperback, a random Data Card,  and a Solo Diorama Set with:
    1 random TechTitan or VoidTitan figurine
    12 stackable Buildings
    1 5 x 5 (8″) Ruined City mat
  •  Those who gave $50 will get as above, and the City Encounter Diorama turns into the Encounter Play Pack.


    It will come with three Tech and Void Titan pieces each; two fighting, one destroyed (random Tech or Void unit). In addition, the Set comes with 16 stackable Dummy Building pieces, 2 Armament buildings, 4 Infantry, 2 Tank, and 2 Civilian pieces – a set suitable for a quick skirmish or roleplaying.

  • Those who pre-ordered the $80 Starter Box Set will have all four of the TechTitan chassis types, and all six of the VoidTitan, 2 new Infantry and Tank models for Tech and Void players, and more Building sets inside. In effect, becoming The Complete Box Set.
  • Those who donated $120 or more for The Expanded Box will have all previous Perk upgrades,  and more pieces for a total war experience. Plus a special SiegeBattles poster, expanded campaign rules, two more environment game mats – Lost Hills and Winter War, and a Base Commander figurine!


I really want this to be a game that you and your family and friends may enjoy for a long time. If the pledges manage to reach $4500, we will go into The Megascale Game.

  •  Instead of 3″ tall figures on 1.5″ base, they become highly detailed epic 4″ tall figures.  All of them meticulously painted and posed.
  • Customization! They can now be assembled and customized to suit your playstyle or overarching strategic plot you may want to weave through the campaign.
  • The game board will become a tactical hex grid instead of just a square grid.

  •   A special new unit – the Land Dreadnought; a purely mechanical combat platform that relies on brute strength and armor instead of the exotic powers of Tech and Void Titans.
  •  More terrain options, including a mountain set, beach assault, and even on the back of aliens god-beasts of truly colossal scale.
  •  More artistic detail on everything! From the buildings, to play figures, to the game board, we will provide an even more photogenic play area.
  •  Campaign options expand even more, allowing you to play different factions and craft the metaplot. Human against human and alien against alien play is improved.


Four inches tall? Those are unusually large figurines for a board game. Tell me more.

They have features more than just size! Each individual TechTitan or VoidTitan would also be composed of several sections:

  1. The Base, likely made of thick hard plastic or resin, or even magnetic- two 25mm discs under each foot.
  2. The Legs, with different poses and types that hint at the movement speed of the unit
  3. The Torso, which is the most important item for the aesthetics of that unit, whether it’s meant for speed, resilience, or special abilities
  4. The Arms, which have weapons and allow for attacks and additional movement options (climbing on top of buildings, for example)
  5. The Face, which further differentiate each (Type)Titan and confer sensory abilities
  6. Back and Shoulder assemblies, which represent more weapons or equipment. Wings, extra arms, etc, for VoidTitans.

Each section serves a purpose, and it is possible to highly customize and personalize each unit. Differences in layout and abilities also give advantages and disadvantages. As more models become available, unique tactical opportunities present themselves.

              

But what if you get even MORE?

It would be awesome if the project gains at least $5000, since that would allow us to be free of worries about  this project over the next few months and devote all our time to giving you the best possible value for your funding. 

It will go towards the purchase of a 3D printer just for this game, which will significantly increase the efficiency  of design and production.

But enhancing the environment and promoting different playstyles will be the main focus of this unlocked funding goal.

  • The buildings and units become unique to three different zones – Heartlands (plains, US industrial theme), Cloudhome (mountains, Incatech theme), and Vanaheim (snow, European War theme). More types of terrain with different height levels for a true tactical map experience.

  • We will provide modular components for Massive Structures that can be used to create an unlimited variety of scenes.

  • VoidTitans also gain new features, units, and abilities. They will have their own buildings that can be dropped to quickly terraform the area to their advantage. A new map, Inside The Beast, will become available.  It’s a campaign goal wherein a team of the most veteran TechTitan pilots and machines attempt to put an end to the extinction-level threat of a Maker-Titan, and its endless spawning of Void-Titans.

    But there are three such behemoths laying siege to the world. This massive creature is its own battle map.


What if I don’t feel like playing a war game?

Hey, no problem! The pieces of TechTitan SiegeBattles are good enough in themselves as toys or for display as a diorama. You could pledge just to get the game pieces, the special art cards, the story collection or comic books.

TechTitan SiegeBattles is a great gift idea too. Game items that can be mailed as printed material have less shipping requirements and may arrive much earlier.

 

Sounds good! How much should I give?

By pledging $80 or $120, you are in effect pre-ordering the full game. This already includes international shipping costs to anywhere in the world. You get the benefit of free updates and shipping of the more refined next generation of play figurines free of charge.

Any help you could give would be much appreciated, but please consider at least $10; that’s how much it to costs to create each figurine prior to mass production.


When can I expect the actual game?

The earliest that the game is expected to be commercially produced is two months after this project ends. In this instance, Feb 18. Therefore, we set our sights on April 30th. Additional elements such as music, promotional materials, special rewards and such, may take longer to arrive.

If you would prefer, you may also receive the game earlier as individual components (figurines, game boards, books, etc.) instead of the ‘boxed set’. Parcel delivery costs may require further action, however.

Can I still help without giving money?

Of course! Any help at all would be very much appreciated.

Please share this crowdfunding project to those you know who might be interested. Post this project on your facebook or blog, if you would be so kind.

Leaving comments and advice about producing game components would also be very useful. Even just simple encouragement would help lighten the load by a lot.

Thanks for reading through this project. May you have a blessed day, you esteemed indie patron!
story_txt:
I have a dream. It is a dream of giants, of metal and men and the incomprehensible monstrous alien, clashing with such force that sky itself screams.Buildings shudder, and the earth itself thunders with their footsteps. Man-made sunfire lashes out from above. There is a strange, flowery smell in the middle of such chaos. A wet tide of purple ichor slaps against armored walls.I dream - as if I were a mere soldier, standing in the shadow of monsters from beyond the stars, sweating in terror, but at the same time full of hope as man-made gods rampage. I look up, and up, and bare my teeth as titanium slams upon chitin. I dream of a legend being written before my eyes. I close my eyes and reach for that feeling, as I stand here in this dense and smoky city. Of a titanic clash of 'natural philosophies' rendered to its purest and most violent form*.
 *giant robots and giant monsters punching the heck out of each other. An epic adventure about savage new steel pantheons:Out of the cold dark Void came strange spawns from strange suns, here to wage war upon the little beings for simply daring to exist. Man, long basking by his uncontested dominance open his lonely planet, was shaken from his complacence.And shouts of rage and despair rose with the radioactive winds.  But though the Voidborn were powerful, they were not completely invincible. When all hope seemed lost, The Betrayer gave humanity the understanding about how to battle its own kind. The woven threads of spacetime were shattered by the collective psychic screams of billions, but the invaders were only temporarily stymied.Dream with me now, of a desperate time, of two and a half decades spent by a broken but yet unbeaten mankind, in nothing but preparation.In feral expectation.For the stars will yet be right again, and the broken threads be as one again, and alien skies will overlap the azure blue.And gargantuan alien horrors, they return.But now mankind possesses weapons that can fight them. Titanic war machines, designed to battle the Enemy on their own terms, to turn the enemy's terrible power upon themselves.New stars are in the sky.
 
The siege has
begun.

Even if we have to send hand-crafted figurines and game boards with the parcels, you will have what was promised. While we are sufficiently funded to produce the game pieces; be it the figurines, terrain blocks, and the game mats; sizable outlay of time and money are still required for various artwork and literature. In this instance we are actually at the mercy of our contracted artists when it comes to finishing the game cards and the manual. However, those who provide their email and shipping address are due free updated editions of the game manual and lorebook in PDF format. We will not be shipping the manuals as printed editions due to how much a book weighs and the volume it eats up in a box set. That’s good to hear, but what if you manage to receive over what this project needs?Reaching and going over $4000 will see upgraded perks to everyone who pledged. Those who gave $10 will get a pdf copy of the game rules and a random TechTitan or VoidTitan data card. Those who gave $25 will get the rulebook in paperback, a random Data Card,  and a Solo Diorama Set with:1 random TechTitan or VoidTitan figurine12 stackable Buildings1 5 x 5 (8″) Ruined City mat Those who gave $50 will get as above, and the City Encounter Diorama turns into the Encounter Play Pack.It will
come with three Tech and Void Titan pieces each; two fighting, one destroyed (random
Tech or Void unit). In addition, the Set comes with 16 stackable Dummy
Building pieces, 2 Armament buildings, 4 Infantry, 2 Tank, and 2
Civilian pieces – a set suitable for a quick skirmish or roleplaying.
Those who pre-ordered the $80 Starter Box Set will have all four of the TechTitan chassis types, and all six of the VoidTitan, 2 new Infantry and Tank models for Tech and Void players, and more Building sets inside. In effect, becoming The Complete Box Set.Those who donated $120 or more for The Expanded Box will have all previous Perk upgrades,  and more pieces for a total war experience. Plus a special SiegeBattles poster, expanded campaign rules, two more environment game mats – Lost Hills and Winter War, and a Base Commander figurine!I really want this to be a game that you and your family and friends may enjoy for a long time. If the pledges manage to reach $4500, we will go into The Megascale Game. Instead of 3″ tall figures on 1.5″ base, they become highly detailed epic 4″ tall figures.  All of them meticulously painted and posed.Customization! They can now be assembled and customized to suit your playstyle or overarching strategic plot you may want to weave through the campaign.
The game board will become a tactical hex grid instead of just a square grid.

  A special new unit – the Land Dreadnought; a purely mechanical combat platform that relies on brute strength and armor instead of the exotic powers of Tech and Void Titans.
 More terrain options, including a mountain set, beach assault, and even on the back of aliens god-beasts of truly colossal scale. More artistic detail on everything! From the buildings, to play figures, to the game board, we will provide an even more photogenic play area. Campaign options expand even more, allowing you to play different factions and craft the metaplot. Human against human and alien against alien play is improved.Four inches tall? Those are unusually large figurines for a board game. Tell me more.They have features more than just size! Each individual TechTitan or VoidTitan would also be composed of several sections:
The Base, likely made of thick hard plastic or resin, or even magnetic- two 25mm discs under each foot.
The Legs, with different poses and types that hint at the movement speed of the unit
The Torso, which is the most important item for the aesthetics of that unit, whether it’s meant for speed, resilience, or special abilities
The Arms, which have weapons and allow for attacks and additional movement options (climbing on top of buildings, for example)
The Face, which further differentiate each (Type)Titan and confer sensory abilities
Back and Shoulder assemblies, which represent more weapons or equipment. Wings, extra arms, etc, for VoidTitans.
Each section serves a purpose, and it is possible to highly customize and personalize each unit. Differences in layout and abilities also give advantages and disadvantages. As more models become available, unique tactical opportunities present themselves.              But what if you get even MORE?It would be awesome if the project gains at least $5000, since that would allow us to be free of worries about  this project over the next few months and devote all our time to giving you the best possible value for your funding. It will go towards the purchase of a 3D printer just for this game, which will significantly increase the efficiency  of design and production.But enhancing the environment and promoting different playstyles will be the main focus of this unlocked funding goal.

The buildings and units become unique to three different zones – Heartlands (plains, US industrial theme), Cloudhome (mountains, Incatech theme), and Vanaheim (snow, European War theme). More types of terrain with different height levels for a true tactical map experience.


We will provide modular components for Massive Structures that can be used to create an unlimited variety of scenes.


VoidTitans also gain new features, units, and abilities. They will have their own buildings that can be dropped to quickly terraform the area to their advantage. A new map, Inside The Beast, will become available.  It’s a campaign goal wherein a team of the most veteran TechTitan pilots and machines attempt to put an end to the extinction-level threat of a Maker-Titan, and its endless spawning of Void-Titans.But there are three such behemoths laying siege to the world. This massive creature is its own battle map.

What if I don’t feel like playing a war game?Hey, no problem! The pieces of TechTitan SiegeBattles are good enough in themselves as toys or for display as a diorama. You could pledge just to get the game pieces, the special art cards, the story collection or comic books.TechTitan SiegeBattles is a great gift idea too. Game items that can be mailed as printed material have less shipping requirements and may arrive much earlier. Sounds good! How much should I give?By pledging $80 or $120, you are in effect pre-ordering the full game. This already includes international shipping costs to anywhere in the world. You get the benefit of free updates and shipping of the more refined next generation of play figurines free of charge.Any help you could give would be much appreciated, but please consider at least $10; that’s how much it to costs to create each figurine prior to mass production.When can I expect the actual game?The earliest that the game is expected to be commercially produced is two months after this project ends. In this instance, Feb 18. Therefore, we set our sights on April 30th. Additional elements such as music, promotional materials, special rewards and such, may take longer to arrive.If you would prefer, you may also receive the game earlier as individual components (figurines, game boards, books, etc.) instead of the ‘boxed set’. Parcel delivery costs may require further action, however.Can I still help without giving money?Of course! Any help at all would be very much appreciated.Please share this crowdfunding project to those you know who might be interested. Post this project on your facebook or blog, if you would be so kind.Leaving comments and advice about producing game components would also be very useful. Even just simple encouragement would help lighten the load by a lot.Thanks for reading through this project. May you have a blessed day, you esteemed indie patron!

story:
What Makes This Game a "Must"

No honey bees, no more Almond Joy candy bars. No more Hagen Das Strawberry Ice Cream. No more Burt’s Bees lip balm. No more apples, peaches, raspberries, blueberries, watermelon, pumpkins. How much more do you know about honey bees? I created a board game to teach kids & adults about the importance of honey bees.

if enough people learn what they can do to restore healthy honey bee habitat, we  can rejuvenate honey bee populations. Then we can all bite into our favorite fruit or vegetables for decades to come.

I live in Philadelphia, PA where there is a vibrant urban beekeeping community. I teach beginners beekeeping to children & adults. Bee Green Philly.com, my informational blog on urban & international beekeeping, reaches 300,000 visitors a year. 

Honey bees are in serious trouble, and urban beekeepers are helping honey bees from becoming extinct. Cities are less toxic to honey bees. In rural areas,  bees may be forced to forage on monoculture crops and toxic habitat. Since honey bees pollinate one-third of our food crops, keeping honey bees alive is in everyone’s best interest. With me so far?

35 states in the U.S. are losing honey bees! Many honey bee problems have been caused or are amplified by human creating eco-system imbalances for all of our pollinators. Through education, we can be part of solving the challenges that will threaten global food security. No bee = less food, less food = more global strife and suffering. Visualize World Peace, Visualize World Bees!

Let's make protecting our food system pollinators as easy as learning how to recycle. This game can be as effective in educating kids & adults about what we can all do to protect our honey bees.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution to my goal of $40,000 (after IndieGoGo's fees) gets Visualize World Bees game and study guide published, packed up & shipped to schools along with a ‘meadow in a box’ resource. With 35 states in the U.S. alone losing honey bees, year after year, there’s no time to waste. This money will pay for:

  • Addiitonal beta testing & development
  • A graphic artist to finalize game design with specs for game manufacturer
  • Translating the game & all materials into: French, German, Italian & Spanish
  • Setting up online content delivery platform including Smart Board capacity for teaching to students/classes all over the world
  • manufacturing board game samples; publishing study guides
  • Packaging my “meadow in a box” companion resource; this is an organic seeds pollination kit for planting variety of bee-friendly plants as community/school projects
  • attending targeted trade shows 2013 & 2014
  • Introduce Visualize World Bees board game and the study guide into schools and youth learning environments
  • 6,000 manufactured games ready to distribute for a national promotion during National Pollinators Week in June of 2013
  • Connecting local beekeepers and beekeeping groups with Visualize World Bees gaming community
  • A traveling exhibition for the Envision Peace Museum
  • Development of a Visualize World Bees phone app for 2014

If I don’t reach the goal of $40,000 in 45 days, any funds contributed will be used to support the game developmt goals listed above. I am great at parsing out pennies! If the goal is surpassed, 5% will be donated to a program that supports beekeeping as a micro-economic enterprise.

I’m offering some cool perks! Here are just a few: A lanyard usb flash drive filled with information about honey bees, Colony Collapse Disorder, and how to BeeCome a Pollination Super Hero! You can also receive a collector’s version of Visualize World Bees with your face on one of the beekeeper tokens.  Or you can get a meadow in a box and start something wild in your community!

The Impact? Global!

Kids learn so much through play!

Visualize World Bees is fun to play and the concept is simple: How do we restore healthy honey bee habitat in order to ensure 1/3 of our global food supply for 7-9 billion people?

When it comes to making a difference on an important environmental concern, the impact of public educatiion is enormous! Can you remember a time when recycling wasn’t a part of daily life? Probably not. By distributing this game, the study guide, and the meadow in a box  into the world’s classrooms, someday soon we be able to ask: “Remember the time when honey bees were endangered of becoming extincT?" and our children's children say: "No, I don't remember that."

That's the win! That's what this campaign is all about!

The Game

Kids learn cooperation over competition; competitive energ is channeled into solving a problem rather than besting a fellow player. No one wins until everyone wins.

Players restore toxic honey bee habitat to healthy habitat on their given section of the game board. Every player must reveal a Queen Bee with the image 1 Billion on its flip side. This is the equivalent of feeding 1 Billion People. Every player has to have one of these queens on his section of the board. Players are encouraged to share resources.

Using our study guide, this game is a teaching tool. Visualize World Bees is a fun way to learn about honey bees on family game night -- you have to be able to answer the questions correctly to move the game along. This game does not teach violence to children. Instead, it's a game that enhances language, science, math, creativity and team-building skills. I think that's pretty cool and I hope you do, too.

Kids who have played Visualize World Bees say two things: I love this game! When can I buy this gamE

You discover more about the game on our YouTube channel.

Can I make this happen? You bet!

As the executive director of a small non-profit, my track record includes successful collaborations with several local community partners; Interim House, Inc., Awbury Arboretum, Project Learn School, helping to launch a an urban farm, a community apiary, a beekeeping program, and the launch of the Philadelphia Beekeepers Guild annual Langstroth Honey Festival.

My past professional experience includes a staff position with Congressman, now Senator Bernard Sanders, I-VT. Organizing on his behalf, I managed door-knock blitzes for over 4,000 households and set up a GOTV office, so I learned a great deal about how to get things done, make a difference in my community and have fun doing it! As publicity and marketing manager for a major publishing house, I booked public speaking, TV &  radio appearances for numerous authors of travel & lifestyle books. I'm comfortable with public speaking. I've been a guest on numerous radio talk shows, presented at conferences, led workshops, & facilitated retreats. I'm not shy about spreading excitement & a great idea!

I don’t want to overwhelm you with talking points! Let’s just say I’m a tireless worker bee. I love teaching kids about honey bees, helping everyone be less fearful of bees, and sharing the benefits we receive from having honey bee in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know what it’s like to want to support a great project but not being able to chip in financially. No worries!

You can make this campaign a success by sharing our campaign link with friends, family, your children’s school, your church, your local YMCA.

Those who can invest money, we love you! Those who can’t? We love you, too! Somewhere down the line you may be in a position to help connect the game with a school district or classroom, or you can buy Visualize World Bees for your family game nights.

So --- MAKE SOME NOISE for us by using our campaign Share tools.

FAQS

You will need to add appropriate shipping/mailing costs for delivery of your perk. This assures that the majority of funds raised go into the project goals we have listed. If you are in a school, you can spread the word about our campaign, send your contribution in as a team, and we'll all save on shipping costs.

Thank you!

story:
AS SEEN ON / PARLANO DI NOI

  

(VERSIONE ITALIANA)

CLICCA QUI


RIOT is a Board Game about social conflict, the sides involved are Police and Rioters; we want to create a simulation of urban political tension and uprising.

In RIOT the player has to choose a side and rule the streets of the city maintainig control of different areas in a situation that is out of any control.

This campaign concludes 12 months of hard work, imagination, research and testing with 4 different prototypes - bringing into life a dream we were chasing - a board game that could talk about reality in a time of crisis and increasing social conflict. 

Your support will help us to make this dream reality and in exchange, you will be the first to enjoy it.



Our Goal is to produce the first copies of the game for the lowest price possible, so that anyone can afford it.

 We also want to improve the Artwork and the graphics with the help of an illustrator (everything will be renewed except our great logo).

At the same time we want to create a 4 players option for the game (See Survey section for details) 


To do so we need € 3.500 that we'll spend this way:

Inside the game's box you will find:

  • 1 board
  • 1 rulebook (ENG - ITA)
  • 148 playing cards divided in 9 different decks
  • 135 cardboard circular tokens
  • 4 player's resume boards
  • 2 plastic miniatures
  • 2 plastic points markers

RIOT uses several board game mechanics which contribute to the games strategical aspect and replay value.

  • Resource management - the resources are constantly collected by players and can be spent in many different ways, according to the players' strategy
  • Units variety - every side has 4 different units to deploy + 2 special characters, each one with different features

  • Bonus based combat system - we want to keep luck in the corner, prefering strategy over all, this is why the game's combat system is based on bonuses and not on dices

  • 2 different decks of playing cards for each side - this gives the player more strategical opportunities to use the cards and play the game in different ways


These T-shirts come only in BLACK. They have a white RIOT Logo on the front. They come is sizes Small, Medium, Large and X-Large. If you would like a larger size. 2XL will be an added € 2.00, and 3XL will be an added  € 4.00 to your order.

As this will be a 4 players game we need YOU to decide wich will the other two sides involved in the RIOT be.  At the end of the campaign we'll held an ONLINE SURVEY to get answers from all the backers. 

RIOT is scheduled for production around the end of June 2014. This means that delivery is expected within September of 2014. 

The production of the game will be done in an italian manufacturer ensuring the quality of the components, and will be shipped from there.

You can add the shipping cost to the perk contribution, or by making a different free contribution.

If you are going to choose more perks, you can add the TOTAL postage to one of the contributions.

For example, if you live in Germany and you selected a "Player" perk, the contribution field will display  € 23. To add  € 9 for postage, you'll have to manually type in € 32.

The copies of the game will be shipped from Italy.


Payments are processed through Paypal which ensures the security of your transaction and refund in case our funding goal isn't reached. 


If you don't have a Paypal account you can create one using any Credit Card.


Email contact: info@riotboardgame.com

PS: REMEMBER TO SHARE, THANK YOU



VERSIONE ITALIANA



RIOT è un gioco da tavola che parla di conflitto sociale. Le due parti coinvolte sono la Polizia e i Manifestanti; vogliamo creare una simulazione il più realistica possibile di una situazione di tensione politica e sommossa urbana.

Su RIOT ogni giocatore deve scegliere da che parte stare ed ottenere il controllo delle strade della città, occupando i vari quartieri.

Questa raccolta fondi conclude un periodo durato 12 mesi e fatto di immaginazione, ricerca, test (ancora in corso) su 4 diversi tipi di prototipo, per arrivare alla realizzazione di un gioco  da tavola piacevole e facile da imparare, che possa parlare della realtà,  in un momento di crisi e conflitti sociali crescenti.

Il vostro supporto ci aiuterà a far diventare realtà questa idea ed in cambio sarete i primi ad avere tra le mani una copia del gioco.



Il nostro obiettivo è quello di produrre in Italia le prime copie del gioco (bilingue ITA-ENG) al prezzo più basso possibile, in modo tale che tutti possano permetterselo. 

Vogliamo anche migliorare la parte grafica (aggiungere i colori, ridisegnare la mappa...) grazie all'aiuto di un illustratore, e continuare a testare il gioco per renderlo sempre più avvincente.

Allo stesso tempo vogliamo creare un gioco che sia giocabile anche da 4 giocatori (Vedi la sezione Sondaggio per i dettagli) 


Per fare questo abbiamo bisogno di € 3.500 che spenderemo così:

All'interno della scatola del gioco troverete:

  • 1 plancia
  • 1 manuale delle regole ( ITA - ENG)
  • 148 carte da gioco divise in 9 mazzi differenti ( ITA - ENG )
  • 135 segnalini circolari in cartone
  • 4 tavole riepilogative in cartone (una per giocatore)
  • 2 miniature in plastica
  • 2 segnapunti in plastica


RIOT usa diverse meccaniche tipiche dei giochi da tavola che consentono di sviluppare varie strategie e modalità di gioco differenti.

  • Gestione delle risorse - le risorse vengono ottenute e utilizzate dai giocatori in maniera costante e in molti modi diversi, dando la possibilità ad ognuno di diversificare la propria strategia
  • Tipi di unità differenti - ogni giocatore può schierare 4 differenti tipi di unità + 2 personaggi speciali, ognuno con differenti caratteristiche e abilità
  • 2 mazzi di carte diversi per ogni giocatore  - questo dà la possibilità ai giocatori di utilizzare diverse strategie di gioco in base alle carte che si decide di usare e a come vengono utilizzate


Le T-shirts sono solo di colore NERO. Hanno il logo di RIOT davanti e l'indirizzo del sito sul retro. Le taglie sono: Small, Medium, Large e X-Large. Se avete bisogno di una taglia più grande:  per l' XXL aggiungete € 3.00, per la XXXL aggiungete € 4.00 al vostro ordine.


Il gioco definitivo sarà adatto anche a 4 giocatori; per questo abbiamo bisogno di VOI per decidere quali saranno le  altre due fazioni coinvolte in RIOT. 

Alla fine della raccolta fondi organizzeremo un SONDAGGIO ONLINE per avere una risposta da tutti i donatori.

Se riusciremo a raggiungere il traguardo la produzione di RIOT inizierà intorno alla fine di Giugno 2014. Questo significa che lo potrete ricevere a casa da Settembre 2014. 

La produzione del gioco verrà fatta in Italia da un'azienda del settore, garantendo la massima qualità di tutti i componenti.


Puoi aggiungere le spese di spedizione al costo del premio facendo un'unica donazione, oppure in un secondo momento effettuando una donazione libera.

Se vuoi ricevere più di un premio, puoi anche aggiungere il TOTALE ad una delle singole donazioni effettuate.

Per esempio, se vivi in Italia e ha selezionato un premio "Giocatore", il campo donazione ti mostrerà € 23. Per aggiungere € 7 per le spedizioni, dovrai digitare manualmente € 30.

Le spedizioni saranno effettuate dall'Italia

I pagamenti devono essere effettuati attraverso Paypal che garantisce la massima sicurezza ad entrambe le parti e la restituzione immediata dei soldi nel caso in cui il progetto non fosse completamente finanziato.

Se non avete un account Paypal potete crearne uno in pochissimi minuti collegandoci la vostra Carta di Credito (va bene anche la POSTEPAY)



Contatto Email: info@riotboardgame.com


PS: RICORDATI DI CONDIVIDERE, GRAZIE





RIOT The Board Game è distribuito con Licenza Creative Commons Attribuzione - Non commerciale - Condividi allo stesso modo 4.0 Internazionale.

This campaign concludes 12 months of hard work,
 imagination, research and testing with 4 different prototypes - bringing into life a dream we were 
chasing - a board game that could talk about reality in a time of crisis and increasing social conflict. 
Your support will help us to make this dream reality and in exchange, you will be the first to enjoy it.Our Goal is to produce the first copies of the game for the lowest price possible, so that anyone can afford it. We also want to improve the Artwork and the graphics with the help of an illustrator (everything will be renewed except our great logo).At the same time we want to create a 4 players option for the game (See Survey section for details) To do so we need € 3.500 that we'll spend this way:Inside the game's box you will find:

1 board

1 rulebook (ENG - ITA)
148 playing cards divided in 9 different decks
135 cardboard circular tokens 

4 player's resume boards
2 plastic miniatures
2 plastic points markers

RIOT uses several board game mechanics which contribute to the games strategical aspect and replay value.



Resource management - the resources are constantly 
collected by players and can be spent in many different ways, according to the players' strategy
Units variety - every side has 4 different units to deploy + 2 special characters, each one with different features


Bonus based combat system - we want to keep luck in the corner, prefering strategy over all, this is why the game's combat system is based on bonuses and not on dices


2 different decks of playing cards for each side - this gives the player more strategical opportunities to use the cards and play the game in different ways
These T-shirts come only in BLACK.  They have a white RIOT Logo on the front.  They come is sizes Small, Medium, Large 
and X-Large.  If you would like a larger size. 2XL will be an added 
 € 2.00, and 3XL will be an added  € 4.00 to your order.As this will be a 4 players game we need YOU to decide wich will the other two sides involved in the RIOT be.  At the end of the campaign we'll held an ONLINE SURVEY to get answers from all the backers. RIOT is scheduled for production around the end of June 2014. 
This means that delivery  is expected within September of 2014. The production of the game will be done in an italian manufacturer ensuring the quality of the components, and will be shipped from there.You can add the shipping cost to the perk contribution, or by making a different free contribution.If you are going to choose more perks, you can add the TOTAL postage to one of the contributions.For example, if you live in Germany and you selected a "Player" perk, the contribution field will display  € 23. To add  € 9 for postage, you'll have to manually type in € 32.The copies of the game will be shipped from Italy.Payments are processed through Paypal which ensures the security of your
 transaction and refund in case our funding goal isn't reached. If you don't have a Paypal account you can create one using any Credit Card.Email contact: info@riotboardgame.comPS: REMEMBER TO SHARE, THANK YOUVERSIONE ITALIANARIOT è un gioco da tavola che parla di conflitto sociale. Le due parti coinvolte sono la Polizia e i Manifestanti; vogliamo creare una simulazione il più realistica possibile di una situazione di tensione politica e sommossa urbana.Su RIOT ogni giocatore deve scegliere da che parte stare ed ottenere il controllo delle strade della città, occupando i vari quartieri.Questa raccolta fondi conclude un periodo durato 12 mesi e fatto di immaginazione, ricerca, test (ancora in corso) su 4 diversi tipi di prototipo, per arrivare alla realizzazione di un gioco  da tavola piacevole e facile da imparare, che possa parlare della realtà,  in un momento di crisi e conflitti sociali crescenti.Il vostro supporto ci aiuterà a far diventare realtà questa idea ed in cambio sarete i primi ad avere tra le mani una copia del gioco.Il nostro obiettivo è quello di produrre in Italia le prime copie del gioco (bilingue ITA-ENG) al prezzo più basso possibile, in modo tale che tutti possano permetterselo. Vogliamo anche migliorare la parte grafica (aggiungere i colori, ridisegnare la mappa...) grazie all'aiuto di un illustratore, e continuare a testare il gioco per renderlo sempre più avvincente.Allo stesso tempo vogliamo creare un gioco che sia giocabile anche da 4 giocatori (Vedi la sezione Sondaggio per i dettagli) Per fare questo abbiamo bisogno di € 3.500 che spenderemo così:All'interno della scatola del gioco troverete:
1 plancia
1 manuale delle regole ( ITA - ENG)
148 carte da gioco divise in 9 mazzi differenti ( ITA - ENG )
135 segnalini circolari in cartone
4 tavole riepilogative in cartone (una per giocatore)
2 miniature in plastica
2 segnapunti in plastica
RIOT usa diverse meccaniche tipiche dei giochi da tavola che consentono di sviluppare varie strategie e modalità di gioco differenti.
Gestione delle risorse - le risorse vengono ottenute e utilizzate dai giocatori in maniera costante e in molti modi diversi, dando la possibilità ad ognuno di diversificare la propria strategia
Tipi di unità differenti - ogni giocatore può schierare 4 differenti tipi di unità + 2 personaggi speciali, ognuno con differenti caratteristiche e abilità
2 mazzi di carte diversi per ogni giocatore  - questo dà la possibilità ai giocatori di utilizzare diverse strategie di gioco in base alle carte che si decide di usare e a come vengono utilizzate
Le T-shirts sono solo di colore NERO. Hanno il logo di RIOT davanti e l'indirizzo del sito sul retro. Le taglie sono: Small, Medium, Large e X-Large. Se avete bisogno di una taglia più grande:  per l' XXL aggiungete € 3.00, per la XXXL aggiungete € 4.00 al vostro ordine.Il gioco definitivo sarà adatto anche a 4 giocatori; per questo abbiamo bisogno di VOI per decidere quali saranno le  altre due fazioni coinvolte in RIOT. Alla fine della raccolta fondi organizzeremo un SONDAGGIO ONLINE per avere una risposta da tutti i donatori.Se riusciremo a raggiungere il traguardo la produzione di RIOT inizierà intorno alla fine di Giugno 2014. Questo significa che lo potrete ricevere a casa da Settembre 2014. La produzione del gioco verrà fatta in Italia da un'azienda del settore, garantendo la massima qualità di tutti i componenti.Puoi aggiungere le spese di spedizione al costo del premio facendo un'unica donazione, oppure in un secondo momento effettuando una donazione libera.Se vuoi ricevere più di un premio, puoi anche aggiungere il TOTALE ad una delle singole donazioni effettuate.Per esempio, se vivi in Italia e ha selezionato un premio "Giocatore", il campo donazione ti mostrerà € 23. Per aggiungere € 7 per le spedizioni, dovrai digitare manualmente € 30.Le spedizioni saranno effettuate dall'ItaliaI pagamenti devono essere effettuati attraverso Paypal che garantisce la massima sicurezza ad entrambe le parti e la restituzione immediata dei soldi nel caso in cui il progetto non fosse completamente finanziato.Se non avete un account Paypal potete crearne uno in pochissimi minuti collegandoci la vostra Carta di Credito (va bene anche la POSTEPAY)Contatto Email: info@riotboardgame.com





PS: RICORDATI DI CONDIVIDERE, GRAZIE


RIOT The Board Game è distribuito con Licenza Creative Commons Attribuzione - Non commerciale - Condividi allo stesso modo 4.0 Internazionale.

story:
Hello!

 

After several unofficial Game boy games developed on greenboygames.com,  ('Micro  Doctor', 'Lunar Journey', 'Submarine 9', 'Leo Legend'), I would like to start a New Game: "Where is my body?".  All my previous games are sold and distributed mostly in physical cartridge (not ROM) since the main idea  is to keep alive the spirit and gameplay of this legendary console.

You can take a look at greenboygames.com

The type of game is very particular, an original idea from the graphic adventures of the early 90s. You have to find out the different types of mysteries and follow the thread of the story (Maniac Mansion style). Your mission is to find the body.  Surely you have not seen many games of this type in Game boy,  and surely you will  spend some very entertaining hours. 

Initially the launch was planned only in the US and European version:
 

Recreation boxes and instruction booklet:

 

Design of the final boxes:

Recreation of the label:

 

But thanks to the continuous requests for the Japanese version, we also present a special edition completely adapted to Japanese, with all the texts only in Japanese and with an instruction booklet:

 

 

 

 

One Game, Three chapters!

The game is divided into three chapters: 'The Lab' , 'The metro' and 'The City'.  In the first chapter, you need to solve various mysteries and get out of the lab before moving to the metro.  

Screenshots Chapter 1:

 

Screenshots Chapter 3:

 

 

and I share with you the Video Demo of the first chapter:

 

The main character: a Hand

The main protagonist of the game is a hand. Yes, a hand that has lost its body. Please note that this is a 16x16 pixel hand.  

 

 

Music

In this new campaign we have two excellent music composers. Cesc  Mozota and Oscar Latorre are the composers of the music and sounds FX  of the game "Where is my body?". They were classmates at EUMES, a music  school in Girona, in the Advanced Music and Sound degree. Cesc Mozota,  with a more orchestral background, facing productions for audiovisuals  and videogames, while his partner, Oscar Latorre comes from more  electronic roots, and dominates the technical part and the sound design.

 

(Cesc Mozota)

 

(Oscar Latorre)

 

Limitations

Game Boy games have quite a few limitations. I share with you some Game boy game Requirements:

  • Game Boy screen resolution is 160x144 pixels
  • The VRAM is limited to 8KB.
  • The whole game weights from 32kb to 1MB. This game will size 1MB.
  • The Game Boy is powered by a 4MHz CPU, but despite the 4Mhz speed, all the Game Boy games are displayed in constant 60fps.
  • Limitation a maximum on 40 sprites on screen.
  • Gameboy cannot display more than 10 sprites on the same line.
  • Only 4 colors! I can only use 4 colors to draw all the scenarios.
  • Only 3 colors in characters !! ... and all the images are built by  assembling loads of "tiles", in this game 8x8 pixels squares (this  technique is designed to reduce the amount of video RAM needed to  display images)

 

Previous games

For those who want to know more about the previous games, you can see the demos through this link. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCY7L-HM5LxogoA...

You can see a lot of screenshots on the webpage www.greenboygames.com

 

The Impact

The market for old consoles is almost obsolete, but there are a  lot of people that still use this systems and have another perspective of the history of video games and old tech. 

Being alone in this whole process, I need support and resources to help me during development.

My mission is keeping alive the origin of portable video games.

  • This project brings innovation and new fun to the first extended portable system.
  • Currently there are not many other projects developing for this console.
  • To protect the continuity of new video games for Game Boy.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you share the spirit of keeping a legendary console alive, you can visit my page www.greenboygames.com  . You can buy me a coffee!

Long life to the cartridge!

 

Note

Please note that 'Game Boy' is named to illustrate compatibility with the game. All trademarks are the property of their respective owners. This is not an official Nintendo or Game Boy game. You can play the game also in Analogue Pocket (https://www.analogue.co/pocket) , Game Boy Classic, Game Boy Color, Game Boy Advance, Super Game Boy, and other consoles compatible with this type of cartridge.
Final boxes, instruction booklet and labels will omit any registered trademarks.
