story:
Dear Stampout contributors and fans

 

On March 17th, 2013 our crowdfunding for Stampout has finished. To honestly come directly to the point: We have completely missed our financial goals! 

So, what's next? The most important thing is that we will not give up and we will continue our work on Stampout.

But one step after the other:

First of all we want to thank you all again. Thanks for the ones who have supported us in a financial manner. Thanks for all who have given us feedback to Stampout and to our crowdfunding campaign. And finally thanks to all that have helped us spreading the word about Stampout or who have helped us in any other way.

So, what are the facts?

  • We have missed all of our goals (goal 1 to goal 5).
  • We have only received about 927 USD.
  • Our campaign reached theoretically about 150'000 people (due to analysis and the addressed network range).
  • Most important: For a planned minimum continuation of Stampout a goal of 20'000 USD had to be reached -this goal we have also missed.
  • Our crowdfunding campaign is a big disaster on the financial side, but it is a good chance to learn a lot from it for the future.

What are our first findings?

  • From people who were able to play Stampout (contributors of the beta test perk and invited people) we received a lot of constructive feedback and not to forget often a statement like: ”… It’s a great puzzle game where you have to recognize structures and you have to be really fast and I’m sure will bring you fun for a long time. Just great ...” (Marc Lynn, from the band Gotthard).
  • People who were not able to play Stampout and have only read about Stampout on the website and on the crowdfunding campaign page were unfortunately not convinced.
  • Although we have received a lot of feedback, unfortunately only a few were really willing to support us financially.
  • The details, the technical feedback we have received and the result from the beta test will soon be posted to you.
  • So our conclusion is that we have made our job in the crowdfunding campaign not as good as required, but we are more convinced than ever that Stampout has a potential for a successful launch (but only if we learn how to promote our game better and to convince the community of Stampout's potential).

Next week we will start our third Stampout workshop. Main topics are the analysis of the crowdfunding campaign, the general feedback, the beta test results and the re-scheduling of the project. Yes, based on the missing of goal 1 in the crowdfunding campaign, we are not able to reach our planned minimum feature set to release Stampout in June 2013. So we will need to re-plan our project work, also to include all the feedback that is relevant and approved by our development team and most important: We have to find other investment sources. We will inform you about our findings in detail after the third Stampout workshop in April 2013.

At this moment we hope that it will take about three months for securing our needed investments. Therefore a possible release of Stampout has to be shifted to the third quarter of 2013, also depending on the approved feature set resulting from the beta test feedback analysis. And we have to be honest: There is a worst case scenario: If we don't find an alternative investment source, the completion of Stampout is not assured. But there’s one promise we give you: We will try hard to find a solution to release our game. So please keep in touch with us so that you don't miss important news about Stampout!

For all contributors of our recent crowdfunding campaign we have the following important additional news: 

  • Although our campaign has missed the goals, we will deliver your perks as promised in June 2013.
  • Due to the fact that Stampout will not be released in June 2013, we have to adjust some perks, because Stampout will not be completed by then.
  • We will inform all contributors in details about the individual changes after the third Stampout workshop in April 2013.
  • As a compensation for the adjusted perks we will offer all contributors the current version of Stampout for free for ever. Please keep in mind; this is a beta version and not a complete game. Contributors of the beta perk will also be able to upgrade to the current version (the beta version was planned to be limited to the beta test timeframe). And the best thing is that all current contributors will get any further version of Stampout that will be produced for free for ever as well. This includes also a potential re-launch of Stampout or a future release in Apple's iTunes Store, independently if that possible release will be free of costs or not. Information how you will get the free Stampout version will be sent to you by email in April 2013.

We hope that you understand our situation and you appreciate our offer.

We are now heading forward to our third Stampout workshop. We will keep you informed and we hope that you still believe in us and in Stampout. And please continue to spread the word about our game – Thank you!

 If you have any concrete questions or want to tell us something, you can visit our forum (http://www.stampout.ch/?page_id=719) or contact us directly: stampout@traentworks.com.

Thank you again for your support and let's keep in touch!

 

Kind regards,

Patrick.
Producer of Stampout

 

 

 

NEWS

February 23rd, 2013

Hi Followers

To clarify a possible misunderstanding: The mimimum goal we have to achive to finialze and release a first version of Stampout is that we reach goal 1. This means that as soon as we get in minimum $ 20'000 then a Stampout release in Apple's iTunes Store is assured (accourding the goal 1 specification; see below).

Higher contributions (goals 2 - 5) enable us to bring you additional features or support for other platforms.

I hope this helps for clarification.

Best regards,

Patrick
Producer of Stampout

February 17th, 2013

Dear all

Thank you all for your feedback to our survey, to our crowdfunding campaign and to Stampout itself. We have heard your feedback, we learn from it (it's our first campaign;-)) and we want to improve our campaign and give you the information you asked for!
 
As a first step we addressed the major issues:
  • Explanation of what will we do with the money.
  • A new game-play introduction video will soon be published that explains how Stampout is played
  • Added a new pre-purchase perk for the ones that only want to buy Stampout before the official launch for a lower price (and don't want explicitly to support the development itself)
  • Upgraded all perks with an included version for the iOS device right after the release (only applies to perks that have not already a free copy included).

Stay tuned. We will keep you informed and we appreciate any further feedback.

Patrick
Producer of Stampout

February 12th, 2013

Hi all

Recently we have started this crowdfunding campaign for Stampout. We have to be honest … so far we are not satisfied with our progress. So, something seems to be wrong. Therefore we want to start analyzing what’s wrong and what can we made better so that you will like Stampout as much as we do. Therefore we kindly ask you to support us by giving us some feedback to our campaign – it only takes some seconds. The poll can be found on our game website: www.stampout.ch/?p=731.

Thank you very much!

Patrick
Producer of Stampout

 

FACTS AND GOALS IN SUMMARY

Facts

  • Stampout is planned to be released in June 2013, based on the goal 1 feature set and that we reach this goal with your contribution.
  • The first planned release is for iOS devices.
  • The launch price in Apple's iTunes US store for Stampout will be $ 2.99.
  • Your financial contribution is need that we are able to complete our goals and Stampout.
  • Depending on the amount of the overall financial contribution we are heading for goal 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5.
  • We do not use your money to reverse fund the invests we have made personally so far.
  • Althought we have a company TRAENTWORKS that earns money with other projects the development of Stampout is not finacially assured, because we need that money for the people working in TRAENTWORKS to be paid and for TRAENTWORKS itself. Stampout is mainly developed by an additional team and is a first game project as starting point for TRAENTWORKS in that market. So we really need your financial contribution and your support! So thank you very much for helping us!

Goals

Reaching this goal is requeired so that we are able to complete the work of the minimum feature set for Stampout 1.0, to be release in June 2013 for the iOS devices.

The following work is still to be done for release 1.0 (among other things):

  • Adding achievement badges for won scores, reached levels and realized combos.
  • Implementation of a local ranking system to compare your results.
  • Adding of graphical and acoustic sound effects.
  • Improvements of the menus.
  • Extending the tutorial.
  • Fine-tuning of the graphics.
  • Adding additional music for menus and other sound effects.

Your money is needed for the following topics:

  • Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above.
  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1.
  • Licensing costs for music and sounds.

If we reach goal 2 then we will add the following functionality to the release 1.0:

  • Integration of Facebook, so you can compete with your facebook friends.
  • Extending the local ranking system so that the scores of your Facebook friends is also shown.
  • Option to publish your scores and won badges to Facebook and Twitter.

Your money is needed to:

  • Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1.
  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 and 2.

If you help us to reach goal 3 then we will add the following functionality to the release 1.0:

  • Sharing of replays by emails, Facebook and Twitter (export and import of the game-play).
  • Export of game-play videos and upload of the replays to YouTube into a special "speed running channel" so that you can show to the world your amazing game-plays.

Your money is needed to:

  • Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1 and 2.
  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 3.

If goal 4 is reached then we will extend Stampout release 1.0 with the follwoing things:

Adding additional music for menus and other sound effects.

  • Implementation of a themeing framework so that Stampout will support multiple themes.
  • Creation of a second theme (new graphics, music and sound) for the launch of release 1.0.
  • The player will also get the possibility to play its own music.

Your money is needed to:

  • Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1 to 3.
  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 4.
  • Licensing costs for music and sounds.

If you really help us by your contribution so that we reach goal 5 then we will definitively launch Stampout also for the Android, PC and MAC platform!

Please take note of:

  • The additional work for added platforms will require a step by step release schedule for Stampout:
    • Launch of iOS release: June 2013.
    • Launch of Windows and Mac release: October 2013.
    • Launch of Android release: December 2013.
  • If we reach this goal 5, then every contributor of this campaign will get an additional free version for Android, Windows and Mac (short after the corrsponding platform release is launched).
Your money is needed to:
  • Implement the features of goals 1 to 4 and to migrate Stampout to the Android, Windows and Mac platform.
  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 4.
  • Licensing costs for required development licenses for the added platforms.
  • Purchasing of test equipment for the additional platforms (mainly for Android devices).

What if we reach a lot more than $ 75'000? We have still some other ideas. The implementation and integration of these ideas depend also on the crowdfunding response.

Here are some examples of ideas:

  • Additional game-play modes (e.g. with changing stamps or playing a ghost (playing against a collegues' replay)).
  • Support for Windows Phone.
  • Development of Stampout as Windows 8 App.
  • ...

 

ALL ABOUT STAMPOUT

THE STORY BEHIND

About a dream

I'm Patrick, I'm from Switzerland and this is my story:

Since many years I love to play computer and video games. I grew up with the Commodore C64 and had the luck to enjoy many of the inspiring and famous games of the last three decades.

I've always been passionated about creating my own ideas, so I already early started to develop my small projects. But my biggest dream always was to have my own company and to create games for a bigger audiance.

In December 2011 I started to make my dream come true. I formed my company TRAENTWORKS (www.traentworks.com), where we focus on the development of gaming, learning and training products. Our goal is to make learning and training more enjoyable and therefore we are combining gaming elements with professional learning and training solutions.

The starting idea

Already some years ago I had the idea of the game mechanics Stampout is based on. One of the first sketches about the game is shown below:

At the beginning the game was called "Flip.it". Later the name was changed to "Stampout".

With the formation of my company the real work on Stampout started. During the followed months I wrote the game design concept and developed some first prototypes. We also decided to invest our money into the development until we reach our beta version. This beta version now should and is the starting point for our crowdfunding campaign that helps us to fulfill our goal: The release of version 1.0 of Stampout!

It get's real

In summer 2012, I finally crowded some friends to start the development of Stampout. The first milestone was our kick-off workshop where we took some first decisions about gameplay improvement and art design. Below are some impressions from that workshop:

On our Stampout website you will find additional information and photos from that first workshop (www.stampout.ch/?p=551).

Between the first gameplay ideas and the beta version that is available now we have gone through many iterations. Not only the game title has changed also some elementary parts of the gameplay have been optimized, so that the game gets a more unique touch about speed and pattern recognition.

And now?

We are now ready to launch the first beta version and to start the crowdfunding campaign!

By the way, if you want to know more about the development history of Stampout, then please visit our game website (www.stampout.ch). You'll find many background infos there, the latest news about the development, photos and artworks from the last months as well as our development blog.

WHAT IS STAMPOUT?

Stampout is a puzzle game with the key elements of speed and pattern recognition.

Some words about the gameplay

The player plays against the time and the scores and achievements of other players.

At the beginning of a game the computer is randomly placing stamps (a predefined quad area with different quad levels represented by colors) on the initially clean play-field. All the quads where the stamp was placed are incremented by the quad levels of the stamp. Overlapping stamps will influence each other. Everywhere where the maximum quad level is reached, the quad level is reseted and the incremention continues.

The goal for the player is now to clean the play-field by placing the same stamp at the correct positions with the difference, that the player decrements the quad levels.

Unfortunately, as soon as the player puts the first stamp onto the play-field, the remaining game time starts counting down. The player has to try to place the stamps as fast as possible. He is able to get time back if many correct placed stamps are combined in short time, leading him to combos, that will not only bring more scores as other stamps, but also additional time.

As soon as a level is completely cleaned the game continues with a new level of higher complexity.

The game is over as soon as there's no remaining time left.

Again, how is Stampout played?

To visualize the gameplay, nothing is better than a gameplay video:


About Stampout's features

Core features of Stampout:

  • Speed-driven and pattern recognition based puzzle game
  • Losing and winning time
  • Achievments for scores, levels and combos
  • Competition through ranking statistics with your Facebook colleagues

Supported platforms

As initial launch platform we chose Apple's iOS. The following devices (with minimum iOS 4.0) will be supported:

  • iPhone 3GS and newer
  • iPad 1 and newer

Currently we are also testing the iPod touch devices. A final decision about a planned release for that devices will be taken within the next weeks.

Other platforms like Android, Windows Phone, PC and Mac are planned for the future but also depend on the crowdfunding response of this campaign.

And when will Stampout be released?

We are looking forward to a Stampout release in Apple's iTunes Store in June 2013!

OUR TEAM

Since summer 2012 our team has grown. Currently six project members from three countries in Europe are working on Stampout:

  • Ursula Waldner, TRAENTWORKS (www.traentworks.com): She is the associate producer of Stampout.
  • Robin Ebser, Robin Ebser Visual Engineering (www.visng.com): He is our development lead and coding guru.
  • Be Engel, POWERPIXEL mediendesign (www.powerpixel.ch): She is the art director of Stampout and is leading the graphical work.
  • Viktor Szalai, Pannon Pixels (www.pannonpixels.com): He is our expert for the graphical work.
  • Martin Häne, MARTYTONE (www.martytone.com): He is our music and sound virtuoso.

and not to forget ... myself:

Patrick Diezi, TRAENTWORKS (www.traentworks.com): I'm the game producer and designer of Stampout and the CEO of TRAENTWORKS.

Below there are photos of some Stampout team members, taken at the last two workshops:

OUR CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN

Why we need you

In the last months we have invested our money to get this beta version of Stampout running. For the last project phase until the release of Stampout in June 2013 we still have some great ideas we want to integrate into our game.

We do not only appreciate your financial sponsorship for the remaining work but we also like you to participate in the final steps to the launch by giving us feedback and beta testing support.

In the next two months there will be a closed beta testing going on, starting today with the launch of this campaign. Because our beta keys are limited, you are able to get one of them by supporting us with the "Closed Beta" perk.

The following work is still to be done for release 1.0 (among other things):

  • Adding achievement badges for won scores, reached levels and realized combos.
  • Implementation of ranking system to compare your results.
  • Integration of Facebook, so you can compete with your facebook friends.
  • Adding of graphical and acoustic sound effects.
  • Improvements of the menus.
  • Extending the tutorial.
  • Fine-tuning of the graphics.
  • Adding additional music for menus and other sound effects.

To complete our feature list until release 1.0 we need about 75'000 USD. In summary the money raised will be used for:

  • Paying our work and our freelancers work for the mentioned features.
  • Licensing costs for music and sounds.

We also have still some other ideas. Some of them could already be included in version 1.0 or are maybe foreseen for later updates. The implementation and integration of these ideas depend also on the crowdfunding response. Here are some examples of ideas:

  • Sharing of replays.
  • Upload of replays to YouTube into a special "speed running channel" so that you can show to the world your amazing game-plays.
  • Facebook updates you on your mobile devices about new records of your Facebook friends.
  • Additional game-play modes (e.g. with changing stamps or playing a ghost (playing against a collegues' replay)).
  • Integration of a theme framework, so that additional themes will be supported (see below for a possible next theme... an early concept).

In addition to your financial help we also want your feedback! Any constructive feedback is important for us and helps us to improve in any way. This is an important requirement so that Stampout becomes as good as possible.

For a detailed feature schedule based on the overall contribution please have a look at the facts and goals section above (after the news section at the beginning of this page).

There are two main ways for you to help us getting the game ready for a perfect launch and mainly also for your personal amazing play experience:

  • Join our closed beta testing by getting a "Closed Beta" perk. You will get the chance to be one of a few people in the world that will be able to play Stampout some months before the official launch!
  • Give us your feedback. Tell us everything you think about what you see, read and hear about our game. Share your ideas with us. But please, be constructive :-).

You can contact us through this campaign website or through our website. There you will also find a forum to share your comments and ideas.

What will you get?

First of all, you will be part of our story and our dream!

Furthermore you will get some additional goodies that will not be available for all other "normal" buyers that will buy Stampout directly from Apple's iTunes Store.

Among other perks, there are some highlights we want to mention here:

  • "Closed Beta" perk: You will get exclusive access to the closed beta. In addition you will get Stampout for free after launch and you will be named in the credits as beta tester.
  • "Collector Editior" perk: This perk includes a printed art book, a printed game high concept document from the development start of the game, a signed postcard of the developer team, a Stampout shirt and a free version of the released game. Everything will be delivered in an elegant collector edition box.
  • "Exclusive Art" perk: This is a very unique and exclusive perk limited to only three items. It's a big, high quality and exclusive art perk made by a Swiss graphic artists. Every of these items will be unique in the world and will be an artistic interpretation of Stampout and TRAENTWORKS.
  • "Workshop III Attendance" perk: With this perk you get an exclusive invitation to be part for one day at our third and last workshop about Stampout. This workshop will take place in Switzerland near Zürich around the beginning of April 2013. The main topic is the analysis of the closed beta outcome and the final planning of the remaing features for release 1.0. This perk will give you the chance to play an active part of the decisions taken for the last development phase of Stampout. Your feedback and collaboration in the workshop will be as important for us as the one's of all other members. To fulfill your job you will also get the "Stampout Closed Beta Perk". Included are also two accommodations in the same hotel where our team will stay during the workshop. Not to forget: Eating and drinking will also be included during the workshop day and you will join the team for the evening dinner. This perk is unfortunately limitied to only a few people.
  • "Stampout Release Party Attendance Perk": This perk will give you the chance to be part of our release party in June 2013. Included will be also one accomodation in the same hotel where our team will stay and all food and drinks during the party.

These are only five interesting perks. So have a look at the other possibilities to get a complete overview of what we will give you back for your support and help!

What if we don't reach our financial goal?

The obvious way will be that we need to prioritize the features we had planned for release 1.0. Maybe we will be able to get a chance to deliver the remaining features later. When we are speaking about prioritization we will prefer quality over feature quantity. This means we have to cut away some planned features.

But to be honest, it's never a good idea to cut down a dream. So we won't give up and try to find possibilities to realize version 1.0 of Stampout in the way and quality we think it should be released.

And what if the campaign will really go bad? Then we will have to analyze in deep our game idea, the concept and also the campaign ... what was wrong? The game idea? The presentation? The campaign? The communication? After that analysis we will restart our project and create a new campaign with the experience we got so far, also with your feedback, so that Stampout will become the game the audiance and we want.

In any of these cases we will use the money that was raised for the prioritized features or if necessary for a deep analysis why we missed our goal completely. Afterwards we will discuss a restart of Stampout and a new campaign and we will share our experiences so that others might learn as well.

What impact can this campaign have?

If we are successful, the finalization of Stampout is assured in the way we planned it and you will get an enjoyable puzzle game with hopefully many hours of fun and challenging game-play.

If not we will make some smaller or bigger adjustments so that the game can be released with a slightly changed feature set or later in a way, that makes us all satisfied anyway.

Whatever will be, we will try and work hard to have Stampout released!

Other ways how you can help us

Independent from your decision to help us in this campaign or not, please spread your word about our game, follow us on twitter #TE_Stampout (twitter.com/TE_Stampout), like us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/testampout) and talk with your friends and colleagues about Stampout.

WHATEVER YOUR DECISION WILL BE, WE HONESTLY THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST AND SUPPORT. EVERY HELP IS APPRECIATED AS WE NEED YOU TO FULFILL OUR DREAM! THANK YOU VERY MUCH!
story_txt:
Dear Stampout contributors and fans
 
On March 17th, 2013 our crowdfunding for Stampout has finished. To honestly come directly to the point: We have completely missed our financial goals! 
So, what's next? The most important thing is that we will not give up and we will continue our work on Stampout.
But one step after the other:
First of all we want to thank you all again. Thanks for the ones who have supported us in a financial manner. Thanks for all who have given us feedback to Stampout and to our crowdfunding campaign. And finally thanks to all that have helped us spreading the word about Stampout or who have helped us in any other way.
So, what are the facts?

We have missed all of our goals (goal 1 to goal 5).
We have only received about 927 USD.
Our campaign reached theoretically about 150'000 people (due to analysis and the addressed network range).
Most important: For a planned minimum continuation of Stampout a goal of 20'000 USD had to be reached -this goal we have also missed.
Our crowdfunding campaign is a big disaster on the financial side, but it is a good chance to learn a lot from it for the future.

What are our first findings?

From people who were able to play Stampout (contributors of the beta test perk and invited people) we received a lot of constructive feedback and not to forget often a statement like: ”… It’s a great puzzle game where you have to recognize structures and you have to be really fast and I’m sure will bring you fun for a long time. Just great ...” (Marc Lynn, from the band Gotthard).
People who were not able to play Stampout and have only read about Stampout on the website and on the crowdfunding campaign page were unfortunately not convinced.
Although we have received a lot of feedback, unfortunately only a few were really willing to support us financially.
The details, the technical feedback we have received and the result from the beta test will soon be posted to you.
So our conclusion is that we have made our job in the crowdfunding campaign not as good as required, but we are more convinced than ever that Stampout has a potential for a successful launch (but only if we learn how to promote our game better and to convince the community of Stampout's potential).

Next week we will start our third Stampout workshop. Main topics are the analysis of the crowdfunding campaign, the general feedback, the beta test results and the re-scheduling of the project. Yes, based on the missing of goal 1 in the crowdfunding campaign, we are not able to reach our planned minimum feature set to release Stampout in June 2013. So we will need to re-plan our project work, also to include all the feedback that is relevant and approved by our development team and most important: We have to find other investment sources. We will inform you about our findings in detail after the third Stampout workshop in April 2013.
At this moment we hope that it will take about three months for securing our needed investments. Therefore a possible release of Stampout has to be shifted to the third quarter of 2013, also depending on the approved feature set resulting from the beta test feedback analysis. And we have to be honest: There is a worst case scenario: If we don't find an alternative investment source, the completion of Stampout is not assured. But there’s one promise we give you: We will try hard to find a solution to release our game. So please keep in touch with us so that you don't miss important news about Stampout!
For all contributors of our recent crowdfunding campaign we have the following important additional news: 



Although our campaign has missed the goals, we will deliver your perks as promised in June 2013.
Due to the fact that Stampout will not be released in June 2013, we have to adjust some perks, because Stampout will not be completed by then.
We will inform all contributors in details about the individual changes after the third Stampout workshop in April 2013.
As a compensation for the adjusted perks we will offer all contributors the current version of Stampout for free for ever. Please keep in mind; this is a beta version and not a complete game. Contributors of the beta perk will also be able to upgrade to the current version (the beta version was planned to be limited to the beta test timeframe). And the best thing is that all current contributors will get any further version of Stampout that will be produced for free for ever as well. This includes also a potential re-launch of Stampout or a future release in Apple's iTunes Store, independently if that possible release will be free of costs or not. Information how you will get the free Stampout version will be sent to you by email in April 2013.

We hope that you understand our situation and you appreciate our offer.
We are now heading forward to our third Stampout workshop. We will keep you informed and we hope that you still believe in us and in Stampout. And please continue to spread the word about our game – Thank you!
 If you have any concrete questions or want to tell us something, you can visit our forum (http://www.stampout.ch/?page_id=719) or contact us directly: stampout@traentworks.com.
Thank you again for your support and let's keep in touch!
 
Kind regards,
Patrick.Producer of Stampout
 
 

 
NEWS
February 23rd, 2013
Hi Followers
To clarify a possible misunderstanding: The mimimum goal we have to achive to finialze and release a first version of Stampout is that we reach goal 1. This means that as soon as we get in minimum $ 20'000 then a Stampout release in Apple's iTunes Store is assured (accourding the goal 1 specification; see below).
Higher contributions (goals 2 - 5) enable us to bring you additional features or support for other platforms.
I hope this helps for clarification.
Best regards,
PatrickProducer of Stampout
February 17th, 2013
Dear all
Thank you all for your feedback to our survey, to our crowdfunding campaign and to Stampout itself. We have heard your feedback, we learn from it (it's our first campaign;-)) and we want to improve our campaign and give you the information you asked for!
 
As a first step we addressed the major issues:


Explanation of what will we do with the money.
A new game-play introduction video will soon be published that explains how Stampout is played
Added a new pre-purchase perk for the ones that only want to buy Stampout before the official launch for a lower price (and don't want explicitly to support the development itself)
Upgraded all perks with an included version for the iOS device right after the release (only applies to perks that have not already a free copy included).

Stay tuned. We will keep you informed and we appreciate any further feedback.
PatrickProducer of Stampout
February 12th, 2013
Hi all
Recently we have started this crowdfunding campaign for Stampout. We have to be honest … so far we are not satisfied with our progress. So, something seems to be wrong. Therefore we want to start analyzing what’s wrong and what can we made better so that you will like Stampout as much as we do. Therefore we kindly ask you to support us by giving us some feedback to our campaign – it only takes some seconds. The poll can be found on our game website: www.stampout.ch/?p=731.
Thank you very much!
Patrick Producer of Stampout
 

FACTS AND GOALS IN SUMMARY
Facts

Stampout is planned to be released in June 2013, based on the goal 1 feature set and that we reach this goal with your contribution.
The first planned release is for iOS devices.
The launch price in Apple's iTunes US store for Stampout will be $ 2.99.
Your financial contribution is need that we are able to complete our goals and Stampout.
Depending on the amount of the overall financial contribution we are heading for goal 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5.
We do not use your money to reverse fund the invests we have made personally so far.
Althought we have a company TRAENTWORKS that earns money with other projects the development of Stampout is not finacially assured, because we need that money for the people working in TRAENTWORKS to be paid and for TRAENTWORKS itself. Stampout is mainly developed by an additional team and is a first game project as starting point for TRAENTWORKS in that market. So we really need your financial contribution and your support! So thank you very much for helping us!


Goals

Reaching this goal is requeired so that we are able to complete the work of the minimum feature set for Stampout 1.0, to be release in June 2013 for the iOS devices.
The following work is still to be done for release 1.0 (among other things):

Adding achievement badges for won scores, reached levels and realized combos.
Implementation of a local ranking system to compare your results.
Adding of graphical and acoustic sound effects.
Improvements of the menus.
Extending the tutorial.
Fine-tuning of the graphics.
Adding additional music for menus and other sound effects.

Your money is needed for the following topics:

Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above.
Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1.
Licensing costs for music and sounds.


If we reach goal 2 then we will add the following functionality to the release 1.0:

Integration of Facebook, so you can compete with your facebook friends.
Extending the local ranking system so that the scores of your Facebook friends is also shown.
Option to publish your scores and won badges to Facebook and Twitter.

Your money is needed to:

Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1.
Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 and 2.


If you help us to reach goal 3 then we will add the following functionality to the release 1.0:

Sharing of replays by emails, Facebook and Twitter (export and import of the game-play).
Export of game-play videos and upload of the replays to YouTube into a special "speed running channel" so that you can show to the world your amazing game-plays.

Your money is needed to:

Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1 and 2.
Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 3.


If goal 4 is reached then we will extend Stampout release 1.0 with the follwoing things:
Adding additional music for menus and other sound effects.

Implementation of a themeing framework so that Stampout will support multiple themes.
Creation of a second theme (new graphics, music and sound) for the launch of release 1.0.
The player will also get the possibility to play its own music.

Your money is needed to:

Implement the features and to complete the work mentioned above and of goal 1 to 3.
Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 4.
Licensing costs for music and sounds.


If you really help us by your contribution so that we reach goal 5 then we will definitively launch Stampout also for the Android, PC and MAC platform!
Please take note of:


The additional work for added platforms will require a step by step release schedule for Stampout:

Launch of iOS release: June 2013.
Launch of Windows and Mac release: October 2013.
Launch of Android release: December 2013.


If we reach this goal 5, then every contributor of this campaign will get an additional free version for Android, Windows and Mac (short after the corrsponding platform release is launched).

Your money is needed to:

Implement the features of goals 1 to 4 and to migrate Stampout to the Android, Windows and Mac platform.
Paying our work and our freelancers work for Stampout's goal 1 to 4.
Licensing costs for required development licenses for the added platforms.
Purchasing of test equipment for the additional platforms (mainly for Android devices).


What if we reach a lot more than $ 75'000? We have still some other ideas. The implementation and integration of these ideas depend also on the crowdfunding response.
Here are some examples of ideas:

Additional game-play modes (e.g. with changing stamps or playing a ghost (playing against a collegues' replay)).
Support for Windows Phone.
Development of Stampout as Windows 8 App.
...


 
ALL ABOUT STAMPOUT

THE STORY BEHIND
About a dream
I'm Patrick, I'm from Switzerland and this is my story:
Since many years I love to play computer and video games. I grew up with the Commodore C64 and had the luck to enjoy many of the inspiring and famous games of the last three decades.
I've always been passionated about creating my own ideas, so I already early started to develop my small projects. But my biggest dream always was to have my own company and to create games for a bigger audiance.
In December 2011 I started to make my dream come true. I formed my company TRAENTWORKS (www.traentworks.com), where we focus on the development of gaming, learning and training products. Our goal is to make learning and training more enjoyable and therefore we are combining gaming elements with professional learning and training solutions.
The starting idea
Already some years ago I had the idea of the game mechanics Stampout is based on. One of the first sketches about the game is shown below:

At the beginning the game was called "Flip.it". Later the name was changed to "Stampout".
With the formation of my company the real work on Stampout started. During the followed months I wrote the game design concept and developed some first prototypes. We also decided to invest our money into the development until we reach our beta version. This beta version now should and is the starting point for our crowdfunding campaign that helps us to fulfill our goal: The release of version 1.0 of Stampout!
It get's real
In summer 2012, I finally crowded some friends to start the development of Stampout. The first milestone was our kick-off workshop where we took some first decisions about gameplay improvement and art design. Below are some impressions from that workshop:

On our Stampout website you will find additional information and photos from that first workshop (www.stampout.ch/?p=551).
Between the first gameplay ideas and the beta version that is available now we have gone through many iterations. Not only the game title has changed also some elementary parts of the gameplay have been optimized, so that the game gets a more unique touch about speed and pattern recognition.
And now?
We are now ready to launch the first beta version and to start the crowdfunding campaign!
By the way, if you want to know more about the development history of Stampout, then please visit our game website (www.stampout.ch). You'll find many background infos there, the latest news about the development, photos and artworks from the last months as well as our development blog.

Included are also two accommodations in the same hotel where our team will stay during the workshop. Not to forget: Eating and drinking will also be included during the workshop day and you will join the team for the evening dinner. This perk is unfortunately limitied to only a few people.

"Stampout Release Party Attendance Perk": This perk will give you the chance to be part of our release party in June 2013. Included will be also one accomodation in the same hotel where our team will stay and all food and drinks during the party.

These are only five interesting perks. So have a look at the other possibilities to get a complete overview of what we will give you back for your support and help!

What if we don't reach our financial goal?
The obvious way will be that we need to prioritize the features we had planned for release 1.0. Maybe we will be able to get a chance to deliver the remaining features later. When we are speaking about prioritization we will prefer quality over feature quantity. This means we have to cut away some planned features.
But to be honest, it's never a good idea to cut down a dream. So we won't give up and try to find possibilities to realize version 1.0 of Stampout in the way and quality we think it should be released.
And what if the campaign will really go bad? Then we will have to analyze in deep our game idea, the concept and also the campaign ... what was wrong? The game idea? The presentation? The campaign? The communication? After that analysis we will restart our project and create a new campaign with the experience we got so far, also with your feedback, so that Stampout will become the game the audiance and we want.
In any of these cases we will use the money that was raised for the prioritized features or if necessary for a deep analysis why we missed our goal completely. Afterwards we will discuss a restart of Stampout and a new campaign and we will share our experiences so that others might learn as well.

What impact can this campaign have?
If we are successful, the finalization of Stampout is assured in the way we planned it and you will get an enjoyable puzzle game with hopefully many hours of fun and challenging game-play.
If not we will make some smaller or bigger adjustments so that the game can be released with a slightly changed feature set or later in a way, that makes us all satisfied anyway.
Whatever will be, we will try and work hard to have Stampout released!
Other ways how you can help us

Independent from your decision to help us in this campaign or not, please spread your word about our game, follow us on twitter #TE_Stampout (twitter.com/TE_Stampout), like us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/testampout) and talk with your friends and colleagues about Stampout.
WHATEVER YOUR DECISION WILL BE, WE HONESTLY THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST AND SUPPORT. EVERY HELP IS APPRECIATED AS WE NEED YOU TO FULFILL OUR DREAM! THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
PROJECT DIGITAL BOOT CAMP - Help the Future of Video Games

Project Digital Boot Camp is a new endeavour of studio 3Mind Games Inc.  The mission of this project is to give new up and coming game talent an opportunity to showcase their strengths in a working game production environment.

Our first team of graduating cadets will be releasing the first game mission from this project in the summer of 2012.  In the next following weeks, we will be posting the evolution of this innovative project.

If you would like to follow our mission or if you just want to tell us you support our troops, please do so, by visiting our website regularly and leaving us a comment.  Share our website link www.3mindgames.com with your friends and like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/3MindGames, PPP: https://www.facebook.com/PPPGame so they can follow the experience as well.

We value the opinions of all our followers, so feel free to send us your questions and comments about this project or 3Mind Games Inc.

Brief Description of the Game:

Pinot is a rocket back-packing, power hungry penguin who will stop at nothing to protect the Pyramid of Power.  Help him stop a variety of crazy creatures who are working together to steal the Pyramid of Power.  Use an arsenal of fruit bombs to stop the endless waves of new enemies as the battle for power progresses.  What more could you ask for?  Test your skills.  Beat your time.  How long can you last in this fast paced, fun for all, strategy game?

What We Need & What You Get

We need the funding to finish our game and start our marketing campaign, promotions, etc.  An honorable mention will be given to everyone who donates to the “Pyramid Power Penguin” project as a “Penguin Patron” on our social network pages and websites.  Watch for special promotions as we get closer to our goal.

The Impact

The Pyramid Power Penguin (PPP) game is a special game project created to support, encourage and inspire future game designers, artists, and programmers looking to make an impact in the game industry.

This game is the result of a special intern project at 3Mind Games Inc. in Montreal.  It was conceived, developed and produced completely by a team of five interns in three months.

This is just a sample of the new talent emerging in our gaming community.  Please support the growth of our community and industry by downloading this game when it becomes available.  All sales of this game will contribute to the creation of future quality games made by new talent in this industry.

Help us to promote and fund this exciting new game created for you by our team of talented interns.  Show them your pride for their work, motivation, and dedication to this project by donating today.   With your donations, you are creating career opportunities for fresh, up and coming talent and their futures in the Video Game Industry. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by sharing our web site or Facebook page. Share this project with your friends so that they can get involved in this worthy cause as well.  Also, we are read all comments and emails sent to us so feel free to contact us any time. We value your opinions very much.

Thank you so much for the support and encouragement by donating to our project. Stay tuned for more exciting news about this project!

story:
Hello! I'm Rahdo, and I film a series of video runthroughs of board and card games. This year, I plan to go all out and make as many videos for my viewers as I can, and I've been lucky enough to be invited to cover the Cardboard & Sun 2013 event, where people like you and me will be playing board games in the Greek island of Paros, in addition to enjoying the sights, sounds and tastes of this Mediterranean paradise!

The Kickstarter campaign that I ran a couple of months ago for my video series helped cover most of the costs of my attending, including getting a new camera and the flight to Paros. However, I soon realised that there is a lot more to film than just gameplay runthroughs at the event. There is a vibrant board game culture in Greece - publishing, collecting, but above all, playing, and I want to cover this in my video series! And if this campaign funds, I'll be able to spend more time in Athens and make even *more* videos. 

This can be accomplished if a bunch of like-minded board game geeks join me for the Cardboard & Sun event in Paros, because BoardGameTravel.com (the event organizer) has allowed me to set up my own group, giving me a generous discount that I can pass on to you! 

So success with this project means I be able to film and broadcast more content about Greek gaming culture.  What will that look like?

 

The Project

For examples of the sorts of boardgaming videos I've been doing so far, you can check my youtube page at youtube.com/rahdo.

So that's what I've done so far, but now I'd be doing something new for me, a bit more like a documentary, covering the growing Greek boardgame culture.  Visiting boardgame cafes like Playhouse, Playce, and Playtime and awesome stores like Playscape.

Greek boardgame culture is exploding, and I want to cover it!
 

The Goal

Why is the goal £2765?

Originally, I had set up this campaign on Kickstarter, with a goal of getting 10 folks to join us in Paros, for a total of fund target of £3950.  During that brief KS campaign, a number of people got a chance to pledge, and all was well.  However, due to some obscure Kickstarter rules that I wasn't aware of when I started (it's not allowed to offer travel options as rewards, apparently), Kickstarter suspended that campaign.  BUT, BoardGameTravel.com still honoured their commitment to those early pledgers, and so now we only need 7 more to make our goal! 

Why is this a flexible funding campaign?

Because anyone who contributes will want to arrange their flights to Athens as soon as possible, to make sure that they get the best airfare. As for the previous backers, BoardGameTravel.com has told me that they will honour this rate for you until June 30, no matter what happens, so you are free to book your flights!

 

The Rewards

So what do you, the backer get, as your backer reward?  Well, let's talk about about the Cardboard & Sand event! :)

Well, for starters, designer Touko Tahkokallio, the award winning designer of Eclipse will be the special guest star. Fans of Eclipse won’t want to miss the chance to play one of the top rated games in the world with the game’s creator, and I'm looking forward to interviewing him about his experiences in making games and what we can expect from him in the future!

The many games of Touko Tahkokallio!

But wait, there’s more!

Boardgame publishers Portal Games and Ignacy Trzewiczek are co-sponsoring the event, and have promised to send many of Portal's Games, and even organizing a Neuroshima Hex tournament!

As if that wasn't enough, another exciting reason to attend is that Touko has designed a game especially for the event: Thermopyles, which will be produced in a very limited quantity, for the participants of the event.

By pledging, you get not only the game, but you join me for a fantastic week on the Greek island of Paros, with access to an incredible library of some of the best boardgames ever, along with a bunch of like-minded board game geeks to play with. All the fun of a convention, but in an intimate Mediterranean paradise.

Please read the BoardGameTravel.com website for all terms and conditions, and feel free to ask them if you have any questions.

 

Inclusions

  • A welcome package in the form of a game box (Agricola-size) containing Thermopyles, a game by Touko Tahkokallio, a t-shirt, maps and information about Paros, promotional offers from our partners, discounts on board game related products and services, and more. 
  • A record of this great experience in the form of content like behind the scenes video, bloopers, interviews and more. 
  • A custom-made photo album containing scenes from what happens when you put 30 boardgamers moving cardboard & wood under the mediterranean sun. 
  • Pickup at Athens airport 
  • 1 night’s accommodation in Athens, on 26 August 2013 
  • Transportation by ship from Athens to Paros on 27 August 2013
  • Transportation by bus from the port of Paros to Alea Apartments in Naoussa 
  • Accommodation in Paros on 27, 28, 29 and 30 August 2013 
  • Welcome dinner in Paros 
  • Use of the game library at Alea, and visits as described in the trip overview below 
  • Fresh bread delivered every morning 
  • Transportation by bus from Alea Apartments in Naoussa to the port of Paros 
  • Transportation by ship from Paros to Athens on 31 August 2013 
  • 1 night’s accommodation in Athens, on 31 August 2013

Keep in mind that if you are a single participant booking 1 spot, BoardGameTravel.com will match you with another participant in a room. They don't charge single supplements, but they do want as many board game geeks to enjoy the event.

 

 The Game

THIS... IS... SPARTA!

Thermopyles is a co-op card game that can be quite tough to beat, where players take on the role of the brave 300 Spartans who stood against the invading Persian army at the Thermopyles pass. But rather than tell you about the game you'll be getting by backing this project, I figured I'd show it to you - soon I will have a PnP copy in hand and will make a Rahdo Runthrough of it!

It's a nice little game - a great light filler to play between other games, or even play solo instead of Klondike - so if you'd like to see this game made and in your hands, you might want to consider a trip to the Greek isles!

 

The Venue

Now this is something special.  Where else can you spend the morning touring ancient ruins, the afternoon swimming in azure blue seas, and the evening playing Eclipse, with the designer of the game?  This is truly one-of-a-kind experience, and I for one am super excited about it!

Beats playing games at the local pub!

Now I'm just going to borrow some text from the event's website:

The inaugural trip for BoardGameTravel.com will be to the Greek island of Paros, located in the middle of the Aegean Sea, and home to Alea Apartments, our board game-filled hosts for a warm, relaxing holiday.

With nearly 400 games to choose from, there is something for everyone, from Loopin’ Louie to Antiquity, from Bunny Bunny Moose Moose to Agricola, and from Bang! to Android: Netrunner.

This is just a fraction of Alea's games collection!

Besides the games, Paros has a lot more to offer than just beautiful beaches and good food. Famous since antiquity for its marble, it is also home to Byzantine monuments like the Ekatontapiliani church and narrow-alleyed villages like Lefkes, where the family of our boardgaming hosts comes from.

Paros, it doesn't get much nicer than this!

Joining us will be accomplished designer Touko Tahkokallio, most famous for being the creator of Eclipse. Touko has also designed a board game especially for the occasion of the trip, which will be given to every participant, as a limited-edition print.

There is no set itinerary, and everyone is free to explore the island, go to the beach, shop and eat, or just play board games the whole time. There will be opportunities for group trips such as to the ancient marble mines, so everyone can make their own schedule and spend their time on the island as they please.

We do not believe in restrictive, expensive, all-inclusive tours. More important is the freedom to choose where and when to wander around, enjoy a meal, get a tan, or play a game. At the same time, we will be right there with you along with our hosts, to pick you up at the airport, to give you advice and to enjoy the trip together. 

You know you want to do it! :)
 

Backer Levels

For participants there’s only one, which is the all inclusive package travel deal plus free game.  However, if you want to book more than one ticket when backing (this trip makes a perfect romantic getaway for geek couples, or bring friend or the whole family!) you can add the same amount for every additional person you'd like to bring with you to Paros. Simple as that! Each person coming will get their own copy of Thermopyles!

For game publishers and distributors who would like to become a sponsor of the Cardboard & Sun (as has Portal already), there's a backer level that guarantees you coverage for your titles at the event. Contact info@boardgametravel.com for more info on this backer level. :)

 

Special Thanks

Cardboard & Sun cover art by Mateusz Bielski

Thermopyles game Art by Tasos Kyriakidis

story:
March 23 Edit: Monolith has been increased from 32 to 48 pages. If we hit $5500, Green Devil Face #5 will be 12 pages instead of 8. If we hit $6000, The God that Crawls will have an additional 2 pages of color art added.

Edit #1: Green Devil Face #5 added as a perk for all levels of sponsorship. See Update #1.

What is The Monolith from Beyond Space and Time?

The Monolith from beyond Space and Time is a 48 page A5-size adventure written for the LotFP Weird Fantasy Role-Playing Grindhouse Edition game, but also directly compatible with other "Old School Renaissance" systems and the classic 70s and 80s games that spawned them. The adventure is written by James Edward Raggi IV with additional material by Kenneth Hite, with all artwork done by Aeron Alfrey.

The adventure is a wild one. Suitable for use in absolutely any campaign world, suitable for character levels 0-∞, absolutely any GM can use this for their game. Inspired by Lovecraft (but leaving out Cthulhu, the Necronomicon, and all such references and equivalents!), the Monolith adventure features an alien structure which phases in and out of time and space. (The title, it is descriptive, no?) The adventure is about the player characters encountering and dealing with the alien environment caused by the Monolith's presence and the effects it has on those in the physical world.

I'll go on record now and say this is going to be one of the wildest adventures your group will ever play.

What is The God that Crawls?

The God that Crawls is a 32 page book containing an adventure (+ foldout map section) written for LotFP Weird Fantasy Role-Playing Grindhouse Edition game and directly compatible with other "Old School Renaissance" systems and the classic 70s and 80s games that spawned them. The adventure is written by James Edward Raggi IV with artwork by Jason Rainville.

The adventure, for character levels 1-2, presents the God that Crawls, its lair (a three-level dungeon!), and the cult that worships it. Fairly standard setup twisted and made interesting and horrific in the LotFP tradition.

But that's not all! The adventure was originally planned for 16 pages, but technical printing issues require it to be 32 pages, so we're including a mini-rules supplement. Firearms, replacing the demi-human classes in the game, and more!

About Both Books

The books will be printed and shipped from Finland, and we're looking at an April print date.

Please note that this a Sponsorship, not a simple pre-order. Because of currency fluctuations and boring business details like varying shipping and tax expenses depending on your location, the exact cost of each project is unknown until it goes to the printer. Plus check out one of the perks of the Monolith class sponsorship. With all that in mind, we've made blanket contribution categories that cost bit more than if you bought these after release. But we're doing this IndieGoGo thing because we want LotFP to release projects faster. Contribute if you do too, with the bonus of getting yourself some perks in the process. If you don't like the setup, wait for the books to be released and buy them then. Easy. :D

Details about the Art Print

Crawling God and Monolith Class sponsorships receive an A4 size full color original art print by an LotFP artist of your choice (available: Rowena Aitken, Aeron Alfrey, Dean Clayton, Eric Lofgren, Rich Longmore, Jason Rainville, Amos Orion Sterns) depicting a scene from any published LotFP release of your choice. After you receive your print, the art will be posted on the LotFP blog.

YOU are the art director! You dictate what you want the art to depict, and then the artist of your choice will produce it (always subject to artistic interpretation, mind you!) and you will then receive a one of a kind art print. Note that the artists may have prior commitments (Alfrey and Rainville are right now working on their bits for the Monolith and God, for instance!) so the art may not be done IMMEDIATELY!! but we'll get it to you as soon as possible.

Note that this art is for you, and will not be used in LotFP publications without explicit permission, separate from this IndieGoGo campaign, from both you and the artist.

More Details about the Monolith Class Sponsorship

In addition to the perks listed above, a Monolith Class sponsorship also gives you up to 5 print copies of the book shipped first class as gifts to whoever you wish (1 per giftee, you must provide their addresses which are different than your own!).

In addition to that, $400 of every Monolith Class sponsorship goes to offsetting the cost of both books' final retail price in both print and PDF. Those willing and able to purchase a Monolith level sponsorship are directly helping both LotFP and every LotFP fan.

See Update #1.What is The Monolith from Beyond Space and Time?The Monolith from beyond Space and Time is a 48 page A5-size adventure written for the LotFP Weird Fantasy Role-Playing Grindhouse Edition game, but also directly compatible with other "Old School Renaissance" systems and the classic 70s and 80s games that spawned them. The adventure is written by James Edward Raggi IV with additional material by Kenneth Hite, with all artwork done by Aeron Alfrey.The adventure is a wild one. Suitable for use in absolutely any campaign world, suitable for character levels 0-∞, absolutely any GM can use this for their game. Inspired by Lovecraft (but leaving out Cthulhu, the Necronomicon, and all such references and equivalents!), the Monolith adventure features an alien structure which phases in and out of time and space. (The title, it is descriptive, no?) The adventure is about the player characters encountering and dealing with the alien environment caused by the Monolith's presence and the effects it has on those in the physical world.I'll go on record now and say this is going to be one of the wildest adventures your group will ever play. What is The God that Crawls?The God that Crawls is a 32 page book containing an adventure (+ foldout map section) written for LotFP Weird Fantasy Role-Playing Grindhouse Edition game and directly compatible with other "Old School Renaissance" systems and the classic 70s and 80s games that spawned them. The adventure is written by James Edward Raggi IV with artwork by Jason Rainville.The adventure, for character levels 1-2, presents the God that Crawls, its lair (a three-level dungeon!), and the cult that worships it. Fairly standard setup twisted and made interesting and horrific in the LotFP tradition.But that's not all! The adventure was originally planned for 16 pages, but technical printing issues require it to be 32 pages, so we're including a mini-rules supplement. Firearms, replacing the demi-human classes in the game, and more!About Both BooksThe books will be printed and shipped from Finland, and we're looking at an April print date.Please note that this a Sponsorship, not a simple pre-order. Because of currency fluctuations and boring business details like varying shipping and tax expenses depending on your location, the exact cost of each project is unknown until it goes to the printer. Plus check out one of the perks of the Monolith class sponsorship. With all that in mind, we've made blanket contribution categories that cost bit more than if you bought these after release. But we're doing this IndieGoGo thing because we want LotFP to release projects faster. Contribute if you do too, with the bonus of getting yourself some perks in the process. If you don't like the setup, wait for the books to be released and buy them then. Easy. :DDetails about the Art PrintCrawling God and Monolith Class sponsorships receive an A4 size full color original art print by an LotFP artist of your choice (available: Rowena Aitken, Aeron Alfrey, Dean Clayton, Eric Lofgren, Rich Longmore, Jason Rainville, Amos Orion Sterns) depicting a scene from any published LotFP release of your choice. After you receive your print, the art will be posted on the LotFP blog.YOU are the art director! You dictate what you want the art to depict, and then the artist of your choice will produce it (always subject to artistic interpretation, mind you!) and you will then receive a one of a kind art print. Note that the artists may have prior commitments (Alfrey and Rainville are right now working on their bits for the Monolith and God, for instance!) so the art may not be done IMMEDIATELY!! but we'll get it to you as soon as possible.Note that this art is for you, and will not be used in LotFP publications without explicit permission, separate from this IndieGoGo campaign, from both you and the artist.More Details about the Monolith Class SponsorshipIn addition to the perks listed above, a Monolith Class sponsorship also gives you up to 5 print copies of the book shipped first class as gifts to whoever you wish (1 per giftee, you must provide their addresses which are different than your own!).In addition to that, $400 of every Monolith Class sponsorship goes to offsetting the cost of both books' final retail price in both print and PDF. Those willing and able to purchase a Monolith level sponsorship are directly helping both LotFP and every LotFP fan.

story:
Welcome!

If you want to help us without giving us money, please scroll all the way to the bottom. There is a lot that you can do for us. And there are some things that we can do for you as well.

Buffalo Bill's Great Show is coming up soon!

And Buffalo Bill himself is out to recruit only the greatest names he can find. Those who are famous - or infamous - for their outstanding abilities and achievements.

You are dreaming to be a part of the show since you were a little boy. Now a feeling in your guts is telling you - this is the time to finally put your name on the top of the list.

You can't wait to show that you are the best shooter and gambler, to win the ladies' hearts, find gold and treasures, and become rich and famous.

Game Basics
Bust'em Bandits is an HTML5 based pinball game for mobile devices. It has a 2D game engine and a top down pseudo 3D view.

The theme of the game is the old wild west. The story starts in the streets of a small old west town. From there it will lead the player to various scenarios on different subtables.


We aim to create a modern pinball game with 2d illustrations, 3d animated gameplay elements, and various effects like particles. It will still have the flair of a traditional mechanical machine in respect to sound and table elements. To make it appealing to a wider group of players there will also be options to activate or deactivate certain features.

* An asterisk for the iOS version. We plan to publish the game for iOS in a second step shortly after Android.

11.000 € - Initial Game Version

If we reach our initial funding goal you will get the basic version of the game which contains three settings: the VILLAGE (maintable), the SALOON, & the  PRAIRIE.


14.000 € (or more)

ONLINE HIGH SCORE TABLE - This first stretch goal will give you a free and unlimited subscription to our online high score table that resembles an old wild west newspaper and contains all your game events. The best players will make the biggest headlines and the most interesting stories. Don't miss out on the next issue!

17.000 € (or more)

New scenario: the JAIL - Some bandits are asking for your help! They were arrested by the sheriff and are now rotting in an . By helping us to reach the above amount you will be able to sneak into the building and free them. But be aware not to be arrested yourself!

20.000 € (or more)

New scenario: the BANK - If you ever wanted to rob a bank then this your chance! If you help us to reach the above amount we will grant you access to this highly protected area.

23.500 € (or more)

A FIGURINE for your desktop or shelf - At this point we will start producing our first real figurine. This amount will cover only the production costs. We will sell them (at a fair price) through our online store.

We haven't decided yet which of the characters will be the first. Actually our idea is to let YOU decide. Not now, but at some later time, when we know more.


After reaching all these goals we still have enough on our minds.

Please come back again to check for updates.



Our characters are a vital part of the game as they tell big parts of the story and interact with the player. You will get to know them better in the game. Until then we will give you brief introductions on a regular basis.

After the initial set of three key characters we are going to publish one additional character per week. So don't forget to come back to get to know them as early as possible!

NEW characters are showing up EVERY SATURDAY!


Listen to the Sheriff!

Listen to Blaze!

Listen to Shirley Star!

I'll talk to you later, boss!

Come visit our village to hear me.

Will try to speak for some dollars!

I'm no man of big words.

Words are smoke and mirrors.

Caramba! Talk to you in town...


State of the Art 2D Illustrations and 3D Animations
The cartoonish graphical style consists of hand drawn 2D and rendered 3D elements. The design of the machine contains many animations, effects, and illustrations. What you see here is a preview of the characters. There will be many more story related objects and background elements in the same style.

Screen and Controls
As tables might be higher than device screens a scrolling game field is the default setting. This can be configured to play with a smaller non-scrolling view.
The game has a very simple touch interface just as you probably know it from other pinball games.

Our target resolution for the game is defined to give you a great picture even on HD devices. This might be a performance issue depending on your device. Please see a bit more info on this down in section "risks and challenges".

Real Physics Simulation
For a realistic ball movement and collisions we use the Box2D physics engine. Multiball will not only be a feature, but also an important element of the gameplay.

If the ball gets stuck during the game or ends up in a place where it doesn't move anymore the player can push the device to get the game going again.

Additional Effects
To enhance the feedback there are also animations in the large DMD (Dot-matrix display) on the top of the screen.


The Game
The goal of this campaign is to make sure Bust'em Bandits can be finished and published in a reasonable time and great quality. Most of the perks we offer will give you the game for free as soon as it is published.

Our schedule currently targets a release date

for the initial version in October 2014.

The Goodies
Apart from the pinball game itself there will also be some other cool things for you to look forward to.

  • Cool stickers (make sure to collect all of them)
  • T-Shirt (in different sizes)
  • Set of High Quality Poker Playing Cards

Depending on your perk you will either get stickers, playing cards, T-shirts, or combinations thereof. Many packages also include a certificate that proves your contribution.
The pinball game itself is of course always in the focus of our project so please excuse if it might take some time until we are ready to send everything to you.

All items include FREE worldwide shipping.

Please acknowledge that the images below are not 100% like the final items.

If the campaign is a success there will be other items as well in the future. Please check out the stretch goals.


To be able to finish this game in a reasonable time and in the way we imagine it, we need every bit of financial support that we can get. This crowdfunding campaign doesn't aim to cover 100 percent of our costs. We still invest our own money, but every contribution that you make makes a huge difference.

How we will use the money

  1. First of all more money will give us the opportunity to stop working on other projects until this game is finished. This means we can publish and provide it to you earlier.
  2. Secondly we will be able to pay other professionals to do parts of the game where we feel it is useful. Like for voiceovers, (some) story & texts, additional graphical content, and programming. All of this means we will achieve higher overall quality in at least the same time.
  3. We will also need some more software and hardware for development and (internal) testing.
  4. The goodies - if you like them - may also be a reason for you to support us. Even if the pinball game itself is not for you.

As we are not a company yet, all your contributions will first go to Mig Marn, who will then use it for everything listed above.

We are a group of people with - combined - more than 30 years of experience in the games and creative (graphics & advertising) industry with close ties to the game development scene in Austria and Germany.

  • Mig Marn, responsible for coding, and putting it all together
  • Andi Timmelmayer, illustrations, graphical and other creative work
  • Tim Roedl, working on sounds and pinball game design.

Currently we are in the process of getting our own business started. While working on other projects that make money for the butter on our bread, we always try to follow our own ideas. Bust'em Bandits is one of them.

Some of our history
We have been working on many different games in the past. While years of experience alone don't mean a lot, they were full of interesting and also nameworthy projects.
All of the following games have been published and sold. Some of them got very positive feedback and reviews.

  • The Nations 2
  • Pusher & Itch! (puzzle games)
  • Neighbours from Hell series (part 1,2,console version)
  • Seven Million MMO
  • Flash games for local corporate customers like T-mobile (AT), BIPA, etc.
  • Multiplayer online games for different well known web platforms


As usual with projects of this kind there are technical and administrative challenges.

  • There is a possibility that we are going to see some performance issues on mobile devices, especially those from previous generations.
  • Another risk is that of bugs in the game code. We are of course going to test as much as we can with different devices.
  • Time & schedule problems might come up if we can not gather enough money to hire some external professionals.
  • Publishing on iOS or any other mobile platform than Android might be more effort than expected, as we don't have experience with them yet. We plan to do this in a separate second step.


You can help us even without giving any money. These are a few suggestions that came to our mind.

  • Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BustemBandits
  • Visit us on our webpage: http://www.lifeofpinball.com
  • Give us feedback: Write to feedback@lifeofpinball.com
  • Include our URI on your webpage: http://www.lifeofpinball.com
  • Write about us in your Blog: We can provide you with images and other material from Bust'em Bandits.
  • Sweepstakes or community action: If you want items as giveaways or prizes for your community please write to contact@lifeofpinball.com
  • Talk about us: Tell your friends of this upcoming game Bust'em Bandits.

Thank you!

story:
Have you played games on your phone and wished you could help others?

Have you played games on your phone and wished that was real money?

Now you can do both :)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would like to create the "Play It Forward" app.

The app that would help charities and turn those points into coupons to                 places you go or want to go.

The goal is to help local charities and businesses while helping the game developers.  

It will be a club with an annual membership of $1 (buck).

Each game will cost $1 (buck) half goes to the developer and the                                   other half will go to a charity partnered with that game.

Each business will input coupons and say how many points to redeem this for.

It will work like Square for businesses and charities, they can do all transactions with this app, 

It is up to the game developer if they want to have their game included.

It is up to the charity if they want to have their charity partnered with a game.

There will be all types of games, from Match 3 to Word and everything in between.

Play It Forward app is like the airline points, turn into real money.
