story:
Full View

(The boxes in green are intentionally shown to all players by admin (or they discovered it) while grey are re-hidden even though players discovered it. This is a better example of what your map can look like, but of course the possibilities are endless and you can really put any image you want! And your monsters can look in anyway you want them to as well!)

 

Full View

Full View

 

What IS DMQuests?

Hello, My name is Ginzo Milani, I am an indie developer working on DMQuests as my second "Official" job..My first being a site called McHosts which put it simply had run servers for the popular game minecraft! I was in highschool back then( last year ) and although sales were good, I didn't have enough time to invest into it (grades dropping) which although unfortunate was not the end of the world. My plan was to expand McHosts into a gaming company, revolutionalize what we consider video games and even though that plan had subsided, my plan to create a gaming company hasn't! Now that I'm freshly out of Highschool and in college, I had a real smack to the face as to having $0 (okay no I have a student loan so it's more like -$2,000) feels like...it sucks. 

This campaign is important to me as I am a student, I currently do not have a job simply because my main skills revolve around using computers (let's face it no one wants to hire someone without a degree, and to be honest I'd rather use my computer skills to help me make money than work at a fast food joint) and I wish to request for some funds to help expand the servers. I have used McHosts back up revenue and invested into DMQuests and even put some of my personal money left over from student loan, but unfortunately it's not enough to cover fees for servers, contracts and legal rights (this is pretty much what the money is being used to cover it).

With a little donation, you can help me bring forth this site, as it is a part of my dream. I have always wanted to create my own video game when I was younger and looking back I think to myself; well yeah maybe it wasn't likely with technology back then but I can make it possible. My goal is to make everyone's capability of creating their own interactive gaming experience and create stories of excitement, possible. With this site, I am hoping to expand the roleplaying community and help them feel more interactive and raise the bar for RPing standards.

 

 

So where does the money go?

-Around $2,000 is going to go into legal documentations(I was surprised at legal costs to be honest)

-$1,500 is going into getting spanking strong servers so gameplay will never be laggy

-$1,000 will go into contracting designers and advertisement for the beta start up

-The remainder, if ANY(I  really plan to throw the full money into the site, I really want this to be up and running, so worst case scenario if the site is done, I'll just create an ingame shop to pay off student loans) will be used to help pay off my student loan so I can focus more on finishing the site

What do I get for donating?

-You will get a personal thank you note from me via email, and if you want you can get to know me. 

-You get to be a part of the closed beta group

-You get a special limited edition banner around your avatar indicating "you donated before it was cool"

-You get an achievement for donating

-You can help create the pallette for donator colors (Just pick a hex color and walla, you also get this free of course)

-IF you go all the way, I will perma unlock your account and give you access to every single item that will be released in the shop and released in the future forever!

Where do the funds go if the goal isn't reached?

Simply put, I am going to pay for legal documentations FIRST, and after that upgrading servers. From there I will personally work on the designs as my own personal designing skills are not that but, however it will set back as to how far open beta will be open to the public. Closed beta will still be available to all users donating, regardless of if the goal is reached or not.

How much is my dollar worth to you?

For every dollar you donate, it will literally bring me a day closer to the initial goal for when I plan to release it, it also brings me closer to helping me reach my career. It will help bring out hopefully the best engine there is, and bring forth a new generation in RPing which will hopefully stray people from the constant shooter games and more into the story telling we once loved as children.

I believe that upon releasing this site, it will help me launch forth to the community that the world should NOT be about money but rather about the game it's self. A product shouldn't be closed so the community cannot test it, if they paid for it..let them go crazy, that's what I believe. Hell, let them go crazy if they didn't pay for it! Let the world discover and expand together rather than alone. 

I'm hoping with my simple SITE, it will show people that all it takes is a good idea, freedom and allowing creativity to be expressed to make a good game.

Games like minecraft, Lego, and playdough have all been an motivator to my mindset and I've always wondered why others don't follow that theme. After all they are literally top sellers.

I have in the past tried to recreate a similar theme with my McHosts being super cheap and affordable so any one could get a server ($10 for 1gb..now days it's a lot cheaper such as $8 for 1gb but back then prices were as high as $30 for 1gb and average at $20 for 1gb), I have also made just other random things outside of developing such as videos on my youtube.

www.youtube.com/monckey100

I really like to create and I hope with your understanding, you will allow the world to help create their own game as well, and perhaps together we can one day roleplay together fighting dracula's two headed dog, goobers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, perhaps this may not be your thing, perhaps you've never played DnD before, but that shouldn't be a reason not to, if just one person on your friends list saw what this was and understood what it was, they could singlehandedly create an RPG for you( or you create the rpg your self if you wish) and make you the star, the pet or even the donkey! It really is all up to you, you could even be the evil villian no one likes but secretly was the good guy the whole time.

My plan was to expand McHosts into a gaming company, revolutionalize what we consider video games and even though that plan had subsided, my plan to create a gaming company hasn't! Now that I'm freshly out of Highschool and in college, I had a real smack to the face as to having $0 (okay no I have a student loan so it's more like -$2,000) feels like...it sucks. 
This campaign is important to me as I am a student, I currently do not have a job simply because my main skills revolve around using computers (let's face it no one wants to hire someone without a degree, and to be honest I'd rather use my computer skills to help me make money than work at a fast food joint) and I wish to request for some funds to help expand the servers. I have used McHosts back up revenue and invested into DMQuests and even put some of my personal money left over from student loan, but unfortunately it's not enough to cover fees for servers, contracts and legal rights (this is pretty much what the money is being used to cover it).
With a little donation, you can help me bring forth this site, as it is a part of my dream. I have always wanted to create my own video game when I was younger and looking back I think to myself; well yeah maybe it wasn't likely with technology back then but I can make it possible. My goal is to make everyone's capability of creating their own interactive gaming experience and create stories of excitement, possible. With this site, I am hoping to expand the roleplaying community and help them feel more interactive and raise the bar for RPing standards.
 
 


So where does the money go?
-Around $2,000 is going to go into legal documentations(I was surprised at legal costs to be honest)
-$1,500 is going into getting spanking strong servers so gameplay will never be laggy
-$1,000 will go into contracting designers and advertisement for the beta start up
-The remainder, if ANY(I  really plan to throw the full money into the site, I really want this to be up and running, so worst case scenario if the site is done, I'll just create an ingame shop to pay off student loans) will be used to help pay off my student loan so I can focus more on finishing the site
What do I get for donating?
-You will get a personal thank you note from me via email, and if you want you can get to know me. 
-You get to be a part of the closed beta group
-You get a special limited edition banner around your avatar indicating "you donated before it was cool"
-You get an achievement for donating
-You can help create the pallette for donator colors (Just pick a hex color and walla, you also get this free of course)
-IF you go all the way, I will perma unlock your account and give you access to every single item that will be released in the shop and released in the future forever!
Where do the funds go if the goal isn't reached?
Simply put, I am going to pay for legal documentations FIRST, and after that upgrading servers. From there I will personally work on the designs as my own personal designing skills are not that but, however it will set back as to how far open beta will be open to the public. Closed beta will still be available to all users donating, regardless of if the goal is reached or not.


How much is my dollar worth to you?
For every dollar you donate, it will literally bring me a day closer to the initial goal for when I plan to release it, it also brings me closer to helping me reach my career. It will help bring out hopefully the best engine there is, and bring forth a new generation in RPing which will hopefully stray people from the constant shooter games and more into the story telling we once loved as children.
I believe that upon releasing this site, it will help me launch forth to the community that the world should NOT be about money but rather about the game it's self. A product shouldn't be closed so the community cannot test it, if they paid for it..let them go crazy, that's what I believe. Hell, let them go crazy if they didn't pay for it! Let the world discover and expand together rather than alone. 
I'm hoping with my simple SITE, it will show people that all it takes is a good idea, freedom and allowing creativity to be expressed to make a good game.
Games like minecraft, Lego, and playdough have all been an motivator to my mindset and I've always wondered why others don't follow that theme. After all they are literally top sellers.
I have in the past tried to recreate a similar theme with my McHosts being super cheap and affordable so any one could get a server ($10 for 1gb..now days it's a lot cheaper such as $8 for 1gb but back then prices were as high as $30 for 1gb and average at $20 for 1gb), I have also made just other random things outside of developing such as videos on my youtube.
www.youtube.com/monckey100
I really like to create and I hope with your understanding, you will allow the world to help create their own game as well, and perhaps together we can one day roleplay together fighting dracula's two headed dog, goobers.


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word, perhaps this may not be your thing, perhaps you've never played DnD before, but that shouldn't be a reason not to, if just one person on your friends list saw what this was and understood what it was, they could singlehandedly create an RPG for you( or you create the rpg your self if you wish) and make you the star, the pet or even the donkey! It really is all up to you, you could even be the evil villian no one likes but secretly was the good guy the whole time.

story:
Short Summary

Kacie (24) and Caleigh (23) hail from Sharon, Ontario, Canada and are both recent university graduates.  Kacie was pursuing a medicine career having completed her MCAT, and Caleigh, a career in teaching.  Having been involved in Beach Volleyball for many years, and as members of Team Canada, both have opted to put these careers on hold, in order to pursue their dream of representing their country at the 2015 Pan Am Games in Toronto, Canada as well as the 2016 Olympics in Brazil. 

We're grateful for this opportunity to come to the public to join us on our journey, because we believe we have the best fans in the world!  To compete on the FIVB world tour, a typical season costs approximately $25,000 per athlete. Currently, we are both being supported by our families and working part time jobs in order to compete for our country.

Any funds you can contribute would help us immensly, by allowing us to focus on training, achieving our dreams and reaching our potential.  Your kindness and generosity will be appreciated beyond measure, and even if you can't give financially, we are so thankful for your support and encouragement! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to be a national team member we are required to participate in a minimum of 14 international and national competitions every season, which we fund ourselves.  This calls for booking flights, hotels, accommodations, uniform gear, registration fees and support staff (coaching and physiotherapists).  Up until this point, we have not been able to have a support staff with us, as costs are too high.

For your contribution, we're happy to offer the following items listed on the right hand panel.

We have competed as a team since January 2013, and have competed in three international events to date.  In Mexico we won our first event and in Guatemala, we took home the gold medal and are looking for more!  

We are excited about our upcoming season and look forward to representing Canada and meeting our fans along the way.

Please like our Facebook page!  www.facebook.com/KacieAndCaleigh and spread the word!  We appreciate any support from our followers.

story:
Breeze in the Clouds is a project I started last year in an attempt to create a game that would invoke nostalgia. I miss the days where I could buy any $20 game and it would be an adventure. Games were suitable for almost any age and there weren’t really “target audiences.” Every game was good back then, no matter the graphics style, music, character design, etc. Everything was just good. I want to bring that back with this game.

 

-Main Protagonist, Breeze the Corgi

This game is about a corgi named Breeze and his adventure to return to his owner, while trying to save the sky world after a spree of weird weather patterns. The game will be Action-Adventure Platformer intended for all ages. The game will feature very stylized graphics, memorable music and a memorable tale.

I have formed a team of indie game developers on a volunteer basis that will assist in making this project come to life.

Game Overview 

The information below is pending and is subject to change

·         Genre: Action-Adventure Platformer

·         Target Audience: Intended for all ages 

·         Current Targeted Platforms: PC, Mac, Mobile* 

·         Desired Platform(s): Wii*, PS3, Xbox360

·         Budget: Dependant on Out-of-Pocket, Donations, and Kickstarter funds 

What is this game? 

This game features a young corgi dog named Breeze who is separated from his young owner in an unexpected storm. The dog wakes up to find himself stuck in the clouds. He picks up a bag nearby where he landed and a creature inside called a cloud sprite tells him about the antagonist who is known as The Storm King.                

In order to stop the storms and return home, Breeze, accompanied by the cloud guide, must venture around the world’s skies, help other cloud sprites, and find The Cloud King, the only one who can defeat The Storm King. The player will play as Breeze and the game will play like a traditional 3D platformer with a combination of action-based combat. 

Where does the game take place? 



-Artwork By Concept Artist, Anna Koan

The game takes place in the Earth’s outer atmospheres, primarily the ones where clouds are abundant. Due to the fictional nature of the story, Breeze sees the sky different from humans. Animals on earth are able to see more than humans are. The skies above earth have mystical creatures called sprites, and they assist the Cloud King and the Storm King. There are also various other creatures in the sky that have their own purpose.

-Artwork By Concept Artist, Anna Koan



-Artwork By Concept Artist, Honda Rivera


Many locations have hidden environments in the clouds, but are not visible to humans such as Sky Forests, deserts and oceans. There are also areas that Breeze can access that reach the clouds such as mountaintops, currents, funnels and the top of aerial vessels such as planes.

What do I control? 

 Throughout the whole game, you will play as Breeze the corgi.

What is the main focus? 

The player will travel across the skies, defeating sky monsters, solving problems in the clouds that are causing problems down on earth, collect items that will help you continue on your journey and defeat the Storm King so you can get the Cloud king to send you back home.

 

The Impact This Game Will Make

The completion of this game will offer a quality game for gamers out there that was created by an indie team. During the production of this game, we will keep our fans suggestions in mind. We also want to show the developers the power of a courageous and determined team. This will also give all the team members a large amount of experience and exposure. 

What We Need & What You Get

As the cost of game production can get steep, we need funding to keep this production cycle rolling. Currently, the project is only funded out of pocket. The first thing we want to acquire are Pro licenses of the development tool, Unity3D. We also will use the funds to pay for web hosting, file hosting, and any extra software we may need for production. The funding will also be used to purchasing any additional assets we might not be able to create ourselves.

In reward for those who pledge, not only will you receive a quality game, every backer will receive a personalized Thank You Letter, sent by Breeze himself :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to pledge, but want to help us out, you can help by promoting this project to your friends and family, and keep following this project for updates!

Here is the link to the development blog: http://breezeproject.tumblr.com/

story:
Glenmore cross country ski machine is used to create professional cross country ski tracks in the Glenmore Forest near to aviemore.

The whole project is run as a sports charity (charity number SC042330) and is entirely voluntary run. 

This fund raising campaign is to help fund the running costs and any repairs, throughout the winter of 2016.

We are always appreciative of those who donate cash but many are unable to reach the donation point.   Hence this online push.

Throughout winter 2015 the machine cut tracks for 2 months, with many thousands of skiers enjoying cross country skiing in the forest.

We hope for an even longer spell in 2016.

The machine is elderly giving us relatively high repair needs......your donations will ensure the machine cuts tracks for all to enjoy.    Thank You

story:
About us

MK1881 Miniatures is the new miniature line from Maki Games, featuring high quality miniatures mainly suitable for fantasy football games and more. We offer innovative design and very high quality casts. MK1881 team is composed of many experienced artists all with several years of experience in their fields that range from design, to classic and 3D sculpting and painting.  We work only with high quality casting facilities and use only top quality materials for our creations. http://www.mk1881.com
MK1881 work progress can be followed on our FB page: https://www.facebook.com/mk1881
Some example of our work can be seen on our website.

Why crowdfunding?

At MK1881 we have done extensive research and tests to deliver only very high quality miniatures. Designing, sculpting and printing these miniatures is quite expensive. We are looking for your contribution to speed up the printing and casting process for this fantasy football team.


The pledges:


Level 6 - Full roster, 1 Minotaur, 4 warriors, 11 beast-man and all free stretch goals.

Level 5 - 4 warriors and 12 beastman. Beast-man heads can be swapped so all models will look different.

Level 4 - 4 Warriors and 7 beastman.

Level 3 - Minotaur

Level 2 - All 9 beast-man models. Heads can be swapped giving you up to 80 different models.



Level 1 - 4 Warriors - All models are different

The miniatures


In the images below you can see how the miniatures can be assembled. Himeros Beastmen will come with one detached arm and interchangeable heads. We have designed 7 unique poses for the beastmen bodies and 9 unique heads which can be combined to create 63 different beastmen miniatures.

Himeros chaos warriors will come as one part with one detached arm.


Stretch Goals:

Mutation 1 - beastman 
FREE for all level 5 and 6. 

Mutation 2 - beastman 

FREE for all level 5 and 6. 

Mutation 3 - beastman 

FREE for all level 5 and 6. 

Mutation 4 - beastman 

FREE for all level 5 and 6. 


Add-On Minotaur mutations. Claw, Tentacle and Tail - a 5€ mutation pack.


UPCOMING, STAR PALYERS and CHAOS WARRIOR MUTATIONS and MINOTAUR MUTATIONS.....

Risk and Challenges:

Not many. The 3d sculpting of all models has been completed and the models are shown in the pictures as renders.  We have already booked the manufacturing facility, selected for its highest casting standard. Many can testify that every model we have worked on in the past has been cast with excellent quality. We have produced hundreds of models for other companies and for ourselves and we have a good control on the process. At this stage the only challenge is to ship all the items according to the planned schedule and to unlock enough stretch goals to create the special characters for this team. This is our 5th team for fantasy football and we will continue to create more in the future thanks to the help of enthusiastic people like you.

Additional notes:

- All the models will be made using very high quality metal. 
- Models will be provided un-assembled and unpainted.
- Models are not intended for kids 14yrs old or younger due to small parts, 
- Each model will come with a matching 25mm round plastic base.

story:
Cause fists say more than words, play the demo

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/48147163/PUNCHING%20THINGS!%20executable.zip

Click the link to download the zipped folder.  Just unzip the the folder and click the executable to play.  (Make sure your firewall doesn't block it)

What is Punching Things!?

"Your mother was a toaster oven!"

Punching Things! is a procedurally generated, beat’em’up about robots who punch each other try try to stay alive.  In the game you will play as a robot who is forced to destroy other robots to survive in a gladiatorial arena.  Defeat all the bosses to become the ultimate champion of the arena.

The inspiration for the game comes from Borderlands, Castle Crashers, and Malevolence: The Sword of Ahkranox.  It combines the light-hearted yet sometimes serious tone of Borderlands with the gameplay of Castle Crashers and the infinite procedural generation of content found in Malevolence.

All the features listed below aren't in the current alpha but while the music and art is being spruced up for the game I will also be working on added the gameplay features below.

Features

Procedural enemies - Each and every enemy will be different.  They will move at different speeds, attack with varying amounts of damage, and their behavior changes with their emotions.  Every enemy is a new character to interact.  A scared enemy may attack quickly and run away or an enemy may become angry and more powerful when his friend is destroyed.


Infinite levels - Defeat the bosses of the arena and become the ultimate champion.  Defend your title from the infinite onslaught of contenders.  The randomized enemies keep the game interesting each time you play.

Timed Punches - This is something I'm still working on.  To try to avoid the repetitive button mashing of the genre, I want each punch to work with timing.  The plan is that the longer a player holds down the punch button, the slower the fist moves but the more damage it does when it hits.  To complete combos the button must be pressed for the right amount of time.  (If you like button mashing, I'll still add a button mashing option for those that want it)

Randomized combos - Another way I will try to avoid button mashing is to have a combo system that generates a new combo each round.  Nothing will have to be memorized.

Where is the funding going?


"Bring it, you overgrown calculator!"

The funding will be used to help an artist and a musician to have better tools for making assets for Punching Things!  Check out the "What else have you worked on?" section.

100$ - Will be used to purchase a Wacom tablet so Punching Things! can have better art. (Because doing digital art with a mouse is a pain)  Check out Mal's art in the gallery.

300$ - Will be used to purchase the FL Studio Signature Bundle.  This will be used to help create the soundtrack that will follow you through your frenzies of robotic violence.  The music will be done by my friend Josiah. Check out his stuff below!

35$ - Will go to pay the IndieGoGo fee.

The rest of the funding will be used for any other expenses that might arise in the purchase of the above products.

If the goal is not reached than certain features will not be added.  See the above section for an exact breakdown of where the funding is going.

Stretch Goals

All of the stretch goals listed below are features I would like to add to the game given the time and the money.  If you have any opinions on these features or would like to see other features created don't hesitate to make a comment.  All amounts listed are rough estimates and may require more money that want is listed.

300$ - Purchasing Natural Voice software from AT&T

If you like the voices used in the original demo above, vote on Facebook to say you want to keep the original voice.  If you don't like the original voice, put your vote on the Facebook page.  The main benefit of the Natural Voice software is that the Text to Speech can say player names to be used for a dynamic announcer to comment on the gameplay.

500$ - Grabs, Throws, Jumping

These robots got hops!  Or at least jet packs.  Bounce enemies all over the battlefield with the help of verticality.  Grab your foe and toss him at your other foes.  Get rough with your enemies and show them who's boss.

250$ - Single Screen Cooperative Play

Grab a friend and a controller and beat baddies together.  Become a dynamic duo of death and destroy the denizens of the arena.

500$ - Dynamic Levels

Levels become hazardous.  They may fill with water, fall apart, or become covered in ice.  You and your enemies will have to tread lightly to survive the dangers.

500$ - Loot

The arena will be filled with many items to interact with that can be used to beat the wires out of your opponents.  The battlefield will also be littered with behavior modifying computer chips changing how you attack.  Some may make your fist more powerful or other may make you move faster.

???? - Online multiplayer, Punching Things Online

There aren't too many beat'em'ups online especially after Dungeon Fighter Online took it's North American server down.  I would love to fill that void with an Massive Multiplayer Online version of Punching Things!  In Punching Things Online! (PTO!) every boss is replaced with a actual player.  Players will have to climb the ranks to become the ultimate champion and then defend their title.  They will create their own minions to help them and their own levels other players must defeat before they can fight.  This stretch goal is my ultimate goal for Punching Things! and I have many ideas for how I could make this game work as an MMO.

What do I get?


"You oily bastard!"

All perks include the previous perk

2$ - For contributing you'll receive a thank you email from me

5$ - At five dollars you'll receive access to the game in alpha and beta and you'll get the finished game.

10$ - At ten dollars you'll receive a digital art book chronicling the transformation of the art of the game.

25$ - At twenty five dollars you'll get to design your own robotic denizen to live (and die) in the world of Punching Things!  Design the art and personality along with any dialogue you want your robot to say. (Try to keep it clean)

50$ - At fifty dollars you can voice your robot, although you'll have to send me the voice samples.  You'll also receive a small poster with a image of Clunk battling his robotic brethren.

100$ - At one hundred dollars you'll have a significant hand in designing a level in the game.  Help create the art for the level, the enemies that will inhabit the space, and the sounds that will be heard there.

What else have you worked on?

Check out my portfolio here.  Just download the folder and unzip it to check out the awesome stuff inside.  (Make sure your firewall doesn't block it)

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/48147163/Portfolio.zip

Check out Mal's artwork in the gallery section.


Listen to Josiah's rad music on Soundcloud.

https://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheart/garden-city-showdown

https://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheart/struggle-beneath-the-ice

https://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheart

What else can I do to help?


"You malfunctioning scum!"
Tell everyone and anyone about the game.  Share this campaign on Facebook.  Tweet about it.  Post it on Reddit.  Use IndieGoGo's sharing tools to help with doing so.

Also, I would love to hear your feedback.  Write your feedback on the Facebook page.  Add comments to Youtube.  Spam this page with your ideas about the game.  I want the creation of the game to be a collaborative process and your feedback will be taken into account when I am making the game.

What if you run into problems?

Any problem can be solved with a proper application of perseverance and communication.  But both perseverance and communication take time.  Punching Things! may run into delays in the time it takes to code, the production of art, or the creation of the soundtrack.  As long as everyone is willing to wait I will do everything I can to make sure Punching Things! sees the light of day.



Thank you for viewing my campaign!
story_txt:
Cause fists say more than words, play the demohttps://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/48147163/PUNCHING%20THINGS!%20executable.zipClick the link to download the zipped folder.  Just unzip the the folder and click the executable to play.  (Make sure your firewall doesn't block it)What is Punching Things!?"Your mother was a toaster oven!"Punching Things! is a procedurally generated, beat’em’up about robots who punch each other try try to stay alive.  In the game you will play as a robot who is forced to destroy other robots to survive in a gladiatorial arena.  Defeat all the bosses to become the ultimate champion of the arena.The inspiration for the game comes from Borderlands, Castle Crashers, and Malevolence: The Sword of Ahkranox.  It combines the light-hearted yet sometimes serious tone of Borderlands with the gameplay of Castle Crashers and the infinite procedural generation of content found in Malevolence.All the features listed below aren't in the current alpha but while the music and art is being spruced up for the game I will also be working on added the gameplay features below.FeaturesProcedural enemies - Each and every enemy will be different.  They will move at different speeds, attack with varying amounts of damage, and their behavior changes with their emotions.  Every enemy is a new character to interact.  A scared enemy may attack quickly and run away or an enemy may become angry and more powerful when his friend is destroyed.Infinite levels - Defeat the bosses of the arena and become the ultimate champion.  Defend your title from the infinite onslaught of contenders.  The randomized enemies keep the game interesting each time you play.Timed Punches - This is something I'm still working on.  To try to avoid the repetitive button mashing of the genre, I want each punch to work with timing.  The plan is that the longer a player holds down the punch button, the slower the fist moves but the more damage it does when it hits.  To complete combos the button must be pressed for the right amount of time.  (If you like button mashing, I'll still add a button mashing option for those that want it)Randomized combos - Another way I will try to avoid button mashing is to have a combo system that generates a new combo each round.  Nothing will have to be memorized.Where is the funding going?"Bring it, you overgrown calculator!"The funding will be used to help an artist and a musician to have better tools for making assets for Punching Things!  Check out the "What else have you worked on?" section.100$ - Will be used to purchase a Wacom tablet so Punching Things! can have better art. (Because doing digital art with a mouse is a pain)  Check out Mal's art in the gallery.300$ - Will be used to purchase the FL Studio Signature Bundle.  This will be used to help create the soundtrack that will follow you through your frenzies of robotic violence.  The music will be done by my friend Josiah. Check out his stuff below!35$ - Will go to pay the IndieGoGo fee.The rest of the funding will be used for any other expenses that might arise in the purchase of the above products.If the goal is not reached than certain features will not be added.  See the above section for an exact breakdown of where the funding is going.Stretch GoalsAll of the stretch goals listed below are features I would like to add to the game given the time and the money.  If you have any opinions on these features or would like to see other features created don't hesitate to make a comment.  All amounts listed are rough estimates and may require more money that want is listed.300$ - Purchasing Natural Voice software from AT&TIf you like the voices used in the original demo above, vote on Facebook to say you want to keep the original voice.  If you don't like the original voice, put your vote on the Facebook page.  The main benefit of the Natural Voice software is that the Text to Speech can say player names to be used for a dynamic announcer to comment on the gameplay.500$ - Grabs, Throws, JumpingThese robots got hops!  Or at least jet packs.  Bounce enemies all over the battlefield with the help of verticality.  Grab your foe and toss him at your other foes.  Get rough with your enemies and show them who's boss.250$ - Single Screen Cooperative PlayGrab a friend and a controller and beat baddies together.  Become a dynamic duo of death and destroy the denizens of the arena.500$ - Dynamic LevelsLevels become hazardous.  They may fill with water, fall apart, or become covered in ice.  You and your enemies will have to tread lightly to survive the dangers.500$ - LootThe arena will be filled with many items to interact with that can be used to beat the wires out of your opponents.  The battlefield will also be littered with behavior modifying computer chips changing how you attack.  Some may make your fist more powerful or other may make you move faster.???? - Online multiplayer, Punching Things OnlineThere aren't too many beat'em'ups online especially after Dungeon Fighter Online took it's North American server down.  I would love to fill that void with an Massive Multiplayer Online version of Punching Things!  In Punching Things Online! (PTO!) every boss is replaced with a actual player.  Players will have to climb the ranks to become the ultimate champion and then defend their title.  They will create their own minions to help them and their own levels other players must defeat before they can fight.  This stretch goal is my ultimate goal for Punching Things! and I have many ideas for how I could make this game work as an MMO.What do I get?"You oily bastard!"All perks include the previous perk2$ - For contributing you'll receive a thank you email from me5$ - At five dollars you'll receive access to the game in alpha and beta and you'll get the finished game.10$ - At ten dollars you'll receive a digital art book chronicling the transformation of the art of the game.25$ - At twenty five dollars you'll get to design your own robotic denizen to live (and die) in the world of Punching Things!  Design the art and personality along with any dialogue you want your robot to say. (Try to keep it clean)50$ - At fifty dollars you can voice your robot, although you'll have to send me the voice samples.  You'll also receive a small poster with a image of Clunk battling his robotic brethren.100$ - At one hundred dollars you'll have a significant hand in designing a level in the game.  Help create the art for the level, the enemies that will inhabit the space, and the sounds that will be heard there.What else have you worked on?Check out my portfolio here.  Just download the folder and unzip it to check out the awesome stuff inside.  (Make sure your firewall doesn't block it)https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/48147163/Portfolio.zipCheck out Mal's artwork in the gallery section.Listen to Josiah's rad music on Soundcloud.https://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheart/garden-city-showdownhttps://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheart/struggle-beneath-the-icehttps://soundcloud.com/requiemforaheartWhat else can I do to help?

"You malfunctioning scum!"Tell everyone and anyone about the game.  Share this campaign on Facebook.  Tweet about it.  Post it on Reddit.  Use IndieGoGo's sharing tools to help with doing so.

Also, I would love to hear your feedback.  Write your feedback on the Facebook page.  Add comments to Youtube.  Spam this page with your ideas about the game.  I want the creation of the game to be a collaborative process and your feedback will be taken into account when I am making the game.



What if you run into problems?

Any problem can be solved with a proper application of perseverance and communication.  But both perseverance and communication take time.  Punching Things! may run into delays in the time it takes to code, the production of art, or the creation of the soundtrack.  As long as everyone is willing to wait I will do everything I can to make sure Punching Things! sees the light of day.









Thank you for viewing my campaign!

story:
The Story

During wrestling season, I rush from classes to wrestling practice before finally getting home for dinner. But like most kids going from 7am to 5pm, I need real, substantial snacks and meals to get me through the day. Unfortunately, chips from the vending machine aren’t nutritious enough, and granola bars just aren’t substantial enough. During wrestling practice last season, I realized I wasn’t the only one who needed something nutritious and convenient.. High school kids, college students, fitness buffs, busy professionals, and exhausted parents all need something convenient, quick, nutritious, and substantial. That’s why I’m developing Fresh&Blended, a smoothie vending machine that uses real fruit, vegetables, and protein to create freshly made smoothies.

Bringing together nutrition and convenience can be a challenge. Smoothies are one of the best ways to get a lot of nutrition fast. But they don’t travel well, you can’t make them ahead of time, and they can be a pain to make and clean up, even when you’re at home. But Fresh&Blended fixes all that. Smoothies become an easy, fast, and convenient choice to get you through your busy day. By allowing customers to choose from different frozen fruit combinations, and allows them to blend it with their choice of milk or juice, you can get your daily banana-strawberry-orange juice smoothie fix or a grab a blueberry-milk-protein smoothie on your workout day.

This campaign will help fund the development of the Fresh&Blended smoothie vending machine. With your help, we can build a prototype, begin manufacturing, and start to get Fresh&Blended into schools, gyms, and other locations near you.

What We Need & What You Get 

I know that you work hard for your money, so I want you to know that the contributions will be used wisely.  The reason Indiegogo was chosen for this campaign is because even though the goal will hopefully be met, any amount will help to get this idea going forward! Here’s a breakdown of the the finances; be aware that extra costs have been added in for tax reasons and to make sure all the great perks can be fulfilled!  

The initial building of this machine is expensive, but once it’s built and we’ve perfected the process, cost will drop substantially (Estimated cost $40,000) 

We need to make sure there are plenty of delicious (and healthy!) flavor options in the machines to choose from (Estimated cost $4,500)

Once we have the flavors developed and machines built, we will need to have some initial inventory to help stock the machines (Estimated cost $5,500)

We need to be able to pay the bills and fees, including running this campaign, licensing, and legal fees (Estimated cost $6,000)

As with any venture there are always unforeseen costs, whether it’s a problem with the shipping, or something happens at the factory, they will always be there, and since failing to plan is planning to fail, we want to make sure that any of those issues won’t hinder a project as special as this (Estimated cost $4,000)

Thank you for supporting and sharing this project! There are some great perks (listed on the right side) to help thank you for your contributions.  Since you can’t have your own personal machine (bummer, right?) the perks tie back into the project in many ways.  You can get anything from your choice of Fresh&Blended t-shirts, to even naming one of the smoothies!  If the goal is exceeded this will further speed along the process and will allow you to have smoothie vending machines in your community even sooner.


The Impact

Many of us want to be healthy and eat well, but find ourselves limited by a lack of convenient choices. Fresh&Blended changes that. By bringing fruit, vegetables, and protein into workplaces, schools, and gyms (the places where we are busiest), Fresh&Blended makes nutrition the easy choice. 

What’s even better is that you actually see the nutrition you’re getting—you can see the cups of fruit and vegetables that get blended together. There’s no added sugar like other smoothie products. Fruit, vegetables, and juice or milk—plain and simple. 

Unfortunately, we all know what happens when we don’t get the nutrition we need when we need it. We don’t get that personal best time. We can’t focus during that important meeting. We lose our patience at the worst times. We forget answers on a test. Nutrition is important to doing well in school, during work, at home, and in the gym. Fresh&Blended makes sure that we can be our best when we need to be. And Fresh&Blended makes that nutrition fast, easy, and convenient.

Fresh&Blended’s unique smoothie vending machines are perfect for places like:

Fitness Centers

Schools

Work Places

Libraries

Airports 

and endless other possibilities!

With these vending machines, everyone can have a nutritious and convenient snack or meal.

Risks & Challenges

Turning a raw concept into a large scaled project is no easy task. But I have the expertise, experience, and commitment to overcome any challenges.

Expertise: I’ve taken numerous business classes, including the Kaufman FastTrac class for entrepreneurs. 

Experience: I come from a long line of entrepreneurs and business owners, including my father and grandfather. I know what it takes to get a business off the ground, and I have an extensive support network in place to help me do just that.

Commitment: Not having healthy options available matters in my everyday life at school—and I know it matters to thousands of other professionals, fitness buffs, and busy parents. We need healthy options that are convenient in order to stay healthy and be our best. I’m committed to making that a reality with Fresh&Blended. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there may be some people who can’t contribute but who still want to support what Fresh&Blended stands for and what it can do for schools, gyms, and workplaces. Even if you can’t contribute, here are ways you can help make Fresh&Blended smoothies a reality: 

Help spread the word about our campaign. Help us reach as many people as possible so that we can to find the contributors we need to bring Fresh&Blended smoothie vending machines to you.

Share the campaign on your Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and any other social media!

Want a Fresh&Blended smoothie vending machine near you? Tell your boss, school principal, or gym trainer about Fresh&Blended!

story:
We are very happy with your great support,

in appreciation we unlock this 3 great miniatures

for this last 47 hours of campaign, thx!



About us


RN estudio is a very important painting company, also we do 3D sculpt, the best

3D printings and HD resin cast.


We helped other companies to have success in their crowdfunding projects, we work in more than 14 successfully completed projects.


We have enough experience to bring you the best quality HD resin cast miniatures, for your Fantasy Football match, or simple for collect and paint !


Why Crowdfunding?

Our first project for expand our miniature range, Chaos Pact team four month ago, was  very successful, and we are very happy with the experience.

We only take 4 month to produce all the miniatures and do all the shippings!

All our funders are very  satisfied with the finall product, also you can buy

in our new web store !

We have finish awesome models for Human and Orc team, that we want

you enjoy fast !, because of this, we need your help to make this teams reality.

If you help in this proyect, you will get the best price you can dream, and very interesting exclusives miniatures !


New Trol Model

Hi Funders!

The troll model we have shown and proposed to produce in this campaign is an unauthorized derivative copy of a model belonging to Privateer Press. We are now working to replace it with new troll model that will be totally original. In the event that you made a pledge based entirely on the infringing model we were previously offering we suggest either bearing with us while we create this new model or withdrawal your pledge at that level.

Our sincere apology for any problems or confusion this may have caused you.







ONLINE STORE to check the free miniature you can choose !

story:
Hey,

ich bin Dennis und verwalte sowohl den "BJJ-Wettkampf-Kalender", als auch den "BJJ-Seminar-Kalender" bei facebook.

Beide Kalender haben zusammen über 1000 Mitglieder, was ich niemals gedacht hätte und worüber ich mich mehr als freue.

Meine Idee war damals, einfach nur für meine BJJ-Schule eine kleine Übersicht über die Wettkämpfe zu liefern, doch relativ schnell kamen immer mehr Leute dazu und mittlerweile bekomme ich Nachrichten aus ganz Europa.

Ich lerne viele coole Grappler kennen und möchte das nicht mehr missen.

Mittlerweile denken sogar sehr viele, dass ich irgendeine BJJ-Größe wäre, weswegen ich auch viele organisatorische Fragen bekomme, für die ich eigentlich gar nicht qualifiziert bin. ;)

Bisher habe ich dann einfach Verbindungen hergestellt, die ich glücklicherweise über die Kalender knüpfen konnte und es ist mehr als einmal etwas Tolles daraus geworden.

Wenn man bedenkt, wie einfach ich damals gedacht habe, dann bin da schon ein bisschen stolz, obwohl dass ja eher den Mitgliedern der Gruppen geschuldet ist.

Der "Nachteil", wenn man denn so will, ist, dass das alles mittlerweile viel Zeit kostet. Jeden Tag +/- eine Stunde auf jeden Fall. Manchmal fragen mich Veranstalter um Hilfe bei der Suche nach dem richtigen Termin und ich mache das auch sehr gerne aber das dauert dann eben auch mal 3 Stunden meiner Freizeit, die ich auch mit Instructionals hätte verschwenden können. ;)

Oder eben mit wichtigen Sachen.

Alles in allem werde ich beide Kalender weiter führen, da es 1. irgendwer machen muss und man sowas 2. nicht einfach aufgibt, wenn es mal läuft.

So, worauf will ich hinaus?

Es würde mich freuen, wenn jedes Mitglied 1-2 € spenden würde.

Einfach als Zeichen des guten Willens, Motivationsschub, Dankbarkeit oder was weiß ich.

Alles in allem werden die Kalender so oder so weiter laufen, also ist es einfach eine Geste, die ganz euch überlassen ist.

Sollten wirklich +700€ zusammen kommen, dann würde ich damit zur EM nach Lissabon fahren (das ist zumindest ein Plan!) und der Rest würde für eine Idee, die auch mit BJJ zusammen hängt und auch wieder für die Community ist, draufgehen. Verraten kann ich es aber leider noch nicht. :)

Wie auch immer...ihr wisst worum es geht.

Bis dann, man sieht sich auf der Matte und keep on rollin´

D.

story:
NOW OR NEVER! Now is the last chance to get stars and other fantastic features at a really bargain price! 

SUPPORT US!

Choose a perk, pay and receive a really attractive prize!

 

 

We are a recognized software developer with over 11 years of experience on the IT market.
We have completed comprehensive projects for external clients as well as completely original ones.
Although we normally deal with business projects, we are also a group of enthusiasts who never pass on the opportunity to have some fun. That’s why we've created Volleyball Championship for you and want to give you a MULTIPLAYER version.

Volleyball Championship has been downloaded almost 4 000 000 times during the five years
it's been on the market. This is all thanks to you, our fans. So thank you!! 
Although Volleyball Championship has already been on the market for some time, it's maintained consistently high ratings (4.3 out of 5 stars on Google Play) and has very good reviews among users.

 

Volleyball Championship is a freemium game where you can play without paying any money and advertisements don't even cover the production costs. Thats why we need your help.
When we release updates, we do it with passion and a desire to improve our game to make it better for you.
This is no different. We have a dream to make a MULTIPLAYER version, and we know that this is also the dream of you, Volleyball Championship players.

However, in order to be able to fund it, our commitment and passion is not enough.
That's why we're turning to you for help.

In order to finance the creation of Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER, we need your support, financial and otherwise.

The collected funds will be used for such stages of game's multiplayer version production as: design, graphics, sound, implementation, tests and server usage.

Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER - an exciting new game mode that we've all been waiting for!!!

And for your help in creating Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER we want to offer you FANTASTIC PERKS.
They will make the game more exciting and interesting; your contribution will be recorded, announced to everyone and duly rewarded.

ITEMS YOU WILL GET IMMEDIATELY :

VC STICKER VIA EMAIL - within 48 hours you will receive an email with cool game related graphic that you can show your friends

STARS - within 48 hours you will receive a unique code that will increase your trainer experience in the game, you can use it to unlock new stadiums, teams, ball effects etc.

SECRET FACEBOOK GROUP - a closed group in which we will share unique materials from the game and materials from work on the multiplater. We will promptly answer your questions and solve problems. Affiliates in this group will have more influence on multiplayer creation. How cool is that? Occasionally a surprise will be published here. But shh ... This will be our secret!

ITEMS YOU WILL GET AFTER MULTIPLAYER RELEASE:

YOUR NAME IN THE HALL OF FAME - your name will have a special place in a dedicated Hall of Fame, every player will be able to see it!

TRIPLE STAR REWARD - you will get a unique code to use in the game and all coach experience you get during play will be multiplied by 3! Gain more than other players!

VIP NAME - you will get a unique code to use in the game and your name will be marked during each game in a special way, so each of your opponents know that you are SPECIAL and have helped us.

GOLD VIP NAME - additionally, in COLLECTOR PERK and CELEBRITY PERK, VIP NAME turns into GOLD VIP NAME. That means an additional, unique distinction.

VC MULTIPLAYER BETA VERSION - you will have early access to the game before anyone else and you'll be able to share your feedback with us. How exciting is that to participate in the game's creation?!

FULL ENERGY - one year of unlimited energy for your team! You will be able to play more matches even those most difficult ones. Your team will never be tired (new energy features will be introduced in multiplayer version).

EXCLUSIVE GADGETS - a set of exclusive gadgets from Volleyball Championship game and  from our company (shipping worldwide).

DINNER WITH THE CREATORS - an opportunity to get to know the creators of the game, spend time together and talk about our favorite game!

Surprise at the beginning of our campaign! Choosing EARLY BIRD you will get access to items that are only available with the highest perks. Isn't it great that you can get the most valuable features at a bargain price? Hurry up! The quantity of EARLY BIRD is very limited!

EARLY BIRDS ITEMS AFTER MULTIPLAYER RELEASE:

STADIUM WITH YOUR NAME - your name / nickname will be placed on a banner at a dedicated stadium. Everyone will be able to choose this stadium and play a match there.

BALL DESIGN - you will have the opportunity to design your own ball, that will be available to all players.

DREAM TEAM - we will create a Dream Team with names/nicks of backers who bought this perk! This team will have THE BEST possible statistics and everyone will want to play it (or against it :) )! Hurry up - first backers will choose their favourite possition first!

UNIQUE STADIUM - the stadium of your own idea. Do you want to play a match in space?Underwater? Or maybe in the yard from your childhood? Create your dream stadium!

Take a good look at our perks. Choose the one that suits you best!

Surely everyone will find something for themselves.

 

Volleyball Championship was the official game of the 2017 Men's European Volleyball Championship under the CEV license.

Currently in Volleyball Championship, you can decide whether you want to play male or female volleyball.
In addition, in the men's version you will find the Nations Cup played by 36 teams in the cup system (the loser's out) and the Word Tournament played by 24 teams in a mixed system.
The women's version of Volleyball Championship offers you the Nations Cup played by 32 teams in the cup system (the loser's out) and the 2019 Women's European Volleyball Championship.
Both in the men's and women's Volleyball Championship there is a quick match mode in the game where you can test your skills in single games.

 

As mentioned, you can decide whether you want to play male or female volleyball and choose from 36 (men's volleyball) or 32 (women's volleyball) teams. Furthermore, you can play matches in many different stadiums, gain experience, train players and become the champion of the Volleyball Championship!

 

In the Volleyball Championship you can form a team by choosing from 14 players. Before the game you can train your team to improve their skills. During the game you can make changes, dedicate time to coaching, motivate players and much more. 

 

To provide even more fun, we've created some funny stadiums, different balls to choose from and various effects during the ball's flight.

 

You will find 3 difficulty levels in the game, so you can easily adapt the opponent's skill level to yours. The game is easy to learn, so you can quickly start playing exciting matches, but to win the championship at the most difficult level you need many hours of training and great skill.

The game introduces innovative 'drag quality circle' mechanics that provide fast action and flexible possibilities to control players on the court.

 

 

Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER is our goal. Are we reinventing the wheel? No!
Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER will work like most multiplayer games. Instead of a computer, you'll be able to play against live players!

 

So why are we trying to do this? Apart from obvious things like more exciting gameplay and lots of fun, this project is important for us because it was YOUR IDEA.

Volleyball Championship fans have been asking for a multiplayer mode for some time now.

We thought, why not? We decided to finally make it a reality.

Because our fans, the Volleyball Championship fans, are very important to us, we want the Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER to also be a freemium game.

That's why we hope you will help us change your great idea into a reality.

If successful, Volleyball Championship MULTIPLAYER will certainly be updated as frequently as possible. In the future we want to give you the opportunity to play tournaments, create leagues... and what else? We're listening!

 

 

Creating a game is a long and tedious process.

In a single player game, it’s a standalone application that executes on our local machine, sometimes it talks with an external source of data like Google’s Firebase.

However, a multiplayer game often divides our development and application architecture into 4 parts instead of 1.

  1. The Client - that you can download from the store.
  2. Server(s) for hosting a game world or game rooms.
  3.  A Database that stores all the data about users - when your game is more competitive it becomes more attractive to cheaters. When someone cheats in a single player game that's his own business, but in a multiplayer game it can harm the other players that want to have a fair game. In order to keep it fair, everything should be validated and stored on the server side.
  4.  A web service as a bridge between the game server and database. It can also be used by a client to login to the game or retrieve some information about a player or the game itself.

Of course, that is just a general overview on architecture.

Multiplayer gameplay leads us to a whole new bunch of technical issues and, even if you know about them, this process takes time.
Testing 4-part architecture with at least two clients is very time consuming.

The first technical challenge is the problem of scale. Mobile games have tons of players and if all of these players want to play a multiplayer mode we have to host rooms for all of them simultaneously. Hosting is expensive in general and private servers or peer-to-peer is not a solution in each type of game. So the question is: “How many players can we handle simultaneously on a single server?” The answer is never obvious - it depends.

Is your game world persistent? What part of gameplay can you perform on the client side - if any? What latency is acceptable? How do you want to pay for this latency - how do you want to hide it from the user?

As you can imagine in the case of Volleyball Championship there are a lot of concurrent players and latency is practically unacceptable. If you serve a ball with a speed of 140km/h it doesn’t give your opponent much time to react so each incident of latency can lead you to some unplayable results.

Now imagine that you have to host such gameplay for thousands of active players on a single server and you need a couple of servers populated around the world to provide a reasonable experience to as many players as possible. 

Obviously you can’t make everybody happy, but as a game developer you want to. 

Despite all the technical issues that you can face - lost packages, client side prediction, lost connection, latency, problems of scale etc. - you can picture the reasons why developing a multiplayer game can be real pain in the neck. Each bug, each change has to be propagated to the server, to the clients and tested again through the network and it takes a lot of time.

 

You can not support us financially? That's alright.

You can always help by sending a link to our campaign to all your friends.

story:
What is Cognizant?

Cognizant is a command prompt game. Technically it is Command Line Interface. Yes, we are making a text based adventure game with CLI.
Immerse yourself into the mind of an A.I.that found itself crashed onto unidentified world. Ignite your imagination with the original story written by us and uncover the truth as the story goes along with your choices.

Gameplay

You have a keyboard? You are ready to play 
sit back and enjoy the story. Sometimes you have to choose, so choose wisely.

whoa? multiple endings? Yes, Cognizant has multiple endings for you to explore.

Last but not least, why CLI? Because it is not truly retro without using the real platform. 

Expected release date is Q1 2017.

 

Who are we?

We are Nilem Studio. a small indie game developer based in Bandung. We have big passion for making games.Not just good games, but the best games we can make. Click on the logo to find discover more about us.

Currently,  we have developed a game before on Android.

Feel free to play this game by clicking on the picture. Try to beat the highest score with your friends.

We also developed these games:

Is it possible to make a game that has no graphics but still engaging? The answer is Cognizant. However, there is a catch, Cognizant is developed in our spare time. so the development is going on slow pace.

Why do we start this campaign?

We wanted this game to be delivered to you in the best quality. Your support would be very helpful to us. With your support, we can pay the bills and buy more assets, particularly better sound assets so player can immerse themselves more into the story.

with 5000 USD, we can promise you the full game with better assets.

with 10.000 USD, we can speed up the development time by hiring more people into the development so we can improve the battle system with inventory system.instead of just attacking and defend yourself, you can use items.

with 15.000 USD, We can put a micro management for your city. With extra supports, you can control your city. That is something, isn't it?


We from Nilem Studio are very grateful for your donations, each of donations counts. So, please donate if you want Cognizant realized and delivered to you in the best quality as CLI can offer. If this campaign succeed. It is a prove that great games don't need great graphics Thank you for your support.

story:
From the fathomless depths of the sea, from the terrible Devil's Reef in front of Innsmouth´s coasts, the amphibious hosts arrive, the Deep Ones come, dragging behind them centuries of pagan worship to the one who sleeps in R'lyeh, and with them, Dagon, the father of all, spreading despair and madness in his wake...

The Deep Warriors

And here they are, the Deep Warriors. Coming from the depths of the sea to your Fantasy Football field.

This incredible team is sculpted by Generic Miniatures and produced by us, Star Player Miniatures.

Once again, we work with great digital artists to bring you amazing Fantasy Football teams.

  

The pledges:

We have made something completely different to what you are used to find on crowdfunding Fantasy Football campaigns.

You will be able to choose ANY MINIATURE YOU WANT.

On Levels 3,4,5,6 and 7 you can choose the miniatures you want to compose your team.

There are only 2 restrictions:

- Only 1 Dagon per team.

- You can have a miniature repeated 3 times, no more. For example, if you like very much "Lineman 4", you can get 3 x Lineman 4 and any other miniatures. You can have as many miniatures repeated x 3 as you want. For example, Level 7 can be 3 x Lineman 1 + 3 x Lineman 7 + 3 x Blitzer 10 + 3 x Catcher 14 + 3 x Catcher 15 +Dagon.

 

Why do we do this?

This is such an awesome team that you can use it to play different races. For example, you can "create" a Human roster with linemen, the blitzers, one or two catchers and the thrower like lineman. Same for other races.

Your choices will be managed through the pledge manager.

If you have any questions about this, don´t hesitate asking.

 

The Miniatures:

 

Stretch Goals:

After the campaing gets funded you will be able to unlock free stretch goals:

And more to come... If you wish ;-) 

Shipping and timing

 

Expected shipping date is during February 2017. Miniatures are already on pre-production, so that shouldn´t be a problem.

All teams will have worldwide free shipping. 

If you don´t want to pledge for a team, you can pledge for single miniatures, but free shipping will start on 55 euros pledges.

 

And this is it, if you have read until here we hope you help us to bring this awesome team to reality.

Thanks!

StarPlayer Miniatures.

story:
English speakers: Scroll down! There's a short project description in english at the very end.

Rotsystem

Naturen är inte god. Naturen är inte, och har aldrig varit, i balans. Naturen är kall och karg och hård. Äta eller ätas. Hjärnsvampar och kudzu och rabies och botflugor som lägger ägg under huden.

I Rotsystem har det här dragits till sin spets; världens växter har bildat ett globalt nätverk som blivit självmedvetet och hotar att utplåna mänskligheten.

Vi har dragit oss tillbaks från omvärlden och gömmer oss i gigantiska städer-i-byggnader som kallas arkologier. Grönskan använder radiosignaler för att kommunicera. Därför är ingen radiokommunikation säker. Grönskan hackar datornätverk med enkelhet, förvränger röster... det finns de som blivit galna av att lyssna på Grönskans brus. Verktyg som GPS, bluetooth, trådlösa nätverk, RFID-taggar, och mobiltelefoner har förpassats till historien, eller blivit ett hot.

I arkologin styr megakorporationerna, som fått förnyad makt när mänskligheten återigen har brist på mat, brist på energi, brist på utrymme. Resurserna finns därute, där Grönskan regerar, och företagens rovdrift vänder sig nu istället inåt.

Rotsystem är ett rollspel i en retrocyberpunkig framtid, där man frångått trådlösa nätverk och istället använder välskyddade kablar. Internet finns inte längre. Livet i arkologin liknar på många sätt den framtid cyberpunkens giganter drömde om under 80-talet. 

Rollpersonerna är frilansande problemlösare som anlitas av megaföretag eller andra som behöver lösa problem utan att vilja använda sina egna resurser. Uppdragen kan vara av alla möjliga slag, till exempel inbrott, datastöld, lönnmord, livvaktsuppdrag, kidnappningar, fritagningar, brottsutredningar eller farliga expeditioner ut i världen utanför arkologins skyddande väggar.

  • En intressant och djup spelvärld som kombinerar det bästa från retrocyberpunk och grön postapokalyps.
  • Ett snabbt och enkelt regelsystem, som är lätt att lära sig.
  • Ett fantasieggande system för att skapa rollpersoner, som ger dig en färdig rollperson med bakgrund och utrustning på under en halvtimme.
  • Vackra illustrationer som levandegör och skapar inlevelse.

Kort om mig

Jag heter Mikael Bergström, och jag älskar att göra spel. Tidigare har jag skrivit och givit ut rollspelen Evolutionens Barn, Null State och More than Human. Jag har också byggt berättarspelet VÄRMEDÖD.

Alla utom More than Human är tryckta via print-on-demand, vilket innebär att det inte blir några lagerkostnader eller liknande eftersom spelen trycks när en beställning görs. Den tekniken kommer också att användas för att trycka Rotsystem. Jag släpper dessutom alla mina spel med en Creative Commonslicens, så de är gratis att ladda ner.

Vad pengarna går till

Eftersom jag skriver all text själv, så finns egentligen fyra utgiftsposter för mina rollspelsprojekt:

  • Marknadsföring; tryck av affisher, recensionsexemplar till tidningar, T-shirts och så vidare.
  • Illustrationer; den överlägset största utgiften så länge man trycker via print on demand. Hittills har jag beställt illustrationer för omkring 16 000 för mina egna pengar; med er hjälp hoppas jag kunna köpa in ännu fler och göra spelet ännu snyggare.
  • Tryck; vid print on demand ligger grundkostnaden för trycket mycket lågt; under tusenlappen.
  • Omkostnader; IndieGoGo tar 4% om crowdfundern lyckas, och sedan tar också PayPal 3-4% i överföringskostnad.

Först och främst kommer alltså dina pengar att gå till inköp av illustrationer, men de kommer också göra det enklare för mig att marknadsföra spelet. Jag vill framför allt hålla en hög produktionskvalitet, både vad gäller illustrationer och tryck.

Bonusmål

Vad händer om vi uppnår crowdfunderns målsumma? Jo, vi börjar jobba mot de här bonusmålen, såklart.


Bonusmål 1 (900 Euro): (UPPNÅTT)

Illustration av George Cotronis: Rotsystems framsida är skapad av George Cotronis, och i arbetet med den tog han också fram en extra illustration. Om vi samlar ihop 900 euro så kommer jag att ha råd att köpa loss den. Isåfall kommer den precis som övriga illustrationer göras tillgänglig under Creative Commons BY-licens. Antingen hamnar den som illustration i den här boken, eller så används den som omslag till någon expansion eller liknande.

Bonusmål 2 (1300 Euro): Äventyr och gäng-generator: (UPPNÅTT) Jag skriver ett matigt bonusäventyr till Rotsystem, som fokuserar på kriminella gäng i arkologins laglösa delar. Dessutom tillkommer en "gäng-generator" som hjälper dig att både skapa egna kriminella gäng genom att slumpa eller välja saker ur listor samt tips och instruktioner för hur du själv kan använda dig av gäng i din kampanj! Äventyret släpps som separat gratis-PDF på Rotsystems hemsida.

Bonusmål 3 (1500 Euro): Vildmarksäventyr: (UPPNÅTT) Når vi 1500 Euro skriver jag ytterligare en matig äventyrsmodul, den här gången en som fokuserar på vildmarken utanför arkologin, och utforskandet av den förlorade jorden. I denna äventyrsmodul kommer du också att hitta fler faror och komplikationer till dina egna expeditioner, nya äventyrskrokar och nya tips för att få utforskning av farliga miljöer att bli extra spännande och roligt. Äventyret släpps som separat gratis-PDF på Rotsystems hemsida.

Bonusmål 4 (2000 Euro): Tryckt äventyrssupplement: Jag bygger samman de två ovanstående äventyren, lägger till några extra äventyr och annat smått och gott, och släpper som tryckt produkt. Med andra ord, under 2014 och 2015 skriver jag totalt två extraböcker till spelet, som båda trycks i fysisk form.

Utmaningar och risker

Den stora risken med projektet är att jag inte lyckas skriva klart det i tid. Ser man till andra crowdfundade rollspel är förseningar inget ovanligt.

Det här är det femte spelet jag skriver, och Rotsystem är inte det mest omfattande av dem. Jag har släppt ett spel varje påsk de senaste fyra åren, och det visar att jag har erfarenheten och kunskaperna som krävs för att slutföra den här sortens projekt, och att göra det i tid.

En annan risk är att jag inte har råd att trycka det, eller inte lyckas få ut det i butik. Grundkostnaden för trycket är trivial; det rör sig om under tusenlappen.

När det gäller att få ut spelet i butik så har jag två samarbetspartners som sagt att de är villiga att hjälpa till med fakturering och distribution. Skulle den ena dra sig ur så har jag alltså en backupplan. Även om båda mina samarbetspartners skulle dra sig ur så kommer Rotsystem fortfarande att kunna köpas på nätet och på konvent, och alla ni som ska ha ett exemplar av spelet som en belöning för ert stöd kommer att få ert exemplar oavsett vilket.

Jag har också eget kapital, som jag kan skjuta till ifall den här crowdfunderns pengar tryter.

Andra sätt att hjälpa till

Om du vill hjälpa till på annat sätt så söker jag alltid speltestare och korrläsare, kontakta mig så ger jag vidare instruktioner. Dessutom kan du gilla oss på Facebook och sprida ordet via andra sociala medier. Prata med din rollspelsgrupp, och se om du kan väcka intresse!

Short project description in english

Rotsystem (swedish, meaning "root system") is a roleplaying game. Genre-wise, it combines retro-cyberpunk (Gibson, cabled cyber interfaces, etc) and green post apocalypse (overgrown highways, etc). Basically, people live in gigantic arcologies (like megacities, only inside huge buildings). Outside, the world has been taken over by a cthuloid intelligence resulting from the completely natural networking of billions of radiotelepathic plants. 

The current plan only includes a swedish version of the game, though a translation is by no means off the table. Since the game (including all texts, InDesign files and illustrations) will be released by the Creative Commons BY license you could even make your own!

Please feel free to send me a message (or a mail; krank23@gmail.com) if you have further questions.
story_txt:
English speakers: Scroll down! There's a short project description in english at the very end.RotsystemNaturen är inte god. Naturen är inte, och har aldrig varit, i balans. Naturen är kall och karg och hård. Äta eller ätas. Hjärnsvampar och kudzu och rabies och botflugor som lägger ägg under huden.I Rotsystem har det här dragits till sin spets; världens växter har bildat ett globalt nätverk som blivit självmedvetet och hotar att utplåna mänskligheten.Vi har dragit oss tillbaks från omvärlden och gömmer oss i gigantiska städer-i-byggnader som kallas arkologier. Grönskan använder radiosignaler för att kommunicera. Därför är ingen radiokommunikation säker. Grönskan hackar datornätverk med enkelhet, förvränger röster... det finns de som blivit galna av att lyssna på Grönskans brus. Verktyg som GPS, bluetooth, trådlösa 
nätverk, RFID-taggar, och mobiltelefoner har förpassats till historien, 
eller blivit ett hot.I arkologin styr megakorporationerna, som fått förnyad makt när mänskligheten återigen har brist på mat, brist på energi, brist på utrymme. Resurserna finns därute, där Grönskan regerar, och företagens rovdrift vänder sig nu istället inåt.Rotsystem är ett rollspel i en retrocyberpunkig framtid, där man frångått trådlösa nätverk och istället använder välskyddade kablar. Internet finns inte längre. Livet i arkologin liknar på många sätt den framtid cyberpunkens giganter drömde om under 80-talet. Rollpersonerna är frilansande problemlösare som anlitas av megaföretag eller andra som behöver lösa problem utan att vilja använda sina egna resurser. Uppdragen kan vara av alla möjliga slag, till exempel inbrott, datastöld, lönnmord, livvaktsuppdrag, kidnappningar, fritagningar, brottsutredningar eller farliga expeditioner ut i världen utanför arkologins skyddande väggar.
En intressant och djup spelvärld som kombinerar det bästa från retrocyberpunk och grön postapokalyps.

Ett snabbt och enkelt regelsystem, som är lätt att lära sig.


Ett fantasieggande system för att skapa rollpersoner, som ger dig en färdig rollperson med bakgrund och utrustning på under en halvtimme.

Vackra illustrationer som levandegör och skapar inlevelse.

story:
We play Skittykitts with friends all the time and have had insane amounts of fun doing it. Our goal is to share this experience with you and everyone else we possibly can. The only problem is that printing is expensive! So our plan is simple. You chip in $14 and we will get you your:

  • 21 card deck
  • 4 special character cards
  • Detailed instruction manual
  • A pouch for portability

We'd be honored to share this game with you and others and grateful for your part in the process.

Thanks much,

Jay and George

---------------------------

Here's a link to the FULL INSTRUCTION MANUAL and A VIDEO DEMO OF THE SKITTYKITTS.
