story:
Short Summary: 

Skybox VUE (Visual Up-to-the-minute Entertainment) is an attractive and colorful scoreboard display measuring approx. 25 x 21 x 2 inches (635 x 530 x 50 mm). The Skybox VUE is currently designed for Major League Baseball games. This unique, patented concept, allows sports enthusiasts to follow their favorite teams and view LIVE play-by-play scores as well as game statistics. The display also features a built-in text/messaging/scrolling capability for information sharing and advertising. The Skybox VUE operates via subscription-based Wi-Fi technology which allows scores, messages and statistics to be displayed wirelessly. The Skybox VUE can be set up in sports bars, personal game rooms, VIP lounges, corporate offices, and sports venues designed for fan enjoyment.

Using Wi-Fi technology, the Skybox VUE becomes your own personalized wireless scoreboard. The Skybox VUE will not only give you the scores of your favorite team, but also updated pitch and play information, statistics and narrative on the play that just transpired. You can set the Skybox VUE to always display the information from your favorite team, or have it automatically scroll through all teams.

Many sports fans are often unable to watch a full game on TV due to distractions of a busy lifestyle. The Skybox VUE is your solution. Turn off the TV. Spend more family time, help the kids with their homework, relax or get caught up on paperwork. All of this can be accomplished while still getting your game updates from the Skybox VUE!

While our current product is focused on Major League Baseball, the Skybox VUE’s concept is versatile and flexible to be updated in future models to include the NFL, NBA, NHL, and other major team sports.

Feel the excitement of being at the game from your own home or office. This is the perfect gift for the sports fan who has everything.

 

 

 

 

How does it work?

How does it work? When a play happens (for example a Pitch or a Hit in major league baseball), the scores and statistics are processed by our live update server within seconds. Our customized software reads the new data from the server and displays it on the Skybox VUE. There is normally only seconds from when the play happens to when it shows up on your Skybox VUE.   Displayed on the built in 7” tablet will be your favorite team identifier or logo.  The Skybox VUE will also be able to provide fantasy sports data and we intend for future models to show replays of memorable moments along with advertising as if you were at the game.

Our current Skybox VUE features Major League Baseball (MLB). We anticipate the National Football League (NFL) to follow shortly thereafter. Eventually we plan to support all major sports including NBA, NHL and MLS. And yes, college sports are in our sights as well!

The Skybox VUE will connect to any Wi-Fi network using the tablet interface. 

  • It will be very attractive and will look great on the wall of your home, rec room, man cave, office, bar, restaurant and anywhere you want live sports action.
  • We will be offering customizable, interchangeable front covers (skin) with an opportunity to personalize the overall “look and feel” with your favorite teams and team colors with eye-catching designs.
  • The Skybox VUE features nearly 500 square inches of printable, visual front fascia real estate. This creates an excellent opportunity for advertiser and sponsor visibility.
  • We will be offering branded versions of the VUE with custom skins created by our graphics team for you with the branding of your organization.
  • We will be offering custom skinning services using the photo that you provide. Do you have a photo that would be the perfect background for your Skybox VUE? We'll make it happen. Hint: This is a GREAT idea for Dad for Father's Day! (Dads - simply share the website www.skyboxscoreboards.com with your family by clicking on the social media buttons!)

 

 

 

 

Status:

I’ve put a management TEAM in place, consisting of a group of highly dedicated and experienced business leaders, committed to bringing the Skybox VUE to sports fans everywhere.

We have successfully built and tested 2 fully functioning prototypes and are currently in the process of designing the first 3 production models for field testing, marketing and pre-sales. 

 

Opportunity - cost – availability

A full product roll-out and official product launch is scheduled prior to the 2014 Baseball Season. We invite you to follow our progress on our website, Twitter, and on our FACEBOOK page

We are working out the details with our manufacturer so we cannot yet provide a price. We can tell you that if you are an avid sports fan, it will no doubt be worth the price!

 

 

 

Call for action / what we need now and for what: 

To get us to the next stage, we need investment funding. We are reaching out to the crowd-funding community to help us bring the Skybox VUE to market. Our goal is to raise $60,000 to pay for;

      - Components, material and tooling

      - Assembly of pre-production units

      - Software development & programming

      - Statistic feed from The Sports Network

      - Marketing

      - UL Testing

 

Direct-investment opportunity:

Skybox VUE also offers an opportunity to direct-invest in this new product. We are actively seeking serious investment partners who share a passion for new technology, and who wish to capitalize on the chance to become part of this exciting product on the front-end. Interested parties may submit inquiries to the Skybox VUE team.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

You can help us by funding this project. You can also promote it around you. You can give us your advice on how to improve the Skybox VUE. Let’s make the very best product for all sports enthusiasts!

 

Closing / Thank you

I hope YOU are as excited about the Skybox VUE as we are, and consider participating in our quest to bring it to sports enthusiasts everywhere. We THANK YOU very much for your generous support. With your support you can help finish my journey in making my dream become a reality.

When the campaign is over and the Skybox VUE becomes available, we will send out special offers on our products to all of those who contributed.

story:
Game Design

Aftermath: The End Game is an open world survival horror that focuses on combat realism, innovative game mechanics, authentic shooting & survival culture, graphical quality, and balanced gameplay. As a PvP player, you will be challenged by Aftermath, however the gameplay is geared towards PvE for several good reasons. The PvE gameplay in Aftermath will allow for PvP to occur naturally as a gameplay decision of risk vs reward rather than the default mode of play, while ensuring PvE is challenging. 

You will be pitted against the environment with the added danger of a player element able to pop up at any time, and vice versa. This game design supports the greatest number of play styles and the perpetual double threat looming over your head will make for authentically thrilling gameplay that survival game enthusiasts have been missing out on from the genre for a very long time. PvE gameplay also allows the game to contain truly thrilling and terrifying AI encounters that wouldn't often happen in PvP focused game.

In game audio comms, visual signals, as well as AI detection and spawning mechanics will help to minimize needless "shoot-on-sight" gameplay while allowing freedom of choice. Most importantly - it is played exclusively from the first person perspective to eliminate third-person gimmicks and maximize immersion. 
 

Visual Quality

A major focus for Aftermath: The End Game has been visual quality. Due to the massive boom in video game technology and the game development market over recent years, achieving fantastic looking assets has never been easier. While many other games in the genre are ageing (and were only bordering on acceptable upon launch), we are future-proofing the development as much as possible by creating high quality assets, and will continue to update and improve as much as possible going forward. We want to develop a game we can be proud of. One that will give you, the player, what you deserve. 
 

Why Aftermath: The End Game Needs You

Development has gotten far through personal funding and a lot of hard work, but it has to go that extra bit farther to make it onto Steam and console as a polished, stable game. We have many custom models such as weapons, characters, vehicles and buildings but there are still plenty more to make and we believe you deserve better than generic marketplace assets!
We have been working with very talented freelancers and will be seeking out an established, successful studio to partner with in order to complete development. Quality animation is a particularly time consuming process and the sheer number of animations required means a big chunk of our funds will go towards this. The upside, however, is the end result - smooth, realistic and immersive animations that bring Aftermath: The End Game to life!
 

The Vision

The open world survival genre has transformed the gaming industry in recent years. Probably just like you, the creators of Aftermath: The End Game were captivated by the survival aspects of games like The Forest, Minecraft, ARK: Survival Evolved, Arma 2 mods and many others. There have been many survival titles that have captured the imagination of gamers, however none successfully offer what Aftermath: The End Game will deliver - gorgeous environments, confronting gameplay, terrifying enemies, and intuitive gun mechanics inspired by first person shooters such as Escape From Tarkov, Squad and Insurgency. 
Our first map is a gorgeous snowy wilderness which will provide a sense of adventure and isolation. A beautiful 8km x 8km setting marred by horror and hopelessness. Additional map concepts will be larger (15km x 15km or larger) and with Aftermath: The End Game achieving the necessary crowdfunding and launch success, more inventive and aesthetic as the game matures and evolves.
There is a plethora of game mechanics and features to be implemented. Realistic, simulator inspired vehicle mechanics (2WD, 4WD, 6WD, high + low range etc), unique and innovative climb + shoot mechanics (not parkour) and entertaining interactive features like generators for lighting systems & loudspeakers and an in-vehicle sound system that lets you play your own music tracks!

All of this will be complimented by a state-of-the-art web community linked to the game database with a host of features to compliment the interactions of players both in-game and on social media. By building a strong and dedicated community, we will bolster the player base and ensure that Aftermath: The End Game reaches its full potential and longevity.
 

The Journey Ahead

Our first hurdle is getting the proper funding to continue the work we have completed so far. After crowdfunding, we will be seeking an established studio to partner with so that we can combine our creative drive with technically capable industry experience. The next stage of development will include significant testing of game networking, bug finding, design testing and ongoing asset development, particularly environment assets such as buildings and props.
Excess funds will be put towards expediting additional maps and advanced game features. 
 

How To Help

As well as contributing at one of the several crowdfunder tiers, you can also help our project greatly by sharing this campaign with friends, family and on social media.
If you are unable to contribute right now, rest assured that we will keep the sale price as fair as possible to grow the Aftermath community. Any contribution you make, however, will be hugely appreciated and will help ensure that Aftermath: The End Game is able to complete development. 

 

Follow The Development

You can follow our development journey on various social media platforms!
https://www.facebook.com/AftermathTheEndGame/
https://twitter.com/AftermathTEG

https://www.reddit.com/r/AftermathTheEndGame/

https://discord.gg/st2QUGm
story_txt:
Game Design
Aftermath: The End Game is an open world survival horror that focuses on combat realism, innovative game mechanics, authentic shooting & survival culture, graphical quality, and balanced gameplay. As a PvP player, you will be challenged by Aftermath, however the gameplay is geared towards PvE for several good reasons. The PvE gameplay in Aftermath will allow for PvP to occur naturally as a gameplay decision of risk vs reward rather than the default mode of play, while ensuring PvE is challenging. 
You will be pitted against the environment with the added danger of a player element able to pop up at any time, and vice versa. This game design supports the greatest number of play styles and the perpetual double threat looming over your head will make for authentically thrilling gameplay that survival game enthusiasts have been missing out on from the genre for a very long time. PvE gameplay also allows the game to contain truly thrilling and terrifying AI encounters that wouldn't often happen in PvP focused game.In game audio comms, visual signals, as well as AI detection and spawning mechanics will help to minimize needless "shoot-on-sight" gameplay while allowing freedom of choice. Most importantly - it is played exclusively from the first person perspective to eliminate third-person gimmicks and maximize immersion.  
Visual Quality
A major focus for Aftermath: The End Game has been visual quality. Due to the massive boom in video game technology and the game development market over recent years, achieving fantastic looking assets has never been easier. While many other games in the genre are ageing (and were only bordering on acceptable upon launch), we are future-proofing the development as much as possible by creating high quality assets, and will continue to update and improve as much as possible going forward. We want to develop a game we can be proud of. One that will give you, the player, what you deserve.

A beautiful 8km x 8km setting marred by horror and hopelessness. Additional map concepts will be larger (15km x 15km or larger) and with Aftermath: The End Game achieving the necessary crowdfunding and launch success, more inventive and aesthetic as the game matures and evolves.There is a plethora of game mechanics and features to be implemented. Realistic, simulator inspired vehicle mechanics (2WD, 4WD, 6WD, high + low range etc), unique and innovative climb + shoot mechanics (not parkour) and entertaining interactive features like generators for lighting systems & loudspeakers and an in-vehicle sound system that lets you play your own music tracks!All of this will be complimented by a state-of-the-art web community linked to the game database with a host of features to compliment the interactions of players both in-game and on social media. By building a strong and dedicated community, we will bolster the player base and ensure that Aftermath: The End Game reaches its full potential and longevity.

story: ----

Digital version released. Perks removed. Campaign closed. We will move to a custom store for further cartridge sales. Update will follow. Thanks for your support!

 

THIS GAME IS 100% FINISHED and works on the real NES console!

In September, we ran a successful Kickstarter campaign in order to raise funds for cartridge, box and manual production. To meet the continuing demand, we decided to transfer to Indiegogo InDemand to offer anyone who missed the original campaign a chance to get a copy of Micro Mages while the game cartridges are being produced.

Micro Mages is a new platform game for the NES, play solo or with up to 4 players simultaneously. Fight to get the best score or cooperate to overcome challenging sections.

 

NES version

All officially released console versions and regions are supported: NTSC NES, PAL NES, Famicom with a 72-to-60-pin cartridge adapter (not included).

High-quality clones such as the retroUSB AVS and Analogue Nt mini are also supported. Furthermore, our testers confirmed the game works on the RetroN 5.

 

Digital version

Alternatively, we offer a ROM version. This allows you to play the game on your PC and many other platforms through the use of an emulator. 

Alongside the ROM download, we will provide easy-to-understand instructions on how to set up an emulator and play Micro Mages on a Windows PC.

 

Enter the Demon Fortress. Built to torture pesky adventurers, this place is home to great treasure and ghastly creatures alike. But don't worry, you can count on allies like Fairies and Magical Seagulls to come to your help!

Micro Mages is an homage to NES-era platformers. Being a homebrew NES game itself, it was made completely from scratch. We carefully distilled the spirit of the best games in the system's library, all the while drawing inspiration from the modern and putting our own spin on things, creating an experience like no other on the NES.

© Grzegorz Karkoszka. Pictures from Gamefest at gamesweekberlin 2018.

While many homebrew games and later commercial NES releases can be upwards of 512 Kilobytes in size, we challenged ourselves to make the best game we could given the harsh limitations that the very first NES titles (e.g., Super Mario Bros.) had to deal with. That is, the whole game fits into 40 Kilobytes. Micro Mages could have been an NES launch title!

And yet, fun was our number one priority, the classics were our benchmark. Half of the game's development time was spent on optimization and polish. Fluid gameplay, tight controls and a carefully balanced challenge were our dedication.

Multiplayer mode

That's right, Micro Mages supports up to 4 simultaneous players. We made sure the game plays perfectly well in single player mode, but for that extra bit of fun, do invite friends and family!

Players of all skill levels can take part in the action. Play carefully and cooperate to overcome difficult sections OR take risks, shove your friends into lava and snatch the high score!

As long as at least one player is alive, you won't lose a life. Dead players turn into ghosts and have the ability to help their comrades by freezing enemies. They can also destroy crates and treasure chests in the hope of finding a Fairy or Magic Seagull Feather that will bring them back to life.

Micro Mages is full of surprises

  • Up to 4 simultaneous players
  • 8 worlds spanning a total of 26 levels (normal + hard mode)
  • Dangerous traps, monsters and bosses
  • Secrets!
  • Password function
  • 40 Kilobytes, fully optimized
  • and more...

Will you be able to beat it?

Team up with friends

Discover the different towers of the Demon Fortress

Can you beat the dark forces?

Pictures from Gamefest at gamesweekberlin 2018. Picture on right by © Grzegorz Karkoszka.

Despite having only two controller ports, the NES can be extended with the FourScore multiplayer adapter that allows you to connect up to four controllers. Micro Mages is compatible with this adapter as well as the Hori 4-player adapter released for the Famicom. The NES Satellite wireless 4-player adapter works, too!

On the left, the FourScore for the NES; on the right, the Hori adapter for the Famicom

 

Why Indiegogo?

This is another chance to get a copy of Micro Mages if you missed our Kickstarter campaign in September. As cartridge production goes, it is necessary for us to know demand in advance, and since many people have just discovered Micro Mages after the end of our September campaign, we opted to use Indiegogo InDemand to make the game available again until we finish the production steps.

We have been working meticulously for the past two years to bring you an experience on-par with NES era commercial releases. The game and print data are finished, but it's a special financial challenge to produce cartridges, manuals and boxes in high quantities.

Exclusive to the NES version: cartridge, box and instruction booklet

Comprehensive instruction booklet: hero moves, enemies, worlds and more...

We are a two-man team from Berlin, dedicated to bringing new games to old hardware!

Julius created Morphcat Games in 2011 when he released the NES demo Super Bat Puncher. He made other games during game jams and also composes music on his free time. On Micro Mages, he did the programming, created tools for data optimization as well as music and sound effects.

Nicolas joined Julius during the Ludum Dare 32 game jam and together they created a short NES game named Banana Nana. On Micro Mages, he made the graphics and levels as well as box and manual illustrations.

 

Risks & Challenges

Risk reduction is our highest priority. Thus, finishing the game and print data before launch was an absolute necessity for us. That's right, the game is 100% complete!

Naturally, we have thoroughly planned and prepared all the steps required for the game's release. Antoine Gohin of Broke Studio, who successfuly produced and released his own NES homebrew game Twin Dragons, will hande the cartridge production while we will take care of print and shipping.

We made sure to add a suitably large buffer to all of our calculations in terms of both financial and time requirements - in case of any unforeseen events.

story:
ZØRE X’s revolutionary electro mechanical dial is designed to allow quick unlocking under any circumstances, even in the dark. To unlock, just turn the dial a few notches back and forth according to your PIN code, regardless of the dial starting point and the initial dialing direction. You won’t realize how fast it is until you try it yourself. 

 

 

 

  

ZØRE products ship with an optional smartphone app that allows you to be always connected to your guns. The ZØRE APP lets you define different notification profiles in accordance with various situations. For example, while your gun is stored at home, you can receive gun-movement notifications, as well as notifications for dial movement. 

 

You can even unlock your gun directly from the app, although locking the gun is only possible through the mechanical lock button.

 

 

Simply owning a gun isn’t useful if you don’t know how to operate it, or even worse – if you can’t unlock it. To make sure you never have any trouble unlocking your gun, we created the ZØRE Trainer. According to your training settings, the trainer will surprise you and measure how long it takes you to reach your gun and unlock it. Nothing beats practice.

 

 

ZØRE X's uses a standard CR2 battery that is designed to last for over a year under normal operation.

But batteries run out, so we have built in 5 precautions so you'll know when to replace it. Watch the following video to learn more.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

ZØRE's team is made up of IDF veterans from combat and technology units. This allows for a team with a gun owner's perspective as well as high capabilities for designing and creating solutions to fit the variety of needs that gun owners have.

 

 

 

 

What is the warranty policy?
We stand firmly behind our products. Every ZØRE product comes with a full FIVE years warranty for any manufacturing defects.

Is ZØRE X dependent on a smartphone? Do I have to own a smartphone to use ZØRE X?
No. ZØRE X is a stand-alone storage lock.
For those that would like, the smartphone app offers more options as an added value: For example, it enables ZØRE X to notify you when someone tampers with your gun.

Do I need to purchase a Bridge with the ZORE Watchdog?
No. The ZØRE Bridge is an extension for the ZØRE X only. The ZØRE Watchdog has a built-in WiFI support and thus you'll always receive a tampering alert straight to your phone, even when you're outside of your home.

Can the ZØRE X cartridge device damage the barrel of my gun?
No. The expansion of the cartridge only occurs at the moment that one attempts to charge the gun, and while the gun is in ‘rest mode’, there is absolutely no pressure being applied to the barrel. Any unauthorized attempt to rack the slide will not cause any damage to the barrel. This is because the locking unit is coated with polymers, thereby not allowing the barrel of the gun to be damaged in any way.

What if I charge my gun and ZØRE X is ejected from it, will the ZØRE X be damaged?
ZØRE X is highly durable and was designed to absorb a 6 ft. fall of a fully loaded 1911 with the ZØRE X inside it.

Is the RAPIDIAL electronic?
Yes. The RAPIDial is an electromechanical dial that was developed by ZØRE and meets the highest military standards.

What if someone removes the battery from my ZØRE?
That is impossible - as long as your gun is locked, no one can remove the battery from your ZØRE. The battery is only accessible when ZØRE is open. Therefore, when your gun is locked, no one can take the battery out of your ZØRE.

How close to my ZØRE X should I plug the ZØRE BRIDGE?
ZØRE products support BLE (up to 300 ft). We recommend to plug in the ZØRE BRIDGE in the same room as the stored gun with ZØRE X.

Does the ZØRE BRIDGE communicate with only one ZØRE X lock?
No. One ZØRE BRIDGE can communicate with multiple locks when they are within its Bluetooth range so you can monitor all your guns through the app with one bridge.

Can I be tracked by my ZØRE?
No. ZØRE does not have a GPS, therefore tracking it is impossible.

Is it possible to hack my smartphone and lock my gun?
No. The only way to lock your gun is mechanically - by physically pressing the lock button. Unlocking your gun using the dial overrides the communication with your phone, so you always control your gun when it is in your hands.

Will communication screening interfere with the RAPIDial?
The RAPIDial is separated from the communication system and overrides it. When the lock is in the hands of the gun owner, RAPIDial will always open the lock.

 

 

 

 

Need help? 

We're here for you. If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach us at contact@zore.life.
Feel free to also check out our website at http://www.zore.life.

story:
http://karma-adventure.com           Vote for us on the Steam Greenlight!   

                                 

The game tells of a creature named Pip, who has an incarnation in a surreal world as a funny but brutal worm. Pip is naive and doesn’t know anything at all about this reality. Talking with a flower or a stone for him as natural as tasting another representative of local fauna. He examines this new world overcoming obstacles to a new rebirth and trying to figure out who he really is. At the same time he is learning the laws of karma and the relativity of good and evil.


Platforms: Windows / Mac / Linux


No text dialogue in the game. No text at all! All communication is via visual cues and images, in the form of clouds over the heads of the characters with cartoon icons only.

Crazy psychedelic world surrounds the character throughout the game. Over 20 unique locations, lots of mini-games and original, surreal and mind-bending puzzles.

Astral sight gives an opportunity to look into the world of spirits at any point in the game. It also allows you to see through different sets of eyes at the surrounding scenery. In the astral world you could find the hints for quests and many other exciting and amazing things. The most common object could look quite different in the astral world.

Variability of completing quests gives different ways to play through the game again and again. You have a choice whether you’d like to do good or evil things to complete quests. Each evil deed spoils Pip’s karma and changes his appearance. He grows spikes and horns. Good deeds purified karma. Key characters respond differently to Pip’s karma, opening additional storyline.

A lot of funny animations of the varied interactions of Pip.  The environment and other characters of the quests are drawn individually for each situation.


                               

Magic music  in ethnic-trance and psychedelic trance style accompanies your journey in each location and immerses you within the unique atmosphere of the unusual world of the game. All the music recorded live by band Zmeiraduga.

                           

                                    



                       

The game was devised  in 2012 when our source of inspiration and Art Director Alexander Kuvshinov created a cartoon about the laws of Karma.


At first it was intended as a small animated series which was just for fun. But when we saw how that turned out, we immediately decided to make a game of it, a real indie psychedelic adventure, that we all love to play! We got together and started developing the game in our spare time between major projects.

Since that time enormous work on pre-production has been done; we’ve drawn a huge amount of concept art, designed and painted a bunch of brain puzzles, locations, made game design documentation and created the working prototype.

Now we can safely say that the project will live! And we know how it will look. Our team has planned the distinct stages of its development. In order to fully concentrate on production and release truly amazing and unique game without censorship from publishers and non-core investors, we need your help.

                                     

We are a small indie team of true professionals in their areas: game production, producing, game design, design, animation. Each of us (except musicians) has a huge experience in the major game-development companies. Every specialist has several successful projects. We have established the team to release this project - a truly indie adventure which we have all dreamed of creating.


Alexander Kuvshinov

Idea, design, animation, scenario

Andrey Sharapov

CEO, producing, marketing

Roman Povolotskiy

Сo-producing, consulting


Yuriy Kuptsevich

Programming


John Kukaryamba

Zmeiraduga band, music


We believe in principles of karma and would like to make the world a better place! We are confident that if we all do good deeds, then the world will respond to us in return. And also we believe that the saving of one tree purifies karma no worse than meditation and walking around the Kailash mountain=)

We would like to give a piece of ownership of this belief to our players through our game. So our team decided that part of the revenue from sales of the game will be donated to the wildlife rescue fund WWF.

By supporting our project you make a direct contribution to saving our planet. Let's make the world a better place together!


                             

 Digital copy of the game (500)       

For IndieGoGo backers only. It’s a unique opportunity  to get original digital copy of the game for $7 only! 


 Personal thanks (1500)  

Digital copy of the game, set of 6 wallpapers for backers only, mention in credits.


 Personal thanks                 

Digital copy of the game, set of 6 wallpapers for backers only, digital high quality copy of soundtrack, mention in credits.


 Digital Collector

Digital copy of the game, set of 6 wallpapers for backers only + special collectible wallpapers for smartphone and iPad, digital high quality copy of soundtrack, digital copy of artbook, mention in credits.


   Special Edition

Digital collector + special digital edition of the game. We send 1 digital copy of the game to your friend with original e-card invitation and appreciation on behalf of the developers.


  Special Edition   

Digital collector + special digital edition of the game. We send 2 digital copies of the game to your friends with original e-card invitation and appreciation on behalf of the developers.


 Special Edition 

Digital collector + special digital edition of the game. We send 3 digital copies of the game to your friends with original e-card invitation and appreciation on behalf of the developers.


Full Digital Pack 

Digital collector + special digital edition of the game. We send 3 digital copies of the game to your friends with original e-card invitation and appreciation on behalf of the developers, wallpapers for desktop, digital copy of artbook and soundtrack, mention in credits of 3 friends whom you made this present + special thanks for you in credits, access to developer’s forum, early access to the game.


 Collector’s Edition (150)

Collector’s DVD with digital copy of the game, digital copy of artbook and soundtrack signed by the team. It also includes previous rewards.


 Extended Collector’s Edition (75)

T-shirt, Collector’s Poster signed by the team. It also includes Collector’s DVD with digital copy of the game, digital copy of artbook and soundtrack signed by the team and previous rewards.


 Full Collector’s Edition (50)

T-shirt, Collector’s Poster signed by the team. It also includes Collector’s DVD with digital copy of the game, digital copy of artbook and soundtrack signed by the team and previous rewards. Collector’s hard copy of art book signed by the team, special thanks in artbook and credits. There will be an image of unique creature from astral world near your name in credits which you could see in game with the help of astral sight.


 Designer’s Pack (10)

Together with our designers you could create a character in the game style. Special thanks in credits and artbook near the image of your character. Mention in credits as one of the designers of the game. It also includes previous rewards.


 Extended Designer’s Pack (10)

Together with our designers you could create a character in the game style and mini-game with it. Special thanks in credits and artbook near the image of your character. Mention in credits and artbook as one of the designers of the game. It also includes previous rewards.


 Full Designer’s Pack (2)

Together with our designers you could create a character in the game style and location with brain puzzle for him. Mention in credits as a designer of your character. It also includes previous rewards.


 Producer’s Pack (1)

Together with our designers you will create extra storyline with several quests in it, a race of creatures for your locations, key character in the game style and location with brain puzzle for him. A mention in credits as one of the producers and it also includes previous rewards.


                                 

How Add-Ons work: you could add an extra reward to already paid set. No need to change already paid reward. Just add to it desired amount. We will see an extra payment and add to your chosen reward addition. Prices include Shipping.

 Poster signed by the team.

                    


 T-shirt of your choice.


 Сollectable DVD disc, 

signed by the team, wich contains the game, digital artbook and high quality soundtrack


  Hard copy of artbook signed by the team.

Some of that add-ons are included in several collectible rewards starting from $100. Look descriptions of rewards.


                           

    Initial     

We continue developing of the game and will release it with minimum required set of features for intriguing gameplay. Versions for Windows, Mac and Linux.


               VS  

The main storyline and variations of ending could change depending on a way of completing key quests (good or evil way). 


      

Additional locations and brain puzzles. The game will be uncensored in full version.


       

Special music and electronic album as a present to all backers. Zmeiraduga band release original album special for Karma. 


        

Version for tablets on Android and iPad. 


       

Additional side storylines which you could open completing quests in alternative way. 


            

Version for PS4 & XBOX One.     


         

Immediately after the start of testing Incarnation 1 we begin to develop Incarnation 2. Actions committed in Incarnation 1 will influence on the plot of Incarnation 2.


                                         

Q: When Karma will be released?

Late 2014 - early 2015, we can’t give a more precise date, as it depends on what the amount of revenue generated and if we then do additional storylines - this would add to development time..


Q: What engine is the game being created in?

Unity3D. Our first prototype was actually built with Adobe Flash, but we rejected this idea because of the ease of porting in Unity3D.


Q: Do you have plans to port to other platforms?

Yes, as you can see in stretch goals - we have goals to get money to do port to Android, iOS, PS4 and Xbox One. If we don’t reach the goals - the ports will then depend on the sales of the game.


Q: How far into development is the game now?

We have working prototype, all of the game’s design, documentation and a lot of conceptual art. We already assembling locations in the prototype now, which you can see it in the video. Approximately 20% of development is complete.


Q: Will there be any form of DRM?

We’re not totally certain, it will be on publisher’s side (Steam for example), so the answer is yes.


Q: How will my pledge be distributed?

Approximately:

7% IndieGoGo & other fees

10% development of the rewards for backers

45% art & music development

20% programming

15% testing and debugging

3% software licenses, etc.


Q: What drugs are you smoking, guys?!

No one, only green tea =)


Q: You have very small team, and it’s your first label together, how you can be sure you will create a great game?

We will increase our team as necessary after we meet the goal. Of course it’s close to impossible to create awesome game without QA for example, or with only one animator.

Secondly, we are all experienced professionals in game development, and in management of the process from beginning to the end of the process. Before we get together we’ve worked in big game studios in key positions and, of course, some of us already work together before Karma.Here are some examples of titles that members of our team helped creat:

F2P Browser Based MMORTS “Rise Of Heroes” http://rohgame.com  

Social F2P MMORPG "The Heavens" http://www.nebogame.com

Social F2P MMORPG "GodSendGame" http://www.dargame.com

F2P Browser Based MMORPG "Technomagic" http://www.tmgame.ru

F2P Browser Based MMORPG "Territory" http://www.territory.ru

F2P Browser Based MMORPG "Legend: Legacy of the Dragons" http://www.dwar.ru

Children's game "Doremi Frog"  http://doremifrog.ru/eng.html

...and many others in fact (mobile, social, browser based), so we know what we do and what we are talking about =)


Q: Your game is about karma and the relativity of good and evil; does that means that you believe you know what is good and what is bad and trying to impose your personal point of view to the player?

No, we’re just telling a story of one incarnation of one strange creature in surreal world. Any coincidences is absolutely random =) And to be serious, of course not. It’s too complicated for someone to pretend to know what is good and what is evil, actually. We just created the game to give some fun to our players, that’s all we do. Everyone will find their own meaning in our game’s storyline.


Q: Do you have clear scenario of the game?

Of course we do =) Additional scenes and quests are still in progress, but it’s about we know what will happen within the scenes, but we don’t know how exactly yet. It doesn’t mean that the game will be released without any edits of current scenarios we have planned - we continually invent (and reinvent) new puzzles, quests and characters all the time, but we have a fixed base storyline.
story_txt: http://karma-adventure.com           Vote for us on the Steam Greenlight!                                    The game tells of a creature named Pip, who has an incarnation in a surreal world as a funny but brutal worm. Pip is naive and doesn’t know anything at all about this reality. Talking with a flower or a stone for him as natural as tasting another representative of local fauna. He examines this new world overcoming obstacles to a new rebirth and trying to figure out who he really is. At the same time he is learning the laws of karma and the relativity of good and evil.Platforms: Windows / Mac / LinuxNo text dialogue in the game. No text at all! All communication is via visual cues and images, in the form of clouds over the heads of the characters with cartoon icons only.Crazy psychedelic world surrounds the character throughout the game. Over 20 unique locations, lots of mini-games and original, surreal and mind-bending puzzles.Astral sight gives an opportunity to look into the world of spirits at any point in the game. It also allows you to see through different sets of eyes at the surrounding scenery. In the astral world you could find the hints for quests and many other exciting and amazing things. The most common object could look quite different in the astral world.Variability of completing quests gives different ways to play through the game again and again. You have a choice whether you’d like to do good or evil things to complete quests. Each evil deed spoils Pip’s karma and changes his appearance. He grows spikes and horns. Good deeds purified karma. Key characters respond differently to Pip’s karma, opening additional storyline.A lot of funny animations of the varied interactions of Pip.  The environment and other characters of the quests are drawn individually for each situation.                               Magic music  in ethnic-trance and psychedelic trance style accompanies your journey in each location and immerses you within the unique atmosphere of the unusual world of the game. story:
Lasercut Braille Materials

64 Oz. Games already offers a wide variety of braille materials and have be constantly increasing our line of products. We are already the world leader in providing ways for blind users to access the hobby board gaming market.

We feel that in order to reach the next level in our production we could use a lasercutter. Our business model relies on printing products on demand and having tools like these allow us to create the items after a customer has ordered them. Lasercutters are excellent at rapid prototyping and producing small runs of products both of which is essential for our business.

We've found what we believe to be an excellent deal on a lasercutter and we want to make it a reality. We are asking for small $5 donations to help fund our project. 

Some ideas that we use the lasercutter for include...

  • Create custom tactile replacement pieces for various board games. This will help distinguish pieces that are only different in color.
  • Create a lasercut version of some of our products such as our braille puzzle blocks to increase efficiency and reduce cost.
  • Create additional RPG materials such as lasercut structures for use with our tactile grids.
  • Increase detail on some of our thermoformed creations
  • Rapid prototyping of games using blind as a mechanic similar to our existing Yoink game. 

Why IndieGoGo?

Our previous projects have used Kickstarter and not IndieGoGo. Changing platforms is an intentional choice on our part because this project is less about a particular end game product and more about giving us the capacity to make more very cool things. 

By not providing the physical rewards that we've done in our previous Kickstarters we hope to be able to hit the ground running creating new prototype things right away. With both our previous Kickstarter campaigns it was almost a year before any of the products that we produced were in the store. This was because we had to fulfill the rewards for our backers before we could put up the new products. We hope to have things produced with the lasercutter available much sooner.

What if we go over the goal?

The community has been very supportive in the past and we have been fortunate in far exceeding our initial goals in both of our Kickstarter campaigns. While we don't expect this to be the case here for a couple reasons including the lack of physical rewards we could see it possibly happening. The goal that we set was to purchase the lasercutter but it is by no means the only cost that we will be facing with this project.

In order to safely house the lasercutter for instance we will have to replace our garage doors which leak terribly. We will need to put in new vents to the garage and a cooling system so that I can actually work out there in summer. We also will have to buy materials to cut and have a supply ready for when orders do come in.

If we far exceed the goal we would put it to other projects further down the line such as upgrading our embosser to improve the quality of braille produced or getting new tools to create tactile stickers in different ways. 

What if we don't reach the goal?

We have some options for making this happen even if we get very little support but those options will limit our ability to do other projects concurrently. It isn't dire and you don't need to feel guilt to contribute. We're going to make this happen... but that doesn't mean we're not too proud to ask for help.

Who is 64 Oz. Games?

For the last 3 years 64 Oz. Games has introduced games to the blind community through two successful Kickstarter campaigns. It is run by Richard and Emily Gibbs. Richard is a board game lover and a life skills teacher. Emily is a Teacher of Blind Students and an expert in braille and accessibility.

Our first campaign focused on modern board games. We were able to create accessibility kits that allowed blind and sighted players to play board games together with over 14 different titles within the scope of the Kickstarter. This also allowed us to open our store. Since then we've expanded it to over 100 different games that were not previously available in Braille.

Our second campaign focused on creating RPG dice. This project gave us access to a brand new 3d printer, a CNC mill for creating tactile grids and a thermoforming machine to allow us to make transparent overlays for board games.

Risks & Challenges

    Using a lasercutter is something that we have some experience with from different hacker spaces. They are finky beasts though and often require a lot of maintenance. It is possible that we could get a lemon or it could require more work that we realize now. We could also discover this laser doesn't meet the demands that we are placing on it.

    We've experienced this with our 3d printers and have done a lot of repairs on them during both of our Kickstarters.

    We already have some experience working with lasercutters and have made some products with them in the past. We are familiar with the technology and it's pitfalls and if things go badly we know many experts on lasercutters as well that we can contact for advice and guidance such as our (kind of) local Houston hacker space, the good folks at Daft Creations or The Broken Token.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute consider spreading the word. Share and like our posts on Facebook, Retweet and favorite our posts on Twitter and just tell people who you think might be interested.

It isn't dire and you don't need to feel guilt to contribute. We're going to make this happen... but that doesn't mean we're not too proud to ask for help.
Who is 64 Oz. Games?
For the last 3 years 64 Oz. Games has introduced games to the blind community through two successful Kickstarter campaigns. It is run by Richard and Emily Gibbs. Richard is a board game lover and a life skills teacher. Emily is a Teacher of Blind Students and an expert in braille and accessibility.
Our first campaign focused on modern board games. We were able to create accessibility kits that allowed blind and sighted players to play board games together with over 14 different titles within the scope of the Kickstarter. This also allowed us to open our store. Since then we've expanded it to over 100 different games that were not previously available in Braille.
Our second campaign focused on creating RPG dice. This project gave us access to a brand new 3d printer, a CNC mill for creating tactile grids and a thermoforming machine to allow us to make transparent overlays for board games.

Risks & Challenges


Using a lasercutter is something that we have some experience with from different hacker spaces. They are finky beasts though and often require a lot of maintenance. It is possible that we could get a lemon or it could require more work that we realize now. We could also discover this laser doesn't meet the demands that we are placing on it.
We've experienced this with our 3d printers and have done a lot of repairs on them during both of our Kickstarters.
We already have some experience working with lasercutters and have made some products with them in the past. We are familiar with the technology and it's pitfalls and if things go badly we know many experts on lasercutters as well that we can contact for advice and guidance such as our (kind of) local Houston hacker space, the good folks at Daft Creations or The Broken Token.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute consider spreading the word. Share and like our posts on Facebook, Retweet and favorite our posts on Twitter and just tell people who you think might be interested.

story:
HEXES!! is a fast-paced party card game where you hex your friends with rules they must follow!  Your goal is to stay in the game while managing to follow the rules on all the hexes you happen to receive.  If you break one of these rules, you’re out!  On paper, it might sound pretty simple, but in practice, it can be incredibly difficult.  The hex rules combine with each other to create some absolutely hilarious moments.  Fun to play with friends and family!

 

 

                

We're looking for $6000. Our goal includes the production of 250 games, payment for our artist, and any other small fees we may have overlooked. Our biggest desire is to bring this game to life for people to enjoy with friends and family.  

What's in the box:

  • 45 Hex Cards.
  • 60 Defense Cards
  • A rule book. That's it!

We've avoided providing perks such as posters, t-shirts, or other things that aren't our game, so that we can get the game to you faster when our campaign ends.  However, we do have a couple perks that you might enjoy!

 

  • We have an Early Bird perk for those people who fund us early. Get our game for only $20!
  • We have a Wizarding Super Fan Kit perk.  With this, you get our game, plus a hex card from the original prototype, signed by the team.  Some of these hexes are no longer in the game!
  • Ever wanted to Go Down In Wizarding History as a badass backer?  With this perk you'll get a copy of the game, and your name printed in the thank you section of the rules booklet in the box!
  • Create Your Own Hex perk.  With this, you get to work with us to create a hex, and have it included in the game when it's released!
Our campaign was started when we were chosen as top 5 out of 500 submissions to Hasbro's Gaming Lab competition.  We found out about having been chosen on October 10, so it's been quite the effort to get ourselves campaign-ready.  With such a short time frame, we do want to stress that much of the art for our game is still in development, but we will regularly update this page and our backers with examples of finished artwork.
 

 

As game design students, we play A LOT of games.  These range from party games, like HEXES!!, to more complex group tabletop games.  As such, we've learned a lot and have taken our experiences, our analyses of these games, and put that it all into HEXES!!. 

In recent years, there's been a resurgence of analog party games.  These games bring families and friends together to have a fun time, laugh, and just enjoy being with each other for a time.  We believe that HEXES!! has what it takes to become your go-to game to play with friends.
 

     

     

    When making HEXES!!  and compiling this campaign, we assessed our risks, as listed below:
    1. Testing
         Between the playtests in class and the many we have done since, we feel that many of the problems that our players encountered have been solved or alleviated. As a result, we've created a deck of hexes that have amazing interactions, and provide a fun gameplay experience.
     
    2. Quality of Product & Delivery Date
         One of our major concerns was cost and the quality of product we could provide to you.  As such, we reached out to Ad Magic, the printer for both Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens, and requested a quote.  The quality of cards, rules booklet, and box they provide has already been proven by the games they produce for some of the most popular party games out there.  We're super excited to be working them to bring HEXES!! to market as quickly as possible after the campaign ends.  
         We don't expect to deliver the game until early next year.  We wanted to be up-front about that, as we don't want our backers left wondering when they'll receive our game after we get funded.
     

       

       

      If you can't donate to support the game, you can easily support us by sharing our Indiegogo page, our Facebook page, or just our video!  Indiegogo has made it easy for you to share, so please use the tools provided to the left (or the links below)!

      • Facebook
      • @HexesCardGame
         

       

      Alex Bogart, Norman Greenberg, Douglas Mansell, Sam Sternklar, and Tom Smith.

      We're a group of students from the Rochester Institute of Technology.  HEXES!! was made as a class assignment, which became popular incredibly quickly.  We submitted it to Hasbro, and got into the top 5 out of over 500 submissions for their competition!

      Since then, we've been putting in insane amounts of work for this campaign, reworking the art for the game (beyond developer art!), and overall getting the game ready for you!

       

      We want to give huge shout outs to everyone who has helped us get here.  So a very special thank you to:
      • Elouise Oyzon, our class Professor and video producing guru.
      • Jennifer Hinton of the MAGIC Center at RIT.
      • Angela Muscariello, sound engineer extraordinaire.
      • Gabby Bennett and Aaron Miller, our artists.
      • Our professors at RIT in the School of Interactive Games and Media for all their advice and knowledge.
      • Our classmates, friends, and family who helped playtest HEXES!!

If you can't donate to support the game, you can easily support us by sharing our Indiegogo page, our Facebook page, or just our video!  Indiegogo has made it easy for you to share, so please use the tools provided to the left (or the links below)!

Facebook

Elouise Oyzon, our class Professor and video producing guru.
Jennifer Hinton of the MAGIC Center at RIT.
Angela Muscariello, sound engineer extraordinaire.
Gabby Bennett and Aaron Miller, our artists.
Our professors at RIT in the School of Interactive Games and Media for all their advice and knowledge.
Our classmates, friends, and family who helped playtest HEXES!!

story:
The Rewards:

 

 

Emory University sits on the frontier of the social media revolution...

Most current Emory students have heard about "The Emory Bubble," a term for the "Bubble" that the campus community creates for students. For some it represents the cocoon of safety that students seek being away from home. For others it's a term for the manner in which the community insulates itself from the surrounding community and larger world. For most it is the nature of a college community's unique culture. Each class has a syllabus; its the other stuff--extracurriculars, nightlife, campus happenings, the city--that needs a filter. Say hello to that filter. The Emory Bubble. 

What it is:

First, it is the gateway to events at Emory and in the community. No more wondering what’s happening on campus. All of the organizations you care about most will be here, and you’ll know what they’re doing. No more exhaustive detective work just to find out  AND have a way of interacting with them. 

Next, the Emory Bubble is the hub for all of the content published by the Emory community. All of the Media Council content is here, from the Spoke to WMRE to The Wheel. When you sign on, you too become a contributor to the Emory Bubble. 
 

Last, and perhaps most importantly, The Emory Bubble is a way to plug our community into itself. The institutional rate of change is far too slow. Our generation’s rate of change is exponential. This is a way for our institution to change at the same rate as we do. As a filter for only the best of the community, The Emory Bubble will follow the course you map for it. 

What features are available? 

1) Facebook integration. Users can sign in with their facebook account and get connected to the Emory community! This reduces the hassle of creating another account and adding friends and etc. Events on Facebook also sync on the Bubble, so no additional work is required of users when it comes to keeping it all coordinated! 

2) Deals. We'll bring only the best vendors with the most compelling deals to students. Come on the site and see offerings from the places who have the most to offer.

3) Points and rewards. We are building a point and reward system for users where users will be awarded points by posting articles, videos and photos, creating and attending events, purchasing deals, which users can redeem for rewards like food and apparel at select vendors.

4) Mobile App. Our mobile app is will be a must-have this fall. It will keep users update with the latest happening on and off campus, wherever they are!

5) Events Calendar. This will be a simple yet powerful feature for students who want to know what’s going on without checking 3 different calendars. 

Who does it benefit? 

Everyone! From small business owners, to student organizations, to students, it will help facilitate communication and interaction between different groups of people, ultimately enriching the bubble and linking the entire community on and off campus!

Where are we?

We have launched a beta site and engaged students of Emory to use it and provide feedback. To date, we have had 4,000 unique visitors, highly concentrated but not limited to the university’s student demographic and the local geographic area. A version 2.0 is currently at the preview stage which promises to be more engaging and easier to use. 

Beta: emorybubble.com 
Version 2: http://thecampusbubble.com/redesign/preview 

With this funding, we will be able to further develop our version 2.0 and market it on campus. This will bring the student community together with a common website to visit.

story:
PLATINUM SERIES BASEBALL!

The Only MLBPA-Licensed Baseball Strategy Board Game currently available 

Platinum Series Baseball is a new baseball strategy game that allows you to create a fantasy roster of players by adding Player Packs to build your ultimate team of All Stars!  

I have been a huge baseball fan my whole life and have collected cards for years. I loved trading them to get different players.  This campaign gives me the opportunity to share that excitement with all baseball and strategy game fans.

Build Your Fantasy Team!

Contributors receive the FIRST EDITION Platinum Series Baseball Game Set that will include everything you need to start playing right away! 




Platinum Series Baseball Game Set Includes:
  • 1 game board (12"x12")
  • Quick Start Instructions (unlock advanced gameplay at platinumseriesbaseball.com)
  • 3 ten-sided game dice (Red, White and Blue)
  • 1 Starter Pack of player cards (30 Random Players)
  • 1 Game Score Sheets
  • 6 Player Card Holders (Markers)
PSB includes 30 player cards in the Starter Pack, with at least two players for each position.  Build your fantasy team with PLAYER PACKS that contain 12 pitcher and batter cards, with a full team in each pack.



GAMEPLAY

Platinum Series Baseball’s player cards are the heart of the game.  They make the game fast pace and easy to play while maintaining an incredible level of baseball authenticity and statistical accuracy.  This balance of gameplay and realism is achieved by Platinum Series Baseball’s comprehensive player ratings, which are included on each player’s card.  Each player card has numerous ratings, including range, speed, arm strength, power, fatigue, fielding, jumping, bunting, # DL days, and more.  Even each ballpark has unique attributes:  varying outfield fence distances and heights, different infield and outfield types, different foul territory sizes and even unique effects on certain types of plays.  

Platinum Series Baseball is easy to set up and get started.  Each manager selects their team, making your starting pitcher, lineup and batting order, even determining time of day and the weather on game day.  

The offensive manager rolls the dice for the batters and the defensive manager should roll for the fielders when applicable.  The decisions of the manager and the luck of the roll will always affect the outcome. 


Here's how to play:   

Everything from clutch Home-runs to 4-6-3 Double Plays! Each player’s odds to achieve a more desirable outcome are based off their stats on the Player Card. Our Player Packs will be available to purchase with random players that include at least one player for all fielding positions with a few extra pitchers. This way you can play right away and continue to build your ultimate team, as well as giving you an opportunity to exchange Player Cards with friends to get your favorite players! 

Build Your Team with Player Packs

Platinum Series Baseball is enhanced with the edition of player packs.  Each player pack includes 12 random players, with at least 1 player for every position to give you a full team in each pack.  Grab a wax box and get 24 Player Packs.  We plan to release updated Player Packs every season.  Our first edition player packs were created using 2014 player stats.  


PERKS






STRETCH GOALS


3X STRETCH GOAL
Help us raise 10 times our goal and we will be able to develop a Platinum Series Baseball mobile app.  We hope to make this soon, but exceeding our goal will allow us to prioritize the development of an app for scoring games, tracking your season, and connecting with other PSB players.  

5X STRETCH GOAL

Help us raise 20 times our goal and in addition to developing a mobile app, we will organize an event to bring together PSB players and hold a "world series" competition to name the first Platinum Series Champion.   


PSB Community

We are building a community at PlatinumSeriesBaseball.com to connect players and answer questions about the game.  We also want your help creating PSB Mini-Games and sharing them with other players.

Like us on FACEBOOK

Follow us on Twitter


The PSB Team

Platinum Series Baseball Inc. is a Denver, Colorado based company. Established in 2013, Platinum Series Baseball Inc. was founded by Patrick Durkee, a baseball and trading card fanatic who is looking to rejuvenate the baseball strategy board game industry with an exciting new approach in the form of Platinum Series Baseball.

The sales and marketing team is lead by Todd Leveque and Mark McManus out of the Columbus, OH office and potential the US Distribution headquarters.

PSB set out to create a game that can be played for years and years. PSB makes use of real season stats of the players that create a more realistic experience. You can continue to build a dynasty of sorts by collecting the best players, in their best years statistically. 

Learn more at PlatinumSeriesBaseball.com


FAQ

Do I need to buy more cards to play PSB? 

Answer: No, PSB comes with everything you need to play. 30 of the 744 player cards are included with the full game, giving you at least 2 Player Cards for every position.

How is PSB different than other baseball board games? 

Answer: What makes PSB different is that it is a higher level of strategy than other games out there.  PSB is also the only MLBPA-licensed baseball strategy board game currently on the market.


What makes PSB a realistic baseball strategy game?

Answer: The level of intricacy compared to other games we grew up with.  The level of precision that PSB delivers allows both players (both managers) the ability to make many decisions on every roll of the dice.  Your decisions as the manager play a critical role in the outcomes.
How is the game played? 

Check out the instructions on our website at www.platinumseriesbaseball.com/trainingcamp

When will PSB ship?

Answer: June 2015

What about International shipping?

Answer: ALL shipping is included! We will ship to you no matter where you are in the World!



Official Licensee of Major League Baseball Players Association


Find This Campaign On

Facebook  |  Twitter  |  YouTube  |  Website
