story:
Thank you for Visiting the Dark Cargo funding page!

Dark Cargo is a 3rd person action game where you must navigate dangerous regions of space and warn-torn planetside landscapes in order to deliver your client's goods.  You can choose to play a non-violent campaign,  or blast your way through the territories of the pirates and rogue mercenary factions that are wreaking havoc on the colonies. 

The (earth) Moon, Mars, Space stations,  Asteroid Belts, War zones, Dark Space, Mercury and the Shattered Earth are just some of the places you will be tasked to fly in this futuristic Action title. 

3rd Person and side-scrolling gameplay types both appear in this unique combination of racing and shooter game genres. Top-Down missions and Player vs. Player challenges could be possible if this campaign is a success.!





WE NEED ENGINE LICENSES!

In order to make this game look and play like the polished adventure game we have in mind,  we are going to need some licenses for our engine.  Currently we are using the free version of the unity engine,  which has some pretty hefty limitations on the effects you can use. 

Aside from licenses we have 2 team members working in their spare time without pay, and the primary development machine could use some upgrades.   The licenses are $1500 each just for PC, and another $1500 for android.  All together we need 3 licenses and workstation overhauls. 

    Your Contributions at work!

    If we exceed our Goal!

    If we can surpass our goal then we will do everything within our power to make this game as detailed and polished as we possibly can. There would be a greater likelihood of a console release. 

    We might be able to bring in another team member to speed up progress and expand potential. 4 modes of play, 5 factions to work with, and as customization as we could provide.

    If we meet our Goal!

    We could make the game we are targetting and you,  the player, get the experience you deserve to play. 

    4 factions to play as (including pirates), at least 3 play modes and PC/Mac/Android releases. 

    If we are part way there...


    We wouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth. With a decent chunk of funding we would at least be able to have 3 factions,  and most likely 3 modes of play.

    Probably wouldn't be able to play as pirates and an android release might not happen. 

     If we get practically nowhere...

    Hey,  we tried and we could say it proudly.  The game would still happen, but we can't predict what incarnation it would be.  Definitely no android, and maybe only 1 mode of play with 1 faction in a worst-case scenario. 



      If not financially,  there are other ways YOU can still help!

      Please please please spread the word about our campaign!  We would love to make this game for you, with the best possible presentation!  We can't make this game the way it should be produced without monetary assistance.  Any mention on your social media page would be greatly appreciated!
story_txt:
Thank you for Visiting the Dark Cargo funding page!

Dark Cargo is a 3rd person action game where you must navigate dangerous regions of space and warn-torn planetside landscapes in order to deliver your client's goods.  You can choose to play a non-violent campaign,  or blast your way through the territories of the pirates and rogue mercenary factions that are wreaking havoc on the colonies. The (earth) Moon, Mars, Space stations,  Asteroid Belts, War zones, Dark Space, Mercury and the Shattered Earth are just some of the places you will be tasked to fly in this futuristic Action title. 
3rd Person and side-scrolling gameplay types both appear in this unique combination of racing and shooter game genres. Top-Down missions and Player vs. Player challenges could be possible if this campaign is a success.!



  WE NEED ENGINE LICENSES! In order to make this game look and play like the polished adventure game we have in mind,  we are going to need some licenses for our engine.  Currently we are using the free version of the unity engine,  which has some pretty hefty limitations on the effects you can use. Aside from licenses we have 2 team members working in their spare time without pay, and the primary development machine could use some upgrades.   The licenses are $1500 each just for PC, and another $1500 for android.  All together we need 3 licenses and workstation overhauls. 

  Your Contributions at work!

If we exceed our Goal!
If we can surpass our goal then we will do everything within our power to make this game as detailed and polished as we possibly can. There would be a greater likelihood of a console release. 
We might be able to bring in another team member to speed up progress and expand potential. 4 modes of play, 5 factions to work with, and as customization as we could provide.If we meet our Goal!

We could make the game we are targetting and you,  the player, get the experience you deserve to play. 
4 factions to play as (including pirates), at least 3 play modes and PC/Mac/Android releases. 


If we are part way there...
We wouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth. With a decent chunk of funding we would at least be able to have 3 factions,  and most likely 3 modes of play. Probably wouldn't be able to play as pirates and an android release might not happen. 

 If we get practically nowhere...

Hey,  we tried and we could say it proudly.  The game would still happen, but we can't predict what incarnation it would be.  Definitely no android, and maybe only 1 mode of play with 1 faction in a worst-case scenario. 
  If not financially,  there are other ways YOU can still help! Please please please spread the word about our campaign!  We would love to make this game for you, with the best possible presentation!  We can't make this game the way it should be produced without monetary assistance.  Any mention on your social media page would be greatly appreciated!

story:
18 hours left guys!  

We need to get to at least 1% like we did for CDF Ghostship 2 years ago.


As a big Thanks to our current pledges and to give something special to new pledges :

Everyone who pledges as Pilot or Above will get access to the demo for VR - oculus DK2 & OSVR just before Christmas!



The next 10 pledges of pilot or above will have a transport named after them in the game!  



*Real quick! Important information listed below.* 


CDF Starfighter is an epic space combat simulator with a focus on immersion, a luscious sci-fi world and pickup and play controls which offer simplicity and requires skill to master over time . We are focused purely on space combat which means you are not bogged down with stats, menus and micro-transactions. We offer an epic next generation space combat simulator with a simple control system with an immersive story-line and fun game-play.  We are developing the game with a fun and competitive multiplayer approach.

CDF Starfighter is a single player and a multiplayer space combat simulator.  It is designed for VR (Virtual reality) and a game-pad or joystick.  Keyboard and mouse is also supported.

Alpha Gameplay Video 1 :

Alpha Gameplay Video 2 :

Alpha Gameplay Video 3 (VR - OculusRift DK2) :

 Alpha Gameplay Video 4 : 

Alpha Gameplay Video 5 :


We do not propose to make a huge open world sci-fi game, we do not propose to have real scale solar systems, procedural generated levels and galaxies.  We do not propose a massive multiplayer where you are bogged down with lore, stats and customization options! 

We propose CDF Starfighter! A definitive space combat simulator styled after the famous 90`s games we were blessed with such as Freespace, Wing commander, Star wars and many more.

Our focus is purely on space combat and skill, we are aiming for a pick up and play type of game.  The single player campaign and simulator missions will incorporate a great story-line set in an awesome universe.  

We have designed the game for use with VR and head tracking devices, at our current unfunded alpha stage we have an awesome working alpha/prototype.  CDF Starfighter plays much better in VR than it looks on a flat 2d screen.  We have a great prototype through a lot of blood and sweat and are at the stage were we need some funding in crucial areas of development.  We need funding from you guys to build on what we have in some key areas, then we can bring you a truly awesome space combat simulator. 

MAG Studios is a small independent game studio located in the United Kingdom. Founded in May 2013 by Shaun Williams, our tiny studio has seen the release of 2 games on Steam.  Specializing in science fiction based games, we utilize the latest technology such as virtual reality and tracking devices. We focus on unique and challenging game-play which has the fun and replay value of old style games.


CDF Starfighter is a single player, multi player and co-op space combat simulator.  In single player mode you embark on a non-linear campaign as you fight through a galactic war.  The star fighters are the elite pilots of the CDF and engage in some of the most challenging and difficult missions. In multiplayer you fight each other in a variety of fun and competitive multiplayer and co-op game modes.

In CDF Starfighter you can fly 6 different ships, each has their own advantages and disadvantages.  Each ship is very different and certain ships are designed for specific roles. Some ships boast firepower like the heavy starfighter and heavy gunship, while other boast speed and agility like the scout and starfighter type Y.  Each ship is quite different and mixing ships in your team in multi-player can give you the tactical edge.  

Many aspects of the game are realistic, our focus is fun and an easy to pick up and play type game.  The controls in the game are simple yet effective.

Non-Linear Single Player Campaign

Each mission success or failure will shape the direction of the war with 3 possible endings.

Immersive First person View  

We have designed the game with a huge focus on immersion, the game and all briefings are played out in first person. 

Designed for VR & head Tracking

We have designed the game for use with VR and other devices such as head tracking.  

Pick Up & Play  

CDF Strarfighter is very simple to get to grips with and is designed for use with a game-pad or joystick.  A wealth of training simulations and tutorials will also be available in single player as well as the campaign.

Re-Fuel, Re-Arm & Re-Supply  

Management of ammo and fuel are a crucial part of game-play, In most missions you can rearm and resupply at any time during combat.      

Diverse Multi-player and Co-op modes  

As well as the common death-match and versus type modes, we also have some fun and unique game modes planned such as Battleships & Genocide.  With a variety of player ships on offer, skill and competitive game-play are a huge focus.

6 + Playable Ships!    

There are 6 CDF playable ships and in Campaign mode and you can also fly a pirate fighter and an alien shuttle.  Each and every ship is very different and each is designed for a specific role. The 2 Ships featured in the game-play videos above are the heavy starfighter and the starfighter type Y.  As you can see in the prototype, these are 2 very different fighter craft and are for 2 different roles.

Each ship will take time to master and in multiplayer, skill and experience will be essential if you are to prevail on the battlefield.

The game is based in the CDF (colonial defence force) universe which is a 90`s styled vision of the future with industrialized styled ships and technology.  Based 350 years in the future mankind has colonized many worlds and spread their influence in a small area of our galaxy.  

The CDF was created to protect and serve mankind as we embarked on a new era of exploration.  The Human Civil war wiped out almost a third of the human race and half of the entire CDF Fleet.  

During the Human Civil War the starfighter`s where formed.  An elite group of pilots who passed the vigorous starfighter selection process and ear the right to wear the starfighter Insignia.  

The specially trained elite pilots helped turn the tide in the civil war and the Colonial Defence Force defeated the CLA (Colonial Liberation Army) at the battle of Sidook.  

CDF Starfighter gives the player a chance to join the elite pilots of the CDF who are known as starfighters.  As mankind is about to face a new enemy, the starfighters will be needed to ensure the survival of the human race as a new and unknown alien threat emerges.

A flight/space simulator and VR are the ideal mix!  But We don't stop there! 

Every aspect of development is designed with VR in mind. With 2 years of VR development experience, we are packing a lot of cool features and the immersive experience into the game. The game in its alpha state is up to date with the current VR offering (DK2 from Oculus, we are currently on 0.8 sdk) and we will be aiming full VR compatibility with a variety of headset manufactures by the time of release.

Multiplayer is a huge focus for us and we want it be fun and competitive. We have some great co-op, team and versus modes which will offer fun and teamwork in a balanced mix.  We have some great Multiplayer game modes lined up but none of that really means anything without you`re help!  

We need you're support which will help to shape the multiplayer game into something amazing.  As a small Indie games developer, we want and need you to get involved the way you want.  We have rewards which offer the final polished game in all its glory for those who don't want to take part in testing.  We have rewards which offer early access and other perks who want to get more involved and help shape the multiplayer aspect of the game. 

We have come a long way on zero funding, we now need to build on the potential of our game and push the quality level up and get some more talent on board.  We need help from you guys to make a truly awesome Space combat simulator.  We need to get some great voice actors, character artists, talented coders and much more to build on what we have.  We also need resources for marketing and polishing the game up to look and play much better than its current alpha state.  

We have some great rewards on offer which give you more of the role you want to play.  If its early access or just the full final finished game, there are a lot of incentives on offer for everyone to help play a part in CDF Starfighter.  

NAME YOUR OWN TRANSPORT IN THE GAME!

We have a limited number of transports waiting to put your name on it!  As well as the name you can also decide on the color scheme.  

 

NAME YOUR OWN SPACE STATION IN THE GAME!

We have a limited number of space stations waiting to put your name on them! Our first Pledge for the Colonial Director reward will get their station named and ready in game within days of your pledge!  So to see this space station with your name on it, become a Colonial Director and we will work with you to get your station ready within days!

Our game in its current state may look and play great but we still have a long way to go.  What we have achieved up to now is with zero funds! And if we can achieve this with no funding, then what could we achieve with some? 

Our key areas we need funding for are :

  • Character Artist/Animation and Lip sync for briefings etc.
  • Professional Voice Actors
  • Particle Effects
  • Sound FX
  • Marketing

£25,000 may not seem like a lot compared to other games but for CDF Starfighter it will make a huge difference.  We have some great rewards up for grabs and with popular Demand we may add some more.

(Reward breakdown which is based in the GBP - UK Sterling)

Our first funding goal is £25,000 and will enable us to bring you a fully polished single player experience and start the ball rolling with multiplayer which will be worked on with the community over 6 months.  

We have some great plans for CDF Starfighter and we really do hope that we can unleash more potential of the game by reaching some of our stretch goals with some help from you guys.  

If we raise above and beyond our funding goal then we can expand on what we have and offer many more features.  We can raise the quality bar overall by the time of release and we will have the single player finished as a complete package in march.  CDF Starfighter is designed for controller support, VR and head tracking.  We are developing the game with cross platform support in mind.

STRETCH GOAL 1 :

£50,000 +

If we can double our primary funding goal then we can have a lot more resources at our disposal to bolster the games quality in crucial areas such as motion capture for characters and much better overall voice actors.  We will have more resources to invest in the overall release quality of the game as whole.

STRETCH GOAL 2 :

£100,000 + 

With our second stretch goal we  will be putting a lot more resources into multiplayer and be able to hire the necessary talent to ensure that CDF Starfighter is one of the best multiplayer and co-op space combats sims out there.  We will be able to carry forward the multiplayer side of the game and add extra ships, turrets and invest in a new community Co-Op game mode which will be voted and decided by you, the community in March 2016.  We will take the best ideas and input from all you budding pilots and work with you to create an Epic multiplayer mode.

STRETCH GOAL 3 :

£350,000 +

We have an awesome game which we really want to expand to include a mission editor/level editor.  As a small indie company this is currently beyond our financial and required workflow scope, as building the necessary simple user tool-set to make this reality would require a perm-ant team and more time.  We really want to go beyond that and make the game modifiable within a year of first release but again, this requires a large team to be able to launch and support the modding community.  There are many more limits which can be lifted,  If we get more than Stretch Goal 3 then we have a new mandate from you and the community we build together to take a little more time and turn CDF Starfighter in the greatest space combat simulator of all time.

With all our stretch goals, we will give updates and more information about these when we get close to each tier.

story:
http://www.thegamehasbegun.com/





They talk about us in the newspaper !






Version française ICI !

--

1. What is Kaode ?
2. Why play Kaode ?
3. Special features
4. Artworks
5. Why a crowdfunding ?
6. Team
7. Conterparts in english (PDF)




The third World War occurred... And at the beginning of the nuclear winter, a group of philantropist and humanists -  composed of artists, philosophers, scientists, politicians... -  save in particular crystals allowing to stock sensible informations, their memories, ideas, dreams, their plans of objects and workpieces.
Pretty much everything that could represent the memory of humanity, preparing themselves to see their species being eradicated.

Soon, the planet is again silent.

The Kaodian crystals containing the fragments of past life are patiently waiting in their shelters, slowly evolving with time, submitted to Time and the high radioactivity of the planet.

At first, these ideas adjust and take an “organic” shape.
Finally, they end up freeing themselves from their envelops – a cocoon with which they today still have a strong bound – then from their shelters, to now represent the new fauna of the Known World.

Born of ideas contained in crystals to their current form, we call them : the "Kaodes".


"And what about the player in all this ?"

Good question fellow player/contributor/artist eager to join us !

After the downfall and the re-emergence of men on Earth, it was decided that each man and woman would undertake a journey of at least one year long.
A journey across forests, cities and swamps all around the world ; they would learn about the value of life, about helping one another, about the value of adventure and the importance of knowledge : all hoping that mistakes made in the past - mostly those which lead to the Great War – would never happen again.

You will embody this traveler, accompagnied by a Kaode that is bound to you since your childhood, in order for you to stumble upon the mysteries and legends of the new world, while cooperating with other travelers, challenging some of them.




Kaode is an independent game, offering an individual and personalised gaming experience : its concept goes back over a time where the graphism were not the only key to its success.


The system is built in order for you to be at the center of an adventure of which YOU are the hero, in a progressive world :

  • Challenge your friends

  • Live an original adventure, plot and set in a new world where humanity emerges from the ruins of a medieval, steampunk and contemporary world.

  • Choose your own approach of the game : exploration, collaboration or collection ?



You understood that Kaode is mainly an adventure and exploration game.

Aware of our capacities and of our limits, our goal is to tell a story with humour, about important themes, and to introduce a certain depth in the places and caracters that will come across, the quests, the enigmas and the functioning of the game.
It is essential for us to create elaborated atmospheres, all gathered around adventures and battles between friends.

This is why the first interest is the discovery of a coherent and referenced universe.

In order to personalise each and everyone's adventure, and force the community to undertake researchs on our universe, each place will offer numerous quests and surprises of which the probability to come across them will vary from one player to the other.
Doing this way, two peope will be able to move in the same places, but face very different situations, access to various places, posess Kaode that do not look the same. This way, the adventure becomes personal, at the opposite of many MMORPG claiming to be epic, but where the player is very often an anonymous somebody.

The second appeal of the game - and the second way to play the adventure - is to consider Kaode as a monster battling game.
We are both collectors, and we are familiar with the pleasure to go and look for creatures and objects, the importance of the elements that personalise the player's experience and avatar.



Here a "style" preview of the map, it's the one we used for the Alpha version, and it's from Laura Eva Zimmer ;)


About the community aspect : the game is based on three particular systems, including two innovative ones.

1 - The Events are key moments in the game where new elements are being introduced, and that are likely to transfom the Map - to the point of destroying towns and forests, change river's course, extinct species – and the game. The players who will feel concerned with their universe will participate or oppose to these “moments”.

Our current ambition is to be able to set up these moments as often as possible, this way confronting as many players as possible to moral choices that will lead the game towards any new mecanics it will bread.

2 - Finaly, Kaode will be progressive thanks to your particpation.
For now, the map will be entirely revealed to all. Some areas will be however limited by certain handicaps, and others accessible with the necessary acquisition of Unlock Achievement, and others possible to unlock by the community thanks to the players' ingenuity.

Some cities of the world will offer real democratical campaign of construction of buildings, and players will be able to vote for the choice of the first structure and for its functions.

Will the players' population vote for a train station, a guild hall or an arena for the capital ?


But enough chit-chat, like they say, a video is worth a long speech, forewarned is forearmed and a rolling stone gathers no moss.

[The English subtitles have to be activated form youtube. You know, the little card between the timer and the gear.]






Oh yeah, I save the best for last : in order to represent the subjectivity of the informations contained in the crystals and saved by the members of the Oneiros project, the Kaodes were drawn by different illustrators, thus offering a great diversity of styles, concepts and colourisations compatible with the general spirit and the background of the game.

Here are a few artworks from our illustrators.


[Want to participate ? Join our project ! kaode@outlook.com ]

    
      

 



   




"What about the battle ?!"

For the players that are less inclined to narration, collectors, and let's be honest, all the players that love strategy and slay a few monsters from time to time, *drum roll*, here is the combat system of Kaodes :

Na just kidding it would take too long. Let's do this another way.

For all that include definitions of the evolution system, statistics and techniques/skills learning, I will rather send you back to this PdF made in january (on our first call for participations), which defines the bases of our work on the battle system.


Fight system (PDF EN)

One last specificity concerning the Kaodes : it will be possible, and sometime necessary for the character to personaly intervene in the combat.
Indeed, although the tournaments and the amateur matches will mostly stage Kaodes, whenever the player will have to defend himself against bandits, zombies and other Kaodian threats, and that he has no one to protect him : it will be time for him to defend himself.


HERE, a preview gif of the combat !




Because from the start, we have been working with the team of free volunteers on a collaborative game, and we wish to keep a free spirit in its conception and its scenario.

In France, whenever you do not belong to a big structure, the only way to be financed is through the regional financial support (granted once a year) or through the help of the CNC (Centre National du Cinéma et de l'image animée, a National Centre of the Cinema and Moving Pictures), including three sessions a year, a jury of 13 people belonging to the gaming world.

It is a bit like that : pulling strings, constraints and deals against a concept that fits with the Kaode spirit : mutual aid, freedom and human adventure.

In this case, why not ask our players for some help... ask your help : dreamers to dreamers, we should get along... right ?

To prove to you that we do are hard-headed, here is an estimation of our budget and a market study (in french - sorry !) realised by our marketing manager and financial advisor :


Etude de marché light (PDF FR) 



Coming back on the crowdfunding, we have decided to adopt a tiered approch, with first what is absolutely necessary for us.

The successive levels allow us to truely climb one step of the ladder, by allowing us a mass communication, the production of super fun goodies and giving us the opportunity to go further in the set up and the development of the game.


Here are the levels in detail :


Level 1 – Design and first expense : 1550 euros

With this amount, we would be able to hire a designer in order to finish the Map of Kaode, offer animations and mini-maps for the 50 to 70 places that are planned.

In other words : transforming a paper role-playing game into a video game.

We would also be able to repay our application fees, the server space, etc...


Level 2 : Communication and goodies : (+750) 2300 euros

Kaode inside, Kaode outside, Kaode everywhere !

A good communication (games room, T-shirts, posters, flyers, cardboards, mugs - having a press agent...) would mean more players.

It may seem quite simple and corny, but in the end, this would mean : a more interesting world, more exchanges and investment coming from the gamers community, and thus more movement and evolutions in the game.

If Kaode is indeed working after a few months, we would be able to further its development at the same rhythm, and to continue to create new places and events, add new functions, create always more and more !




If the level 1 validates the game's release, the level 2 will secure a proper launch ; this way allowing us a certain amount of players as soon as the beta game is realeased.


Level 3 – Kaode IRL : (+850) 3150 euros

Between us gamers, no lies be told, and this especially since the 90s : having a physical representation of our creatures, our comics' characters, cartoons and video game is pretty awesome.

With the (relative) boom of the 3D impression, our research brought us to rub shoulders with modelers and other 3D enthusiasts.


Slowly catching the idea in our own range, we have been working on a few patterns, and we are just starting to have a few versions of Kaodes in 3D.


Here is a test impression, a basic exemple of one of the creatures of the game, a “phobia of knives”, drawn by Arthur Besson : “Chickenife” !

   

Jookoki, by Roman !  

               !!!

Arachniege, by Sylvain Guidotti

    


Upcoming : Slim !                                                                          



For now, only a few companies or labs allow the impression of plastic objects like the one in large scale. We would howerver only need a small printer model to allow us a certain quantity of production.

This is why if you help us obtain a printer, we will be able to create a wide 3D figurines range at low cost, and thus, low cost for you too !

Level 4 - Expansion !

La troisième guerre mondiale a eu lieu... et à l'aube de l'hiver nucléaire, du "grand cataclysme" : un groupe d'humaniste composé de philanthropes réunissant artistes, philosophes, scientifiques, politiciens etc... enregistrent dans des cristaux permettant le stockage d'informations sensibles, leurs souvenirs, idées, leurs rêves, des plans d'objets ou des œuvres. En somme, tout ce qui pourrait constituer une mémoire de l'humanité, se préparant à l’éradication de l’espèce.

Les craintes de ces individus se confirment, et la planète est une nouvelle fois silencieuse.


Les cristaux Kaodiens renfermant les parcelles de vie des individus du projet Oneiros attendent patiemment dans leurs abris, évoluant doucement avec le temps, soumis à la forte radioactivité de la planète. Dans un premier temps, les idées se réajustent et prennent une forme "organique".
Finissant par s'émanciper des cristaux - une enveloppe avec laquelle ils conservent aujourd'hui un lien fort - puis des abris pour aujourd'hui représenter la nouvelle faune du monde connu.

D'idées humaines contenues dans des cristaux à la forme que l'on leur connaît aujourd'hui, on les appelle : les « Kaodes ».

- « Et le joueur dans tout ça ? »

Décidément, tu poses de bonnes questions joueur/contributeur/artiste désirant nous rejoindre !

Après la chute et la mystérieuse ré-émergence de l'homme sur la Terre, il a été décidé que chaque homme et femme entreprendrait dans sa vie un voyage d'une durée minimum d'une année.

Parcourant les forets, les villes et les marais du monde, ils et elles apprendraient la valeur de la vie, de l'entraide, de l'aventure et l'importance du savoir ; dans l'espoir que les erreurs du passé - et surtout celles ayant conduites à la Grande guerre - ne soient jamais reproduites.


Vous incarnez ce voyageur, accompagné d'un Kaode qui vous est lié depuis l'enfance, afin de vous confronter aux mystères et légendes du Nouveau Monde, coopérant avec d'autres voyageurs, en affrontant certains.




Kaode est un jeu indépendant proposant une expérience de jeu individuelle et personnalisée, et un type de multijoueur participatif ; son concept reprend les éléments de jeux d'un temps où le graphisme n'avait pas forcément une place centrale dans son succès.

Pour résumer :

Kaode est un jeu d'aventure, d'exploration et de collection/combat de créatures communautaire sur PC et mobile, prenant place dans un univers post-apocalyptique.

Le système est conçu pour que vous soyez au centre d'une aventure dont VOUS êtes le héros, au sein d'un monde évolutif :

  • Affrontez vos amis

  • Vivez une aventure originale, scénarisée et prenant part dans un monde nouveau, où l'humanité refait surface dans les décombres d'un monde médiéval, steampunk et contemporain.

  • Choisissez votre approche du jeu: exploration, collaboration ou collection ?



Kaode est avant tout un jeu d'aventure et d'exploration.
Le gameplay se veut simple - et mobile friendly – à l'image du design.
Notre objectif est de raconter une histoire avec humour sur des thèmes importants, d'introduire une certaine profondeur dans les lieux et personnages rencontrés, les quêtes, les énigmes et le fonctionnement. Il est primordial pour nous de créer des atmosphères travaillées, le tout autour d'aventures et de batailles entre amis.

L'intérêt primaire est donc celui de la découverte d'un univers cohérent et référencé, où le fond compense la forme.

Pour personnaliser l'aventure de chacun et forcer la communauté à entreprendre des recherches dans notre univers, chaque lieu sera pourvu de nombreuses quêtes et surprises dont la probabilité de rencontre sera variable. Ainsi, deux personnes pourront se déplacer dans les mêmes endroits, mais rencontrer des situations très différentes, accéder à des lieux divers, posséder des Kaodes qui ne se ressemblent pas (à l'inverse de nombreux MMORPG se voulant épiques, où le joueur n'est bien souvent qu'un personnage lambda).


Le second attrait du jeu - et la deuxième façon d'aborder l'aventure - est de prendre Kaode comme un jeu d'affrontement de monstres. Nous sommes deux collectionneurs, et nous connaissons le plaisir de partir à la recherche de créatures et d'objets, l'importance d'avoir des éléments qui personnalisent l'expérience et le héros du joueur.


Ici une petite preview de la map du monde utilisé pour la version alpha (vous ne la retrouverez pas dans le jeu mais le style y est !)
Oh et c'est de Laura Eva Zimmer =) !




Pour rester sur l'aspect communautaire : le jeu repose sur 3 systèmes particuliers, dont deux novateurs.

Nous venons de citer le Pvp (Player Versus Player) sur lequel nous reviendrons plus tard, parlons un peu du reste :

1 - Les Événements sont des moments particuliers du jeu où de nouveaux éléments sont introduits, et qui sont susceptibles de transformer la Map - quitte à détruire ville et forêt, changer le cours des rivières, éteindre des espèces... - et le jeu. Les joueurs qui se sentiront concernés par leur univers participeront ou s'opposeront à ces « moments ».

Il est vraiment important pour nous de rythmer le jeu et de créer une véritable ambiance de roleplay.

Aussi, notre ambition à l'heure actuelle est de pouvoir implanter ces événements le plus souvent possible, confrontant le plus de joueurs possible à des choix moraux qui orienteront le jeu vers telle ou telle nouvelle mécanique à son issue.

2 - Enfin, Kaode sera évolutif, grâce à votre participation.
Dans l'immédiat, la map sera révélée dans son intégralité, et à tous. Certaines aires seront limitées par certains handicaps, d'autres accessibles selon la nécessaire obtention d'Unlock Achievements, d'autres déblocables par la communauté grâce à l'ingéniosité des joueurs.

Certaines villes du monde proposeront aussi de véritables campagnes démocratiques de construction de bâtiments et les joueurs pourront voter le choix de la prochaine bâtisse ainsi que ses fonctionnalités.
La population de joueur choisira t-elle une gare, un hall des guildes ou une arène pour la capitale ?


Mais trêve de fariboles, comme dit l'adage, une vidéo vaut mieux qu'un long discours, un homme avertit en vaut deux et pierre qui roule n'amasse pas mousse.





Ah, oui, je ne vous ai pas raconté le meilleur : pour représenter la subjectivité des informations contenus dans les cristaux, enregistrées par les membres du projet Oneiros, les Kaodes sont dessinés par des illustrateurs différents, proposants une variété de style, de concepts, de colorisations compatibles avec l'esprit et le background du jeu.



Voici quelques artworks de nos illustrateurs.

[Vous voulez participer au projet ?  Rejoignez nous ! kaode@outlook.com]

    
      

 



   




« Et le combat dans tout ça ? »

Pour les joueurs moins portés vers la narration, les collectionneurs, et soyons honnêtes tous les joueurs qui aiment la stratégie et taper sur des monstres de temps en temps, un tonnerre d'applaudissement, voici le système de combat de Kaodes :

Non je plaisante, ce serait trop long. On va faire ça différemment.

Pour tout ce qui est définition du système d'évolution, les statistiques et l'apprentissage de techniques, je vais plutôt vous renvoyer vers ce lien sur la page (datée) d'appel à participation réalisée en janvier, qui définit les bases de notre travail sur le système d'affrontement.

Système de combat (PDF FR)

Une dernière spécificité relative à Kaode : il sera possible et parfois nécessaire pour le personnage de prendre personnellement part au combat. En effet, si les tournois et les matchs amateurs mettront principalement en scène des Kaodes, lorsque le joueur devra se défendre contre des brigands, zombies ou autres menaces Kaodiennes et que personne ne sera plus en mesure de le protéger : il sera temps de se défendre !


ICI, un gif-preview des combats !



Parce que depuis le début, nous travaillons avec l'équipe sur un jeu collaboratif de manière bénévole, et que nous souhaitons conserver un esprit libre dans la conception et le scénario.

En France, lorsque l'on n'appartient pas à une grosse structure, les seules possibilités de financement sont celles apportés par les financement régionaux (accordés une fois par an) ou l'aide du CNC (Centre national du cinéma et de l'image animée) comprenant trois sessions pas an, un jury de 13 personnes appartenant au monde du jeu.
C'est un peu : pistons, contraintes et marché contre un concept qui colle à l'esprit de Kaode : entraide, liberté et aventure humaine.

Dans ce cas, pourquoi ne pas demander un peu d'aide à nos joueurs...à vous ; que les rêveurs aident les rêveurs... non ?


Pour vous prouver que nous avons quand même la tête sur les épaules, voici une estimation de notre budget et une étude de marché réalisée par notre responsable marketing et conseiller financier :

Etude de marché light (PDF FR)


Pour revenir au financement participatif, nous avons décidé une approche par paliers, avec dans un premier temps ce qui nous est absolument nécessaire.

Les échelons successifs nous permettraient de véritablement passer un cap, en nous autorisant une communication de masse, une production de goodies super funs et nous laissant la possibilité d'aller plus loin dans la mise en place et l'élaboration du jeu.


Voici les paliers en détails :

Palier 1 - Graphisme et premiers frais : 1550 euros

Avec cet argent, nous pourrions engager une graphiste pour finir la carte du monde de Kaode, proposer des animations et des mini-maps pour les 50 à 70 lieux prévus.

En somme : transformer un jeu de rôle papier en jeu-vidéo.

Nous pourrions aussi rembourser nos frais de dossiers, payer l'hébergement du serveur etc...


Palier 2 - Communication et goodies: (+750) 2300 euros

Kaode chez toi, Kaode dans la rue, Kaode partout !

Une bonne communication (avoir un attaché de presse, faire les salons du jeu, produire : T-shirts, affiches, flyers, panneaux cartonnées, mugs...) voudrait dire plus de joueurs.

Ça paraît peut-être simple et bateau, mais dans les faits : cela voudrait dire un monde plus intéressant, plus d'échanges et d'investissement de la part de la communauté des joueurs, et donc plus de mouvement et d'évolutions dans le jeu : si Kaode fonctionne même au bout de quelques mois, nous pourrions continuer à développer au même rythme, continuer d'écrire lieux et événements, ajouter de nouvelles fonctionnalités, créer encore et toujours !




Si le palier 1 validerait la sortie du jeu ; la palier 2 assurerait un lancement en bonne et due forme ; nous permettant d'avoir une certaine quantité de joueur dès la sortie de la beta.


Palier 3 – Kaode IRL (dans la vraie vie) – (+850) 3150 euros

Entre joueurs, on ne va pas se mentir, et surtout depuis les 90's : avoir une représentation physique de nos créatures, ou personnages de comics, cartoon et jeux vidéo, c'est vraiment cool.

Avec l'essor (relatif) de l'impression 3D, nos recherches nous ont poussé à côtoyer des modélisateurs et autres passionnés du milieu de la 3D.

Effleurant l'idée d'avoir notre propre gamme, nous avons travaillé quelques patrons, et l'on commence à avoir certaines versions de Kaodes en 3D.


Voici une impression test, un exemple basique de l'une des créatures du jeu, la « phobie des couteaux » dessinée par Arthur Besson : « Chickenife » !


Jookoki de Roman !

          !!                   
Arachniège, par Sylvain Guidotti !


    

 

A venir :  Slim !                 


Pour l'instant, seules quelques entreprises ou laboratoires permettent l'impression d'objets en plastique comme celui-ci à grande échelle. Il suffirait cependant d'un petit modèle d'imprimante pour nous permettre une certaine quantité de production.

C'est pourquoi, si vous nous aidez à obtenir une imprimante, nous pourrions créer une large gamme de figurines en 3 dimensions, à faible coût, et donc : à petit prix pour vous !


Palier 4 – Aller plus loin...et enveloppe collaborateurs ! ( 3150+)

Version française ICI !--1. What is Kaode ?2. Why play Kaode ?3. Special features4. Artworks5. Why a crowdfunding ?6. Team 7. Conterparts in english (PDF)
The third World War occurred... And at the beginning of the nuclear 
winter, a group of philantropist and humanists - 
composed of artists, philosophers, scientists, politicians... -  save 
in particular crystals allowing to stock sensible 
informations, their memories, ideas, dreams, their plans of objects and 
workpieces. Pretty much everything that could represent the memory of 
humanity, preparing themselves to see their species being eradicated.
Soon, the planet is again silent.
The Kaodian crystals containing the fragments of past life are patiently waiting in their shelters, 
slowly evolving with time, submitted to Time and the high radioactivity 
of the planet.
At first, these ideas adjust and take an “organic” shape.
Finally, they end up freeing themselves from their envelops – a cocoon with which 
they today still have a strong bound – then from their shelters, to 
now represent the new fauna of the Known World.
Born of ideas contained in crystals to their current form, we call them : the "Kaodes"."And what about the player in all this ?"Good question fellow player/contributor/artist eager to join us !After the downfall and the re-emergence of men on Earth, it was 
decided that each man and woman would undertake a journey of at least 
one year long.
A journey across forests, cities and swamps all around the world ; they 
would learn about the value of life, about helping one another, about 
the value of adventure and the importance of knowledge : all hoping that
 mistakes made in the past - mostly those which lead to the Great War – 
would never happen again.
You will embody this traveler, accompagnied by a Kaode that is bound 
to you since your childhood, in order for you to stumble upon the 
mysteries and legends of the new world, while cooperating with other 
travelers, challenging some of them. Kaode is an independent game, offering an individual and personalised gaming experience : its concept goes back over a time where the graphism were not the only key to its success.The system is built in order for you to be at the center of an adventure of which YOU are the hero, in a progressive world :


Challenge your friends


Live an original adventure, plot and set in a new world where humanity emerges from the ruins of a medieval, steampunk and contemporary world.


Choose your own approach of the game : exploration, collaboration or collection ?


You understood that Kaode is mainly an adventure and exploration game.
Aware of our capacities and of our limits, our goal is to tell a story with humour, about important themes, and to introduce a certain depth in the places and caracters that will come across, the quests, the enigmas and the functioning of the game.
It is essential for us to create elaborated atmospheres, all gathered around adventures and battles between friends.
This is why the first interest is the discovery of a coherent and referenced universe.
In order to personalise each and everyone's adventure, and force the community to undertake researchs on our universe, each place will offer numerous quests and surprises of which the probability to come across them will vary from one player to the other.
Doing this way, two peope will be able to move in the same places, but face very different situations, access to various places, posess Kaode that do not look the same. This way, the adventure becomes personal, at the opposite of many MMORPG claiming to be epic, but where the player is very often an anonymous somebody.
The second appeal of the game - and the second way to play the adventure - is to consider Kaode as a monster battling game.
We are both collectors, and we are familiar with the pleasure to go and look for creatures and objects, the importance of the elements that personalise the player's experience and avatar.Here a "style" preview of the map, it's the one we used for the Alpha version, and it's from Laura Eva Zimmer ;)



About the community aspect : the game is based on three particular systems, including two innovative ones.
1 - The Events are key moments in the game where new elements are being introduced, and that are likely to transfom the Map - to the point of destroying towns and forests, change river's course, extinct species – and the game. The players who will feel concerned with their universe will participate or oppose to these “moments”.
Our current ambition is to be able to set up these moments as often as possible, this way confronting as many players as possible to moral choices that will lead the game towards any new mecanics it will bread.
2 - Finaly, Kaode will be progressive thanks to your particpation. For now, the map will be entirely revealed to all. Some areas will be however limited by certain handicaps, and others accessible with the necessary acquisition of Unlock Achievement, and others possible to unlock by the community thanks to the players' ingenuity.
Some cities of the world will offer real democratical campaign of construction of buildings, and players will be able to vote for the choice of the first structure and for its functions.
Will the players' population vote for a train station, a guild hall or an arena for the capital ?

But enough chit-chat, like they say, a video is worth a long speech, forewarned is forearmed and a rolling stone gathers no moss.
[The English subtitles have to be activated form youtube. You know, the little card between the timer and the gear.]
Oh yeah, I save the best for last : in order to represent the subjectivity of the informations contained in the crystals and saved by the members of the Oneiros project, the Kaodes were drawn by different illustrators, thus offering a great diversity of styles, concepts and colourisations compatible with the general spirit and the background of the game.
Here are a few artworks from our illustrators.
[Want to participate ? Join our project ! kaode@outlook.com ]
               "What about the battle ?!"For the players that are less inclined to narration, collectors, and let's be honest, all the players that love strategy and slay a few monsters from time to time, *drum roll*, here is the combat system of Kaodes :Na just kidding it would take too long. Let's do this another way.
For all that include definitions of the evolution system, statistics and techniques/skills learning, I will rather send you back to this PdF made in january (on our first call for participations), which defines the bases of our work on the battle system.Fight system (PDF EN)One last specificity concerning the Kaodes : it will be possible, and sometime necessary for the character to personaly intervene in the combat.
Indeed, although the tournaments and the amateur matches will mostly stage Kaodes, whenever the player will have to defend himself against bandits, zombies and other Kaodian threats, and that he has no one to protect him : it will be time for him to defend himself.HERE, a preview gif of the combat !Because from the start, we have been working with the team of free volunteers on a collaborative game, and we wish to keep a free spirit in its conception and its scenario.In France, whenever you do not belong to a big structure, the only way to be financed is through the regional financial support (granted once a year) or through the help of the CNC (Centre National du Cinéma et de l'image animée, a National Centre of the Cinema and Moving Pictures), including three sessions a year, a jury of 13 people belonging to the gaming world.
It is a bit like that : pulling strings, constraints and deals against a concept that fits with the Kaode spirit : mutual aid, freedom and human adventure.
In this case, why not ask our players for some help... ask your help : dreamers to dreamers, we should get along... right ?
To prove to you that we do are hard-headed, here is an estimation of our budget and a market study (in french - sorry !) realised by our marketing manager and financial advisor :Etude de marché light (PDF FR) 


Coming back on the crowdfunding, we have decided to adopt a tiered approch, with first what is absolutely necessary for us.
The successive levels allow us to truely climb one step of the ladder, by allowing us a mass communication, the production of super fun goodies and giving us the opportunity to go further in the set up and the development of the game.

Here are the levels in detail :Level 1 – Design and first expense : 1550 euros
With this amount, we would be able to hire a designer in order to finish the Map of Kaode, offer animations and mini-maps for the 50 to 70 places that are planned.
In other words : transforming a paper role-playing game into a video game.
We would also be able to repay our application fees, the server space, etc...Level 2 : Communication and goodies : (+750) 2300 euros
Kaode inside, Kaode outside, Kaode everywhere !
A good communication (games room, T-shirts, posters, flyers, cardboards, mugs - having a press agent...) would mean more players.
It may seem quite simple and corny, but in the end, this would mean : a more interesting world, more exchanges and investment coming from the gamers community, and thus more movement and evolutions in the game.
If Kaode is indeed working after a few months, we would be able to further its development at the same rhythm, and to continue to create new places and events, add new functions, create always more and more !


If the level 1 validates the game's release, the level 2 will secure a proper launch ; this way allowing us a certain amount of players as soon as the beta game is realeased.Level 3 – Kaode IRL : (+850) 3150 euros
Between us gamers, no lies be told, and this especially since the 90s : having a physical representation of our creatures, our comics' characters, cartoons and video game is pretty awesome.
With the (relative) boom of the 3D impression, our research brought us to rub shoulders with modelers and other 3D enthusiasts.Slowly catching the idea in our own range, we have been working on a few patterns, and we are just starting to have a few versions of Kaodes in 3D.
Here is a test impression, a basic exemple of one of the creatures of the game, a “phobia of knives”, drawn by Arthur Besson : “Chickenife” !     Jookoki, by Roman !                  !!!Arachniege, by Sylvain Guidotti     Upcoming : Slim !                                                                           
For now, only a few companies or labs allow the impression of plastic objects like the one in large scale. We would howerver only need a small printer model to allow us a certain quantity of production.
This is why if you help us obtain a printer, we will be able to create a wide 3D figurines range at low cost, and thus, low cost for you too !Level 4 - Expansion !
Co-workers
We currently count 14 official members working on the project, including the leaders, and on top of that numerous advices and encounters making this project such a great experience.
To sum up, we are :






Fabien Plart : developer, projet leader, super coder and outstanding coffee maker.
The machine whisperer.




Quentin Guidotti : scriptwriter, gamedesigner and sound effect engineer of the known world.
 
                The storyteller with the plan.










Laura Eva Zimmer : cartographer/map maker and graphic designer on Kaode.
The woman with the star-freckles.




Maud Troufflard  : interface designer.
She can talk to your brain.










Arthur Besson : illustrator and Kaodes designer.
Doctor Frankestein.
                                         But way cooler.




Chloé Georges Boutin : illustrator and concept artist.
The hidden professional in the project.










Sylvain Guidotti : illustrator and councelor.
Gandalf the white, just more sexy.




Roman Krmášek : illustrator and Kaodes designer.
A minimal style for a cool dude.










Isabella Zsoldos : illustrator and Kaodes designer.
New kid on the block.

Bruce Wayne, with glasses.










Robin Antoniotti : jurist and intellectual property manager.
« Objection ! »




Erik Thormann aka Christian Meth : musician.
The guy with the 1001 projects.

« Yeah. Well, i'm just having a break from my exam, I'll translate your 200 pages project, no biggy. »




Corentin Magniere : graphic designer dealing with communication.
May soon replace Mac Gyver AND the Pretender.










Léa Rondeaux : graphist and creator of the Kaode website.
Passionated stackhnovist.
            she also knows how to knit.




Conterparts in english (PDF)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

http://www.thegamehasbegun.com/

Ils parlent de nous dans la presse !





1. Qu'est-ce que Kaode ?2. Pourquoi jouer à Kaode ?3. Spécificités4. Artworks5. Pourquoi le financement participatif ?6. Team7. Contreparties traduites en français (PDF)
La troisième guerre mondiale a eu lieu... et à l'aube de l'hiver 
nucléaire, du "grand cataclysme" : un groupe d'humaniste composé de 
philanthropes réunissant artistes, philosophes, scientifiques, 
politiciens etc... enregistrent dans des cristaux permettant le stockage
 d'informations sensibles, leurs souvenirs, idées, leurs rêves, des 
plans d'objets ou des œuvres. En somme, tout ce qui pourrait constituer 
une mémoire de l'humanité, se préparant à l’éradication de l’espèce.Les craintes de ces individus se confirment, et la planète est une nouvelle fois silencieuse.

Les cristaux Kaodiens renfermant les parcelles de vie des individus du 
projet Oneiros attendent patiemment dans leurs abris, évoluant doucement
 avec le temps, soumis à la forte radioactivité de la planète. Dans un 
premier temps, les idées se réajustent et prennent une forme "organique". Finissant par s'émanciper des cristaux - une enveloppe 
avec laquelle ils conservent aujourd'hui un lien fort - puis des abris 
pour aujourd'hui représenter la nouvelle faune du monde connu.
D'idées humaines contenues dans des cristaux à la forme que l'on leur connaît aujourd'hui, on les appelle : les « Kaodes ».- « Et le joueur dans tout ça ? »
Décidément, tu poses de bonnes questions joueur/contributeur/artiste désirant nous rejoindre !
Après la chute et la mystérieuse ré-émergence de l'homme sur la Terre, 
il a été décidé que chaque homme et femme entreprendrait dans sa vie un 
voyage d'une durée minimum d'une année.
Parcourant les forets, les villes et les marais du monde, ils et 
elles apprendraient la valeur de la vie, de l'entraide, de l'aventure et
 l'importance du savoir ; dans l'espoir que les erreurs du passé - et 
surtout celles ayant conduites à la Grande guerre - ne soient jamais 
reproduites.Vous incarnez ce voyageur, accompagné d'un Kaode qui vous est lié 
depuis l'enfance, afin de vous confronter aux mystères et légendes du Nouveau Monde, coopérant avec d'autres voyageurs, en affrontant 
certains.

Kaode est un jeu indépendant proposant une expérience de jeu individuelle et personnalisée, et un type de multijoueur participatif ; son concept reprend les éléments de jeux d'un temps où le graphisme n'avait pas forcément une place centrale dans son succès.Pour résumer :Kaode est un jeu d'aventure, d'exploration et de collection/combat de créatures communautaire sur PC et mobile, prenant place dans un univers post-apocalyptique.
Le système est conçu pour que vous soyez au centre d'une aventure dont VOUS êtes le héros, au sein d'un monde évolutif :


Affrontez vos amis


Vivez une aventure originale, scénarisée et prenant part dans un monde nouveau, où l'humanité refait surface dans les décombres d'un monde médiéval, steampunk et contemporain.


Choisissez votre approche du jeu: exploration, collaboration ou collection ?


Kaode est avant tout un jeu d'aventure et d'exploration. Le gameplay se veut simple - et mobile friendly – à l'image du design. Notre objectif est de raconter une histoire avec humour sur des thèmes importants, d'introduire une certaine profondeur dans les lieux et personnages rencontrés, les quêtes, les énigmes et le fonctionnement. Il est primordial pour nous de créer des atmosphères travaillées, le tout autour d'aventures et de batailles entre amis.L'intérêt primaire est donc celui de la découverte d'un univers cohérent et référencé, où le fond compense la forme.
Pour personnaliser l'aventure de chacun et forcer la communauté à entreprendre des recherches dans notre univers, chaque lieu sera pourvu de nombreuses quêtes et surprises dont la probabilité de rencontre sera variable. Ainsi, deux personnes pourront se déplacer dans les mêmes endroits, mais rencontrer des situations très différentes, accéder à des lieux divers, posséder des Kaodes qui ne se ressemblent pas (à l'inverse de nombreux MMORPG se voulant épiques, où le joueur n'est bien souvent qu'un personnage lambda).

Le second attrait du jeu - et la deuxième façon d'aborder l'aventure - est de prendre Kaode comme un jeu d'affrontement de monstres. Nous sommes deux collectionneurs, et nous connaissons le plaisir de partir à la recherche de créatures et d'objets, l'importance d'avoir des éléments qui personnalisent l'expérience et le héros du joueur.
Ici une petite preview de la map du monde utilisé pour la version alpha (vous ne la retrouverez pas dans le jeu mais le style y est !)
Oh et c'est de Laura Eva Zimmer =) !


Pour rester sur l'aspect communautaire : le jeu repose sur 3 systèmes particuliers, dont deux novateurs.
Nous venons de citer le Pvp (Player Versus Player) sur lequel nous reviendrons plus tard, parlons un peu du reste :
1 - Les Événements sont des moments particuliers du jeu où de nouveaux éléments sont introduits, et qui sont susceptibles de transformer la Map - quitte à détruire ville et forêt, changer le cours des rivières, éteindre des espèces... - et le jeu. Les joueurs qui se sentiront concernés par leur univers participeront ou s'opposeront à ces « moments ».

Il est vraiment important pour nous de rythmer le jeu et de créer une véritable ambiance de roleplay.
Aussi, notre ambition à l'heure actuelle est de pouvoir implanter ces événements le plus souvent possible, confrontant le plus de joueurs possible à des choix moraux qui orienteront le jeu vers telle ou telle nouvelle mécanique à son issue.
2 - Enfin, Kaode sera évolutif, grâce à votre participation.
Dans l'immédiat, la map sera révélée dans son intégralité, et à tous. Certaines aires seront limitées par certains handicaps, d'autres accessibles selon la nécessaire obtention d'Unlock Achievements, d'autres déblocables par la communauté grâce à l'ingéniosité des joueurs.
Certaines villes du monde proposeront aussi de véritables campagnes démocratiques de construction de bâtiments et les joueurs pourront voter le choix de la prochaine bâtisse ainsi que ses fonctionnalités.
La population de joueur choisira t-elle une gare, un hall des guildes ou une arène pour la capitale ?

Mais trêve de fariboles, comme dit l'adage, une vidéo vaut mieux qu'un long discours, un homme avertit en vaut deux et pierre qui roule n'amasse pas mousse.
Ah, oui, je ne vous ai pas raconté le meilleur : pour représenter la subjectivité des informations contenus dans les cristaux, enregistrées par les membres du projet Oneiros, les Kaodes sont dessinés par des illustrateurs différents, proposants une variété de style, de concepts, de colorisations compatibles avec l'esprit et le background du jeu.
Voici quelques artworks de nos illustrateurs.[Vous voulez participer au projet ?  Rejoignez nous ! kaode@outlook.com]               « Et le combat dans tout ça ? »
Pour les joueurs moins portés vers la narration, les collectionneurs, et soyons honnêtes tous les joueurs qui aiment la stratégie et taper sur des monstres de temps en temps, un tonnerre d'applaudissement, voici le système de combat de Kaodes :
Non je plaisante, ce serait trop long. On va faire ça différemment.
Pour tout ce qui est définition du système d'évolution, les statistiques et l'apprentissage de techniques, je vais plutôt vous renvoyer vers ce lien sur la page (datée) d'appel à participation réalisée en janvier, qui définit les bases de notre travail sur le système d'affrontement.Système de combat (PDF FR)
Une dernière spécificité relative à Kaode : il sera possible et parfois nécessaire pour le personnage de prendre personnellement part au combat. En effet, si les tournois et les matchs amateurs mettront principalement en scène des Kaodes, lorsque le joueur devra se défendre contre des brigands, zombies ou autres menaces Kaodiennes et que personne ne sera plus en mesure de le protéger : il sera temps de se défendre !

ICI, un gif-preview des combats !
Parce que depuis le début, nous travaillons avec l'équipe sur un jeu collaboratif de manière bénévole, et que nous souhaitons conserver un esprit libre dans la conception et le scénario.En France, lorsque l'on n'appartient pas à une grosse structure, les seules possibilités de financement sont celles apportés par les financement régionaux (accordés une fois par an) ou l'aide du CNC (Centre national du cinéma et de l'image animée) comprenant trois sessions pas an, un jury de 13 personnes appartenant au monde du jeu.
C'est un peu : pistons, contraintes et marché contre un concept qui colle à l'esprit de Kaode : entraide, liberté et aventure humaine.
Dans ce cas, pourquoi ne pas demander un peu d'aide à nos joueurs...à vous ; que les rêveurs aident les rêveurs... non ?
Pour vous prouver que nous avons quand même la tête sur les épaules, voici une estimation de notre budget et une étude de marché réalisée par notre responsable marketing et conseiller financier :Etude de marché light (PDF FR)
Pour revenir au financement participatif, nous avons décidé une approche par paliers, avec dans un premier temps ce qui nous est absolument nécessaire.
Les échelons successifs nous permettraient de véritablement passer un cap, en nous autorisant une communication de masse, une production de goodies super funs et nous laissant la possibilité d'aller plus loin dans la mise en place et l'élaboration du jeu.Voici les paliers en détails :Palier 1 - Graphisme et premiers frais : 1550 euros
Avec cet argent, nous pourrions engager une graphiste pour finir la carte du monde de Kaode, proposer des animations et des mini-maps pour les 50 à 70 lieux prévus.
En somme : transformer un jeu de rôle papier en jeu-vidéo.
Nous pourrions aussi rembourser nos frais de dossiers, payer l'hébergement du serveur etc...Palier 2 - Communication et goodies: (+750) 2300 euros
Kaode chez toi, Kaode dans la rue, Kaode partout !
Une bonne communication (avoir un attaché de presse, faire les salons du jeu, produire : T-shirts, affiches, flyers, panneaux cartonnées, mugs...) voudrait dire plus de joueurs.
Ça paraît peut-être simple et bateau, mais dans les faits : cela voudrait dire un monde plus intéressant, plus d'échanges et d'investissement de la part de la communauté des joueurs, et donc plus de mouvement et d'évolutions dans le jeu : si Kaode fonctionne même au bout de quelques mois, nous pourrions continuer à développer au même rythme, continuer d'écrire lieux et événements, ajouter de nouvelles fonctionnalités, créer encore et toujours !




Si le palier 1 validerait la sortie du jeu ; la palier 2 assurerait un lancement en bonne et due forme ; nous permettant d'avoir une certaine quantité de joueur dès la sortie de la beta.Palier 3 – Kaode IRL (dans la vraie vie) – (+850) 3150 euros
Entre joueurs, on ne va pas se mentir, et surtout depuis les 90's : avoir une représentation physique de nos créatures, ou personnages de comics, cartoon et jeux vidéo, c'est vraiment cool.
Avec l'essor (relatif) de l'impression 3D, nos recherches nous ont poussé à côtoyer des modélisateurs et autres passionnés du milieu de la 3D.
Effleurant l'idée d'avoir notre propre gamme, nous avons travaillé quelques patrons, et l'on commence à avoir certaines versions de Kaodes en 3D.

Voici une impression test, un exemple basique de l'une des créatures du jeu, la « phobie des couteaux » dessinée par Arthur Besson : « Chickenife » !Jookoki de Roman !            !!                    Arachniège, par Sylvain Guidotti !        A venir :  Slim !                 


Pour l'instant, seules quelques entreprises ou laboratoires permettent l'impression d'objets en plastique comme celui-ci à grande échelle. Il suffirait cependant d'un petit modèle d'imprimante pour nous permettre une certaine quantité de production.
C'est pourquoi, si vous nous aidez à obtenir une imprimante, nous pourrions créer une large gamme de figurines en 3 dimensions, à faible coût, et donc : à petit prix pour vous !Palier 4 – Aller plus loin...et enveloppe collaborateurs ! ( 3150+)Nous sommes actuellement 14 membres officiels sur le projet, sans compter les innombrables conseils et rencontres qui font de ce projet une si jolie expérience.Voici en quelques mots :






Fabien Plart : développeur, chef de projet, super-codeur et faiseur de café hors-pair.
The machine whisperer.[L'homme qui murmurait à l'oreille des machines.]




Quentin Guidotti : scénariste, gamedesigner et bruiteur du Monde connu.
The story-teller with the plan.[Le barde avec un plan.]










Laura Eva Zimmer : cartographe et graphiste sur Kaode.
The woman with the star-freckles.[La femme aux étoiles de rousseur]




Maud Troufflard : créatrice de l'interface.
She can talk to your brain.[Elle parle à ton cerveau]










Arthur Besson : illustrateur et dessinateur de Kaodes.
Doctor Frankestein.
                                        But way cooler.[Docteur Frankestein,                        mais en bien plus cool.]




Chloé Georges Boutin : illustratrice et concept-artiste.
The hidden professional of the project.[La professionnelle cachée de Kaode]










Sylvain Guidotti : illustrateur et conseiller.
Gandalf the white, just more sexy.[Comme Gandalf le blanc,                                            mais en sexy]




Roman Krmášek : illustrateur et dessinateur de Kaodes.
A minimal style for a cool dude.[Un style minimal pour un mec cool.]










Isabella Zsoldos : illustratrice et dessinatrice de Kaodes.
New kid on the block.[La nouvelle !]




Dorian Martin : responsable marketing et conseiller financier.
Bruce Wayne with glasses.[Bruce Wayne, avec des lunettes.]










Robin Antoniotti : juriste, et responsable de la propriété intellectuelle.
« Objection ! »




Erik Thormann aka Christian Meth : Musicien.
The guy with the 1001 projects.[Le mec au 1001 projets]










Clémence Paris : linguiste et traductrice.
« Yeah. Well, i'm just having a break from my exam, I'll translate your 200 pages project, no biggy. »[Ouaaais, je fais un break dans mes partiels, je vais traduire tes 200 pages de texte pour Kaode, pas de problèmes.]




Corentin Magniere : graphiste chargé de communication.
May soon replace Mac Gyver AND the Pretender.[Pourrait très bientôt remplacer Mac Gyver ET le Caméléon]










Léa Rondeaux : webdesigneuse du site internet de Kaode, chargée de la cohérence graphique.
Passionated stackhnovist.
            she also knows how to knit.[Stackhanoviste passionée. Elle tricote aussi.]




Contreparties traduites en français (PDF)

story:
click for larger


UPDATE: 29 September 2011 - YOU CHUFFING DID IT!! YOU BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE!!! I can't quite believe we got there. I just wrote a very enjoyable email to Rough Trade (the label), informing them of our staggering victory. This app is going to rock so hard. Really, you have no idea how gleefully grateful we are. What next? It looks like people are still giving, so if we get enough, we'll apply for a two year, instead of a one year licence. Thank you sincerely, Andrew + Tom (two very happy chaps) x


UPDATE: 22 September 2011 - Three-quarters there! So close ... so close. I just hope we don't fall at the final hurdle. Spoken to Rough Trade and they love it. A lot of people have been asking about the limited edition print - sorry it took us so long but we wanted it to be just right (click on the thumbnail above to see a larger version). I think you'll agree, it is rather special. Tom outdid himself. We're only printing 75 of these babies, so don't miss out. Oh and they're A3 in size, by the way.


UPDATE: 16 September 2011 - NO WAY! I've been away in The Netherlands, attending DiGRA (which has been pretty awesome so far. If you guys like what we're doing, check out what the ex-mayor of Bogota Antanas Mockus did - when in power, he drafted 400 mimes onto the streets to mock people who transgressed traffic laws because the police were too inept. It worked! Look up the doc 'Cities on Speed' on youtube). Anyway, I've not had the chance to check up that often on our progress here and I am overwhelmed that we are now officially over half way - and also just over half way through the month. So, amazingly, we are well on the track to victory. Right now, I'm feeling a mixture of humility, gratefulness and guilt. THANK YOU!


UPDATE: 13 September 2011 - Thank you everyone who's put their wallet on the line so far! Things are going rather well although it's way too early to say whether we'll actually make our goal or not. And if we're even one dollar short, it all gets returned - so nervous times here down in the bunker. A common question we've been getting is "Why not Android/Web/Steam?" We feel your pain. The iPhone was the natural platform to launch on as an experiment, but if it proves worthwhile, our next step is definitely to port it onto Android and possibly the web too. 



Our Story

We are Andrew Sheerin and Tom Morgan-Jones. We run a small, satirical games publishing company called TerrorBull Games that uses games as a way to challenge players and provoke thought, as well as entertain.

We believe games are brilliantly suited to tackle "serious" subjects without being preachy, dull or depressing. Additionally, their interactive nature means that when you play one of our games, you become part of the problem. And that's the quickest way to learn how to solve it.


The Impact

A few years ago, we designed War on Terror, the boardgame. It achieved many weird and wonderful things - it got banned by shops, seized by the police, exhibited as art and has resulted in probably hundreds, if not thousands, of falling-outs and break-ups (and its fair share of hook-ups).

But the really amazing thing is the effect it has had on certain individuals. We've received some humbling and moving letters from terrorist attack survivors telling us our game helped them laugh at the subject after years of anxiety and depression and from soldiers serving on the front line of the real war on terror, sharing with us how our game (yes, they play it out there to unwind) made them question what they were doing. There's no such thing as "just a game". They can affect lasting and positive change.

For all its successes, War on Terror is still pretty niche, pretty underground. (For example, few people know that our game came first, and then they named the war after it because it sounded so catchy). So now we're making a digital version of the game for the iPhone in the hope of reaching a whole new audience of satirical game enthusiasts.


What We Need & What You Get

It's really simple. We've done the hard work and the app's almost finished. All we need is the perfect piece of music to play out the game. "Cunts Are Still Running The World" by Jarvis Cocker is that piece of music. If you don't know it, youtube it right now. It's funny, angry, subversive - everything we want our game to be.

We've talked to Rough Trade and they have given us a very fair offer of £1200 to licence this track. And that's where we need your help. We've spent so much on booze, fuelling the development of the game, that we have nothing left for music licences.

Funding Levels:

  • ANY AMOUNT: We will email you a digital "Rosette of Participation!" You can proudly display this on your desktop, or email it to your Mum. Make her proud.
  • £20 or $35: We will send you a signed, limited edition "Cash for Cunts" commemorative poster by award-winning illustrator, Tom Morgan-Jones (who does all our game illustrations)
  • £50 or $85: You'll get all of the above AND a special mention in the credits of our game
  • £1000 or $1,700: For you rich cunts out there, a special platinum-level of funding. If you pledge this much, then we will come round your house and host a War on Terror games evening with you and your mates. We will leave you with many happy memories, that's a guarantee. Well, the memories are guaranteed, the happiness isn't.


Remember, if we don't raise the full amount, everyone gets their pledges back. And if by some kind stroke of fate we manage to raise more than we need, we'll put it towards the development of our next satirical blockbuster.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us in any way you can, even if that's just telling your friends about this and forwarding the link. I know a music licence sounds insignificant and unexciting, but this would mean the world to us. Really, we want it bad and it is sooo doable. Thank you, thank you, thank you, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

Anyway, I've not had the chance to check up that often on our progress here and I am overwhelmed that we are now officially over half way - and also just over half way through the month. So, amazingly, we are well on the track to victory. Right now, I'm feeling a mixture of humility, gratefulness and guilt. THANK YOU!
UPDATE: 13 September 2011 - Thank you everyone who's put their wallet on the line so far! Things are going rather well although it's way too early to say whether we'll actually make our goal or not. And if we're even one dollar short, it all gets returned - so nervous times here down in the bunker. A common question we've been getting is "Why not Android/Web/Steam?" We feel your pain. The iPhone was the natural platform to launch on as an experiment, but if it proves worthwhile, our next step is definitely to port it onto Android and possibly the web too.  

Our Story
We are Andrew Sheerin and Tom Morgan-Jones. We run a small, satirical games publishing company called TerrorBull Games that uses games as a way to challenge players and provoke thought, as well as entertain.We believe games are brilliantly suited to tackle "serious" subjects without being preachy, dull or depressing. Additionally, their interactive nature means that when you play one of our games, you become part of the problem. And that's the quickest way to learn how to solve it.


The Impact
A few years ago, we designed War on Terror, the boardgame. It achieved many weird and wonderful things - it got banned by shops, seized by the police, exhibited as art and has resulted in probably hundreds, if not thousands, of falling-outs and break-ups (and its fair share of hook-ups). But the really amazing thing is the effect it has had on certain individuals. We've received some humbling and moving letters from terrorist attack survivors telling us our game helped them laugh at the subject after years of anxiety and depression and from soldiers serving on the front line of the real war on terror, sharing with us how our game (yes, they play it out there to unwind) made them question what they were doing. There's no such thing as "just a game". They can affect lasting and positive change.For all its successes, War on Terror is still pretty niche, pretty underground. (For example, few people know that our game came first, and then they named the war after it because it sounded so catchy). So now we're making a digital version of the game for the iPhone in the hope of reaching a whole new audience of satirical game enthusiasts. 


What We Need & What You Get
It's really simple. We've done the hard work and the app's almost finished. All we need is the perfect piece of music to play out the game. "Cunts Are Still Running The World" by Jarvis Cocker is that piece of music. If you don't know it, youtube it right now. It's funny, angry, subversive - everything we want our game to be.We've talked to Rough Trade and they have given us a very fair offer of £1200 to licence this track. And that's where we need your help. We've spent so much on booze, fuelling the development of the game, that we have nothing left for music licences.Funding Levels:


ANY AMOUNT: We will email you a digital "Rosette of Participation!" You can proudly display this on your desktop, or email it to your Mum. Make her proud.

£20 or $35: We will send you a signed, limited edition "Cash for Cunts" commemorative poster by award-winning illustrator, Tom Morgan-Jones (who does all our game illustrations)

£50 or $85: You'll get all of the above AND a special mention in the credits of our game

£1000 or $1,700: For you rich cunts out there, a special platinum-level of funding. If you pledge this much, then we will come round your house and host a War on Terror games evening with you and your mates. We will leave you with many happy memories, that's a guarantee. Well, the memories are guaranteed, the happiness isn't.

Remember, if we don't raise the full amount, everyone gets their pledges back. And if by some kind stroke of fate we manage to raise more than we need, we'll put it towards the development of our next satirical blockbuster.


Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us in any way you can, even if that's just telling your friends about this and forwarding the link. I know a music licence sounds insignificant and unexciting, but this would mean the world to us. Really, we want it bad and it is sooo doable. Thank you, thank you, thank you, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you.
