story:
Experience a blind date gone horribly wrong.
- Horror! Comedy! Suspense!
- Grayscale graphics for that retro feel.
- B-Rate worthy script intended.
- Original score/sound effects.

BLIND DATE BAIT, a throwback to campy cheesy horror flicks turned into a modern day video game! You play as Chad Thompson, a lonely horny guy just trying to meet someone on the live dating website gettin-some.com. Play through the date and meetup with Lorie, who knows the way to a abandoned cabin. Impress her with your skills to advance and find out how your blind date will end!
 
 
 
Act I: Getting to Know You
In the first act meet up with your date Lorie. After the end of the 1st cheesy cut scene Lorie demands you prove your worth before heading to the cabin. Play through the park mini-games to prove yourself to her and watch as Chad tries to put the moves on Lorie. However, she seems scared by you and runs ahead to the cabin.
 
 
Act II: Love Notes
The cabin looks abandoned, there are bars on the windows, but this is no bother to our love seeker Chad. You're now separated from your date and have reached the cruddy cabin. Lorie is leaving love notes for you guiding you in a quest for batteries and a flashlight. You feel like you're being watched but no one is around. What could Lorie be planning? Chad is hoping for the best when he finds out Lorie is waiting for him in the basement.
 
 
Act III: Something is Wrong with my Date?
Chad is clueless till the end. He doesn't understand why Lorie is acting this way. Someone gets hurt and the cops are called, but what will they see? How will the date end? All Chad wants is some action, will he get any or be lucky enough to leave with his head intact???
 
 
What Inspired Blind Date Bait
Being fans of old 80’s horror flicks we want to create a modern day horror game that's a throwback to that era. From the times of our youth playing 7th Guest and Phantasmagoria it was decided to create this as a updated point/click game. The color palette is gray scale making this a throwback to the 20’s/30’s as well. Using our love for these campy flicks/games we decided to create a horror game with tongue-in-cheek humor set to 3ds max gray scale images.
 
 
Help support Blind Date Bait
This game will be released worldwide as an iOS video game first off!
in order to continue development of this game we need support! Donations, spreading the word, or anything you can do will be much appreciated! If there is an audience for campy horror games we entend to port this game for Android devices and possibley a short film. So if you enjoy the campy horror fun then spread the love of Blind Date Bait and get some!
 
 
Play Blind Date Bait Act I Now!
Act I: Getting to Know You is available in the Apple App Store!
Check it out and help support this video game in getting completed.
 
 
Perk Pics!

Blind Date Bait Keychain


Blind Date Bait Grey Ringer Shirt (XS-XXXL)




TaTa

story:
The Gate of Realms is a fantasy action/adventure role-playing video game about a settlement that has uncovered an ancient portal in a cavern underneath the city. Upon closer inspection, the portal was activated. It was found to take anyone who dares to enter to an ever changing realm full of discovery, riches, and danger. Create your own character and play solo or with up to 4 friends. Uncover the mysteries of the portal and claim new powers and riches within the gate of realms!


Note: All of the material seen in the images in this campaign are of The Gate of Realms in early pre_alpha, and will be improved upon.

The Gate of Realms does not limit your experience to a small number of worlds. We want the player to be immersed within a whole new exciting world that they want to explore. Areas generate randomly with there own style of structures to explore and unique creatures to face. Each world that is uniquely generated can be visited as much as you'd like or you can choose to delete it.

This project has turned from a small hobby to a true passion for us. We are having a blast working in the engine for the past several months: coming up with new ideas to incorporate to the game, building a skilled team (6 people so far), and working on mechanics in engine. We want to make a fun next-gen adventure game that you can be played alone or with friends both online or offline. We want to make our game cross platform and bring it to not only PC/Mac/Linux, but to Xbox 360, Xbox One, PlayStation 3, and PlayStation 4 as well. If you don't have a very powerful computer or the newest consoles don't worry we are taking that into consideration, and will try to make The Gate of Realms look and run as well as it can for any set up. Using...

                                                  


Planned Features:

Character Customization: Choose from 10+ playable races, and create your own personalized character.

Random Generation: The Gate of Realms randomly generated areas so no two are exactly alike.  

Area/quest Creator: In-game level editor to create your own custom quest lines and areas from scratch for yourself, or to share with others online.

Weather and Time systems: The Gate of Realms features a day/night cycle and dynamic weather systems unique to each generated area.

Dynamic Realms: Realms not only generate uniquely, but they can also change a bit as time goes on. This feature might not be for everyone and will be toggle-able.

Random Desert Generation: Dunes will fluctuate in size as  weather is simulated.


Themed Areas: There are tons of areas within The Gate of Realms that introduce different aesthetic themes, sizes, quests, enemies, loot, and more! 

Varied Enemies/Mobs: The game world will be populated by tons of unique creatures and bosses. Each generated realm that you visit will have its own special sets of enemies and other mobs to interact with. Mobs sizes can range from the size of a mouse to massive titans.

Combat: We are working to make combat engaging, fun, and challenging without making it overly complicated. We also want to allow the player to use their surrounding to aid them in battle if they see fit.

Real-time Dynamic Destruction: We have integrated a way to impact your surroundings with the damage you deal.

Magic: The Gate of Realms will incorporate a wide variety of magic types that are not only used in combat, but that can effect materials in the world in different ways. They will also be used to aid in puzzle solving and other mechanics.


Enchantments: You will be able to infuse your weapon and armor with any magic type you choose. These enchantments will give you boots depending on your skill level in that magic type. We are also working on creating custom infusions so depending on the material, style, and the magic type chosen Whatever you enchant will look unique to that combination. 


Expansive Skill Trees: In The Gate of Realms you will have a true say in how you shape your characters skills. 

Crafting/Blueprinting: You will have the ability to craft unique weapons and armors from resources you find, as well as, create and share blueprints for the items you make.

Stealth mechanics: The Gate of Realms has a multi-factor stealth mechanic, for those who like to be stealthy. This feature does not affect any other play style.

Companions: If you are offline and don't have friends to spare find or hire one in-game to help you as you brave the dangers within the portal.

Mounts: Their will be tons of mounts for you to choose from to help you with some of the more expansive lanscapes.

Multiplayer: You will be able to play The Gate of Realms with up to 4 friends LAN or online.

PVP/PVE Arena Mode: Battle other players online.

Mod support: Making and sharing mods will be made easy.

Language Support: The Gate of Realms will support English, Spanish, Swedish German, Russian and French languages at launch. Additional languages will be added later.


Why IndieGoGo?

We've decided to use IndieGoGo so we can remain independent, and dedicate more time to working on The Gate of Realms. We want to open up to a community where everyone can help shape our game for the better and, we really feel that with the help of IndieGoGo we can create an amazing game. 

We've been developing The Gate of Realms in our free time for a few months now. We currently only have a pretty amazing terrain generator and weather systems. Some of the terrains like the sand dunes currently shift with the weather. our next goal is to work more on character mechanics. We really need to be able to dedicate more time to this project to develop better mechanics and assets. We plan to allow people into our game through its development and during its beta state, but we will work to finish the game. We don't want to drag this game through long unfinished process of small updates. We need funding for the following:

Work: Help us to be able to dedicate more time to working on The Gate of Realms over the next year.

Website: With more time to dedicate to this project we will be able to maintain a website to share development status for The Gate of Realms as well as maintain social media pages. 

Software & Equipment: Help us purchase and maintain software licencing and equiptment to keep this project moving forward.

Multiplayer Hosting: We would like to provide some dedicated servers for those who want an online multiplayer experience.

Music and Audio Effects: We know several talented musicians and sound effect artist that we would like to work with us to create an immersive sound track and spot on sound effects.

 Art & Assets: We plan to hire talented artists to work with us to help us bring our world to life and to refine and polish everything before it's release. 

 Porting: Help us bring our game to multiple platforms.

Translation: We plan to hire voice talent to create authentic regional dialects for voiced characters, as well as help with proper text translations where needed.


Our vision for The Gate of Realms is to make it a beautiful, fun, and innovative game, and by contributing to our campaign you can help make that happen. 


The Rewards?


The Full Game:

Everyone who contributes $25 or more to our IndieGoGo  will receive the full game of The Gate of Realms for the platform of their choice when it is released, and any further updates free, forever until the final release! The game is currently in a pre-alpha stage. We plan on developing it over the next few years, so there is much to come. It will be a digital download game only.


Exclusive Content:

All supporters will receive The Gate of Realms wallpapers. Some tiers reward you with special indieGoGo exclusive content. This content will mainly be an extra aesthetic style for crafted weapons and armor (except for higher tiers which have there own unique power).  We plan to create and release this content when the game is finished.

Some tiers reward you with a special companion creature that will follow and aid you wherever you go.


You/Your name in-game

All supporters will have there name or alias of choice featured in the credits page of The Gate of Realms. Some higher tiers will allow supporters to add a photo of themselves to be photo rendered as an oil painting that can be found in-game.


Digital Artbook

 For those of you who are interested in the development of assets from concept to final release, and things that may not make it into the game.


Name In-game Content

 Supporters of some tiers will have the ability to name in-game content that will be present in the beta and final releases of The Gate of Realms.

Combat: We are working to make combat engaging, fun, and challenging without making it overly complicated. We also want to allow the player to use their surrounding to aid them in battle if they see fit.


Real-time Dynamic Destruction: We have integrated a way to impact your surroundings with the damage you deal.



Magic: The Gate of Realms will incorporate a wide variety of magic types that are not only used in combat, but that can effect materials in the world in different ways. They will also be used to aid in puzzle solving and other mechanics.

Enchantments: You will be able to infuse your weapon and armor with any magic type you choose. These enchantments will give you boots depending on your skill level in that magic type. We are also working on creating custom infusions so depending on the material, style, and the magic type chosen Whatever you enchant will look unique to that combination. 



Expansive Skill Trees: In The Gate of Realms you will have a true say in how you shape your characters skills. 



Crafting/Blueprinting: You will have the ability to craft unique weapons and armors from resources you find, as well as, create and share blueprints for the items you make.


Stealth mechanics: The Gate of Realms has a multi-factor stealth mechanic, for those who like to be stealthy. This feature does not affect any other play style.


Companions: If you are offline and don't have friends to spare find or hire one in-game to help you as you brave the dangers within the portal.



Mounts: Their will be tons of mounts for you to choose from to help you with some of the more expansive lanscapes.


Multiplayer: You will be able to play The Gate of Realms with up to 4 friends LAN or online.



PVP/PVE Arena Mode: Battle other players online.


Mod support: Making and sharing mods will be made easy.


Language Support: The Gate of Realms will support English, Spanish, Swedish German, Russian and French languages at launch. Additional languages will be added later.




   Why IndieGoGo?
We've decided to use IndieGoGo so we can remain independent, and dedicate more time to working on The Gate of Realms. We want to open up to a community where everyone can help shape our game for the better and, we really feel that with the help of IndieGoGo we can create an amazing game. 



We've been developing The Gate of Realms in our free time for a few months now. We currently only have a pretty amazing terrain generator and weather systems. Some of the terrains like the sand dunes currently shift with the weather. our next goal is to work more on character mechanics. We really need to be able to dedicate more time to this project to develop better mechanics and assets. We plan to allow people into our game through its development and during its beta state, but we will work to finish the game. We don't want to drag this game through long unfinished process of small updates. We need funding for the following:



Work: Help us to be able to dedicate more time to working on The Gate of Realms over the next year.


Website: With more time to dedicate to this project we will be able to maintain a website to share development status for The Gate of Realms as well as maintain social media pages. 


Software & Equipment: Help us purchase and maintain software licencing and equiptment to keep this project moving forward.


Multiplayer Hosting: We would like to provide some dedicated servers for those who want an online multiplayer experience.


Music and Audio Effects: We know several talented musicians and sound effect artist that we would like to work with us to create an immersive sound track and spot on sound effects.

 Art & Assets: We plan to hire talented artists to work with us to help us bring our world to life and to refine and polish everything before it's release. 

 Porting: Help us bring our game to multiple platforms.


Translation: We plan to hire voice talent to create authentic regional dialects for voiced characters, as well as help with proper text translations where needed.



Our vision for The Gate of Realms is to make it a beautiful, fun, and innovative game, and by contributing to our campaign you can help make that happen. 


The Rewards?


The Full Game:
Everyone who contributes $25 or more to our IndieGoGo  will receive the full game of The Gate of Realms for the platform of their choice when it is released, and any further updates free, forever until the final release! The game is currently in a pre-alpha stage. We plan on developing it over the next few years, so there is much to come. It will be a digital download game only.


Exclusive Content:
All supporters will receive The Gate of Realms wallpapers. Some tiers reward you with special indieGoGo exclusive content. This content will mainly be an extra aesthetic style for crafted weapons and armor (except for higher tiers which have there own unique power).  We plan to create and release this content when the game is finished.
Some tiers reward you with a special companion creature that will follow and aid you wherever you go.


You/Your name in-game
All supporters will have there name or alias of choice featured in the credits page of The Gate of Realms. Some higher tiers will allow supporters to add a photo of themselves to be photo rendered as an oil painting that can be found in-game.

Digital Artbook
 For those of you who are interested in the development of assets from concept to final release, and things that may not make it into the game.


Name In-game Content
 Supporters of some tiers will have the ability to name in-game content that will be present in the beta and final releases of The Gate of Realms.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm TehOperator (http://www.twitch.tv/tehoperator) and I stream on Twitch. This week, I will be playing on Twitch to fundraise for 3 gaming charities in honor of my late father Chris Myre Sr. My dad loved playing video games and loved watching me play video games. I want to spread the love my dad had for me and video games to other gamers in need.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised here will be split evenly between Extra Life, Able Gamers, and Child's play. Whether or not we reach the goal, the funds will go to these charities. The perk is that you are going to make gamers in need very happy.

The Impact

Gaming has allowed me to see new things, meet new people, and have amazing stories. I want to help other gamers know these feelings. Gamers may not build homes and visit hospitals, but this enables us to use our skills to help children in significant ways.

Risks & Challenges

March is a hard month for me. My father died 8 days after my 22nd birthday. I am trying to make some positive come out of the experience. I will be playing for 80+ hours in 8 days to help other gamers and make March good again.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute your money, please contribute your time. Every share, like, tweet, or follow will benefit greatly. Share and spread the word! http://www.twitch.tv/tehoperator

story:
Did you know that about one third of all computer users suffer from RSI-related complaints? Posture and behavior are two significant contributors.  

The R-Go Break Mouse is an ergonomic vertical mouse that stimulates to keep the hand and arm in a natural position and indicates with colors how healthy you work!

As with all health-related issues, it is important to learn healthy behavior (such as eating healthy, exercising, listening to your body, and avoiding destructive behavior). We realize that behavioral change can be achieved; but this is a process and change will not occur over night. Most people are unaware how long they use the mouse or just leave their hand on the mouse without mousing. This is why we have developed not just an ergonomic mouse, but an ergonomic mouse which helps you to modify behavior.


Why ergonomic mousing?

With office work; the average person uses mouse and keyboard at least 6 hours per day. Based upon a 5 day work week this can result in about 7 full years of your life behind the computer! Understanding the relationship from human to the equipment is the first step. Followed with a proper workstation set-up. Lastly to avoid physical complaints the body should adopt a naturally, relaxed posture. This is obtainable with ergonomic tools by combining the user with the ergonomic R-Go Break Mouse.

The R-Go Break mouse:

- Indicates with color signals how healthy you work and when to take a break!

- Ensures you to move the mouse with the arm instead of the wrist

- Is a unique technology with "patent pending"

- Has an ergonomic vertical shape to eliminate twisting of the forearm


What makes the R-Go Break Mouse unique?

The R-Go Break mouse indicates with color signals how healthy you work: 

Green means"good to go", Orange means that you should take a little (micro) break and Red means that you forgot to take your break or that your total daily mousing hours are exceeded. By using (the similar functions of) trafficlight color indication simple, positive feedback is provided about healthy behavior of the user. The individual is encouraged to take frequent short breaks. These vital breaks will prevent overload of small muscles and tendons in the arm, wrist and hand while help the individual to easily (all be it subconsciously) change his/her behavior. 

As this idea to combine a healthy posture with visual indication to stimulate healthy behavior is completely NEW, we protected the idea and patented the technology for use on any input device! 


Technical Features

The R-Go Break Mouse is a lasermouse with adjustable DPI settings to 500, 1000,1800 and 2500 DPI! The mouse has 2 buttons on the front (right and left click) and a scrollwheel in the middle. Besides, a forward and backward button are located in the thumbrest. The Mouse is currently compatible with Windows, Mac, Linux.  
The mouse works with the standard Windows mouse driver. The application for the color indication was built in .NET and uses the HID-library to communicate with the mouse. 
Project Development

For over a year we have been working on the R-Go Break mouse.  In 2015 the finitial concept was developed. Together with electronic experts we developed the electronics to ensure the light could be controlled by the computer. 



The shape of the mouse that is used as base for the R-Go Break Mouse is similar to the HE-Mouse (developed several years ago and awarded for best input device in 2013 in The Netherlands). The R-Go Break Mouse has a vertical grip which provides a neutral, relaxed position of the hand and wrist. You move from the forearm instead of your wrist, which prevents RSI. The mouse fits comfortably in your hand, and supports your wrist and fingers.

Soon after we developed the concept we formed the R-Go Break -team and started working on the first prototype. When the technical details were defined in a functional requirement specification we had all the information to start the development of a prototype. 

The design of the R-Go Break Mouse as you see today was completed in May 2016. In the meantime we started the development of the production tools to prepare for starting production. 

The Team

The idea of R-Go Break was born by a cooperation between ergonomic experts, technical designers and marketing experts!

Vincent Bons Msc. and Anita Heij Bsc. (ergonomic consultant) were the inventors of the concept. Vincent is the technical lead for the project.

Daniel van Meeuwen LLM developed the functional specifications and Daniel will ensure all required certifications and documents will be available.

Steven, Job and Iris are responsible for the design of packaging and marketing materials.

Herman will ensure orders will be delivered in time

Jeroen Verbeek Msc. is responsible to bring the R-Go Break Mouse into the retail shelves. 

Timeline....

We are targeting for launching the product in the market in September 2016. This is ambitious but achievable with your help! Everything is prepared to get started, so from the moment we raised the required funds we will initiate production. We cannot wait, can you?

We need your support

We have been working hard to create the best ergonomic product possible, have it patented and now we want to release it to the world ASAP! We have finalized the prototype and currently are testing it. Now we need your help to get the tools financed to start volume production. Will you help us, so we can help you to work healthy behind your computer?

Will you help us, so we can help you to work healthy behind your computer?

story:
Bonjour à tous,

Je m'appelle Alain Truffier (Alias Angelstar) et je suis le créateur de plusieurs jeux en ligne dont 650km.com et Druidik.com.

J'ai fondé mon entreprise "Les mots dits Français" pour permettre aux milliers de joueurs en ligne de profiter de nouveaux concepts, add-on et animations au sein de mes jeux.


Ce projet de financement INDIEGOGO permet d'améliorer 650km.com en créant de nouveaux pack d'objets et scénarios pour les ruines.

Cette page INDIEGOGO vous permet de faire vos contributions en toute sécurité et de recevoir vos KM-POINTS sous 24 heures après le crédit des achats sur le compte de 650KM

Je vous invite à mettre à jour vos informations personnelles dans 650km.Com afin que je puisse faire la liaison entre le contributeur INDIEGOGO et le joueur de 650km!

Grâce à ces fonds il me sera possible de maintenir le jeu en état et également de pouvoir créer de nouveaux scénarios et objets pour les prochaines ruines.

Il est donc désormais possible d'utiliser vos cartes de crédits ainsi que vos comptes Paypal pour obtenir des KM-POINTS!

Comme ce projet et vos paiements sont liés à mon activités dans le jeu j'ai décidé de présenter une échelle de travaux qui sera fait en fonction de vos contributions totales :

PALIER DE CONTRIBUTION

TRAVAUX QUI SERONT EFFECTUES

300 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets en boutique (Pack outils, Pack pièges)

600 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

900 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets  basés sur les suggestions des joueurs (forum).

1200 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

1500 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets  basés sur les suggestions des joueurs (forum).

1800 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

2500 $

Nouveau livre et pleins de nouveaux objets à fabriquer!

Alain Truffier / Angelstar

story:
"The Boating Buddy is a tank free alternative to common diving".

 

The story behind Boating Buddy

The idea and set up of Boating Buddy originally came about through a Sheffield based company named Think On! that supports innovation and young entrepreneurs. They provide the infrastructure to young budding business people who have the drive and ability to succeed if pointed in the right direction and the support for inventors who may not have the time, resources or skills to pursue their idea. To find out a little bit more about ThinkOn! click on the links below:

-http://www.thinkon-uk.com

-http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/business/ideas-incubator-seeks-innovative-youngsters-1-5096456#.UJkmZFyZqbs.twitter

Fortunately, I was lucky enough to be one of the individuals they agreed to help...and so Boating Buddy was born!

What is the Boating Buddy?

Boating Buddy is a simple dive system aimed at depths up to 10m to enable crew to be able to free ropes around propellers, clear mooring & anchor lines, assess and fix below water level damage, hull cleaning and general maintenance. Not to mention shallow diving for pleasure!!!

The system consists of:

  • a compact compressor that attaches to the boat battery, 
  • a length of pipe attaching the compressor to a second stage regulator (mouth piece), 
  • an emergency life jacket
  • a diving mask 
  • a diving knife. 
  • all in one simple, easy to use Boating Buddy bag!
The system is exceedingly compact and can be stowed easily on board for use when required. Unlike carrying a diving tank, which will probably have been drained for pleasure diving, this will always provide an air source. 
Boat Maintenance in Ibiza

Why the Boating Buddy?

  • Save a fortune on expensive tanks and professional equipment.
  • Lightweight and Easy to use.
  • Takes just minutes to set up before you're ready to dive.
  • Last of all, It's just GREAT FUN!

Attach your Boating Buddy to your boat battery, clip yourself into your jacket and you're ready to go!

Though not compulsory we strongly recommend diving tuition prior to using the product as we cannot accept any liability other than that, related to the malfunction of the product.

What We Need & What You Get

Parts: http://pcpartpicker.com/p/br3W

Necessary amount for this build. It will help me get a job through youtube.

The Impact

I wish to have a career entertaining people on the internet.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can give me words of advice for the future, or advice on how to go big on youtube. Thats pretty much it, but it would help a lot.

story:
Games are awesome. Making games is awesome. You are awesome. Mix these together and what do you get? ... AWESOME³ !

Have you ever sat there while playing a game thinking: "Man, this level sucks. I could do better if I just knew how! ", I mean haven't we all thought that at least once? 

How about sitting through a game and thinking "Man, this story is getting seriously boring. I wish I could make my own game. I'd make it 100 times more awesome than this!"

Well, that's why I'm here today - To give you thesuperpowers to create the video-games of your dreams. Well alright, they're not really superpowers, but what I am giving you is the knowledge and skills you'll need to be able to create your very own video-game !



The goal of the project is to teach every child, adult and elder how to create video-games in an easy, fun and enjoyable experience! The book will be available digitally for free and for the cost of printing in physical form. I will be sending the book to as many libraries around the World to help get it in front of as many children, adults and elderly people as possible so everyone can create their dream video-game.

With the funding, I will also be able to translate the book into multiple languages; So every single person on the planet will be able to create their dream video-game!


My name is Ryan Shah! I'm a published writer and Lead Developer @ Kitatus Studios! 

Boasting over 10 years of experience creating video-games, I have worked on an assortment of different programs to create video-game experiences. 

Before creating video-games, I was a freelance Writer; Self-Publishing my own stories.

And now, I'm here to teach anyone and everyone who wants to join the Game Development industry. I had a dream of showing as many people the ropes to Game Development as possible; Helping them to dive right in and that's why I'm here.

Before doing this, I wrote and published a FREE Unreal Engine 4 Blueprints book, to teach as many people as possible about Unreal Engine 4 and how it's so simple to create your own video-games WITHOUT writing a line of code! 

A link to this FREE book is available here: CLICK ME.

I enjoyed writing this book so much that I wanted to continue to do so; But I wanted to expand. I wanted to help teach not just Unreal Engine 4 users, but people who want to make video-games, but they don't know how. AND THUS... "So You Want To Make A Video-Game?" was born!


We'll start from the top, making sure we nail every detail of our dream game before bringing it to life. But don't worry about walls and walls of text, oh no. This adventure will be filled with fun, excitement, doodles and screenshots all aimed at making sure you're having the fun you deserve while creating the game that you've been itching to create!

From the planning phase, we'll go straight into making concept art and continue head-on into the Design phase; This means planning how the levels will look, what the characters will look like and many awesome things all to do with designing our game!

Once we've mastered the Design phase, we'll transcend over to the "Production" phase. What's the "Production Phase"? - Well, my friend, it's the meat and bones of making video-games; Actually bringing your idea to life. We'll be using Unreal Engine 4 to turn your dreams into reality and to make sure your game is "Next-Gen" compatible!

Once we complete the project, we'll jump on over to the "Release" phase, in which I'll help guide you through where you can sell your project, who to talk to in terms of getting your project some exposure as well as submitting your project to Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo and Steam.

We'll also be learning about Photoshop, Blender, FL Studio, Audacity, Unreal Engine 4 and Google Drive and how they help us on this adventure to creating our Dream Video-Game!

How does that sound to you? To me it sounds like a huge adventure in which I can't wait to get started! Do you want to know the best part? I hope to release this whole adventure for the grand total of £0 (US: $0, Euro: 0, Everywhere else: $0). But before we do, I need your help! In order to bring this adventure to life, I need as much help as I can get to help fund the book. 


In order to bring this project to life; I've turned to you all for help. Why? Because in order to create the book, I need some funding or it won't be possible! 

This is because in order to take the time out to write the book, Funding helps me focus on the book, so there is no need to get alternative employment to fund the book myself. This means that the book can come out faster; And of the highest possible quality!

Another reason why funding is essential to the book is storage; In order to put all of the content of the book online (So you can use it in your own projects, take it apart to see how it ticks or refer to it if you get stuck), I need to purchase a server to store all of this content. And they don't come cheap!

So not only will the funding help the FREE book come out Faster; But the book will be of the highest possibly quality and will have a dedicated server for every single piece of content in the book (For your own non-commercial and commercial uses!)

I am also planning of sending the book to multiple libraries all over the World, as well paying for translators to translate the book into as many languages as possible, to help get every child, adult and elder who wants to create video-games doing so!

This all isn't a cheap endeavour; Banks would laugh at me for trying to create free content, so I have turned to you wonderful people. And to thank-you for your contributions; I have set up a few Perks such as your name credited in the book, exclusive versions of the book and even a free copy of my video-game Super Distro Horizons!


    I understand that not everyone can contribute; But there are still other ways that you can help the cause (And every man, woman and child who wants to create video-games!). If you'd like to support us but can't contribute the best thing you can do to help is:
    Spreading the Word - Sending this campaign to your family, friends and pets will help get the word out and let more people know about our initiative and goal!
story_txt:
Games are awesome. Making games is awesome. You are awesome. Mix these together and what do you get? ... AWESOME³ !
Have you ever sat there while playing a game thinking: "Man, this level sucks. I could do better if I just knew how! ", I mean haven't we all thought that at least once? 
How about sitting through a game and thinking "Man, this story is getting seriously boring. I wish I could make my own game. I'd make it 100 times more awesome than this!"
Well, that's why I'm here today - To give you thesuperpowers to create the video-games of your dreams. Well alright, they're not really superpowers, but what I am giving you is the knowledge and skills you'll need to be able to create your very own video-game !



The goal of the project is to teach every child, adult and elder how to create video-games in an easy, fun and enjoyable experience! The book will be available digitally for free and for the cost of printing in physical form. I will be sending the book to as many libraries around the World to help get it in front of as many children, adults and elderly people as possible so everyone can create their dream video-game.With the funding, I will also be able to translate the book into multiple languages; So every single person on the planet will be able to create their dream video-game!




My name is Ryan Shah! I'm a published writer and Lead Developer @ Kitatus Studios! 


Boasting over 10 years of experience creating video-games, I have worked on an assortment of different programs to create video-game experiences. 
Before creating video-games, I was a freelance Writer; Self-Publishing my own stories.
And now, I'm here to teach anyone and everyone who wants to join the Game Development industry. I had a dream of showing as many people the ropes to Game Development as possible; Helping them to dive right in and that's why I'm here.


Before doing this, I wrote and published a FREE Unreal Engine 4 Blueprints book, to teach as many people as possible about Unreal Engine 4 and how it's so simple to create your own video-games WITHOUT writing a line of code! 

A link to this FREE book is available here: CLICK ME.
I enjoyed writing this book so much that I wanted to continue to do so; But I wanted to expand. I wanted to help teach not just Unreal Engine 4 users, but people who want to make video-games, but they don't know how. AND THUS... "So You Want To Make A Video-Game?" was born!



We'll start from the top, making sure we nail every detail of our dream game before bringing it to life. But don't worry about walls and walls of text, oh no. This adventure will be filled with fun, excitement, doodles and screenshots all aimed at making sure you're having the fun you deserve while creating the game that you've been itching to create!
From the planning phase, we'll go straight into making concept art and continue head-on into the Design phase; This means planning how the levels will look, what the characters will look like and many awesome things all to do with designing our game!
Once we've mastered the Design phase, we'll transcend over to the "Production" phase. What's the "Production Phase"? - Well, my friend, it's the meat and bones of making video-games; Actually bringing your idea to life. We'll be using Unreal Engine 4 to turn your dreams into reality and to make sure your game is "Next-Gen" compatible!
Once we complete the project, we'll jump on over to the "Release" phase, in which I'll help guide you through where you can sell your project, who to talk to in terms of getting your project some exposure as well as submitting your project to Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo and Steam.
We'll also be learning about Photoshop, Blender, FL Studio, Audacity, Unreal Engine 4 and Google Drive and how they help us on this adventure to creating our Dream Video-Game!
How does that sound to you? To me it sounds like a huge adventure in which I can't wait to get started! Do you want to know the best part? I hope to release this whole adventure for the grand total of £0 (US: $0, Euro: 0, Everywhere else: $0). But before we do, I need your help! In order to bring this adventure to life, I need as much help as I can get to help fund the book. 



In order to bring this project to life; I've turned to you all for help. Why? Because in order to create the book, I need some funding or it won't be possible! 
This is because in order to take the time out to write the book, Funding helps me focus on the book, so there is no need to get alternative employment to fund the book myself. This means that the book can come out faster; And of the highest possible quality!
Another reason why funding is essential to the book is storage; In order to put all of the content of the book online (So you can use it in your own projects, take it apart to see how it ticks or refer to it if you get stuck), I need to purchase a server to store all of this content. And they don't come cheap!
So not only will the funding help the FREE book come out Faster; But the book will be of the highest possibly quality and will have a dedicated server for every single piece of content in the book (For your own non-commercial and commercial uses!)
I am also planning of sending the book to multiple libraries all over the World, as well paying for translators to translate the book into as many languages as possible, to help get every child, adult and elder who wants to create video-games doing so!
This all isn't a cheap endeavour; Banks would laugh at me for trying to create free content, so I have turned to you wonderful people. And to thank-you for your contributions; I have set up a few Perks such as your name credited in the book, exclusive versions of the book and even a free copy of my video-game Super Distro Horizons!
  

I understand that not everyone can contribute; But there are still other ways that you can help the cause (And every man, woman and child who wants to create video-games!). If you'd like to support us but can't contribute the best thing you can do to help is:
Spreading the Word - Sending this campaign to your family, friends and pets will help get the word out and let more people know about our initiative and goal!

story:
Etch-Master is a range of photo-etched metal parts for adding super-fine details to your 28mm scale gaming miniatures and gaming scenery. Photo-etching uses photographic artwork and acid to etch away thin sheets of metal (normally brass) to leave exquisitely detailed metal parts. 

Such details have been used on historical scale models for many years but Etch-Master are now aiming to introduce this 'super-detailing' to fantasy and sci-fi miniatures and gaming. The aim of our crowd-funding campaign is to cover design and tooling costs to launch the Etch-Master range with four different sheets of details, each with a theme. The first four sheets are:


The Products:

'Battle-Zone Details':

For use with:  

(Copyright Mantic Entertainment 2014)

Designed under license and specifically for use with Mantic's awesome 'Battle-Zones' modular plastic sci-fi scenery this sheet features 3D ammo crates, corporation signage, plague symbols, razor wire, vents and even ladder rungs to add super-detailing to your scenery.

Here's some examples of the prototypes of these parts in use:


'Steampunk Details':

The Steampunk Details sheet includes parts to detail Steampunk themed miniatures and scenery. From multi-part clockwork wings to Victorian style gun-blades and, of course, lots of cogs... this sheet has everything you'll need for your Steampunk models.


'Sci-Fi Details':

The Sci-Fi Details sheet includes weapons, accessories and scenery/basing details for your 28mm scale miniatures. From the awesome 9-part 'anti-material rifle' to power-sword blades and combat knives this sheet includes a multitude of weapon options plus basing/scenery details for your sci-fi themed models.


'Fantasy Details':

The Fantasy Details sheet features an array of fantasy sword blades, hand guards and parts from elven style blades to rusted 'undead' swords. There are shields, daggers, belts and even lock mechanisms for flintlock rifles to make your 28mm scale fantasy miniatures really stand out.


'Backer-Designed Sheet':

Should we pass 200 backers in our campaign we will be putting together a very special sheet of details and weapons designed by YOU... the backers of this campaign. If you have a design for a sword, a gun, something you want made for your models, please upload a sketch or image of what you want to make to our facebook page, here: www.facebook.com/etchmaster and we will then ask our Facebook followers to vote on which they like the best. The most popular (and feasible) designs will be included in this special sheet and then, when the campaign finishes, every backer who has pledged at the $40 level or higher will receive one of these sheets. This sheet will not be available by any other means, it will only be given to our IndieGoGo backers.


The story behind Etch-Master:

My name is Ben Jarvis or 'Rocketandroll' on most miniature forums. In 2006 I got back into painting gaming miniatures, something I'd enjoyed as a kid, with the aim of fulfilling a childhood dream of winning a 'Slayer Sword', the most coveted prize in the miniature-painting world.

It took me three years of trying, lots of models and the friendship and encouragement of a lot of great people in the miniature-painting, modelling and gaming world to finally lift that sword above my head in 2009.

The model that won was called 'The Clockmaker' and it stood out because of the fact it used lots of custom photo-etched brass parts in the model. I was just not content with the level of detail available in plastic and resin miniatures, I wanted to make things finer, smaller, more intricate. 

At a scale modelling show in 2007 I came across photo-etched brass sheets of details for tanks and scale vehicles. Looking into the technology it became obvious this medium could be used to make tiny detailing parts for my miniatures. I found a UK company who could make custom photo-etched metal sheets for me and set about learning what could and couldn't be achieved using this technique.

After using these custom details on a few models, including a couple that won awards at painting competitions, people started asking me what they were and where they could get some.... my answer at the time was... well, I guess I can make some for you?

It was only in 2013 that the idea of doing this commercially as a proper product-line occurred to me and I decided to begin work on launching the Etch-Master range.

Using what I have learnt over the six years I've been designing these sheets, and still looking at new ways this medium can be used, I have now started selling the first Etch-Master sheets in April 2014. The trouble is that there is a LOT of time involved in designing and developing these sheets and a cost associated with producing the photo-tools to get them made in large quantities. That is why we are here on IndieGoGo trying to get this full range of exciting details off the ground.

Here's some pictures of some of the weapons that can be made from our detailing sheets:


Thank you for helping support this idea!


The Products - what you get:

Each of our sheets is etched from high-quality brass that is 0.01 inches/0.25mm thick. Each sheet is just under 4 inches square (95mm X 95mm). The sheets are supplied on a card backing sheet in a resealable polythene bag.  We will be uploading photo-tutorials on how to assemble and use the parts in each sheet to our website during the campaign.

We are also offering our Etch-Master branded stainless steel needle-point tweezers which are idea for handling and working with our products. These have a matt black coating on the handles and are emblazoned with the Etch-Master logo in gold.


Pledging and prices:

You can pledge for the number of sheets you want to get now and then specify the mix of sheet designs you will get at the end of the campaign. You don't have to decide which ones you want now. All the sheets are the same size and the same price (excluding the steel sheets offered as extras which are individually priced below).

If you want to 'dabble' and see what these sheets are all about, you can go for a single-sheet pledge at $11 and decide later which sheet you want to try. If you like the look of the 'Battle Zones' scenery detailing sheet for example and know you want four or five sheets of that, but also want to try using some of the Sci-Fi weapons on your troopers, you could go for the 8-sheet option at $75 and choose the quantities of which sheets you want once it comes to shipping time. As the number of sheets in the pledge increases, the cost per-sheet decreases. Buy more, they'll cost less.

All prices at all pledge levels include postage and packaging to UK and US addresses (by standard surface mail). If you are elsewhere in the world please add the small amount listed next to each pledge level to cover postage costs.

EXTRA SHEETS:

If you want a specific number of sheets not offered in the existing pledge levels, please choose the pledge level below and then add $10 USD on to your pledge for every extra sheet you require. If you are outside the USA or the UK please also add $0.50 for postage and packaging for every extra sheet added.


Fulfilment:

Yes, it will be fast! We are quoting that fulfillment should be within a month and a half or so of the campaign finishing. The process of making the photo-tool and then mass-producing these sheets is a quick one (once the design is done) so we are confident we can ship all rewards within a matter of weeks of the campaign ending rather than months.


Stretch-Goals:

$3600 Strech Goal - Steel Blades! - UNLOCKED!

We have now hit the goal and unlocked the first stretch-goal, the 1/6th and 1/12th scale double-sided stainless steel blades sheets. These stunning steel sheets add an incredible level of realism to large figures and cult toys.

These are available in two scales, 6" (1/12) scale where the sword blades are around 55mm/2.3" long and 12" (1/6th) scale where the sword blades are around 115mm/4.6" long. The blades are etched from stainless steel about 0.5mm (20 thou) thick making them rigid enough not to bend under normal play use. Be warned, these do not have sharpened edges but do have sharp points and will be potentially dangerous, these are NOT meant as toys!

These two scales are popular with large-scale figures, collectors toys, action figures and plastic mecha kits and look incredibly realistic (well, they are REAL steel blades!)

Here is a pic of an assembled 1/6th katana. Please note the black handle/grip is hand-made and not part of the sheet supplied. We aim to offer cast resin handles/grips for these blades after the IndieGoGo campaign but for now these blades, like the smaler blades, require some modelmaking or a donor plastic handle from another weapon to work.

You can now add these sheets to your reward by adding:

$15 each for the 1/12th scale steel blades sheet (+$1/sheet for postage outside the UK or USA)

$22 each for the 1/6th scale steel blades sheet (+ $2/sheet for postage outside the UK or USA)

Note: these are more costly than the standard brass sheets as the process of double-sided etching of steel is much more costly than thin single-sided brass and in the case of the 1/6th sheet, the sheet is much larger than the standard brass sheets too. These sheets cannot be chosen as part of your standard reward sheets due to this higher cost.

If you ONLY want these steel blades please pledge the relevant amount based on the above pricing and then set your perk at any level below that amount. We will ask what you actually want in the survey at the end of the campaign.


$5000 Strech Goal - 54mm Steel Blades! -UNLOCKED!!

We've now unlocked the 54mm details sheet stretch goal, we are still deciding if this should be a one-sided brass sheet or a double-sided stainless steel sheet but will include various blades, shields and details in 54mm/2" or 1/35th scale.

Please comment on the comments page and let us know which you would prefer, pics of the sheet coming at the end of the week!


Look for more details and stretch-goal designs coming as the campaign progresses!

story:
A few years ago we ported the solitaire minigame from SHENZHEN I/O to MS-DOS and sold floppy disks with the game and its source code. It was a surprising success!

Not long after the release of EXAPUNKS in 2018 we started working on an NES port of HACK*MATCH, the game's hacking-themed action puzzle minigame. Little did we realize it would take us two years to complete and involve writing our own C compiler for the 6502. But now we're done and we want to share it with you!

What You Get

Since the game is already finished, the only real purpose of this campaign is to take orders for physical cartridges. You'll get a custom cartridge and a matching box, along with a ROM file and the source code for the game. The NES version of HACK*MATCH is very similar to the original minigame version, but also includes a new two-player versus mode that is a lot of fun.

You'll also get the source code for the C compiler we wrote to compile the game, which is written in C#, targets the NES, and only supports the subset of C that we ended up using. No float support here! You probably shouldn't expect to use the compiler for your own projects, although there's nothing to stop you from doing so.

NTSC vs. PAL: We only designed for and tested the game on NTSC hardware. Although we suspect it will run on a PAL NES it will run at a slower speed, both for gameplay and music. It seems like it'd be easy to make a PAL-specific version, so if you're genuinely interested in this and would be able to help test you should email me first so that we can figure out the details. Otherwise, assume that you are getting the NTSC version of the game.

Risks & Challenges

We've tested the game on an original NTSC NES and will be testing every cartridge we make, but it's possible that if you have some other type of hardware that you use to play NES games it won't work on that. But it probably should, right? As with any of our games, contact us if you have any questions or concerns before or after the campaign and we'll do our best to help.

story:
END OF AN ERA - AND LAUNCH!

After an astonishing campaign, and a truly incredible period of on-demand buying, our Indiegogo journey is over. From today you can no longer purchase perks here. 

In just a couple of days, on the 17th of July, GameGlass launches for our existing backers and Early Access list. Then, on the 24th, GameGlass will be open to all. 

Thank you so much to all our Indiegogo backers. 

Stay tuned for our new website and store.


 

GameGlass is a platform for second-screen experiences, for many of the games you love. Immersive, intuitive, and seamless.

All in one place.

GameGlass lets you interact with games directly from a touchscreen device, with ultra-fast low-latency controls.

Do you have an iPhone or Android phone? You can use GameGlass.

Do you have a beautiful high resolution Galaxy Tab or iPad Pro? You can absolutely use GameGlass.

Do you have a janky old tablet gathering dust from when your kids or spouse abandoned it? Repurpose that tech into a futuristic gaming control screen.

 

 

GameGlass makes interacting with complex game control systems easy and immersive. Instead of struggling to remember which keyboard key lowers your landing gear, getting it wrong and firing a countermeasure at a space station, you just reach out and tap a clearly labelled button.

Beautifully designed, easy to read, with subtle animations, audio queues and even haptic feedback - each control screen is designed specifically for each game and function.

 

 

GameGlass has been designed and built to allow us to easily add new games, and easily switch between them.

Each game inside GameGlass is a broken up into bundles of features called Shards. For example there might be one Shard for flight controls, and another for something more specific like trading or managing loadouts.

Our games roadmap is always evolving and expanding:

 

 

Our team are all huge fans, we came together through the community. But we wanted to build a better way to interact with such a complex game.

So the first game GameGlass will support is Star Citizen. And we’re already well into development.

 

 

The Flight Systems Shard puts all the core flight controls at your fingertips, with a focus on giving you everything you need to get your ship from A to B easily and without fuss.

 

 

Combat is fast paced and requires quick access to controls. So an interface that is readable at a glance, with intuitive access to important functions, can make a huge difference. The Shields & Combat Shard lets you quickly access most combat-related controls.

 

 

One of our most requested Shards is designed around social interactions. This Shard is a collection of three features that let you quickly access emotes, take stunning in-game photos and even manage a gallery of your photos right inside GameGlass.

 

 

GameGlass fits into any gaming setup - whether you have a full SimPit packed with mounts and top-end gear, a nice HOTAS or HOSAS, or just want to make your keyboard or mouse setup easier to use.

In a hardcore SimPit you can connect multiple touchscreens to GameGlass, showing different Shards on each. You can even mix sizes and resolutions.

If you have a nice joystick, HOTAS or HOSAS. Using GameGlass you can add touch access to more functions, which is great for people without dozens of switches and dials.

And just by loading GameGlass on your phone next to your keyboard and mouse you instantly have far more intuitive and faster access to many in-game controls. 

 

GameGlass is a service that will continually improve and expand, and we want to give you options for how you can access it.

You will always be able to create a GameGlass account for free. Every game we support will have at least 1 basic Shard you can use for free. For Star Citizen that includes Flight Systems, Shields & Combat, and the new Vehicle Systems Shards.

A simple all-access subscription gives you all the Shards, for all the games. You can also upgrade your subscription to get access to some extra bonuses.

If you'd rather buy Shards outright, you can do that too. You'll get all the updates for your Shards in the future.

 

 

Pre-Alpha is underway, over 50 people from our community have been testing GameGlass and providing feedback. We're getting very close to the wider Alpha for everyone who has that item in their Perk.

Alpha has been announced for March 3rd (PST).

GameGlass is well into development, we have the Flight Systems and Shields & Combat Shards up and working, and implementation is underway on the Social Shard.

Our current plan is to release move on to a Beta in late March/early April.

If you'd like to take a deeper look at GameGlass in operation, you can check out our YouTube channel here.

 

 

When we launch, you'll be able to choose between the basic Shards that come with a free account, a simple subscription for everything, or once-off Shard purchases. 

If you'd like to get in early though, we've put together some perks that give you great discounts on subscriptions and bonuses. 

We're also offering special lifetime perks. These will give you access to every Shard for every game we support, for ever. These will only be available during this campaign.

6 Months

This gives you 6 months of access to all games and Shards. Starting from when we release (not Alpha or Beta).

Annual

1 year of access to all the games on GameGlass, and all their Shards. We'll announce the roadmap of games we intend to support soon, but expect more space and flight sims, RPGs, and even MOBAs. All built with the same level of care, immersion and ease of use you see in our Star Citizen Shards. And obviously this will start when we release.

 

 

Depending on the perk level you choose, you will get a different package of benefits. These include:

Beta - A larger testing wave, focused on polish. We're aiming for March

All games - You will be able to access GameGlass features for every game we support. Bring your own copy of the games though, that's not included

All Shards - Use every Shard for a game, instead of just the base Shards that come with the free GameGlass account

 

 

Our plans for Alpha and Beta currently include only the Flight Systems and Shields & Combat Shards. But since announcing the project we've also been flooded with requests to help get this made faster. 

All the excitement, hype and positive encouragement has pushed us to aim higher. So if we reach our funding goal we'll be able to add two new Shards to the Beta (they're unlikely to be in the Alpha).

Mining

Using an intuitive gesture-based interface you will be able to manage your mining beam throttle, scan for valuable mining resources, and even view data on profitable minerals, routes, and locations.

Ground Vehicles

Vehicles have many different functions to ships, and we have some very cool plans for an interface for interacting with vehicle systems, including the basics such as lights and power, plus extras like turrets and scanners.

 

 

$10,000 - Ship Databank Shard (FUNDED)

 

A Shard filled with data and intelligence for all the ships in Star Citizen - right inside GameGlass.

Use it to help find the right ship for your mission by looking up cargo space, QT range etc.

Or use it to help plan tactics for that juicy "adversarial acquisition" target by looking up shield capacity, hard points and speed.

Hitting this stretch goal will let us accelerate development of this Shard by adding a new team member (or contractor) to tackle it. It won't be included in the very initial release of GameGlass, but will come out approx. 2 months sooner than it would otherwise.

 

$25,000 - Themes & Visuals (FUNDED)

 

You'll be able to swap visual themes for Star Citizen Shards, using simple game preferences.

We want these to be visually impactful, including new animations, artwork and colour shifts.

Some Shards will see large visual changes, including including new animations and artwork. For example we want to create bespoke themes for each ship manufacturer that will apply to the Flight System and Shields & Combat Shards.

Themes for other Shards may focus more on colour shifts.

Hitting this stretch goal will allow us to accelerate delivery of this feature, adding it to GameGlass approx. 3 months earlier.

Please note - changing visual themes will not be a feature included in the free tier of GameGlass.


$50,000 - Mobile & Fragments (FUNDED)
 

GameGlass has always been designed to evolve as we add support for new games, and create new Shards. But we've not yet talked about how it can evolve to meet your personal, unique needs.

We design primarily around tablets for our Shards, they're a good size for our layouts and for accurate touch.

But not everyone has a tablet. You all have mobile phones though, right? (sorry)

What if you just want to prop your phone up next to your screen? What if you have a few old phones you'd like to arrange around your monitor, like the cockpit of your favorite ship?

We didn't just want to do a smaller mobile version of our Shards. Instead we designed a new, modular way to give you tightly focused pieces of Shards, and let you decide where they go.


We call them Fragments.

Let's take the Shields & Combat Shard for example. It has three sections: power, targeting and shields.

Each of these sections is a Fragment, and we've designed them to fit neatly on your mobile phone.
 


(early concept)


You can easily select which Fragment is shown on each of your connected devices, mixing and matching Fragments to suit your personal needs.
 


(early concept)

 

Maybe a scanning Fragment next to your joystick during exploration runs?

Perhaps an "industrial" array below your monitor, with Fragments for Mining, Trade and Shields?

You decide which Fragments to use, and which devices they appear on.

Another great thing about our Fragment tech is they enable you to customize a dashboard on your tablet. You can pick any two Fragments and display them side by side. Giving you flexibility to create a layout that suits your mission or activity.

 


(early concept)

 

While Fragments are designed for mobile phones, you're not forced to use them. If you have a large phone you can choose to use the standard tablet layouts.

If we hit the $50,000 goal we will create Fragments for Flight Systems Shields & Combat and the social shards, and make them available when GameGlass goes live or within the first update.

Hitting this goal during this campaign allows us to accelerate development of this feature and deliver these Fragments approx. 4 months early.

 

$100,000 and beyond

 

Hey everyone.

Fragments are coming!

We just posted an update to our Indiegogo campaign page, you can check it out here -

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/gameglass-po...

We're going to take a break from stretch goals for a while. We want to focus on making the features we've committed to as amazing as possible. We have a few ideas though, and after we've done some scouting we'll report back on where we aim from here. Stay tuned. Big things are on the way. The GameGlass team.

 

 

GameGlass was co-founded by Andy Lee and Craig Sartor. Craig had been working on SCPADD, which was teased to the community resulting in a wave of hype. Andy had been working on a platform for uniting companion-apps for games in a single place. 

Andy has over 15 years experience managing software delivery teams, designing marketing campaigns and running business operations. He's the marketing and business guy.

Craig has been a full-stack developer and digital marketing designer for many years. He's the design and product guy.

They quickly formed a new team to accelerate their efforts, and have been added 3 other members.

Mike S wrote the client app that underpins much of how GameGlass works, and with his expertise in software security helps ensure your data is locked down.

Sjoerd Arendsen is building our server architecture from sunny Amsterdam, and is responsible for much of the core platform features.

 

All GameGlass content and interfaces are copyright of GameGlass Inc. All rights reserved.

All images, graphics and audio of Star Citizen are copyright Cloud Imperium. GameGlass is not endorsed by or affiliated with the Cloud Imperium or Roberts Space Industries group of companies. All Star Citizen game content and materials are copyright Cloud Imperium Rights LLC and Cloud Imperium Rights Ltd.. Star Citizen, Squadron 42, Roberts Space Industries, and Cloud Imperium are registered trademarks of Cloud Imperium Rights LLC. All rights reserved.

Then, on the 24th, GameGlass will be open to all. Thank you so much to all our Indiegogo backers. Stay tuned for our new website and store. GameGlass is a platform for second-screen experiences, for many of the games you love. story:
Our Story

Caladon Falls is Savage Mojo’s first foray into fantasy setting books designed for Savage Suzerain, using Pinnacle's award-winning Savage Worlds rules. Kicked off in November as a PDF, we’ve been asked repeatedly when it will be in print. With your help, we’d like to answer that with, “Before Gen Con 2011!”

As the trailer shows, there are a lot of people who have worked their hearts out to produce a top-notch, high-art, high-quality roleplaying game (RPG) book packed with stunning visuals, intriguing plots, and inventive prose. Caladon Falls is brought to you by names you’ll know and those we hope will become some of your new favorites. And every one of us wants you to experience Caladon Falls the most complete way possible: by owning it for yourself – in print.

Those Names You Know

We are fortunate to have a combination of established talent and people breaking into the business. Fresh ideas, a ton of energy, and experience abound, culminating in collaborative creations just not likely without both groups. Here are a few people who worked on the Caladon Falls project that you might recognize:

  • Aaron Acevedo - award-winning artist, longtime Savage Worlds contributor, and former art director at Pinnacle (Evernight, Deadlands: Reloaded (Origins Award Winner), Solomon Kane, Slipstream, Pirates of the Spanish Main). 
  • Phil Brucato - award-winning author best known for Mage: The Ascension, Werewolf: The Apocalypse, Mage: The Sorcerer' Crusade, and Deliria: Faerie Tales for a New Millennium. 
  • Jason Engle - award-winning Dungeons & Dragons, L5R, Star Wars, World of Warcraft, and Magic the Gathering artist.
  • John Wick - award-winning creator of L5R, 7th Sea, and Houses of the Blooded.  

The Impact

Funds raised through this campaign go toward the production costs of a 750 book, limited edition print-run for Caladon Falls in its full glory. Each book is hard cover containing full-color interiors on high-quality paper. Those who choose to support us at qualifying tiers will get a copy shipped to them along with any other goodies at their chosen tier. Your generosity will help us gain the ability to put additional books on retailers’ shelves for others to access, increasing awareness of our company and introducing more gamers to the Suzerain Universe. If we do not meet our full goal, the funds will still be used to provide the perks promised and put some copies on our convention tables by way of an alternative printing plan.

What We Need & What You Get

We have twelve tiers to enable you to help as you wish. Every sponsor matters and every increment helps! From $1 to simply be remembered as helping to $39 to get not just the physical book, but also the accompanying PDFs of both the full GM's book and the player's guide to our super-crazy, $549 Patron of Suzerain tier with so much stuff you won't believe we're offering it. Printed Gamescapes maps, custom character sheets, short stories dedicated to you, and so much more are available just because you want to help us reach our goals.

If you want to see the various products you will be getting at each of the tiers, here's a link to our shop where you can see what's a Grasslands Gamescape or a Noir Knight print/PDF bundle, for instance.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this site with others to get the word out and speed up the print process. The faster we reach our goal, the quicker we can move to print. We appreciate anything you can do to help us with letting people know what we're up to. Post to your favorite forums; share on Facebook; link via Twitter; tell your game group; do whatever you're most comfortable doing and know you've helped people who just want to do what they love while earning a bit here and there to pay the bills.

What People are Saying about Caladon Falls

Tommy Brownell of The Most Unread Blog Ever bullets his favorite things about Caladon Falls, “Amazing production values as always. More neat new Edges and Hindrances. A unique fantasy campaign with a military theme but a lot of variety that shows what Suzerain can do pre-Heroic rank.”

On DriveThruRPG, Dillard Rape has a lot to say, “Bottom line this is a five star [out of five stars] product…The art is superb. The setting material is enough to get you into the game immediately and Savage Mojo has tons of freebies online. The critters are imaginative. The villains are well thought out and original. It’s a military campaign with your characters as irregular forces. Maybe not the first time this has been done, but one of the best that I have seen.

“I love military fiction and this is good military fantasy...and quite compelling.

“Well worth the price."

Book Details

What exactly are Caladon Falls' contents? Good question! Here's the back cover:

They came out of nowhere and started ripping the world apart, one city at a time. Using power on a scale never before seen, Warlocks, godlike leaders of the Wild army, are rampaging on Austeria with one goal: raise armies and annihilate the entire continent. Set in the fantasy realm of Relic, this book looks at warfare through the eyes of everyday people turned soldiers – soldiers whose side is losing the war.

Take the challenge. Roleplay in a fantasy world where hairless dwarves walk through stone, magic is commonplace, and the spirit world doesn't always stay in check. Focus on a daily life and death struggle where the enemy is cruel, powerful, and around every corner. Take the challenge, and let your adventurers become...

...mankind’s only hope.

Inside the covers you’ll find 144 pages with:

* Heaps of world detail you’ll need to run games in Suzerain’s Relic realm during the War of the Wild.

* Over 50 new Edges, Hindrances, and Powers, including three new playable races.

* Stats for dozens of heroes and villains alike, plus an assortment of soldiers and monsters from the war.

* A finely-tuned setting in which to take your characters from Novices to Heroes.

* 30 scenarios including a full plot-point campaign covering the arrival of the Warlocks and the fight for survival in the Caladon Kingdom.

We have unlocked Relic, the Suzerain Universe’s fantasy realm. Now’s the time, when all kinds of perks are in place for our IndieGoGo sponsors. Come, explore, and answer the Savage call to be Caladon’s only hope.

What People are Saying about Caladon Falls
Tommy Brownell of The Most Unread Blog Ever bullets his favorite things about Caladon Falls, “Amazing production values as always. More neat new Edges and Hindrances. A unique fantasy campaign with a military theme but a lot of variety that shows what Suzerain can do pre-Heroic rank.”
On DriveThruRPG, Dillard Rape has a lot to say, “Bottom line this is a five star [out of five stars] product…The art is superb. The setting material is enough to get you into the game immediately and Savage Mojo has tons of freebies online. The critters are imaginative. The villains are well thought out and original. It’s a military campaign with your characters as irregular forces. Maybe not the first time this has been done, but one of the best that I have seen.“I love military fiction and this is good military fantasy...and quite compelling.“Well worth the price."
Book Details
What exactly are Caladon Falls' contents? Good question! Here's the back cover:
They came out of nowhere and started ripping the world apart, one city at a time. Using power on a scale never before seen, Warlocks, godlike leaders of the Wild army, are rampaging on Austeria with one goal: raise armies and annihilate the entire continent. Set in the fantasy realm of Relic, this book looks at warfare through the eyes of everyday people turned soldiers – soldiers whose side is losing the war.
Take the challenge. Roleplay in a fantasy world where hairless dwarves walk through stone, magic is commonplace, and the spirit world doesn't always stay in check. Focus on a daily life and death struggle where the enemy is cruel, powerful, and around every corner. Take the challenge, and let your adventurers become...
...mankind’s only hope. 
Inside the covers you’ll find 144 pages with: 
* Heaps of world detail you’ll need to run games in Suzerain’s Relic realm during the War of the Wild.
* Over 50 new Edges, Hindrances, and Powers, including three new playable races.
* Stats for dozens of heroes and villains alike, plus an assortment of soldiers and monsters from the war.
* A finely-tuned setting in which to take your characters from Novices to Heroes.
* 30 scenarios including a full plot-point campaign covering the arrival of the Warlocks and the fight for survival in the Caladon Kingdom.
We have unlocked Relic, the Suzerain Universe’s fantasy realm. Now’s the time, when all kinds of perks are in place for our IndieGoGo sponsors. Come, explore, and answer the Savage call to be Caladon’s only hope.

story:
Cinematica is a tapletop RPG supplement designed to enhance games for any system. Using an simple yet elegant rules system, players rewarded for playing characters with depth, filling narrative roles in the party, and moving the story along with the game. The rules set includes a Cinematica RPG system specifically tailored to high drama, trope heavy style roleplaying.

The game has been heavily playtested, but what I need is funding for the high quality art that the individual cards will have. To help make the Cinematica! experience an exciting one, I’d love some exciting images!

story:
My Story

My name is Long Nguyen, a 3D artist and Game Designer from Canada.

 

In 2002, I took the plunge into the world of videogame development and began a small hobby project called 'Out Of Hell', a mod for Unreal Tournament. I spent the next 7 years building the game alone in my spare time, learning about the development process as I went along and growing as an artist over time. The game was finally completed and released to the public in 2009. It won the 'Best Art Direction' award and was nominated for 'Best Single Player Mod' at Mod Database (www.moddb.com)

 

The Project

Now I have set my sights higher and have begun development on a new project, a spiritual successor called 'Daemonicon' which I plan to take commercial. It is a horror-themed adventure/exploration game with a branching storyline, thick atmosphere and haunting visuals.

 

Many ideas that were not included in Out Of Hell will be featured in Daemonicon such as non-linear exploration, player customization, skill structures, multiple endings and more. You can find additional details about Daemonicon at: http://crcdevblog.wordpress.com/

The Goal And Why Your Contribution Is Important

My goal is to raise $15,000. All of it would go towards covering development costs such as hiring additional artists, programmers, purchasing assets and other related expenses. Your generous contributions would aid me in reducing the amount of time it takes to build Daemonicon so that I can get it out to the gaming public!

 

Your Contributions Matter

Know that whatever your contribution is, it will go a long way towards helping an Indie Developer create a new gaming experience! The 3 Perks on the side are my way of saying 'Thank you!' for your generosity! If you request, I will also send you a screenshot of the graffiti and the location of where it can be found!

You can also help by spreading the word about project 'Daemonicon' to your friends, on forums, Facebook, Twitter and beyond! The project needs your support!

Important Note

Before making a contribution, please understand that these Perks are my way of showing gratitude and appreciation for your support but do not imply or constitute that any contributors are in whole or in part: co-authors, partners, joint-venturers or owners in the project. Graffiti tags or NPC's with names provided by the contributor are not owned by the contributor.

If you do not wish to be named or choose to opt out of the Perks, please let me know!

story:
Short Summary

I work two jobs. I'm not some shiftless layabout that feeds off the system. I simply don't have the money to buy one video game I want. I'm just asking for a little help. I'm a productive member of society. It's not as if I don't pay my bills. I'm not on welfare or foodstamps. I don't drink or smoke. If you choose to donate, then I am grateful. If not, no hard feelings. I'm not asking for $500 dollars either. That is just the minimum that this site requires. All I need is $75 to $100.

What We Need & What You Get

This isn't some great cause like buying a new wheelchair for someone that is disabled or trying to raise money for schoolbooks for little children. It is simply to raise money for something that I have put off for a long time. I will do nothing else with the money.

The Impact

This campaign has very little social impact if any at all. I'll be happier. That's it. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than donating, there is no other way to contribute.
