story:
Thank you for your support!

Hey guys, thanks for reading and hope you exited as we are!
In the last months we have invested a lot of time, money, sleeping hours and coffee to get where we are now, we are very proud to have the game finished and live in Beta version without any help.
Now is the time to jump ahead, we are asking your support and will appreciate any amount that you can contribute!
We consider every supporter as part of our team and we will be happy to give back for your help, so BIG thanks to all of you supporters.
Let`s start together the new scene of social based gaming online!



The Idea of social based games online:

Gaming is one of the hottest field on the web, That’s because It is just fun, and in our nature as people we love to have fun!
When combining a social aspect in a game it become even better! involving other people that we may know in our games makes it more competitive and interesting.
So why don`t we build the entire game engine on people actions and connections that’s sounds like a real fun! a social based gaming!



First to go...

Your friends are your soldiers

Social War Game is the first game in our social gaming platform, it is an online Facebook game based on the famous simple "War" game card but with a unique twist.
In the game your deck of cards will be a random 20 Facebook friends that you already know, you can see their profile picture shown as the cover of the card, but you don’t know for sure what is their value.
That’s means that your cards values (that called "PowerTags" in the game) are hidden, so how can you play them? that`s the tricky part – when you recognize your friend try to guess how active is he on Facebook, the more active your friend will be the greater "PowerTag" his card will get.
When you click to play the card, its "PowerTag" reveals both to you and your opponent, the higher card on stage wins the round.
In case of a draw an additional card will be placed on the previews in the stage until one of the cards wins and take all opened cards on the stage.
The winner is the one who grab more cards to his opponentafter he played his 20 cards (a battle).
The points are calculated by the "PowerTags" of the opponentcards that has been taken, plus a bonus points for each battle victory.


The Idea of PowerTag values

"PowerTag" is a value that represent a user strength in a game, "PowerTag" values are based on special algorithm compose by numbers of different parameters, thous parameters showing how much active a user is on Facebook, some of the parameters are: frequency of posting, average shares, number of likes, number of comments, usage of albums, photos, friends tags and much more.
PowerTag can be very dynamic and change from game to game, this because our algorithm consider the last friend activities from the past day, week and month, so a user with a "10" PowerTag can be "J" or "9" in your next game.
This evaluation method is designed to work with more games in the future and right now already implemented on SocialWar Game.


The story of the game…

Not just an empty card game, there is a story and you (the player) are a part of it:
You are a commander and your army squad is build from 20 soldiers – make sure to know them, they will help you to win the battle, Each soldier have different value called "PowerTag" based on his activity on Facebook.
Go up in the ranks scale while you win the battles, a level up will give you a ranks promotion, while you play, it will be harder to get ranks and you will need more battle victories, so stay tuned, remember your friends PowerTags and use them wisely.


Let`s make it more interesting!

To make the game much interesting and fun we have added two Power Ups:

Joker – every level up you will get a Joker, with a Joker your can boost a soldier PowerTag value and make sure you win the current round, It is wise to answer with a Joker after your opponent place one of his high PowerTags soldiers. If you will start a round with a Joker, most chances that your opponent will spare one of his lowest PowerTags.

Grenade – every 5 levels up you will get a grenade, grenade explosion will eliminate 2 of your opponent soldiers. Grenade are most useful when you feel that your chances to win are run out, then one grenade can flip over the game and make you earn that extra bonus points as you win.


a Grenade in a game will eliminate two cards from your opponent:


a Joker in a game will turn one of your friends to a round winner:


You can get points in every battle regardless if you won or not:


Where does it goes from here?

With your support, Online Gaming Platform will specialize in the social gaming, Social War Game will be the first game in a series of online social gaming.

We wanted a relatively simple game to start with, so we can focus in the common core modules that can be shared and used with more games on the platform, for example a "PowerTag" value of a user can be used in a Blackjack (21) game in the future and in other games as well.With your support The platform will enable users to play online from the web and mobile devices while more social networks will be part of the gaming experience.


10 reasons to support us:

  1. Vision – Because you can see far distances and want to be a part of the future gaming scene
  2. Real – Social War Game already available for beta testers, It`s not just an idea
  3. Confidence - We are experience team with hundreds of successful projects on the web
  4. Joining – Because we see everyone who supports us as part of the core team
  5. Unique - There is nothing similar to our project on the web
  6. Feedback – You will receive a variety of benefits depends of your choice (See available Preks)
  7. Participation – Your feedback, suggestions and comments will be important part in our progress
  8. Action – Because you an action type of person and you have the guts to dare
  9. Spark – Because you also have the spark of gaming!
  10. Goodness – Because when you help it makes you feel good


Road Map and the near future

History:
January 2014 – April 2014:
core development, server infrastructure and platform establishment

April 2014 – June 2014:
Client side Development, Graphics design and animation  

June 2014 – July 2014:
Sounds, Fine tuning and bug fixes

July 2014 – Now:
Yeiiii!!! Beta version online, opened to focus group for testing and feedback propose

Future:
September 2014
Let`s Go live! after Feedback implementation and final QA
Next on 2014 with your support:
Additional Power ups development
Mobile version of SocialWar Game
Additional Socials Games planning and development


The people behind Social War Game

Hi, we are the people behind Social War Game – we are experienced individuals specialized in web development and creative in the Internet.
We have years of experience in planning designing and producing digital marketing campaigns from the sketch of an idea to the production.
Our job positions today:

Inbal Engelman – CEO at CreativeAngeles, Digital Campaigns productions and management.


Tom Engelman – Vice President Creative Director at CreativeAngeles, Digital Campaigns productions and management.


Adir Lombrozo – CEO at Interjet - Technologies and web development.

We are self motivated professionals with a childish spark of enthusiasm for Gaming!


For us Social War Game is:

fun, a challenge, an idea of innovation, the start of the future online gaming! 

:)


Random available players screen scrolls and stops with your next opponent:


a T-shirt for our generous supporters: (photo for illustration purposes only)



    a Cool hat for our generous supporters: (photo for illustration purposes only)


    illustration of the future social war game app

story:
UPDATE: ALPHA IS OUT FOR ALL THE BACKERS!

Visit our website FROZENNIGHTMARE.COM

Infinite Pixels is a voxel space exploration and survival game, where the player´s main goal is to expand his territory to other planets and survive. We want to make a game where you have total freedom over the way you explore and survive in this huge map. With tons of different planets and environments the possibilities extend beyond our imagination.  We also want to mix exploration game play with survival mechanics that is why on infinite pixels you have multiple body needs which include nutrition, hydration, health and soon oxygen levels. Trade with other lifeforms, explore the vast space.

 

 

 

 

What the Internet is saying!

"love Minecraft, and I love Space Sims. And the idea that you could put these two things together is as wonderful as a booze party in an elementary school.Infinite Pixels is just that."

 Joseph Christ , 4 Player Network http://4playernetwork.com/blog/2013/05/infinite-pixels-is-minecraft-in-space/

 

"Infinite Pixels is clearly in the early stages of development but it’s also doing something that fills a hole. While similar to a lot of other games about we don’t have a first-person procedurally generated space survival exploration game."

Julian Benson, Pcgamesn http://www.pcgamesn.com/indie/spotlight-greenlight-infinite-pixels

"I could’ve written all that without having watched this video of the game in action. It really just reminded me of the game for me. And Infinite Pixels might not even be that game, but there’s a lot here that I want to try out."

Craig Pearson, RockPaperShotgun http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2013/05/15/space-cubed-infinite-pixels/

 

 

Votes us up on Steam Greenlight

 

Its all about who you want to be, a explorer ready to find new planets and space anomalies, a business man nuts about selling material to other planets, a scientist ready to discover the next big thing on this huge galaxy. With infinite pixels you can be all this. Build spaceships, expand your base, explore solar systems, gather material from asteroids and planets, the universe is your playground.

 

check the gameplay below!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tcLJZj9EauE&feature=youtu.be

Exploring is going to be a huge thing on Infinite pixels, discovering planets, moons, huge asteroids, stars, galaxies, solar systems, space anomalies THE LIST GOES ON!. But how are going to explore and discover new thing on this huge game?!

- a communication center ready to provide you with a satellital view of your current position.

- rockets are the only way to move fast through space, so you are going to need some of those.

- once you have enough material you will be able to build bigger ships capable of achieving extreme speeds.

- Warp gates (more on this later)

 

Build different structures that will impulse your space exploration program and at the same time provide the necessary tool to keep yourself hydrated and fed. From a communication center that provides you with a satellital view of your current position to a water depo that keeps you hydrated.

These are the current structures you can build in Infinite Pixels

- a communications center (provides satellital view of your current position)

- a ship garage (spawn practical ships like material extractors and much more)

- landplatpform : the perfect place to land any ship

- Miner : extract material and other valuable resources from any planet

- Water depo : self explanatory, go here to get some water

- food warehouse : plant vegetables and store food

- lightpost : meh just light

- bedroom : sleep and think in here

- Rocket launcher : build rockets and send them to space, with or without you in them.

- much more!!

 

Explore and learn from space with your friend!!, co-op mode is confirmed !

 

 

Features

Multiple Planets
Multiple solar systems
Multiple body needs
Sandbox features
Co-op *still working on it but its confirmed*

 

 

This is an extremely ambitious project and we need your help, if we want to achieve the many goals we have for  this project we will  need some money.  We want to expand the development team, at the moment there are 2 people working on the game  (me and my brother) but with some money we can hire more people to help in the development process.

if the indiegogo project fails: even 1000 dollars would be enough to finish the game, its just that with 20k we can hire more people, a soundtrack, and finish the game way faster. BUT IF THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN FAILS WE WILL STILL FINISH THE GAME!.

 

If the game does not gets on greenlight (we are oing great on greenlight with over 6k yes votes) you will always be able to get in on Desura.

 

 

 

THE TEAM!

Claudio: the lead developer of the project, I am in charge of making our ideas actual gameplay mechanics. 

Martin : I am into pixel art since I discovered minecraft, i used to make minecraft skins and texture packs, voxels are a new thing for me but I am doing my best to produce good models. 

 

Perks

Too much 525$: Name one of the solar systems on Inifinite pixels! *cant name a planet or moon*

 

 

Take the ride to finish the project with us!

Craig Pearson, RockPaperShotgun http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2013/05/15/space-cubed-infinite-pixels/
 
 
Votes us up on Steam Greenlight

 

Its all about who you want to be, a explorer ready to find new planets and space anomalies, a business man nuts about selling material to other planets, a scientist ready to discover the next big thing on this huge galaxy. With infinite pixels you can be all this. Build spaceships, expand your base, explore solar systems, gather material from asteroids and planets, the universe is your playground.


 
check the gameplay below!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tcLJZj9EauE&feature=youtu.be
Exploring is going to be a huge thing on Infinite pixels, discovering planets, moons, huge asteroids, stars, galaxies, solar systems, space anomalies THE LIST GOES ON!. But how are going to explore and discover new thing on this huge game?!
- a communication center ready to provide you with a satellital view of your current position.
- rockets are the only way to move fast through space, so you are going to need some of those.
- once you have enough material you will be able to build bigger ships capable of achieving extreme speeds.
- Warp gates (more on this later)


 
Build different structures that will impulse your space exploration program and at the same time provide the necessary tool to keep yourself hydrated and fed. From a communication center that provides you with a satellital view of your current position to a water depo that keeps you hydrated.
These are the current structures you can build in Infinite Pixels
- a communications center (provides satellital view of your current position)
- a ship garage (spawn practical ships like material extractors and much more)
- landplatpform : the perfect place to land any ship
- Miner : extract material and other valuable resources from any planet
- Water depo : self explanatory, go here to get some water
- food warehouse : plant vegetables and store food
- lightpost : meh just light
- bedroom : sleep and think in here
- Rocket launcher : build rockets and send them to space, with or without you in them.
- much more!!
 

Explore and learn from space with your friend!!, co-op mode is confirmed !
 
 

Features
Multiple PlanetsMultiple solar systemsMultiple body needs Sandbox featuresCo-op *still working on it but its confirmed*

 
 



This is an extremely ambitious project and we need your help, if we want to achieve the many goals we have for  this project we will  need some money.  We want to expand the development team, at the moment there are 2 people working on the game  (me and my brother) but with some money we can hire more people to help in the development process.
if the indiegogo project fails: even 1000 dollars would be enough to finish the game, its just that with 20k we can hire more people, a soundtrack, and finish the game way faster. BUT IF THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN FAILS WE WILL STILL FINISH THE GAME!.
 
If the game does not gets on greenlight (we are oing great on greenlight with over 6k yes votes) you will always be able to get in on Desura.

 
 
 


THE TEAM!

Claudio: the lead developer of the project, I am in charge of making our ideas actual gameplay mechanics. 

Martin : I am into pixel art since I discovered minecraft, i used to make minecraft skins and texture packs, voxels are a new thing for me but I am doing my best to produce good models. 

 


Perks


Too much 525$: Name one of the solar systems on Inifinite pixels! *cant name a planet or moon*

 
 
Take the ride to finish the project with us!

story:
Short Summary

I want to develop a new STI editor that can replace the old STI-Edit because it is not up to the task anymore. It can not handle the high resolution files introduced in Jagged Alliance 2 1.13 and behaves rather buggy on modern operating systems, plus I want to have more features at my disposal without constantly switching between programs. Unfortunately my personal situation does not allow me to spend much time on the project, a possible release date would most likely be more than 18 months into the future. Assuming I spent all my free time on it, that is.


Who I Am

My name is Tox and I am currently studying Communication & Multimedia Design in the Netherlands. In the past I have spent countless hours hacking Jagged Alliance 2. In 2000 I started the project Lords of the Bytes with two fellow JA2 hackers, releasing several editors for the game as well as info on how to hack the game. Probably the most famous of the editors is JA2AIO (All-In-One). Besides programming I am a designer, musician and audio engineer (specializing in mastering).


So What's The Story?

Several years ago I left the scene to pursue other projects, but I could not leave the game alone. About a year ago I wanted to make my own mod based on JA2 1.13 using the weapons from Jagged Alliance 1. Decoding the STI format used there was not too much of a problem but when I tried to integrate them into JA2 1.13 things became messy and when I tried to edit the interface I ran into more trouble, STI-Edit was just not up to the task anymore. So I began coding a new STI editor.

But that project requires a lot more time than I have available because I am working on my graduation project and need to work to finance my monthly bills and tuition fees. Unfortunately that one job I have doesn't bring in enough, so I need a second one, further limiting my time. Recently I saw the Jagged Alliance: Flashback Kickstarter campaign and was impressed how many people were willing to donate for it. Its successful funding made me wonder if it is possible to get my editor development funded.


Why Support An Editor Project?

It has been more than 10 years since STI-Edit's release. The program is not up to the task anymore (no offense!) since JA2 1.13 boosted the game's resolution, not to mention STI-Edit's buggy behavior on modern operating systems. I can and would love to change that, but developing high-quality software takes a lot of time and that is a luxury I do not have. A successful campaign would give me the necessary financial security to develop a comprehensive editor for JA2's graphics that can replace several of the modder's every day tools. Instead of doing a second job, I could work on the editor while still being able to pay my expenses. It would be more fun for me and a huge benefit for the whole community. And to make it perfectly clear: I am NOT planning to charge for the editor. I want it to be freeware without advertisements, like all the other editors.


What You Will Get

The editor will allow you to view/edit STI files without the need for other programs, all in a neat looking application that is platform independent (only Adobe AIR is required). The list of features depends on the amount of funding, see the following lists for details:

500+ €: The Basic Editor
  • Can process all types of STI files (8bit and 16bit, single/multi page, animation).
  • Can export the current image or the whole sequence contained in the STI.
  • Exports/imports BMP (indexed or 16bit), PNG (16bit with transparency) or STI (both types).
  • Can import single images.
  • Paste from and copy to the clipboard.
  • The viewport can use in-game coloring and transparencies.
  • Select images from a multi page file using a thumbnail overview.
  • Play a single animation in repeat or the whole file as one animation.
  • Adjust the playback speed (animations) and zoom level (all files) for precise editing.
  • Edit the STI palette directly in the editor (single color mode).
  • Colors can be selected with a simple color picker (RGB).
  • All the drawing capabilities of STI-Edit.


750+ €: The Extended Editor

  • The Basic Editor and...
  • Can import sequences of images.
  • Animations can be keyframed and reordered as you wish.
  • Add images via drag'n'drop from your file explorer.
  • Edit the STI palette directly in the editor, even ranges of colors at the same time (hue, saturation, brightness).
  • Colors can be selected with an advanced color picker (RGB, HSB, color suggestions).
  • Along with isometric guides several tools will allow you to draw items like walls, roofs, barrels and other basic objects occurring in the game to use as templates. These will be fine-tuned to match the in-game dimensions of already existing items.


1000+ €: The Advanced Editor
  • The Extended Editor and...
  • Edit your graphics (including animations) directly in a simulated in-game environment for easier offset adjustment, etc.
  • Choose from several simulated in-game environments to compare different game situations (underground, outdoors, indoors, ...).
  • JSDs can be displayed as overlay.


1250+ €: The Really Advanced Editor
  • The Advanced Editor and...
  • The drawing tools can use textures and simple colors.
  • Drawing with brushes that are loaded from PNG or STI files.
  • Drawing simple vector shapes that are loaded from text files with path drawing instructions as used in the SVG format.

1500+ €: The Super Advanced Editor
  • The Really Advanced Editor and...
  • Even more isometric drawing tools.
  • A layer system for drawing, accompanied by a file format to store data for later edits.
  • JSD editing capabilities.
  • Want to change JA2's color palette? No problem, you can edit it directly in the editor, too.

How Long Will It Take?

I still need to study, so I can't make the development a full time job. Therefore I decided to calculate 3 months (The Basic Editor) to 9 months (The Super Advanced Editor) for development split up in several milestones which I will define based on the final amount of funding. The following list will give you an estimate for each level of funding. The time given is counted from the successful end of the fund raising campaign.

  • +3 months: The Basic Editor
  • +5 months: The Advanced Editor
  • +7 months: The Really Advanced Editor
  • +9 months: The Super Advanced Editor


You Don't Have Anything To Donate?

No problem, I know that feeling. Do me the favor and tell others about the project, maybe they can chip in. 


About The Perks

Honestly, I can't offer you much since it's only an editor project. Do you have an idea for a perk you'd like to have? I'm all ears, just drop me a line.

story:
Update #05 (Final): Interview/Article on Geekpr0n.com and a little bit about me



Update #04: Indies Tokyo Game Show 2014, Blindflug Studios First Strike, and meeting Keiji Inafune, creator of the Megaman franchise



Update #03: Top Paper Award! Plus a Game Studies Podcast announcement and the upcoming Tokyo Game Show




Update #02: Japan Game Developers Conference, IGDA Scholarships, and an inspiring example of women in the Japanese games industry



Update #01: HUGE first week and Conference Happenings



The Quest in a Nutshell:

My name is Chris Yap, and I'm a PhD student from the Nara Inst. of Science and Technology in Nara, Japan. 

I study narrative in video games. 

I study it seriously and enthusiastically, because I believe that video games are the new digital mythology of the 21st century and beyond.

The stories of video games allow gamers to have a wide variety of interactive experiences which can be both entertaining and meaningful. They allow us to take a break from life. They teach and inspire. 

They have the potential to allow each and every one of us to become the heroes of our own quests.

My own quest is to commit academically to investigating how stories and narratives are told in the video game medium. To that end, I wish to participate actively in the academic community of Game Studies.

However, that is where I need your help--in this quest, the costs involved in conducting any kind of research can be high. 

In my case specifically, I am seeking your help in funding my subsequent academic trips to present my work at leading academic conferences.

Help me to slay the dragon.


What We Need & What You Get

The funding goal for my research trip is only $2000 USD in total. 

In detail, I'll need (all totals are in US Dollars):
*$1867.00 for the cheapest rate I could find on expedia for combined airfare (Japan <--> Michigan) and hotel accommodations (4 nights at the Holiday Inn)
*$133.00 (the remainder) for food and misc. emergencies.
All of the funding will only go directly towards supporting my research activities for Game Studies. Therefore, your support of this research directly contributes to furthering it. Funds in excess of our $2000 goal will be put towards funding subsequent research efforts and trips.
Any funding amount is A-OK, even if it's only $1. Every little bit helps.
But for all you lovely over-achievers out there, I enthusiastically offer the following:
All supporters of this campaign will get a URL where you can download any and all of my academic output: full conference papers, reports, slide presentations, videos, etc.
$10 - I'll write you a personalized Thank You Card and mail it to you anywhere in the world.
$25 - Personalized Thank You Card AND formal acknowledgement by name in my forthcoming PhD Dissertation (projected 2017) and on the paper I am presenting entitled, "Between Hardcoded Software and the Human Mind--Conceptualizing Player-side Emergence in Games."
$50 - You get the Thank You Card and Thesis Acknowledgement perks AND formal mention on the last slide of my conference presentation (name, photo, etc). It might go something like: "By the way, this research was made possible via crowdfunding on indiegogo, and especially by the following outstanding individuals..."
$75 - Thank You Card, Thesis and Slide Presentation Acknowledgement perks, AND a personal Skype or Google Hangout meeting in which we can discuss anything you want to know about Game Studies research, Japan, advocacy in gaming, or anything else.
$100 - All previous perks AND If you should ever come to the Kansai area of Japan (Osaka/Kyoto/Kobe/Nara), let me know ahead of time and I will personally show you around. My 9+ years of experience living in Japan will be at your disposal and I can be your translator and tour guide for a day here in Japan.

The Impact

Your support allows my research to continue and helps me to achieve my degree.

But when you do that, what are you truly doing?
Well, here's how I like to think of it: you are funding the idea that video games are far more meaningful than merely an entertaining pastime. Your contribution empowers the idea that games truly are the future of storytelling and allows me to continue crusading meaningfully  and vocally for that cause. It supports the idea that a game is an interactive tale that honors the storytelling traditions of generations past while also celebrating new interactive storytelling methods.
Games are the interactive tales which ensure that we are the heroes.
Your support of my research helps me to get the word out. It helps me to prove to naysayers what we as gamers have known all along: that games are epic interactive tales worthy of serious study.

But don't just take MY word for it--

See what some of my talk attendees had to say about my recent PAX East 2014 panel entitled, "The Mythology in and of Games" (which can be viewed in its entirety here: http://youtu.be/WtjAzMj-bIg?t=33m48s   ):
"...[E]ngaging, clever, intelligent, funny, and had a topic that was both crucial and extremely under represented in the selection for panels this year. Of all the panelists I've seen in four consecutive years you were by far the best speaker and had the most inspiring speech. There wasn't a moment during your portion where I wasn't riveted to what you were saying and you put what so many gamers feel about the stories they experience into words like no one else could have. This is going to sound lame but when you talked about how these stories impacted your life, especially during your childhood, I was nearly in tears. I really just need to tell you how much I appreciate what you did and just how amazing it was to me. I just can't stress enough how inspiring you were."
-Joshua N.

"So, thank you for not only underscoring the importance of narrative to gaming and its culture, but for also presenting the information in such an emotional and lively way. Your passion and enthusiasm was contagious, and it became the highlight of this year’s convention for me."
-Tom B.

"I just wanted to let you know you did a fantastic job. I couldn't agree more that the future of storytelling lies within video games. You have a very positive energy that I think touched everyone in that room on a deeper level than most speakers. I hope to see your work in the future, and I hope you continue to speak and share your positivity with gamers and anyone who will listen!"
-Kerry S.

"I loved your part of Sunday's panel!  It brought tears to my eyes and made me want to give everyone at PAX a hug.  This was first PAX and many parts of it will be memorable; however, I know that your emotion, your passion, will be the thing I remember most."
-Andrew U.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, not all people believe that video games are worth anything beyond entertainment. Still others firmly believe that games are a wholly negative influence on people and society.

Furthermore, the idea of video games being a focus of academic inquiry is still a very new and somewhat radical idea. As such, there is still a reluctance to fund projects which research video games, and consequently, it can be very difficult for researchers and graduate students to justify and secure funding with the established funding agencies.
It is for this reason (among others) that I have decided to try this funding experiment out on indiegogo--to see if I can appeal to those who really know games and who believe as I do.
This is admittedly no easy road. But I can assure you that I have the skill, smarts, tenacity, and track record to make sure video games have a strong advocate in academia and beyond.
I've spoken at the following conferences and conventions:
Oct. 2012: Michigan State Univ. Meaningful Play 2012 Conference (Full Paper: "Establishing Literary Merit in Metal Gear Solid")
Mar. 2013: Digital Games Research Association (DiGRA) Japan (Full Paper: "On the Frame Narrative of Ace Combat Zero: The Belkan War"--note: full text in Japanese)
Apr. 2013: International Conference on Japan Game Studies 2013 (Full Paper: "Interactive Frame Narrative and Player Evaluation-based Story Evolution in Ace Combat Zero: The Belkan War")
Apr. 2014: PAX East 2014 (Panel speaker: "The Mythology in and of Games: Why The Legend of Zelda is just as important as the legend of Beowulf")
Aug. 2014: Replaying Japan 2014 (Full Paper: "Genetic Predestiny vs. Digital Free Will: A Critical Analysis of Character Foils in Metal Gear Solid")
(to appear) Oct. 2014: Meaningful Play 2014 (Full Paper: "Conceptualizing Player-side Emergence in Interactive Games: Between Hardcoded Software and the Human Mind in Papers, Please and Gone Home")
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like games and think that they should be studied seriously, please share this indiegogo!

Thank you and keep on rocking.

Aug. 2014: Replaying Japan 2014 (Full Paper: "Genetic Predestiny vs. Digital Free Will: A Critical Analysis of Character Foils in Metal Gear Solid")
(to appear) Oct. 2014: Meaningful Play 2014 (Full Paper: "Conceptualizing Player-side Emergence in Interactive Games: Between Hardcoded Software and the Human Mind in Papers, Please and Gone Home")
 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you like games and think that they should be studied seriously, please share this indiegogo!
Thank you and keep on rocking.

story:
The Fear That Drives Us

Night Terror is a horror, mystery, survival and crafting mmorpg. It's a modern day game with mystical elements. In this open world, you will be allowed to explore at your own will while you prepare yourself to survive the night. There are many creatures from different origins to be discovered and hunted before they hunt you. You could be the world's last hope to prevent the coming apocalypse. Will you survive or become another victim of the night?


                 Here is only some of what you'll be able to do in Night Terror :

  • Create a character and continue to customize your character in game.
  • Survive the night by crafting both traps and your home or base during the day
  •  Use your wits and the weapons you craft or find to keep zombies and other creatures at bay. 
  • Discover and choose which quests to pursue instead of traveling from one quest to another . This is no cookie cutter game.
  • Find hidden treasure on both land and under the sea and use your findings to buy new items,weapons,traps,vehicles,clothing,shelter and more!
  • Unlock hidden mysteries that can lead you to amazing wealth,magical items,horrible creatures and even to or your doom.
  • Duel wield weapons and aim in two directions different directions killing enemies behind you as well as in front.
  • Find magical items and places that may be right under your nose or not even visible to the naked eye.
  • Drive in vehicles on land,air and sea to explore new areas.
  • Interact with players online by trading items from your inventory or invite up to a five member party a long for a quest from which you can all reap the rewards.
  • Challenge other players or parties online to capture the base style battles using your weapon of choice and your own items or currency as the reward for the winner.
  • Discover spirits,creatures,npcs that may want to help or harm you a long the way.
  • Unlock new ways to play that may reward you as a guide to another party or as an enemy seek and destroy other players and much much more.




        WIN NIGHT TERROR & A YEARS OF ADVERTISING ON OUR WEBSITE!
Enter the youtube video contest by posting our youtube video on any of your social networks. Tag three or more people in the post (optional) Copy and paste below :
Watch https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dLQSJq-wikI Support night terror on igg.me/at/night-terror-game #nightterrorgame #survivalgame RT


            Support the game that supports indie horror & mystery fans!

We need your support to bring you all the features that gamers love and expect. Although it takes a lot of money to make a video game, we are only asking for a little right now from fans to help get our project get started. Help us make it viral!


                                                Our Risks & Challenges

We believe the online game community has been waiting for this unique experience for a long time and we believe with everyone's support we can meet any new challenges that come and therefore we will eliminate all risks. We will refund anyone who does not receive the game. Fans of our games are our top priority.

                                  Want to help promote Night Terror? 

                Click here or the image above and share it on Facebook!


  If you have any feedback for us you can reach us on twitter @nightterrorgame

story:
We Need Your Help

We are Big Room Studios, a dozen creative developers and designers from Portland, Maine who build awesome web apps and incubate startup companies. Our newest project is Centerpoint, a massively multiplayer game of colonization, but we need your help to bring it to life. 


Max Felker, our lead project strategist, has been working on this game in his off time for 2 years and we know how much potential it has. As of today, you can play an alpha version of the game online, but this is just the beginning. To make Centerpoint a reality, Big Room Studios needs to raise $10,000 to develop an awesome beta of the game. In exchange, we’re offering tons of free accounts, early access, and even custom game gear! Your contribution will help us fund game development, purchase licenses, and integrate an online community.

The Centerpoint Beta

Today, the Centerpoint alpha build is available for guest play online. This is a rough prototype demonstrating the a few basic components of the game. Check it out here:

Please note that this experience requires that you have an up-to-date browser and have the Unity Web Player installed. There is a known issue with Internet Explorer and the guest play so we recommend using Firefox or Google Chrome.

Our next step is to develop a beta and we need $10,000 to do that. From your contributions, we will develop the core gameplay concepts of Centerpoint, which is a first step toward our final vision. The beta will include the following:

  • Character Mechanics (running, jumping, etc)

  • Factions

  • Structures

  • Equipment & Loadouts (Weapons, armor,etc)

  • Energy Capture

  • Accounts & Settings

  • Cross Platform Builds for PC, Mac and Linux available for download

  • Research & Development Community

When the beta is released, we will open the game up to the public and allow everyone to start playing. Anyone who signs up after the beta is released will pay $3 a month for an account. Each paid account means new features, more servers, and better game play.  Anyone who contributes to this campaign at the PIONEER level or higher will get a free account for a whole year.

Billions of light years away, a massive planet exists at the center of the universe. Named for its location, Centerpoint expands beyond the vanishing point of the naked eye. It is home to an infinite number of continents rich with lush foliage, exotic scenery, and valuable Dark Energy.

A massive, galactic group known as the United Conglomerate has begun to colonize the world in search of  Dark Energy. All citizen have been called upon to build colonies and capture the Dark Energy in exchange for land, credits, and control.

Centerpoint is a persistent, massively multiplayer game of colonization. Players will explore uncharted territory, build colonies, and battle their rival colonists in an all out fight for planetary domination.

The world of Centerpoint is always active, allowing players to join on whenever they want. There are no matches, rounds, server browsers or map packs in Centerpoint. Players will be able to access news feeds, player updates, and even real-time game footage even if they're not active in the game.

As time progress, players and their actions will shape the game world. This ever-evolving and real time experience adds new challenges for players, encouraging them to work together through player-managed teams called Factions. Players are allowed to customize their faction’s name, logo, ranking and reward systems.

Colonists must collect Dark Energy, a valuable resource to the United Conglomerate and its citizens. Once captured, the energy can be redeemed for credits that colonists can use to purchase weapons, vehicles, and structures.

We like to do things differently here at Big Room Studios and that includes our approach to games.

All the Genres

Centerpoint is a mash up of today’s favorite genres: first person shooter (FPS), massively multiplayer role playing game (MMORPG), and real-time strategy (RTS). Players will be able to choose how they participate and what type of game experience they have.

Power to the Players

As gamers ourselves, we want to make this game for the players. Teams are managed by players who are free to build colonies, expand their alliances, and battle enemies at their own discretion. There are no weapons or equipment restrictions, making the game all about a player's character and custom loadouts. There are no mountains a player can’t climb or doors a player can’t go through. Feel the freedom of being able to do whatever you want, whenever you want, however you want.

Centerpoint will always be releasing new features, improvements and fixes.  We are  starting with the core game concepts and building towards our grand vision. This allows players to get new updates quickly and not be bored by stagnant content.

Community Involvement

In order for us to build fast and deliver often, we need player participation. Through the “R&D Department,” we’re going to allow players to not only provide feedback but actually participate in game development. By forging their own ideas with the same tools that we use, players can build and submit models to our R&D department. If you can build it and we like it, it goes into the game.

We’re building this game on Unity 3D and that means we can put Centerpoint on a ton of devices! Currently, Centerpoint is played right on the web with Unity’s web browser plugin. This allows players on Mac and PC to play together without having to download separate clients. We have plans to roll out builds for PC, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android (OUYA), and eventually consoles like Xbox and Playstation.

$15,000 Stretch Goal - Vehicles

If we can reach $15,000 dollars, we would be able to develop a set of vehicles for players to build and use in the game world. This would include both ground and air vehicles, which would allow players to travel faster around the game world.

$25,000 Stretch Goal - iOS & Android Builds

Our current plan is to develop Web, PC, Mac and Linux builds. If we blow past our first $15,000 stretch goal, we can begin work on native iOS and Android builds. This would include a special build for iPhone / iPads and Android phones. In addition to phones, we would port the Android build to the OUYA gaming console.

Onward and Upward!

Thank you so much for taking the time to view our campaign and helping us by investing in our project. We ask that you please share this campaign with your friends and family. Each contribution is a huge step and we cannot meet our goal without each and every one of you. Help us, the Big Room Studios team, support Max and his vision for Centerpoint. Together, we can bring this project from an alpha to a beta version, and Centerpoint can become a viable product to be promoted, supported, and improved by Max, Big Room Studios, and our growing community of players!

Have ideas or suggestions? 
Check out our User Voice page and let us know!

story:
Short Summary

Dear Friends,I was born and raised in Cape Town,South Africa.I moved to this country with my older brother and mom for better oppurtunities.I have been trying to achieve PRO status in the Professional Gaming Community for 7 years now.

 

This Campaign is to help me raise enough money to follow my Passion in Life.This event is important to travel to because only at events will you have the chances and oppurtunities to network with other players.Meet and possibly make new friend ships that long down the road will add up towards making successful Teams form.I came into this country without the means of paperwork.So i havnt been able to work,drive,have a very easy going Souther Orange Coutny life.This campaing will not only let me raise money so i can follow the Road to my passion but to give me a chance to really do somthieng with my life in a field i am very talented in.I have been gaming and competing on a very high intense level for a long time consistently.But but my whole life i have never had the chances to have traveled to any tournaments like this because i never had the money.Then people would always get me downand speak negative about my goals and aspirations.Telling me i am never gunna amount to nothing.PLEASE GIVE ME THE CHANCE TO SHOW ALL OF THESE PEOPLE WHAT I AM passionate and love about my life.Give me the chance to finally make it to one of these tournaments.So i can have the chance of making it.

 

What We Need & What You Get!

My team and I are in need of raising enough money for my bus ticket to be able to make it out there.I also need enough money for my entry fee to play in this tournament.Also a place to sleep and a bus ticket to get back home so i am not stuck there.If i cannot reach my entire goal this website is going to take a percentage out of my current funds.That would be a huge set back.So if you have just 50 cents to a 1$.That would be a tremendous helpOr anything in your heart you can give

 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please if you just have 5minutes to help spread the word any way you can via internet and Facebook SHARING.THAT IS MORE OF A HELP THAN MONEY

 

Remind them use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who we are and what we're doing

I'm Erlend Sogge Heggen @erlend_sh, manager for the jMonkeyEngine project, writing on behalf of the jME Core Team. We care immensely about what we've built, and since you're here, you probably care too.

We're trying something new. Before we knew we got accepted to GSoC, we committed to doing a jME-specific Summer of Code of our own. Essentially a community-supported summer of code event. We will be running both events in parallel.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to sponsor 3 developers to finish 3 of the projects on this ideas list.

  • Each project will have a reward of $250 for successful completion. (We're asking for $850 to comfortably cover transfer fees. Any leftover funds will go to the jMonkeyEngine organisation).
  • We will follow the GSoC timeline and structure as closely as possible, with the key exception of not requiring applicants to be students.
  • There will be no perks. You should fund this project if you want to support jME3 development and you'd like to see similar community-supported events in the near future.

If we fail to raise the full $850 we will cover the rest with our jME funds.

For every extra $250 we raise, we can do another project (provided we have enough mentors).

Important deadlines and application templates can be found on our Summer of Code page which covers both GSoC and jME SoC.

The Bigger Picture

This could be the start of something big. If you prove to us that this crowdfunding model works, we can run similar campaigns again for other projects, like:

  • Tutorials & Documentation
  • Website resources
  • Contests
  • Podcasts

We still firmly believe that you should contribute to open source because it's fun and rewarding, but sometimes a bit of monetary incentive is just the thing to get your priorities straight ;)

Give what you can and please spread the word!

Can't pay with credit cart? We also accept PayPal and Dwolla payments via InspirePay:

https://inspirepay.com/pay/jmonkeyengine

story:
THE PIXELKICK GAMES STORY

My name is Kevin Gunn...I'm the owner of a one man game studio called Pixelkick Games!  I've been a programmer/software developer since I was 13, and I've written software for several major companies throughout my career.   I was fortunate enough to be hired by NASA (United Space Alliance), where I realized my childhood dream to be a part of America's space program.  I left NASA in pursuit of higher pay, and never again found the job satisfaction I had abandoned.  Years-and-years of working long hours for thankless companies eventually took its toll on me.  Suffering from "programmer burn-out", i resigned from a good paying job as a software developer, and took a job as a desktop support technician.  Finally happy again, I excelled in this role, and was promoted to Lead Technician where i am today.   


Over the past four years I have devoted countless hours of my spare time to creating games for the web and mobile platforms. I'm now in a position to finally break out.  I have already prototyped six new games (like Sweet Sudoku and Jazz21 shown below), but these games are begging for improvement.  An artist's touch will add the one component that my talents don't provide... polish. 



 

THE IMPACT

The simple truth is, I'll never stop making games.  The time I spend at it keeps me sharp, and satisfies my need to do something creative.  The sad reality is, without funding, the games I make won't ever go to market, or will, at best get lost in the ocean of all the other great indie games out there.  Too many indie games are passed over and go unseen because of a non-existent promotional budget.  The big name game studios spend money hand-over-fist and grab up all the attention.  The good news is, I have a plan...

 

The funding I'm seeking will allow me to:

 

• Purchase an upgrade for Multimedia Fusion 2 (the development platform I use)

• Acquire a used iPod Touch 4th Gen and a used iPad 2 for testing purposes

• Contract a talented game artist

• Promote existing and future game releases

 

HERE IS HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED

The first $250 will go toward the purchase of an upgrade to the development platform I use called Multimedia Fusion 2.  I own (and am an expert in the use of) the "Standard" version, which has a few limitations.  I consider this purchase to be top priority.  The upgrade to the "Developer" version will enable me to access much needed features.  Specifically, I'll gain the ability to take advantage of Apple's Game Center, a major benefit in today's app store market.  Even if I don't raise any more money, this purchase will also allow me to utilize Apple's iAds. With iAds, I'll be able to release free versions of my games that generate income from advertisements.  (Once I have this upgrade, I'll immediately revise my existing game by adding high score tracking in the Game Center and release a free version of the game that uses iAds).

 

The next $150 will go toward the purchase of a used iPod Touch 4th Gen (for game testing).  Testing on this model allows me to ensure that the games play well, even on a device that is not using the latest technology.  At present, I'm testing on my son's iPod Touch, which sadly has a badly damaged screen (he dropped it).  Wrestling it away from him is a difficult task.  It is his iPod, after all, and its not really fair for me to deprive him of his favorite "toy".   Even If I don't raise more than $400, I'll still have the ability to move forward.

 

The next $300 to $500 will be aimed at promoting my existing game Jazz21 on web sites such as CrazyMikesApps.com.  Crazy Mike's Apps has affordable packages and a colleague of mine has used with significant success.  Other options exist, of course, and will be utilized where possible as well.  Promoting this game will allow some extra income to start to trickle in, and be put back into this business venture.

 

The next $400 will go toward the purchase of a used iPad 2.  The iPad market offers huge potential for games and other apps that I'll continue to develop and promote.  Sure, the next iPad is due to be released in March, but I don't need the latest to get into this market.   I've seen used devices for as little as $365, but the impact will be significant for my games.  As it stands, I can't test on an iPad, so I'm not developing for the iPad, and I'm missing the boat.

 

All funds raised beyond this will be used to hire a much needed artist who can re-work the sprites* and other art for my games.  I have working prototypes in place that just need the right graphics and they can go to market very quickly.  Additionally, money from this point on will be used to promote my games via the most popular and highest rated promotional websites and other media. 

 

My antics, whimsey and thanks - I've scheduled this promotion to end on April 26th, my 45th birthday!   I'm hopeful that this promotion is a success, and I can finally see my efforts get the attention I think they deserve.  I'd like to thank you for reading about me and about Pixelkick Games.  I have no illusions that everyone who reads this will be moved to get involved, but if you do take that step towards helping out, I hope you're blessed for it!  

EVEN IF YOU CAN'T DONATE YOU CAN STILL HELP!

As you read above, I do have a game on sale in the iTunes App Store.  The game play is quite addicting, and although I do want to re-work all of the graphics for this game, it is very fun as it is... Tell everyone about Jazz21 for me and have them download it from the app store at this link:  http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/jazz21/id478733410?ls=1&mt=8  or just have them click the button!

 

My sincerest thanks,

Kevin Gunn

 

* Sprites are the moving pieces in a video game.
story_txt:
THE PIXELKICK GAMES STORY
My name is Kevin Gunn...I'm the owner of a one man game studio called Pixelkick Games!  I've been a programmer/software developer since I was 13, and I've written software for several major companies throughout my career.   I was fortunate enough to be hired by NASA (United Space Alliance), where I realized my childhood dream to be a part of America's space program.  I left NASA in pursuit of higher pay, and never again found the job satisfaction I had abandoned.  Years-and-years of working long hours for thankless companies eventually took its toll on me.  Suffering from "programmer burn-out", i resigned from a good paying job as a software developer, and took a job as a desktop support technician.  Finally happy again, I excelled in this role, and was promoted to Lead Technician where i am today.    

Over the past four years I have devoted countless hours of my spare time to creating games for the web and mobile platforms. I'm now in a position to finally break out.  I have already prototyped six new games (like Sweet Sudoku and Jazz21 shown below), but these games are begging for improvement.  An artist's touch will add the one component that my talents don't provide... polish.  



 
THE IMPACT


The simple truth is, I'll never stop making games.  The time I spend at it keeps me sharp, and satisfies my need to do something creative.  The sad reality is, without funding, the games I make won't ever go to market, or will, at best get lost in the ocean of all the other great indie games out there.  Too many indie games are passed over and go unseen because of a non-existent promotional budget.  The big name game studios spend money hand-over-fist and grab up all the attention.  The good news is, I have a plan...
 
The funding I'm seeking will allow me to:
 
• Purchase an upgrade for Multimedia Fusion 2 (the development platform I use)
• Acquire a used iPod Touch 4th Gen and a used iPad 2 for testing purposes
• Contract a talented game artist
• Promote existing and future game releases
 


HERE IS HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED
The first $250 will go toward the purchase of an upgrade to the development platform I use called Multimedia Fusion 2.  I own (and am an expert in the use of) the "Standard" version, which has a few limitations.  I consider this purchase to be top priority.  The upgrade to the "Developer" version will enable me to access much needed features.  Specifically, I'll gain the ability to take advantage of Apple's Game Center, a major benefit in today's app store market.  Even if I don't raise any more money, this purchase will also allow me to utilize Apple's iAds. With iAds, I'll be able to release free versions of my games that generate income from advertisements.  (Once I have this upgrade, I'll immediately revise my existing game by adding high score tracking in the Game Center and release a free version of the game that uses iAds).
 
The next $150 will go toward the purchase of a used iPod Touch 4th Gen (for game testing).  Testing on this model allows me to ensure that the games play well, even on a device that is not using the latest technology.  At present, I'm testing on my son's iPod Touch, which sadly has a badly damaged screen (he dropped it).  Wrestling it away from him is a difficult task.  It is his iPod, after all, and its not really fair for me to deprive him of his favorite "toy".   Even If I don't raise more than $400, I'll still have the ability to move forward.
 
The next $300 to $500 will be aimed at promoting my existing game Jazz21 on web sites such as CrazyMikesApps.com.  Crazy Mike's Apps has affordable packages and a colleague of mine has used with significant success.  Other options exist, of course, and will be utilized where possible as well.  Promoting this game will allow some extra income to start to trickle in, and be put back into this business venture.
 
The next $400 will go toward the purchase of a used iPad 2.  The iPad market offers huge potential for games and other apps that I'll continue to develop and promote.  Sure, the next iPad is due to be released in March, but I don't need the latest to get into this market.   I've seen used devices for as little as $365, but the impact will be significant for my games.  As it stands, I can't test on an iPad, so I'm not developing for the iPad, and I'm missing the boat.
 
All funds raised beyond this will be used to hire a much needed artist who can re-work the sprites* and other art for my games.  I have working prototypes in place that just need the right graphics and they can go to market very quickly.  Additionally, money from this point on will be used to promote my games via the most popular and highest rated promotional websites and other media. 
 
My antics, whimsey and thanks - I've scheduled this promotion to end on April 26th, my 45th birthday!   I'm hopeful that this promotion is a success, and I can finally see my efforts get the attention I think they deserve.  I'd like to thank you for reading about me and about Pixelkick Games.  I have no illusions that everyone who reads this will be moved to get involved, but if you do take that step towards helping out, I hope you're blessed for it!  


EVEN IF YOU CAN'T DONATE YOU CAN STILL HELP!
As you read above, I do have a game on sale in the iTunes App Store.  The game play is quite addicting, and although I do want to re-work all of the graphics for this game, it is very fun as it is... Tell everyone about Jazz21 for me and have them download it from the app store at this link:  http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/jazz21/id478733410?ls=1&mt=8  or just have them click the button!

 
My sincerest thanks,
Kevin Gunn

story:
www.touchofdeathforums.com

 

Summary

We all loved the graphics and exciting gameplay that the NES/SNES platforms entitled us to when we were younger.  What we as gamers appreciated the most was the extraordinary feeling of accomplishment when we finally managed to beat the final boss, achieve the highest score, or see the ending of a beautiful, pristine story line that allowed our protoganist, whom we played, to come into their own.  Our imaginations ran wild as we stumbled through new levels, found new items, unlocked new revealing secrets, and competed with our friends in these fantasy worlds.  I want to bring that back; the type of gaming that required devotion, imagination, and sometimes just a little pinch of good old fashioned luck, and so Eclipse++ pays homage to those games of old that will forever live in our hearts.


Eclipse++ offers it's users a chance to create expansive worlds using their imaginations and creative expressions, whether it be through alluring visuals or an amazing event driven story.  Unlike consoles during the golden age of gaming Eclipse++ also offers full multiplayer support so that distance never separates or keeps a gamer and their friends, family, or colleagues from joining together in the fantasy world of their choosing.

Features

  • Free
  • Completely Customizable
  • No Previous Programming Experience Required
  • Easy-To-Use Editors
  • Simple and Fast Deployment
  • Full Multiplayer Support

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am a programmer.  This means that, although I can create the engine, I have been using placeholder graphics from other sources that may or may not be under license for redistribution or commercial use. While the user will inevitably be replacing the graphics to suit their own needs I would like to be able to ship this product with a small base tile set, sprite sheet, and a few high quality sound files. I would also like to have a base GUI designed and set up so that people can jump into the process of creating their works without having the overwhelming need for quality graphics much more readily and quickly.

Having access to a VPS in order to host a demo server is imperative; it is also ideal to allow the user base to play test the engine in a live environment before they decide that it's applicable to their needs, and it is also ideal for bug testing purposes.  A professionally crafted website is also a high priority for me as it would allow concise collection of information that would ultimately act as a repository for future users as the engine progresses.

 

My Experience

You may be wondering where my experience lies and if I have the programming knowledge necessary for this task. I am a student of the Art Institute of Vancouver. I am graduating in less then 3 months and I have taken a great deal away from the experience.  I have attended numerous game jams that have targetted development on the Windows and Android platforms, as well as various current generation consoles.

I have been actively programming and using game development tools for approximately a decade; my experience and knowledge of past and present paradigms, tool sets, and languages lends me a great edge in accomplishing this task.

 

The engine is free. Why should I help fund it?

Yes, the engine will be released completely free. When you help fund this project you will be part of something that is not only fun and educational, but an exciting experience in and of itself.  The incentives for funding at or above certain levels allows access to the source code; this allows you to commercialize and freely distribute any derivative works or games made with the works, free of royalties, surcharges, or other compensation; we simply ask for attribution.

Wait. What about the engine found at that link?

If you've had the chance to visit our website you may have noticed that it is already the home of a very active gaming community centered around a similar engine. The difference is that the previous engine is created in Visual Basic 6, and as a result has reached the end of it's development. We are finding it increasingly difficult to find developers to aid in contributing to the engine in a quality controlled manner.  Taking into account newer technologies, a proper programming education and a more powerful language, we believe that we can create a better, more powerful, and feature complete engine then ever before that tailors to a larger demographic.

 

Progress

(Sprites courtesy of RPG Maker and http://farheit.deviantart.com)

(GUI cutesy of Rory Popry Soh and Wing)

 

 

 

 

The server is clean and to the point. I may expand on this in the future. The most important aspects of a server, for me, is that it is lightweight, portable, and highly efficient.  Although it is not visually stunning it falls in line with the criteria presented above.

 

 

Click to view In Game Screenshot

Click to view In Game Screenshot

story:
If you've watched the video and want more info:

About the Drinking Quest Series

Hello, I'm Jason Anarchy the creator of the Drinking Quest series.  It's a quirky comedy series that finds the perfect blend of Tabletop RPG and Drinking Game.  Drinking Quest: The Original Drinking RPG and Drinking Quest 2: Yeddy Vedder's Yeti Adventure were each genre busting independent hits and this third game will complete the trilogy.

Having game nights and drinking with my friends is one of my favourite things in life. It's something I'm very passionate about.  I've been the perpetual GM my whole life and have made thousands of adventures, always tinged with humour to stay in my comfort zone.  My goal was to capture this very specific style of game night (RPG, Drinking, Quick Witted Comedy) and make it a cult game that stands on it's own in the Tabletop Gaming industry.

I really wanted to make sure that the Drinking Quest games stood on their own as comedy games first beyond the "Drinking meets RPG" mechanics.  I've always strived to have additional layers of depth with the story and humour beyond what the players expect.  There is a layer of humour that I would describe as surface level.  Then we have a layer where the player would say "Hey I didn't notice that before, that's awesome" and then there is the layer where I really dig deep into my psyche to try and challenge the players perception of themselves and the world.

Also... DRINKING IS FUN!

So here are the many options available to you!

*** Please note that shipping charges need to be added onto the total in most tiers***

 

Early Bird Special: First 250 Backers of Hard Copies get a signed game by series creator Jason Anarchy.

Stretch Goals:

$20,000 - Everyone who ordered a physical copy of the game gets a Drinking Quest Fridge Magnet portraying an epic battle scene.  This is not something that simply has a logo slapped on it.

$30,000 - Everyone who ordered a physical copy of the game gets a Drinking Quest Key Chain Bottle Opener.  These are different than the "What Would Chuglox Do?" key chains we had going for a while.  It will have some kind of life advice or credo from the game like "Absolute Power is Awesome".

$40,000 - Everyone at the $65 level gets a signed picture of the creator's fist. This can be used to intimidate your enemies or just have framed on your desk at work.  We would post a picture but we don't want to break the internet.  This comes in a really stylish plastic frame.

$60,000 - Dice Upgrade - All three games will get a dice upgrade.  It changes from a simple D6 system to a simple D4, D6, D8 system.  It's something we've always wanted to do but just didn't have the budget for it.

A common question that might come up is "Why not have an expansion or more cards?".  I don't believe in that model, it's bad for the players.  I want everyone to have a consistently entertaining experience and I didn't want to hold anything back.

What am I funding?

This would cover the first run of Drinking Quest 3 games and some additional copies of Drinking Quest 1 and 2 (which are nearly sold out).  Not only would this allow the completion of the planned trilogy but also allow the quality to jump from "Good for an indie game" to "It's good for any game".  With a group funding campaign, everyone who wants a game can get one and with all kinds of great perks! 

The quality of boxes will change to hard "Board Game" style boxes while keeping the condensed size that is easy to bring to a pub or a friends house. Also we have a colourist on board this time so every card for Drinking Quest 3 will be full colour.  The cards will also increase in size slightly and maintain the same high quality thickness and coating introduced in the second edition Drinking Quest 1 and 2's.

We've also had a lot of requests for t-shirts and extra merch so this gives an option to those hardcore fans.

I also wanted to have some ridiculous types of perks and stretch goals and really turn the group funding paradigm on it's head while also offering several tiers that have a lot of value for backers.

The Impact

Drinking Quest is a series that breaks all the rules of the Tabletop Gaming industry.  Beyond the drinking themes, these games are made for Hardcore Nerds (using the term affectionately).
 
Disruptive innovation is good for any industry.

How can I help?

  • Back the campaign
  • Share this link on Facebook or your gaming site
  • Send me a bottle of Scotch in the mail
Drinking Quest games have always stood for responsible drinking.  We aim to facilitate a good time with your friends, not cause anyone to harm themselves.  Regardless of the suggested rules, please know your limits and drink responsibly.  (A typical game over the course of a couple of hours averages 2 or 3 chugs.) Please Quest Responsibly!™
 
Thank you to all backers and feel free to ask questions in the message boards! I will tackle subjects ranging from legitimate questions about the game to questions about how awesome my biceps are.  Let's have fun with this :)

Thank you to all backers and feel free to ask questions in the message boards! I will tackle subjects ranging from legitimate questions about the game to questions about how awesome my biceps are.  Let's have fun with this :)

story:
Ancient Kemet is an upcoming online multiplayer game based on ancient Egypt. The core concept is a world created by players. Embark on a journey in the mystical land around Nile and write your own story as a part of Ancient Kemet.

Kemet stands for „the Black Land“ referring to the fertile black mud that covered the banks of Nile after floods and so created a lasting oasis of life in the dessert.

 

Ancient Kemet the Game starts many years after the gods have left Kemet to be ruled by its own people. Although the gods left their legacy for Kemet, it is now far from a united country, quite the opposite. It is organised into many districts, nomes as they are called, each with their own town and interests. Even in its current state, Kemet is in peaceful balance. But for how long?

Many old stories have become legends now, only to be told to little children. There is one that only select few in Ancient Kemet knew about and hoped for it to be just that, a legend. The story goes that after a long struggle for power, god Horus revenged his father, Osiris, conquered his uncle Seth and regained the throne. Seth was sent into exile into a different world where he was to remain for all days. However, the most loyal followers of Seth facing the fact that they do not possess enought power to rescue their leader, they did what every faithful scribe would do. The left a message, the fabled Scrolls of Resurrection, hoping that one day someone will have what it takes to bring their god back into life. The scrolls became a legend, until now. For the wind whispers words of dark magic coming from the mysterious ancient temple not that far away...

Ancient Kemet the Game is created by two brothers, Dom Tollhotep and Rob AmunRob, who combined their passion for ancient Egypt with an eye for graphics and brain for programming. Not only all the visuals and game style, but even the engine that runs the game was created by us. We added to that our experience with other games and what we would have done differently and what concepts we liked. Ancient Kemet is a creation of passion and fascination, because all the aspects of this project are something we both are passionate about and fascinated by.

To make Ancient Kemet alive, we have split the project into three stages:
1) Alpha testing stage
2) Beta testing stage
3) Ancient Kemet version 1.0

In this Indiegogo campaing we would like to raise funding for alpha testing, which we want to execute in May. Based on all the feedback we get, we want Beta testing up shortly after and then rinse and repeat, Ancient Kemet full version goes live.

For alpha testing stage we want to raise 4 000 EUR to cover our cost for graphics, development, software licenses, sound production and of course, servers. On top of that we would like to get like-minded players fascinated with Ancient Egypt in for the actual testing to help us with their feedback, their ideas.

Let's have a quick overview of the alpha testing scenario

Alpha testing will be based on the scenario of 2 nomes, each with a town with its own ground reserved for gathering resources for basic professions. In between the nomes there will be a free PVP combat zone, where players will find more expensive resources.

There are going to be several character professions in the final version of the game, for aplha testing we picked four: farming, blacksmithing, crafting and fishing. These will be the basic means for getting on your feet with gaining extra gear and materials you need.

On top of that, at the end of the combat zone players will find a mystical Temple of Resurrection, where our innovative concept of raiding is to be tested.

Temple of Resurrection – New raid concept

In alpha stage there will be one major PVP raid which will lead into the Temple of Resurrection. After conquering the enemy team from the other nome you will gain access to an ancient artefact, that will grant you enourmous power and transform you into the dark servants of Seth. It will be your role to hold the temple against enemy and shall you succeed, you will be rewarded greatly.

If you happen to loose the fight for the artefact, your chance comes in defeating the monsters in the temple itself, who are in fact, players from the other nome.

The most important thing from alpha testing stage?
Your feedback :)

We are very grateful for all your contributions and we will keep you posted with all news from Ancient Kemet through our campaing here on Indiegogo, on our website and on Facebook as well.

All the rewards are connected with the game itself and whether you wish to play in the later stages after more content has been added or you want to jump in as a game moderator straight away, there are contribution options for all. The spaces for alpha testing are limited though.

Thank you

Thank you for your time, your interest and your support. If you have a question, want to drop us a line or would like to stay up to date, follow us on Facebook or check out our Ancient Kemet website.
